description: Staten Island Chuck appeared before an excited crowd on Tuesday morning and did not see his shadow, leading to the prediction of an early spring.

title: Lazards Profit Slumps in Quarter as Fees Slide
description: Lazard on Tuesday reported a 29 percent decline in adjusted net income in the fourth quarter as market volatility hampered its asset-management business, while fewer deals closed, which affected the firms advisory revenue.

title: The O.J. Simpson Murder Trial, as Covered by The Times
description: Go back through the key points and main players of the trial.

title: Daily Report: Alphabet Eclipses Apple to Become the Most Valuable Company
description: For most of the past four years, Apple has reigned supreme as the worlds most valuable company. Now theres a new holder of the crown: Alphabet.

title: Despite Pledges, Tax Reform Remains an Elusive Goal
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  From a distance, tax reform reflects the shimmering frontier of American economic policy: bold plans from Republican presidential candidates, hints of interest from the White House and Hillary Clinton, bipartisan whispers in Congress.

title: Lady Gaga Will Pay Tribute to David Bowie at the Grammys
description: Lady Gaga will pay tribute to David Bowie in a special segment at the Grammy Awards, the organizers of the show announced on Tuesday.

title: In Cosby Hearing, Ex-District Attorney Says He Believed Accuser, but Case Was Lacking
description: NORRISTOWN, Pa.  The former district attorney who investigated a sexual assault complaint by a young Temple University staff member against Bill Cosby a decade ago testified Tuesday that he had believed her account but had declined to prosecute Mr. Cosby because he questioned whether the woman would make a credible witness at trial.

title: Germans Eager to See Whose Parade a Carnival Float Will Rain On
description: DSSELDORF, Germany  Every year, as the great Carnival parade before Lent approaches, this wealthy Rhineland city buzzes with the question: Whom will Jacques Tilly, master float builder, skewer this time?

title: Taking Texts Back From iMessage
description: Q. I switched my number from an iPhone to a new Android phone, but Im not getting my text messages now. Why?

title: My Secret Policeman
description: CAIRO  Miss Mona, welcome home. The airport told us youve just returned from Vienna.

title: From Zegna to Saint Laurent, Fashions Rumor Mill Goes Into Overdrive
description: Another day, another fevered round of fashion speculation. Rumors are popping up with the blinding frequency of paillettes on an Elie Saab dress. Ive never seen it this way. Its corrosive. So lets take them out of the shadows where they breed.

title: Corporate Bribery Cases and Fines Fell in 2015, Report Shows
description: The number of Foreign Corrupt Practices Act enforcement actions and financial penalties declined sharply last year, but the federal government has signaled that it plans to bolster its efforts in pursuing corporate bribery cases, according to a new report by the law firm Jones Day.

title: From Bold to Bastard, Readers Debate Role of Working Women in India
description: India needs more angry, bold, real bastard women, wrote a reader in California. Another argued that working women face more of a glass ceiling in the United States than in India.

title: 1941: Pact Signed to Clear Badlands
description: SHANGHAI  Because of the economic and political factors involved, considerable speculation has been aroused concerning the eventual effectiveness of an agreement signed yesterday [Feb. 1] by the heads of the Shanghai Municipal Council and the Chinese government of the city for the ostensible purpose of cleaning up the vice and lawlessness of the citys western badlands. The agreement provides for creation of a special police force and provides that as soon as the special police unit undertakes its duties the gambling dens, opium places and similar enterprises shall be forbidden.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Feb. 3, 1941

title: John Sununu Previews Attacks Donald Trump Will Face in New Hampshire
description: John H. Sununu, the former governor of New Hampshire who has been voicing increasing concern about what a Donald J. Trump victory in his state would mean for his party, twisted the knife after the billionaires second-place finish in the Iowa caucuses on Tuesday morning  and offered a preview of the attacks he is about to face.

title: U.S. and Europe in Safe Harbor Data Deal, but Legal Fight May Await
description: European officials on Tuesday agreed to a deal with the United States that would let Google, Amazon and thousands of other businesses continue moving peoples digital data, including social media posts and financial information, back and forth across the Atlantic.

title: Hillary Clintons Dutiful Slog
description: Late Monday, as the unfinished vote count suggested the slimmest of victories for Hillary Clinton, she stepped to a microphone, flashed an Oscar-worthy smile of triumph and told supporters that she was breathing a big sigh of relief.

title: James Corden to Host Tony Awards
description: James Corden of The Late Late Show was named on Tuesday to host this years Tony Awards.

title: When Is Criticism Unfair?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Leslie Jamison and Alice Gregory debate the boundaries of fair criticism.

title: A Big Louisville Upset of U.N.C., at Least by Human Standards
description: The headlines Tuesday morning were clear: Something surprising had happened in college basketball the previous night.

title: Chris Christie, 10th in Iowa, Tells New Hampshire Fans He Performed as Expected
description: NASHUA, N.H.  Chris Christie on Tuesday morning did not seem like a man who had finished near the back of the pack with 1.8 percent of the vote in the Iowa caucuses the night before.

title: Lincoln Center Season Includes Gianandrea Noseda and Christian  Gerhaher
description: Gianandrea Noseda leading the London Symphony Orchestra in the Verdi Requiem, the baritone Christian Gerhaher singing a program of Mahler lieder, and the pianist Jeremy Denk playing a recital of music from medieval to modern times will be among the highlights of next seasons Great Performers series at Lincoln Center, whose lineup was announced on Tuesday.

title: Mauro Bigonzetti to Direct La Scala Ballet
description: Mauro Bigonzetti, an Italian choreographer with a substantial reputation in Europe and the United States, has been appointed director of La Scala Ballet, the company announced on Monday. He succeeds Makhar Vaziev, who will become the director of the Bolshoi Ballet on March 18.

title: Magic Leap, an Augmented Reality Firm, Raises $793 Million
description: Magic Leap, a secretive augmented reality start-up based in Dania Beach, Fla., announced on Tuesday that it had raised a $793 million round of venture financing, valuing the company at $3.7 billion, excluding the new funds.

title: Nahnatchka Khan on Fresh Off the Boat, Chinese New Year and Michael Chang
description: Once mostly anonymous, the producers who oversee top television series have sometimes become as well known as the actors who star in them. On occasion, The New York Times will pose questions from readers (and some of our own) to notable show runners and post their responses.

title: Prediction Markets Sudden New Favorite: Third-Place Rubio
description: Ted Cruz beat all comers in Mondays Iowa caucuses. He also beat expectations. Yet according to political prediction markets, Marco Rubio was the nights biggest winner. Mr. Rubios third-place showing led his political stock to soar, and markets now rate him as a strong favorite to win the G.O.P. nomination.

title: The Russian Runway Raconteuse
description: In fashion this spring, there are no rules. Perhaps no young designer explored this idea more than Natalia Alaverdian, with her label, A.W.A.K.E. Each collection is meant to tell a story, built around an animal mascot. This season, her most surprising and fantastical yet, is very much about Africa, says the 34-year-old, who was born in Soviet Moscow, raised in Belgium and has also worked as a stylist, photographer and fashion director. I had a vision of a zebra crossing her legs and smoking a cigarette, an image she ended up putting in a slashed circle (so as not to promote smoking) and placing on a jacket sleeve, among other garments, to evoke the insignia of an African military general. Major stylists and fashion followers alike, including Kim and Kanye, have started requesting her clothes. Take note.

title: Takashi Murakamis Superflat Collection: From Shohaku and Rosanjin to Anselm Kiefer
description: The first public exhibition of Murakamis vast personal art collection goes on view at the Yokohama Museum of Art in Japan through April 3, 2016.

title: Nielsen Plays Catch-Up as Streaming Era Wreaks Havoc on TV Raters
description: Dennis Cheatham said he felt as if he were receiving a message from the past last May when a package arrived in the mail from Nielsen asking him to participate in the survey that for decades has detailed the television viewing habits of Americans.

title: The West Must Stop Giving Turkey a Free Pass
description: Last month, more than 1,200 Turkish and foreign academics signed a petition calling attention to the continuing humanitarian crisis in many Kurdish-majority towns in southeastern Turkey, which are the site of fighting between the Turkish Army and the Kurdistan Workers Party, or P.K.K. The petition decried the Armys shelling of urban areas and the imposition of weekslong, 24-hour curfews, which have left many civilians unable to bury their dead or even obtain food. President Recep Tayyip Erdogan publicly denounced the signers as so-called intellectuals and traitors. Within days, antiterror police had detained and harassed dozens of the signatories.

title: Iowa Caucus Night
description: The long battle for the candidates concluded on Monday night in the Hawkeye state.

title: Storm Batters Nations Midsection With Snow and Lightning
description: A storm packing blizzard-like conditions, as well as lightning strikes, was expected to deposit several inches of snow on the countrys midsection Tuesday.

title: Submit Questions for Vince Gilligan and Peter Gould of Better Call Saul
description: Vince Gilligan and Peter Gould answered the questions here.

title: Takashi Murakami on the Art of Collecting Art
description: As his personal collection goes on display at a Japanese museum, the artist describes what its like to be on the other side of the transaction.

title: After a Massacre, San Bernardino Police Stare Down Crippling Cuts
description: SAN BERNARDINO, Calif.  Detective Ryan Wicks trained the headlights of his Ford Crown Victoria Police Interceptor on a young man spotted fleeing local gang members and climbed out of his car, a battered black-and-white cruiser of mid-2000s vintage. The odometer stood north of 95,000 miles. A rear fender was scarred by the belt buckles of hundreds of suspects who had been spread-eagled against it.

title: 8 New Destination Hotels for 2016
description: Hotel openings might seem like everyday events, but a handful come with more excitement and anticipation than the rest. They may be in a particularly notable building, bring a fresh concept to an already-popular destination or have the potential to attract travelers to a location they may not have thought of visiting. With these factors in mind, we turned to travel professionals who check out new properties for a living and picked eight names worth checking into in 2016 (excluded from the list below are hotels that are reopening after a renovation, as with the Ritz Paris).

title: Jane the Virgin Season 2, Episode 10: Jane Swipes Right
description: About halfway through the second season of Jane the Virgin, the question of when Jane will actually lose her virginity is still up in the air. Beyond the original elevator pitch, Janes virginity has never been the point of the series, but its still an important lingering aspect of her life. This episode focuses more on the who: For a while it seemed like a choice between Michael and Rafael, but now could it be someone new?

title: Benoit
description: A French bistro from Alain Ducasse in Midtown.

title: Benoit in Midtown Is the Bistro That Will Take You to Paris
description: Like many New Yorkers, I have convinced myself that a rickety fire escape platform is a terrace and that a segment of the Empire State Buildings antenna seen through a sliver of window constitutes a panoramic skyline view. The same capacity for wishful self-delusion must be what keeps us going to bistros that are nothing like anything in France.

title: Utah Symphony Names New President
description: The Utah Symphony, which has been steadily rebuilding its player ranks under the musical direction of Thierry Fischer, announced on Tuesday that it would soon be under new administrative leadership: It is hiring Paul Meecham, the president of the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra, to be its next president.

title: Butterflies for Ted Cruz, Determined Foe of Ethanol Mandates
description: No matter who prevails as the Republican presidential candidate and who wins the election next November, there may already be a big and enduring win out of this crazy race  for the environment, including ailing monarch butterflies. If butterflies had hands instead of wings, theyd be clapping for Senator Ted Cruz.

title: Let the Moon Be Your Guide in Finding Five Planets
description: For the past two weeks, five of our solar systems planets have paraded across the pre-dawn sky, visible to the naked eye, giving early-risers a rare visual treat. The show will continue into mid-February but as many a stargazer will attest to, distinguishing Mercury, Venus, Mars, Saturn and Jupiter amid the medley of twinkling dots can be tricky. There are a number of apps and computer programs that can help people track the quintet, but for those in need of a low-fi way to spot the planets, a recent NASA video offers the following advice: Look for the moon.

title: Time for a Strategic Shift at UBSs Investment Bank
description: Running an investment bank is a well-paid but sometimes frustrating business.

title: Sarah Palins English
description: Sarah Palin has been mocked a lot for the way she talks, especially in her strange and rambling endorsement speech for Donald Trump. But her speeches on the campaign trail arent simple; they are actually incredibly complicated.

title: Some Iowa Delegates Awarded by Coin Toss
description: With the results so close in the Democratic caucuses in Iowa, some precincts used a coin toss to decide the winner of a spare delegate.

title: Letitia James, New York Public Advocate, Sues Education Dept. Over Schools Disability Services
description: Public Advocate Letitia James has sued the New York City Education Department, saying a $130 million computer system meant to track services for students with disabilities was a failure.

title: Candidates, in New Hampshire, Hit the Ground Running
description: Presidential candidates flew through the night to hit the New Hampshire campaign trail running on Tuesday morning, eager to capitalize on a race that has been reordered by surprising finishes in the Iowa caucuses.

title: Marrakeshs New Super Souk
description: The boutique hotel El Fenn has long been a favorite of the fashion crowd for its glittery rooftop bar with views of the medina, and its one-of-a-kind rooms, decorated with hand-woven kilim blankets and plush, modern Berber carpets from the renowned rug seller Soufiane Zarib. Now, with its new, lushly appointed gift shop, admirers can take these home  plus browse a carefully edited selection of other goods from Morocco and beyond, including unusual vintage jewelry, ethereal clothing by the French designer Thierry Colson and dramatic leather caftans and djellabas, embellished with snakeskin and ostrich, by the American artist Paul Rowland, who spearheaded the store.

title: Is a Cow a Who or a Which? Our Standards Editor Weighs In
description: Philip B. Corbett is the associate masthead editor for standards and oversees The Timess style manual.

title: A Memorable Fillet of Sole, With a Touch of Color
description: Fillet of sole is the perfect fish to cook for a romantic and elegant dinner for two.

title: The Republican Establishments New Hampshire Playbook
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Welcome to New Hampshire, a state with a history of rebutting Iowas best-laid plans. Here, the Republicans four so-called establishment candidates  former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, Gov. John Kasich of Ohio and Senator Marco Rubio of Florida  hope to emerge as a clear alternative to Senator Ted Cruz of Texas and Donald J. Trump, who finished in the top two slots on Monday evening in Iowa. Mr. Rubio enters New Hampshire with the clear momentum, having finished third in Iowa and well ahead of his rivals. But the three governors still believe New Hampshire is their best shot to reinvigorate their campaigns.

title: Joseph Abboud: Fall 2016
description: The first show following the designers return to his namesake brand (which he launched in 1987 and left in 2005.)

title: Finding Common Political Ground on Poverty
description: If you have been paying any attention to Americas paralyzed politics, you are not going to believe this.

title: Bahamas Mega-Resort Stands Empty, Casualty of Dispute With Chinese Partners
description: NASSAU, the Bahamas  Trei Bethel had been looking for work in the Bahamas for about a year when he finally got a break: a coveted spot in a program that trained young Bahamians to work at Baha Mar, a $3.5 billion mega-resort nearing completion on Nassaus white-sand Cable Beach.

title: North Korea, Defying Warnings, Prepares to Launch Long-Range Rocket
description: SEOUL, South Korea  In a new dare to the United States and its allies, North Korea has notified the United Nations agency responsible for navigation safety that it is planning to launch a long-range rocket this month to put a satellite into orbit.

title: George Miller to Lead Cannes Film Festival Jury
description: PARIS  George Miller, the director of Mad Max: Fury Road, will preside over the jury of this years Cannes Film Festival, the festival announced Tuesday. In a statement, it called his appointment a no-holds-barred celebration of genre cinema.

title: ChemChina Is Close to a Deal to Buy Syngenta
description: China is on the verge of its biggest ever foreign deal  and another possible political storm.

title: Duckie Brown: Fall 2016
description: Steven Cox and Daniel Silvers fall designs.

title: Zica Car Will Be Renamed, Tata Motors of India Says
description: When the Indian automaker Tata Motors unveiled the name of its curvaceous new hatchback late last year, it declared that the car would be the the next big thing. The name? Zica.

title: Appetite for S.U.V.s Offers Upside in Slower Month for Auto Sales
description: DETROIT  Sales of new vehicles dropped in the United States in January from a year ago, partly because of the snowstorm that shut down dealerships across the East Coast.

title: Another New Director for Tanztheater Wuppertal
description: Adolphe Binder, the director of the GteborgsOperan Danskompani, will become the new director of the Tanztheater Wuppertal in May 2017, the company announced on Monday. She will be the fourth director to run the Tanztheater Wuppertal, in Germany, since the death in 2009 of the choreographer Pina Bausch, who had taken over the company in 1973 and turned it into a world-famous ensemble and a repository for her potent form of dance theater.

title: Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders Intensify Efforts in New Hampshire After Iowa Standoff
description: NASHUA, N.H.  Hillary Clinton is digging in for a tough fight against Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont in next weeks primary in New Hampshire, her advisers said Tuesday, trying to spark political momentum and fund-raising energy after only a razor-thin victory in the Iowa caucuses.

title: Kossars Returns With Bagels and Bialys on the Lower East Side
description: Kossars Bagels & Bialys In the bagel capital of the world, the bialy, the round, flattened roll with onions in the center, also gets its due. Evan Giniger and David Zablocki, who in 2013 bought the 80-year-old Kossars Bialys on the Lower East Side, closed it in September for renovations. The working bakery in the back is now enclosed in glass, and the storefront is no longer drab, newly decked out with subway tiles and white marble. And now you can order your bialy sliced and filled with cream cheese, peanut butter, hummus and even whitefish salad, which was never offered before. Kossars is also making its own cream cheeses, labeled (and trademarked) as Schmears, in flavors like lox, vegetable, horseradish and everything bagel. The bialys have gone on a flavor trip, too, with sun-dried tomato, olive and apple-cinnamon. There are also pletzls (onion flatbreads), challahs and babkas. Sandwiches like the Yenta, with whitefish salad and pastrami salmon, are available for the first time. (Opens Friday): 367 Grand Street (Essex Street), 212-473-4810, kossars.com.

title: A Party to Open New York Mens Fashion Week
description: Tyson Beckford, Victor Cruz and Matt Harvey celebrate the sophomore week devoted to mens wear at a party held by the CFDA and Dockers.

title: Josh Brolin Revels in the Role of Go-To Guy
description: I should warn you, Josh Brolin said, calling from North Carolina. Ive just come out of the woods after three and a half months, and Im a little crazy.

title: Matt Harvey and Tyson Beckford Help Open New York Mens Fashion Week
description: On Monday night, as much of the nation looked toward Iowa for hints of its political future, the insular world of mens fashion took a moment to raise a glass and give a toast to, well, itself.

title: David Boiess Dual Roles at Theranos Set Up Conflict
description: Theranos is in trouble, and David Boies, a star lawyer, has placed himself at the heart of it, a decision that he may come to rue.

title: Johnny Manziels Days With the Cleveland Browns Appear Numbered
description: The Cleveland Browns issued a terse response on Tuesday to quarterback Johnny Manziels latest incident, with a strong implication that his days as a Brown may be numbered.

title: Heisenberg Will Transfer to Broadway
description: Mary-Louise Parker and Denis Arndt will reprise their roles in Simon Stephenss drama Heisenberg when Manhattan Theater Club transfers its production of the show to Broadway this fall, the theater announced on Tuesday. The two-character play, which Manhattan Theater Club mounted last year Off Broadway, is to start previews at the companys Samuel J. Friedman Theater on Sept. 30, with opening night scheduled for Oct. 13. Mark Brokaw will again direct.

title: Review: In Death of the Liberal Class, a Writer Tones Down His Anger
description: Death of the Liberal Class, a muddle of a play by Robert Lyons at the New Ohio Theater, tries to find bigger themes in a male schlubs midlife crisis. But thats asking too much of the storys irksome, inconsistent characters.

title: Review: In Madoff, What He Was Thinking
description: Bernie didnt fail us. We failed Bernie.

title: Iowa As A Media Focal Point
description: The outsized role the Iowa caucuses play in the nomination process is, as almost everyone acknowledges, sort of stupid. But where does it come from? The immediate answer is that its about the news media, which seize on the Iowa results and use them to tell narratives that can, in turn, have a huge impact on fundraising and later voting.

title: Iowa Votes, and the World Weighs In
description: As the results of the Iowa caucuses  Ted Cruzs narrow but humbling triumph over Donald J. Trump and Marco Rubio in the crowded Republican field, and Hillary Clintons razor-thin victory over Bernie Sanders in the Democratic contest  emerged on Tuesday morning, so did reactions and analysis from reporters, commentators and observers around the world. Below is a sampling.

title: Analyzing the Iowa Caucus Results
description: To the Editor:

title: The Death of a Star Swiss Chef Underscores the Professions Stress
description: The story is starting to sound familiar. A chef at the pinnacle of the culinary world commits suicide.

title: LVMH Posts $7.2 Billion Profit, Beating Analysts Expectations
description: LONDON  LVMH, the worlds largest luxury group by sales, recorded full year profit and revenue for 2015 that outpaced analysts expectations, despite a rocky global market.

title: Public School: Fall 2016
description: Maxwell Osborne and Dao-Yi Chows latest designs.

title: Obama and Paul Ryan Have Lunch, and Consider a Wary Truce
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama held a rare meeting Tuesday with the top Republicans in Congress to assess opportunities for compromise during his final year in office, even as the two sides continued partisan sniping that could undermine the prospect of serious legislative progress.

title: Podcast: Post-Game Wrap-Up on the Iowa Caucus
description: Editorial page editor Andrew Rosenthal talks about the Iowa Caucus results, the winners, losers and whats ahead.

title: Sacramento Kings Pull Year of the Monkey Shirts From Seats
description: Observing two cultural celebrations at the same time can lead to controversy, the Sacramento Kings learned this week.

title: Uniquely Violent Humans
description: To the Editor:

title: Wrist-Worthy New Smartwatches
description: The Apple Watch paved the way for a new generation of smartwatches. Here are six notables ones.

title: Lily Jamess Elegant Striped Crop Top
description: Who: Lily James

title: I Dont Feel Any Pressure, Donald Trump Declares at Rally
description: MILFORD, N.H.  If people thought that his second-place finish in Iowa had discouraged Donald J. Trump or distracted him from his goal of winning the Republican presidential nomination, Mr. Trump made it clear Tuesday night that they were dead wrong.

title: Rivals Look to New Hampshire for a Shot at Breaking Donald Trumps Stride
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Emboldened by Donald J. Trumps defeat in the Iowa caucuses, conservative leaders and rival candidates for the Republican presidential nomination began to challenge him aggressively in New Hampshire on Tuesday, aiming to cut into his wide lead here and perhaps even to embarrass him by denying him victory in a second consecutive state.

title: Super Bowl 50 Playbook Calls for Loaded Nachos
description: The Denver Broncos and the Carolina Panthers face off in Super Bowl 50 on Sunday. Home cooks will serve copious numbers of chicken wings to eat with the game, vats of chili, trays of barbecue. This is the way of our nation.

title: Israel and the U.N. Chief: A Clash of Perspectives
description: To the Editor:

title: Martin Shkreli All but Gloated Over Huge Drug Price Increases, Memos Show
description: Martin Shkreli anticipated huge profits from raising the price of a decades-old drug for an infectious disease, belying any notion that helping patients was foremost in his mind, according to information released by congressional investigators on Tuesday.

title: The Iranian Peoples Dream
description: To the Editor:

title: N.H.L. This Week: Red Wings on the Road
description: Welcome back from the All-Star break. N.H.L. action resumes Tuesday, with 10 weeks remaining in the regular season. Here is a look at the week ahead, highlighting hot  or not so hot  teams and players. (All times Eastern.)

title: A Harmful Class-Action Bill
description: To the Editor:

title: Airstrikes in Afghanistan Kill 29 Militants Affiliated With ISIS, Official Says
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Airstrikes against the Afghan affiliate of the Islamic State in eastern Afghanistan have killed dozens of militants and knocked out their clandestine radio station, an official said Tuesday.

title: Oposicin en Venezuela adopta estrategias del manual poltico de Chvez
description: Por Nicholas Casey y Patricia Torres

title: Which States Trump, Cruz and Rubio Need to Win
description: After the Iowa caucuses, the paths to the nomination diverge for the three leading candidates.

title: Taliban Gun Down 10-Year-Old Militia Hero in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Afghan government declared Wasil Ahmad a hero for leading a militias defense against a Taliban siege last year, parading him in front of cameras in a borrowed police uniform too big for him. On Monday, the Taliban triumphantly announced that they had assassinated him with two bullets to the head.

title: My Head Stagnates
description: I did an interview on NY1 about Bob Gordons Rise and Fall of U.S. Economic Growth. My segment starts at 9:11.

title: Polls Were Way Off on Donald Trump. Heres What It Means.
description: Donald Trump was at the top of each of the last 10 polls in Iowa, but his lead failed to hold up on caucus night Monday. In the end, his seven-point lead in polling averages amounted to a three-point loss to Ted Cruz.

title: Podcast: Postgame Wrap-Up on the Iowa Caucus
description: Ted Cruz wins. Hillary Clinton wins, by the thinnest of margins. Martin OMalley is out. The Timess editorial page editor, Andrew Rosenthal, is in Des Moines and joins us for a postgame wrap-up on the Iowa caucus.

title: Zika Infection Transmitted by Sex Reported in Texas
description: A case of Zika virus infection transmitted by sex, rather than mosquito bite, was discovered in Texas on Tuesday, a development sure to complicate plans to contain a global epidemic.

title: ChemChinas Bid for Syngenta Leaves Monsanto in the Cold
description: The advance of the China National Chemical Corporation, a state-owned company, on Syngenta leaves Monsanto in a thorny spot.

title: Football and Fashion Huddle for a Cause
description: A parade of colors as the N.F.L. and the CFDA team up to auction off footballs reimagined by fashion designers.

title: Mens Wear Veteran Joseph Abboud Returns to the Runway
description: David Bowies music was a staple of the mens fashion shows that recently concluded in Europe, and it was back for the start of the mens fashion week in New York as the first model made his way down the runway for Joseph Abboud.

title: The Most Exacting Photographer in Downtown 70s New York
description: In the pages of T last September, the critic and novelist Edmund White asked, Why cant we stop talking about New York in the late 1970s? This month, Paul Kasmin and Pace/MacGill galleries have teamed up to present an exhibition of two dozen photos from one of that periods most celebrated photographers, the late Peter Hujar, whose archive also supplied the imagery for Whites piece. The show includes some of his most iconic images, including Candy Darling on Her Deathbed, here, and the portraits of Susan Sontag and Fran Lebowitz below that were also included alongside Whites article in T.

title: 18 Elephants on a Plane: Move From Swaziland to U.S. Is Criticized
description: More than a dozen elephants from southern Africa are being moved to American zoos, a plan that critics say will imperil the animals.

title: Iowa Caucus Coverage Draws Large Crowds on Cable
description: In an election season in which audiences for primary debates have shattered cable news records, the coverage of the Iowa caucus also achieved big numbers.

title: Forging a New Path
description: Chinese-American chefs turn to childhood memories and cookbooks to begin a new tradition with the food of their ancestors.

title: Chinese-American Chefs Start a Culinary Conversation With the Past
description: One was working as an accredited C.P.A. Another had just completed the requirements for a pre-med degree at the University of Chicago. Yet another, a junior employee at Morgan Stanley, walked down 75 flights in the World Trade Centers South Tower and back into the family food business on Sept. 11, 2001.

title: Changes at Brioni and Berluti Continue Designer Shuffle
description: Fashion is experiencing another designer exodus.

title: Australia Confirms 2 Cases of Zika Virus
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Health officials in Australia on Tuesday confirmed two cases of the Zika virus in residents who most likely were infected on a visit to Haiti, and the officials also warned pregnant women not to travel to areas where transmission rates are high, like the Caribbean.

title: Comparing Rubio and Obama in Iowa
description: A selection of moments showing similarities between Marco Rubios speech on Monday night and Barack Obamas speech in 2008 after he won the Iowa caucuses.

title: Cue the New Sod: N.F.L. Plays Super Bowl on Its Own Turf
description: SANTA CLARA, Calif.  Hours after the San Francisco 49ers beat the St. Louis Rams on Jan. 3 in the final game of the regular season here, a whole other team entered Levis Stadium for an urgent, curious ritual: to replace the entire field in time for the Super Bowl a month away.

title: SXSW Sets Film Lineup With Western From Ti West
description: Uber drivers, improv groups and vice principals are all in the mix at the next South by Southwest film festival in Austin, Tex. On Tuesday, organizers announced the majority of their feature lineup, this year including 89 world premieres.

title: A Playful, French Take on a Classic Notebook
description: When Smythson approached the graphic artist Vahram Muratyan to design a set of notebooks  carte blanche  Muratyan ran with that freedom. It occurred to me that I could take those words  those French phrases that we use in English  and place them above the different glasses, or characters, the graphic artist says. Carte blanche didnt ultimately make the cut, but theres je ne sais quoi, crme de la crme and touch (and three more) etched onto fuchsia, orange and yellow covers. Muratyan, known for his Paris versus New York: A Tally of Two Cities blog-that-became-a-book, referred to his latest bridging of the cultural gap as a soft and sweet French invasion. I wanted to drop a French guy into Smythsons British history.

title: Francisco Flores, Tainted Ex-President of El Salvador, Dies at 56
description: Francisco Flores, a former president of El Salvador who was facing charges of diverting $15 million in contributions for earthquake victims to his personal and political party accounts, died on Jan. 30 in San Salvador. He was 56.

title: A Sea-Worthy Sweater, Willem Dafoe-Approved Denim and a Winter-Proof Moisturizer
description: Winter essentials that hold up against the harsh elements.

title: Home of the Blinn College Buccaneers
description: Images of Blinn College, a junior college in Brenham, Tex., where Cam Newton played in 2009, after leaving Florida but before heading to Auburn and then the N.F.L.

title: At Blinn College, Cam Newton Plotted a Return to the Big Time
description: BRENHAM, Tex.  Before Cam Newton won the Heisman Trophy, before he was drafted first over all, before he led the Carolina Panthers to Super Bowl 50, he woke up to mooing. The bovine alarm clocks grazed in a pasture, since built over, situated a deep spiral from his first-floor residence in Building 5 of the College Park Apartments here.

title: Obama Seeks More Than $1 Billion to Fight Opioid Abuse
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration said on Tuesday that it would ask Congress to spend an additional $1.1 billion next year to combat a growing epidemic of prescription painkiller and heroin abuse.

title: Review: In The Fugitives, Looking for His Muse in All the Wrong Places
description: In his new novel, The Fugitives, Christopher Sorrentino grafts a halfhearted, Elmore Leonard-style casino heist plot onto what is fundamentally the mournful story of one mans failures as a writer, a husband and a father. The result is something close to a disaster.

title: The Vegetarian, a Surreal South Korean Novel
description: When Han Kangs surreal, violent novel The Vegetarian was published in South Korea nearly a decade ago, literary critics found it baffling. The story stars an unhinged heroine who believes shes turning into a tree, and features some of the strangest erotic passages in literature. (In one unforgettable scene, Ms. Han renders clichd sexual metaphors about flowering plants and protruding pistils quite literally.)

title: Robert Geller: Fall 2016
description: The latest fall looks.

title: After Suing Over Eggless Spread, Hellmanns Introduces Its Own
description: If you cant beat em, join em. Unilever, the global food and consumer products giant, said on Tuesday that it would begin selling an eggless sandwich spread.

title: The Tiny London Shop Behind Some of the Very Best Libraries
description: Londons Heywood Hill curates impressive collections for discerning customers in 60 different countries  and specializes in the obscure.

title: Pentagon Chief Calls for Spending Increase to Address Multiple Threats
description: WASHINGTON  Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter said Tuesday that the United States faced a dramatically different security environment than at any point in the past 25 years, arguing for an increase in military spending to confront an array of threats like the Islamic State and Russia.

title: Marissa Mayer Sets Yahoo on Streamlined Course
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Yahoo is moving full speed ahead  in every direction.

title: Gun Tests and Tears at Officer Peter Liangs Trial in Killing
description: One by one, the jurors held the Glock 9-millimeter pistol that had belonged to Police Officer Peter Liang, from which a bullet ricocheted down a housing project stairwell and killed an unarmed man in November 2014.

title: A Meditation Room of Ones Own
description: Feeling for: a curvilinear steel-framed, wood-layered meditation pod from the popular mindfulness app Headspace, for zoning out in comfort and style.

title: Easing Into Pinstripes
description: The once-stiff power symbol has become more versatile.

title: Virginia Girl Probably Died the Day She Vanished, Officials Say
description: WASHINGTON  A 13-year-old Virginia girl was most likely stabbed to death by a Virginia Tech student on the day she disappeared, the authorities in Blacksburg, Va., said Tuesday, and a second university student  originally accused of helping dispose of the body  now faces charges of helping commit the murder.

title: Muslim Conference Calls for Protection of Religious Minorities
description: MARRAKESH, Morocco  At a recent conference held by Muslim scholars to confront violence in the Islamic world, a representative of the Yazidi religious minority in Iraq and Syria said his people desperately needed protection from the Islamic State.

title: Techs Track Record of Shake-Ups at the Top
description: Ups and downs are nothing new in the fast-moving technology industry. And as soon as a company hits turbulence, calls for a management shake-up almost always follow.

title: Threes a Trend: Urban Meditation Destinations
description: Inspired by their own love of conscious quietude, a trio of women in Los Angeles and New York are bringing nirvana to the jaded masses.

title: Kickstarter as a Path to Grammy Nominations, Far Beyond the Indie Scene
description: Three years ago, the Nashville Symphony was in austerity mode as it recovered from the financial crisis and a flood that caused $40 million in damage to its building. To help finance an album of works by the composer Joan Tower, the orchestra turned for the first time to a source more associated with indie rock than with classical music: Kickstarter.

title: Bernie Sanders Heads to New Hampshire on Iowa Momentum
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Senator Bernie Sanders, who came within half a percentage point of defeating Hillary Clinton in Iowa, will spend the next week trying to maintain a significant advantage in New Hampshire, where he has been leading in polls for months.

title: Review: A New York Philharmonic Contact! Menu, With Esa-Pekka Salonen as Chef
description: Though he wont be the next music director of the New York Philharmonic, Esa-Pekka Salonen isnt leaving anytime soon: Named the orchestras composer in residence last year, he remains in that position through the 2017-18 season. He programmed and hosted the Philharmonics latest installment of its Contact! new-music series on Monday at National Sawdust in Williamsburg, a rare foray to Brooklyn by a Lincoln Center institution.

title: Review: The Curtis Symphony Orchestra Dives Into Mahler and More
description: Luciano Berios groundbreaking Sinfonia, which helped pave the way for the freewheeling compositional styles now in vogue, is too seldom heard. So Ludovic Morlots stirring rendition with the Curtis Symphony Orchestra at Carnegie Hall on Monday evening was most welcome.

title: With the Return of Mens Fashion Week to New York, Street Style Is Back
description: For a number of stylish guys heading to Day 1 of the biannual showcase, suits were all the rage.

title: New Western Wall Prayer Space Highlights Wider Divide Among Jews
description: JERUSALEM  It seemed a solution worthy of Solomon: create a permanent egalitarian prayer space at the Western Wall alongside the gender-segregated area that has been the subject of vitriolic protest.

title: Leicester City Tops Liverpool, and Keeps On Dreaming of Title
description: LEICESTER, England  Three years ago this Thursday, a news conference was held at the University of Leicester to confirm that the remains discovered beneath a city parking lot in 2012 were those of King Richard III, one of the most vilified monarchs in history. The finding, which involved a glorious combination of science and serendipity, brought global attention to this city in Englands East Midlands, and when Richards remains were reburied inside the local Anglican cathedral last year, a steady stream of tourists followed, too.

title: Chipotle Food-Safety Issues Drag Down Profits
description: Chipotle Mexican Grill revealed on Tuesday that federal prosecutors had expanded their inquiry into the companys multistate outbreaks of food-borne illnesses, further threatening sales that declined steeply by the end of last year.

title: Visions of Oakland, Made of Cloth
description: Many facets of the California city  bits of its personality, its history and its social complexity  are captured in works by the African American Quilt Guild of Oakland.

title: Quilts With a Sense of Place, Stitched in Oakland
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Wildfires were burning across California as Marion Coleman began Firestorm, her quilt about the flames that ravaged the Oakland and Berkeley Hills in 1991. It is an inferno captured in cloth: the blackened silhouettes of trees, engulfed in a blaze of intricate, swirling stitches.

title: Fischli and Weiss: Anarchy at the Guggenheim
description: In the art of the 20th century, comedy was tough to come by. Marcel Duchamp and his urinal were the original stand-up act, and Magritte was good for some laughs. But a long, dry stretch followed, through Abstract Expressionism and Minimalism, lightened up in the 1960s only by oddball wits like Ray Johnson and Lee Lozano.

title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing: Donald Trump, Bernie Sanders, Bill Cosby
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Nautica: Fall 2016
description: Nauticas first runway show since February 2014.

title: Review: In Rams, Brothers at Odds Face a Shared Threat to Their Livelihood
description: Even though they live in rural Iceland, thousands of miles from the Holy Land, and in a modern reality of computers and mechanized farm equipment, Gummi and Kiddi have a decidedly Old Testament vibe. Its not just the untended beards and the well-tended sheep. The two men, who live on neighboring farms in a quiet valley, are feuding brothers, locked in a sibling rivalry that recalls Jacob and Esau or Cain and Abel. The sources of the bad blood are never specified, but it trickles though Rams, Grimur Hakonarsons new film, like an icy stream.

title: New Offensive by Assads Forces Overshadows Syria Peace Talks
description: GENEVA  A major offensive by Syrian government forces backed by intensive Russian airstrikes in and around the northern city of Aleppo on Tuesday cast a pall over United Nations efforts to draw government and opposition delegates assembled in Geneva into substantive peace talks.

title: Uber Drivers and Others in the Gig Economy Take a Stand
description: Last September, Dallas-area drivers for UberBlack, the companys high-end car service, received an email informing them that they would be expected to start picking up passengers on UberX, its low-cost option.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Pictures of the Day: Panama and Elsewhere
description: Panama and More  Photos of the Day

title: Feb. 2, 2016  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Panama, France, Russia and the United States.

title: What Were Reading  After Iowa
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Lady Gaga Will Sing the National Anthem at Super Bowl 50
description: The Super Bowl lineup has gained another diva: Lady Gaga will sing the national anthem on Sunday at Levis Stadium in Santa Clara, Calif., the N.F.L. and CBS announced on Tuesday.

title: Iowa Results Signal Long Nominating Contests for Both Parties
description: A pair of presidential primary battles that just days ago seemed to have heavy favorites now present the prospect of protracted and expensive contests for both parties, as the candidates who survived the Iowa caucuses surged on Tuesday toward the New Hampshire primary to be held next week.

title: Opinin: En Per, una campaa presidencial y un juicio por asesinato van de la mano
description: LIMA, Per  En los 80, Hugo Bustos trabajaba como fotoperiodista en Ayacucho, una provincia peruana que entonces se rega por ley marcial. En esa poca el ejrcito libraba una campaa brutal de contrainsurgencia para abatir a Sendero Luminoso. El trabajo de Bustos como reportero lo convirti en un testigo incmodo de las atrocidades cometidas por ambos bandos, y recibi numerosas amenazas de muerte.

title: The Intercept Says Reporter Falsified Quotations
description: The news website The Intercept said on Tuesday that a former reporter had fabricated quotations in some of his articles and impersonated other people by using email accounts in their names.

title: Harpers Magazine Publisher Fires Christopher Cox as Editor
description: Christopher Cox, the editor of Harpers Magazine, was fired by John R. MacArthur, the magazines president and publisher, last week, after a three-month tenure.

title: Businesses Owned by Women Less Likely to Win U.S. Contracts, Study Shows
description: WASHINGTON  The odds of businesses owned by women winning a federal contract are about 21 percent lower than for otherwise similar companies, and years of effort to increase those chances have barely made an impact, according to a new report from the Commerce Department.

title: Carlos Campos: Fall 2016
description: The Honduran born designers official NYFW runway debut.

title: Fox Adds Mexicos National Team to Its Soccer Stable
description: Fox Sports has added the English-language rights to 25 games involving Mexicos national team to its arsenal of soccer properties.

title: Spain: Socialist Aims to Form Coalition
description: King Felipe VI on Tuesday asked the leader of the Socialist party, Pedro Snchez, to try to form a coalition government and break Spains political deadlock after inconclusive elections in December. Last month, Spains acting prime minister, Mariano Rajoy, turned down the kings offer, saying that he lacked sufficient support to form a government. Although Mr. Rajoys conservative Popular Party won the most votes in December, it lost its parliamentary majority. But Mr. Snchez also faces an uphill struggle. He has been trying to persuade two emerging parties  Podemos and Citizens  to back him, even though the leaders of the two parties have recently ruled out working together. He also faces dissent within his own party to a coalition with Podemos. He has asked for one month to line up possible partners before seeking the endorsement of lawmakers. If he fails and no other leader is able to put together a viable government, new elections will have to be called.

title: A Conversation With Gregg L. Schenker
description: Mr. Schenker, 49, is the president and a managing partner of ABS Partners Real Estate, a New York-based brokerage, management and consulting firm that also invests in commercial property, mainly office buildings. Mr. Schenker helped start ABS in 1999, along with Earle S. Altman, the chairman, whom he met while working at Helmsley Spear in his first job out of college.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: Saudi Court Spares Poets Life but Gives Him 8 Years and 800 Lashes
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia  A court in Saudi Arabia on Tuesday revised the punishment given to a stateless Palestinian poet convicted of apostasy, reducing it from death to eight years in prison, 800 lashes and public repentance, his lawyer said.

title: Teenage Brothers Held in Killings at Seattle Homeless Camp
description: Three teenagers who were arrested Monday in the shooting deaths of two people at a Seattle homeless encampment called the Jungle are homeless brothers who live in another camp under an overpass.

title: A Warning on Bankruptcy in Puerto Ricos Debt Crisis
description: WASHINGTON  Puerto Ricos financial troubles are so complex and far-reaching that bankruptcy alone will not solve them, and might even make them worse, experts on financial distress told lawmakers in Washington on Tuesday.

title: Flints Former Manager Resigns as Head of Detroit Schools
description: CHICAGO  The state-appointed emergency manager of the Detroit Public Schools, who had also managed the city of Flint and oversaw its decision to draw its water from the Flint River, resigned on Tuesday, the day before a congressional committee hearing in Washington on Flints water.

title: Amazon Is Said to Be Planning an Expansion Into Retail Bookstores
description: SEATTLE  Amazon signs may be headed to more physical storefronts.

title: Myron Beldock, a Lawyer Who Championed Wounded Outcasts, Right Until the End
description: In the courthouse lobby, the short, white-haired man seemed to be more clothes than body, bundled in a coat and scarf. It was a December day in 2013.

title: A Raisin in the Sun Through the Eyes of Afro-Swedes
description: STOCKHOLM  Groundbreaking at the time, the 1959 Broadway play A Raisin in the Sun showcased to a wider public the struggles of a poor African-American family on the South Side of Chicago.

title: Senators Call for a Much Broader Recall of Defective Takata Airbags After a Recent Death
description: With millions of cars containing potentially defective airbags made by Takata still on the road, two senators on Tuesday urged the Obama administration to significantly expand the airbag recalls.

title: 2 Generals Say Women Should Register for Draft
description: WASHINGTON  Two senior military leaders said Tuesday that women should be required to register for the draft now that the Pentagon had opened all combat roles to them.

title: Gordon Goody, a Leader of the Gang in the Great Train Robbery, Dies at 85
description: Gordon Goody, who combined the rakishness of James Bond with the bravado of Jesse James to help conjure up Britains daredevil Great Train Robbery in 1963, died on Friday in Mojcar, Spain. He was 85.

title: Cam Newton Tries to Move On After Comments on Race
description: Cam Newton surprised many people last week when he said that race played a factor in how he was perceived as a quarterback. In an interview session with members of the news media on Tuesday, he declared the subject closed, at least as far as he was concerned.

title: New York Officer Ran Prostitution Ring at Motels, Authorities Say
description: Eduardo Cornejo had been an officer in the New York Police Department for more than a decade. But in a phone call one night last month, the authorities said, he hinted at his other, more nefarious work.

title: Chicago Professor Resigns Amid Sexual Misconduct Investigation
description: A prominent molecular biologist at the University of Chicago has resigned after a university recommendation that he be fired for violating the schools sexual misconduct policy. His resignation comes amid calls for universities to be more transparent about sexual harassment in their science departments, where women account for only one-quarter of senior faculty jobs.

title: After 14 Years at Odds, Argentina Aims to Settle Debt With Hedge Funds
description: After a bitter face-off for more than a decade between Argentina and a group of disgruntled New York hedge funds, both sides have come to the negotiating table with fresh hopes of a resolution.

title: Early Release for Insider Trading Convict
description: A hedge fund manager convicted of insider trading is being allowed to leave the San Francisco halfway house where he was serving out his 24-month sentence while he appeals his 2012 conviction.

title: Ovadia & Sons: Fall 2016
description: The latest show from Jerusalem born, Brooklyn raised, twin brothers Ariel and Shimon Ovadia.

title: Marco Rubio Campaign Dispatches Its Army and New Lines of Attack
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Senator Marco Rubio of Florida landed here at 2 a.m. on Tuesday, bleary but beaming from a surprisingly strong showing in Iowa, and confronted growing expectations from his partys establishment that he may be the best equipped to unite Republicans.

title: Diminutive All-Star Isaiah Thomas Finds Shoulders to Stand On
description: There are things that bother Isaiah Thomas, things that most N.B.A. players, most N.B.A. All-Stars, do not ever have to worry about.

title: For Alphabet, the Path to Becoming the Most Valuable Company in the World
description: With the close of Tuesdays trading, it was official: Alphabet, the newly formed holding company for Google, is the most highly valued company in the world.

title: Opposition to de Blasios Horse Plan Builds as Council Vote Nears
description: If Mayor Bill de Blasio thought he had a difficult time in Iowa, knocking on doors for Hillary Clintons presidential campaign, he returned home to a grimmer challenge: marshaling votes for his plan to shrink the horse-carriage trade and restrict it to Central Park.

title: Illegal Border Crossings by Families Drop Sharply
description: The number of women and children illegally crossing the southwest border into the United States dropped sharply in January, the Department of Homeland Security reported Tuesday, reversing a surge late last year that Obama administration officials feared could become a chaotic influx like the one in 2014.

title: Bourgeois Baseball Position
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  As a college student, Tom McCoy probably thinks about his future quite a bit.

title: California: Los Angeles Charges Gas Company in Leak
description: Los Angeles prosecutors have filed criminal misdemeanor charges against an energy company for failing to immediately report a natural gas leak that began in October and has forced thousands from their homes. The Southern California Gas Company, which owns the leaking well that has pumped tons of natural gas into the air for more than three months, was charged withthree counts of failing to report the release of hazardous materials fromOct. 23 to Oct. 26, and one count of discharging air contaminants, from Oct. 23 to the present. The company could face fines of up to $25,000 a day for each day that state regulators were not notified about the leak. Fines of $1,000 per day could also be applied for the pollution violation. Jackie Lacey, the Los Angeles district attorney, said that a criminal conviction would help prevent similar public health threatsin the future." Also Tuesday, Attorney General Kamala Harris joined a long list of parties suing the utility company over the leak.

title: Devils Squeak by Rangers and Move Closer to Second
description: NEWARK  Less than two minutes before he scored the game-winning goal Tuesday, defenseman David Schlemko coughed up the puck with the Devils on a power play, leading to a juicy short-handed breakaway chance for Rangers defenseman Ryan McDonagh.

title: The People v. O.J. Simpson Premiere: The Trial of the Century Retold
description: For those above a certain age, it would be easy to experience  The People v. O. J. Simpson: American Crime Story as an extended nostalgia parade. The trial of O. J. Simpson for the murders of Nicole Brown Simpson and Ronald Goldman, which ran from opening statements in January 1995 to the not-guilty verdicts that October, was inescapable.

title: Kristaps Porzingis, Easts Rookie of Month, Continues Recent Struggles
description: Kristaps Porzingis was honored Tuesday afternoon as the Eastern Conferences rookie of the month for the third straight time. A few hours later, the Celtics, unimpressed by his growing list of credentials, battered and bruised Porzingis and the Knicks, 97-89, at Madison Square Garden, dropping the Knicks (23-28) to five games below .500 for the first time this season.

title: What to Watch Wednesday
Word of the Day + Quiz | diva
description: diva  \de-v\  noun

title: Ken Stabler and C.T.E.
description: The family of Ken Stabler, the former Raiders quarterback who died in July at age 69, speaks about his life and the effects of C.T.E., which was diagnosed posthumously.

title: Snapshots of Daily Life in China
description: A collective Instagram account highlights photographs and short videos taken across the country, some of which are featured here.

title: Corrections: February 3, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: He fought like a miracle. He was successfully leading my men on my behalf for 44 days until I recovered.

title: Eyes on China: Illuminating Life Across a Changing Country
description: BEIJING  Two photographers living in China, Kevin Frayer of Getty Images and Fred Dufour of Agence France-Presse, set up a collective Instagram account in June that displays photographs and short videos taken across China. They called it Eyes on China.

title: Moving Freely, and Photographing, in Marseille
description: Joan Liftins images are guided not by storytelling, but by freedom and movement, a driving force from her early years as a dancer.

title: ChemChina Deal for Syngenta Reflects Drive to Meet Food Needs
description: Americas biggest pork producer and a major agricultural commodities trader have been among Chinas prized acquisitions in recent years.

title: Moving Freely, and Photographing, in Marseille
description: From rooftops to railroad tracks, Joan Liftin seemed to be walking  and looking  everywhere in Marseille. She could look up to see the sunshine washing over street art. Below her, a puddle reflects a man in a suit. Underground, passengers wait for the Metro. Though she insists there are no stories in photography, the images in her new book, Marseille, reflect that freedom of movement, which is no surprise: Her artistic spirit comes from modern dance.

title: The N.F.L.s Tragic C.T.E. Roll Call
description: Chronic traumatic encephalopathy, a degenerative brain disease, has been found in dozens of former N.F.L. players. Here are some of the most notable cases, along with New York Times coverage.

title: The Pentagons Top Threat? Russia
description: The Pentagon has put Russia at the top of its list of national security threats with its plan to increase the deployment of heavy weapons, armored vehicles and troops on rotating assignment to NATO countries in Central and Eastern Europe.

title: The Conservative Case for Campaign-Finance Reform
description: ALL Americans should be alarmed about the effects of money in politics. But it is conservatives who should be leading the fight for campaign-finance reform. Unfortunately, none of the Republican candidates for president have taken on this issue.

title: Social Media: Destroyer or Creator?
description: Over the last few years weve been treated to a number of Facebook revolutions, from the Arab Spring to Occupy Wall Street to the squares of Istanbul, Kiev and Hong Kong, all fueled by social media. But once the smoke cleared, most of these revolutions failed to build any sustainable new political order, in part because as so many voices got amplified, consensus-building became impossible.

title: Fighting the Zika Virus
description: The World Health Organization and its director general, Dr. Margaret Chan, were right to declare the Zika virus an international public health emergency, even if its suspected link to severe birth defects has not been proved. The mosquito-borne disease is a serious threat: It is usually so mild as to be undetectable in adults, yet as it has exploded across South and Central America it has been followed by a surge in babies born with underdeveloped heads, a condition called microcephaly.

title: To End Syrias War, Help Assads Officers Defect
description: AS the fraught Syria peace talks inch forward in Geneva, the United States finds itself with little leverage to help negotiate an end to a conflict that has left almost a quarter of a million people dead and helped fuel the worst refugee crisis since World War II.

title: Mr. Cuomos Housing Wrecking Ball
description: Gov. Andrew Cuomo, who should be using his power to make New York City more hospitable to working-class and middle-class families, has instead slipped a little poison into his executive budget that could cripple the citys ambitious efforts to build affordable housing.

title: News Qs | Unemployed, Myanmars Elephants Grow Antsy, and Heavier
description: The following lesson activities are based on the above video and the article Unemployed, Myanmars Elephants Grow Antsy, and Heavier.

title: No Longer Solely for Masters of the Universe: The Pinstripe Suit
description: Debonair, that was the word.

title: For Millennial Men, Gray Hair Is Welcome
description: On two magazine covers the singer Zayn Malik has graced in the last few months  for Billboard and LUomo Vogue (as well as the racy video with his girlfriend, Gigi Hadid)  he looks every bit the young brooding pop star. The requisite smoldering stare, perfectly manicured stubble and bad boy tattoos are all in tow.

title: Celtics Danny Ainge Is Striving to Build Another Winner
description: Danny Ainge does not require much persuasion in order to admit, The reality is that we havent done anything yet other than not falling to the bottom of the barrel.

title: The Ballet Dancer Troy Schumacher on His Fashion Favorites
description: The New York City Ballet dancer and choreographer Troy Schumacher, 29, has been with the company since 2005. As a choreographer, he is known for ballet-meets-fashion collaborations with designers such as Thom Browne, and the team Marta Marques and Paulo Almeida of MarquesAlmeida. His work with the design duo, in the ballet Common Ground, is featured this month at Lincoln Center for the ballet companys winter season. He offered a peek inside his closet.

title: In Ecuador, the Frugal Traveler Tries Luxury
description: I was not surprised when applause broke out as the pilot touched down at the Quito airport, high in the Ecuadorean Andes. In five and a half years as the Frugal Traveler columnist, Ive learned that cheering a safe arrival is a standard (and lovable) practice in some parts of the world.

title: Roger Goodells Unstoppable Football Machine
description: Everywhere you go at the National Football Leagues corporate headquarters in Manhattan, a Park Avenue enclave that feels both futuristic and retro at the same time, you encounter the Shield. The star-studded, upside-down nipple with a football floating on top adorns the front doors; it is painted on walls, carved into trophies, printed on napkins and mouse pads, inlaid in silver on a conference table, etched into cuff links and iced onto cookies. All employees receive a Lucite Shield at the beginning of the season. Security guards in the lobby wear tiny Shield pins. The Shield is sacrosanct. It is a symbol of almost mystical power, and its display seems to be governed by some Constitution-like power. It stands for big notions, like Respect, Resilience, Integrity and Responsibility to Team. These words greet you in big letters on the glass entrance door.

title: Gay Congregation Celebrates Its Identity With New Home in Manhattan
description: The members of Congregation Beit Simchat Torah have not spent 40 years in the real estate wilderness of New York City.

title: Student Demands: Whos Resigned, Whats Renamed
description: This academic year, administrators have wrestled with a deluge of student demands related to cultural and racial issues on campus. Some have been met. Heres a recap:

title: The Power Couple of the New York Tech Scene
description: A girlfriend likes to joke that my look is aggressively natural, said Chelsa Crowley, a founder and the chief creative officer of Stowaway, an online cosmetics company that started last February. Its natural, but bumped up a notch.

title: After Racist Episodes, Blunt Discussions on Campus
description: Scott N. Brooks, draped in a dapper shawl-collar sweater, looked out on the auditorium of mostly white students in puffy coats and sweats as they silently squirmed at his question. Why, he had asked, does Maria Sharapova, a white Russian tennis player, earn nearly twice as much in endorsements as Serena Williams, an African-American with a much better win-loss record?

title: A Political Divide in New Hampshire
description: A mix of contentment and unease hints at the complex dynamics at play in the state as the spotlight shifts to its primary next Tuesday.

title: In New Hampshire, an Anxious Political Landscape as Voting Nears
description: NELSON, N.H.  In this tiny New England town, population 729, with its white steepled church and village green, Hunt and Allison Aldrich Smith, Democrats who support Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont, live in a knotty pine house they built themselves.

title: Living in Hamilton Heights
description: From Hudson River vistas to the neo-Gothic splendor of the City College of New York, Hamilton Heights, in West Harlem, provides compelling sights around nearly every corner.

title: Hamilton Heights: Harlem Enclave With River Views
description: The number of rescue dogs that Barry Katz crosses paths with in Hamilton Heights, a section of West Harlem, tells him something about his neighborhood. At this point, its not a wealthy area, he said. People love their pets but cant afford to pay thousands of dollars for them. Bugsy, his walleyed, French bulldog-Boston terrier mix, is also a rescue.

title: Student Question | Have You Experienced Racism or Other Kinds of Discrimination in School?
description: Some students at Boston Latin, the countrys oldest public school, say it has created a hostile environment in which racial insensitivity is too common, and they have started a hashtag to tell their stories and raise awareness.

title: A Diet and Exercise Plan to Lose Weight and Gain Muscle
description: If there is a holy grail of weight loss, it would be a program that allows someone to shed fat rapidly while hanging on to or even augmenting muscle. Ideally, it would also be easy.

title: Paradise Now: The Story of American Utopianism, by Chris Jennings
description: By any measure, Ann Lee, the illiterate daughter of a Manchester blacksmith, led one of the most audacious and improbable lives of the 18th century. Born in 1736, she came of age in the fetid, soul-destroying crucible of English industrialization. But in religion, Lee discovered her native boldness and charisma. She became a prophet and, in 1774, led a small band of followers across the Atlantic. They became known as Shakers. And from a mean cabin in upstate New York they formed a society that would draw thousands into communal villages across much of the United States. Lee did not live to survey her realm. But her social conscience  forged in the bleak shadow of the Manchester mills  animated Shaker communities well into the 20th century.

title: In Europes Shadow, by Robert D. Kaplan
description: Some 35 years ago, Robert D. Kaplan embarked on what this book portrays as an enduring love affair. The object of his affection and fascination is not a person, but a country: Romania. It is an obsession that has led him to plunge into the surrounding Balkans, and farther afield to contemplate Europe in all its historic complexity.

title: Should Doctors-in-Training Work Fewer Hours?
description: How many hours should medical residents work?
