The next in the series is the cartoonist Alison Bechdel, winner of the 2014 MacArthur Genius Award and creator of the Bechdel test, which measures gender bias in film. She is also the author of the autobiographical graphic novel Fun Home, which was adapted into the Tony-winning musical of the same name. She shares her list exclusively with T.

title: Neighborly Ties Bind Some New Hampshire Voters to Bernie Sanders
description: HAVERHILL, N.H.  In a kitchen where tin pails and rustic kitchen tools hung from the ceiling beams, Glen Putnam pointed to the old box television atop a refrigerator that throughout his life has brought him the latest about Bernie Sanders.

title: Chocolate Peppermint Bars
description: Melissa Clark shows you how to make peppermint patties with a cookie crust.

title: Peppermint Patties Worthy of Dessert
description: We are a family of mint lovers, from the herbs on the deck to the tea in the cabinet to an entire drawer full of Altoids and Tic Tacs.

title: Bow in the Presence of Greatness: On Kanye Wests Twitter
description: Welcome to Social Capital, a series devoted to analyzing the social-media presences of celebrities.

title: Speed Dating for Rabbits
description: The matchmaker in the fur-flecked T-shirt got down to business. What about a white rabbit with pink eyes named Tonya?

title: Think Like a Doctor: Drowning on Dry Land Solved
description: On Thursday we challenged Well readers to unravel the case of a 67-year-old healthy retiree who suddenly developed knife-like chest pain and a worsening cough. Maybe this case was too easy because more than a quarter of you figured it out.

title: Ponzi Scheme in China Gained Credibility From State Media
description: HONG KONG  At every turn in his improbably rapid rise, Ding Ning, 34, went to great efforts to convey the image of strong government backing for his Internet financing business.

title: The Fashion News to Know This Week
description: Hello, does anyone work here?

title: A Hungry Sea Lion Wanders Into a Restaurant ...
description: A hungry sea lion pup wandered off the beach and into a fancy seaside San Diego restaurant Thursday morning, took one of the best seats in the house and peered out the window at the waves as if preparing to order a big plate of sardines.

title: How to Wear a Slip Dress  in the Daytime
description: This spring, the bygone garment is now the star attraction.

title: Joe Earley Named President of New Entertainment Company
description: LOS ANGELES  Joe Earley, who resigned in October from the Fox Television Group, where he served in senior leadership roles for more than two decades, will return to his old stamping grounds  sort of  starting Friday.

title: Sick and Tired of God Bless America
description: THE population of nonreligious Americans  including atheists, agnostics and those who call themselves nothing in particular  stands at an all-time high this election year. Americans who say religion is not important in their lives and who do not belong to a religious group, according to the Pew Research Center, have risen in numbers from an estimated 21 million in 2008 to more than 36 million now.

title: The Big Problem With High Health Care Deductibles
description: When Bernie Sanders released his long-awaited health care plan last month, it was light on the details. But it did include one major, crowd-pleasing promise: Under his Medicare-for-all proposal, no American would ever have to pay a deductible or co-payment to receive health care again.

title: Home Sales Around the New York Region
description: Information on sales in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Chamber Music Society Season Looks to Mendelssohn
description: Mendelssohn will be the guiding spirit next season at the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center, anchoring its opening night concert; a mid-winter festival; and a series of programs throughout the year, inspired by his grand tour of Europe, that will mix his music with that of cities he visited.

title: Why the Film Academys Diversity Push Is Tougher Than It Thinks
description: LOS ANGELES  Roughly 87 percent are white. About 58 percent are male. As many as two-thirds are at least 60 years old.

title: Tips on Reducing Cable and Phone Bills From Ethically Ambiguous Experts
description: BRENTWOOD, Tenn.  Cable companies and mobile phone service providers now offer so many deals, options, add-ons and doodads that the sheer number of potential pricing plans can boggle the mind. Chances are, youre paying too much. Chances are, most everyone is.

title: Literature of Love
description: Match the besotted, thwarted, inappropriate or (more rarely) happy character with his or her beloved.

title: Hunt for Suspects in Southern Crime Spree Reaches Violent End
description: A police hunt for a Missouri couple wanted for a series of abductions and robberies across the South ended early Friday on the Florida Panhandle in a barrage of gunfire that left one of the suspects dead.

title: Syrian Forces Press Aleppo, Sending Thousands Fleeing
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Syrian government and allied forces pressed their most significant advance in months on Friday, sending insurgents scrambling and tens of thousands of civilians fleeing toward the border with Turkey.

title: A Valentines Day Reading List
description: If, as Shakespeare informs us in A Midsummer Nights Dream, the course of true love never did run smooth, often that road seems even rougher in literature than in life. Some of the worlds most celebrated masterpieces are populated by vivid, beautifully drawn characters whose romantic disappointments and satisfactions Ive enjoyed talking about, with my students, in the literature classes Ive taught over the years.

title: Parties Close Out New York Mens Fashion Week
description: One month, four countries, two continents and a ton of shows later, the fall 2016 mens wear season had finally come to a close. But first, a drink.

title: Social Practice Degrees Take Art to a Communal Level
description: Carmen Papalias M.F.A. project doesnt look much like art. For Blind Field Shuttle, he led his classmates across the Portland State campus in Oregon on an eyes-closed walking tour, single file, each with a hand on the shoulder of the person in front.

title: Create Your Own Language, for Credit
description: 1. What do you say to embarrass a polar bear?

title: Learning to Live Small (in a Dumpster)
description: How to get students thinking about their environmental footprints?

title: Who Needs Advanced Math? Not Everybody
description: Andrew Hacker has taught political science at Queens College, City University of New York, for nearly 45 years, plus quantitative reasoning for the last three. Not one to decelerate, at 86 he is doing nothing less than taking on the mathosphere, where, he admits, he has few fans. His experimental course requires no geometry, algebra or calculus; instead, he teaches facility with numbers. He calls it adult arithmetic, and it involves statistics, analytic thinking and rigorous computation. Further challenging convention, his new book, The Math Myth and Other STEM Delusions, published next month, argues against the requirement that all high school students take a full menu of math.

title: Wood Shop Enters the Age of High-Tech
description: You remember wood shop. You made that swan-shaped planter your parents pretended to like. And then you moved on.

title: The Sheltering Campus: Why College Is Not Home
description: Erika Christakis used to teach a course at Yale titled The Concept of the Problem Child, a discussion of child development and socialization in a historical and modern context. The course was a seminar of 20 participants, and it was popular; she had planned extra sessions this semester to accommodate the hundreds of interested students.

title: Are You There, Teenagers? A Newsletter Aims for Your Inbox
description: There is perhaps no creature more vulnerable to scrutiny  or capable of fiercely scrutinizing others  than the teenage girl.

title: Maurice White, a Voyager Who Traveled Countless Musical Paths
description: Maurice White, the boundless funk voyager and smooth-soul maestro who died this week at 74, was one of musics most gifted alchemists of style. The floor-shaking hits he created with Earth, Wind & Fire were more than marvels of pop fusion  though with their precision blend of urbane jazz, Afrofuturist R&B and fluorescent disco, they were surely that. Mr. White, who had formative experience in the vanguard of African-American art music, brought the full spectrum of those interests to the table as a tunesmith, bandleader, producer and singer. His music was populist and positivist even as it arced toward a stratospheric level of harmonic and rhythmic sophistication.

title: Review: Broadway & the Bard Serves Delicious Combos
description: Shakespeare and Broadway have had a relationship quite a bit more intimate than a handshake over the years, but the two have perhaps never met with quite the coziness that they do in Broadway & the Bard, an odd but enjoyable solo show, starring the stage veteran Len Cariou, that juxtaposes monologues and sonnets with songs from musicals.

title: In a Slovenian Cave, Hoping for a Batch of Baby Dragons
description: Creatures resembling dragons dwell deep within the caves of Slovenia. And now with the help of biologists, a new brood is set to hatch at an unusual aquarium, accessible by underground train.

title: Fantasy Sites Are Dealt New Rebuff by Citigroup
description: Already under a growing legal and legislative assault, the daily fantasy sports industry was dealt a new blow Friday when Citigroup said it would begin blocking New Yorkers debit and credit card payments at the two largest sites, FanDuel and DraftKings.

title: Readers Respond: Infinite Jest at 20
description: Nearly 200 readers commented on Tom Bissells essay commemorating the 20th anniversary of David Foster Wallaces novel Infinite Jest. The reactions illustrated the divisive nature of the 1,076-page book. When it was first published, critics called it everything from tedious to uproarious. Some readers consider it a big-hearted postmodern masterpiece, while others find it a pretentious slog.

title: Bernie Sanders to Do S.N.L., With Larry David Hosting
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont plans to travel to New York this weekend to appear on Saturday Night Live, interrupting his campaign in New Hampshire for some national television exposure, according to a senior campaign official.

title: After the Super Bowl, Death Wish Coffee Might Need Its Own Brew to Keep Up
description: ROUND LAKE, N.Y.  Theres no question that Death Wish Coffee, a pirate-flag-adorned brand from upstate New York, is strong, like really strong, like linebacker-strong, like Super Bowl-hype strong, but is it the strongest coffee in the world?

title: Louisville Mens Basketball Team Will Skip Postseason as a Scandal Swirls
description: Louisville is voluntarily withholding its mens basketball team from this seasons Atlantic Coast Conference and N.C.A.A. tournaments, as the N.C.A.A. investigates a scandal in which a former basketball employee is accused of having purchased strippers and prostitutes for some recruits and their fathers from 2010 to 2014.

title: Trade and the Displaced
description: To the Editor:

title: Belgium to Double Spending on Police and Intelligence
description: PARIS  The Belgian government announced police and intelligence changes on Friday intended to address criticism of its failure to properly monitor or arrest the Islamic State-inspired extremists who used the country to plot the Nov. 13 attacks in Paris.

title: One More Thing for U.S. Womens Soccer Team to Worry About
description: The biggest challenge for Olympic and health officials in combating the Zika virus before the Rio Games may be the popular and far-flung sport of soccer, which will be played across Brazil.

title: A Coconut Palms Allure
description: To the Editor:

title: Its Time to Talk About Taxing Oil
description: By the standards of the old adage politics is the art of the possible President Obamas proposal to levy a $10 per barrel fee on oil production and imports is not very politic. But it is very good policy.

title: Pat Haden Stepping Down as U.S.C. Athletic Director
description: Pat Haden, who won two national championships as a quarterback at Southern California before returning nearly four decades later to preside over an athletic department mired in pay-for-play-related sanctions, will step down as the Trojans athletic director in June, the university president, C.L. Max Nikias, announced Friday.

title: The Critics Still Win
description: To the Editor:

title: The Way Ted Cruz Won in Iowa Suggests Trouble Ahead
description: Ted Cruz kept his hopes alive with a come-from-behind victory in the Iowa caucuses this week. But the way he won raises serious questions about his chances later on.

title: Twitter Steps Up Efforts to Thwart Terrorists Tweets
description: For years, Twitter has positioned itself as a global town square that is open to discourse from all. And for years, extremist groups like the Islamic State have taken advantage of that stance, using Twitter as a place to spread their messages.

title: Abortion and the Zika Virus
description: To the Editor:

title: Empowering Women
description: To the Editor:

title: Moving Files to a Mac From a PC
description: Q. How can I transfer files from a 10-year-old Dell PC to a MacBook Pro?

title: Las Vegas Review-Journal Names New Top Editor of Paper
description: The Las Vegas Review-Journal said on Friday that it had appointed a new editor, several weeks after the newspaper was bought by the billionaire casino magnate and Republican donor Sheldon Adelson under controversial circumstances.

title: Snarky Puppy: A House Built on Solid Funk
description: I know youre all wondering why I called you together, David Crosby said to peals of laughter as he sat down. Mr. Crosby, the crinkly folk-rock eminence, had come to Lil Frankies in the East Village for dinner with a half-dozen members of the group he once hailed on Twitter as quite possibly the most advanced band in the world ... certainly the best Ive heard/seen.

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: David Foster Wallaces Infinite Jest
description: Listen to this weeks podcast | Subscribe: iTunes | Stitcher

title: BlackBerry Lays Off 200, Pointing to Shift Away from Phones
description: OTTAWA  In what appears to be part of its retrenchment from making phones, BlackBerry said on Friday that it has laid off 200 workers at its head office in Ontario and at an office in Florida.

title: When a Public Family Is Publicly Attacked
description: When a blogger uses her multiracial family to make a public point, racist attacks may be inevitable. Is she right to take that risk  and to make that choice for her children?

title: Luxury Condos on Brooklyns Fourth Avenue
description: Carlo A. Scissura, the president of the Brooklyn Chamber of Commerce, has a grand vision for the boroughs Fourth Avenue, which for decades was a dreary boulevard where you were more likely to get your tires replaced or buy a cheap mattress than eat a fine meal or find a luxury apartment.

title: Australia Reacts to U.N. Decision on Julian Assange
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Julie Bishop, Australias foreign minister, has sought legal advice on the implications of a United Nations decision on Friday that the WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange, an Australian, has been unlawfully held by Sweden and Britain for more than five years.

title: Big Ticket | 46 East 81st Street
description: A five-story, 20-foot-wide brick townhouse at 46 East 81st Street, between Madison and Park Avenues, sold for $16 million and was one of the runner-up sales of the week in the city.

title: Central Park West Co-op Sold for $35.3 Million
description: One of the founders of the behemoth asset management company BlackRock sold his fully renovated apartment at the white-glove co-op 101 Central Park West for $35,336,000, a transaction that was the most expensive sale of the week, according to city records.

title: Pictures of the Day: Syria and Elsewhere
description: Syria and More  Pictures of the Day

title: In Iowa, Voting Science at Work
description: OF the two winners of the Iowa caucuses, whos the better behavioral scientist, Ted Cruz or Hillary Clinton? To judge from their campaigns respective get out the vote efforts, both politicians seem to have studied up on recent research in the field.

title: Ted Cruzs Campaign Spread False Report in Iowa That Ben Carson Was Quitting Race
description: As Iowa Republicans headed to the caucuses on Monday night, Senator Ted Cruzs campaign left recorded messages for supporters with breaking news that Ben Carson would drop out of the race, and told them to inform any Carson caucus-goers of this news and urge them to caucus for Ted instead.

title: Feb. 5, 2016  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Syria, Turkey, Japan and the United States.

title: French Spelling Changes, 26 Years in the Making, Cause a Fracas
description: LONDON  In France, the land of Molire, questions of language are so sacred that every Thursday the immortals, the guardians of the French language at the Acadmie Franaise, meet to discuss  among other things  proposed changes to the institutions vaunted dictionary.

title: Puerto Rican Officials Warn Congress of Major Defaults Without Restructuring
description: WASHINGTON  Puerto Rico and its top advisers made their case in Washington on Friday for a law that would allow broad restructuring of the islands multibillion-dollar debt, saying that if Congress did not act soon, major defaults were likely this spring.

title: Donald Trump Gets Snowed Out
description: MANCHESTER, N.H. Donald Trump Takes N.H. by Storm, said CNN.

title: For Deon Cole, the Comedy Keeps Him Busy
description: Seriously funny  thats how Deon Cole thinks of himself these days. But its not like his ego has run amok or anything.

title: Review: Recalling the Man in Jim: The James Foley Story
description: If some Americans had not registered just how brutal the Islamic State was before August 2014, the groups videotaped beheading of James Foley that month certainly drove the point home. Mr. Foley, 40, a freelance American journalist, became a symbol of sorts, evidence that the Islamic State, also known as ISIS or ISIL, was an unscrupulous enemy that could not be ignored.

title: New Albums From Infamous Stringdusters, Trixie Whitley and Others
description: LADIES AND GENTLEMEN

title: Syndicated, in Brooklyn, Offers Movies, Munchies and Breakups on the Menu
description: At Syndicated, a new restaurant, bar and cinema at 40 Bogart Street in Bushwick, Brooklyn, Tim Chung is certainly bringing a likable quirkiness to the task of curating the film selections. Themed double features often fill the Friday and Saturday slots, and the Feb. 12 and 13 pairing comes under the heading Erasing Your Ex?

title: Samantha Bee Takes Her Place on Late Night
description: Samantha Bee fumed for a few minutes in September, when Vanity Fair published an article on late-night television and placed a portrait of 10 hosts  all men, including Stephen Colbert, John Oliver, Conan OBrien and Trevor Noah  on its cover. Then she asked a co-worker to insert an image of her as a tattooed centaur shooting laser beams from her eyes into the portrait. She tweeted it with a single word: BETTER.

title: 21st-Century Music Rises on Three Stages
description: Wintry sounds predominate in Laws of Nature, a concert on Thursday, Feb. 11, at Pioneer Works in Red Hook, Brooklyn, featuring the lively new-music ensemble Contemporaneous. The program focuses on female composers and includes new and recent works by Fjla Evans, Anna Thorvaldsdottir and Kate Moore, as well as the premiere of an arrangement of Joanna Newsoms heartbreaking song Sawdust and Diamonds. (718-596-3001, pioneerworks.org.) More 21st-century music is on offer the same evening from the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center at the Kaplan Penthouse, in a salute to the New Mexico summer festival Music from Angel Fire. The Opus One Piano Quartet plays works by Lowell Liebermann, Steven Stucky, Marc Neikrug and Roberto Sierra. (212-875-5788, chambermusicsociety.org.)

title: Paul Bleys Legacy, Invoked in Tribute
description: Paul Bley, who died a few days into the new year, at 83, was a jazz pianist of enigmatic intention and restive yet soulful composure. A catalyst behind the transition from bebop to free jazz, he broadened the realm of possibility for his instrument, deeply influencing generations of improvising pianists. One of them, Keith Jarrett, performs a solo concert on Tuesday, Feb. 9, at Carnegie Hall, and it seems reasonable to assume that the music will unfold, on some level, as a tribute. (carnegiehall.org.)

title: Olivo Barbieris Serendipitous Choreography on the Adriatic
description: The Italian artist Olivo Barbieri is known for his photographs investigating human behavior in relation to the natural majesty of waterfalls and mountain ranges. Now he has turned his attention to the Italian coastline of the Adriatic Sea.

title: The Stakes in the Democratic Race
description: To the Editor:

title: The Latest Jobs Report Cuts Both Ways
description: The employment report for January, released on Friday, plays into the old joke about economists: Give me a one-handed economist, President Harry Truman once said. All my economists say on the one hand.on the other.

title: Review: The Gambler, Dostoyevsky With Laughs
description: Scroll through your mental list of gifted comic writers, and Dostoyevsky probably doesnt make the cut. But he was a funny guy, and his wisecracking novella The Gambler, published in 1866, is a case in point. Even the inevitable descent into torment and ruin is peppered with laughter.

title: Review: A Schubert Song Cycle and Moods It Inspired
description: Schubert already knew he was dying when, during his final three months of life, in 1828, he composed three piano sonatas, the Shepherd on the Rock trio, the String Quintet in C and 14 songs that were later published together under the heading Schwanengesang (Swan Song). Unlike his other song cycles, like Winterreise, there isnt a dramatic or narrative thread to Schwanengesang, though one was provided on Thursday in a thoughtfully conceived program by the baritone Roderick Williams, the pianist Susie Allan and the actress Jenny Agutter.

title: Review: Aventura Sighs Goodbye, as Women Squeal
description: A high-voiced heartthrob and songwriter leads his band to Top 10 albums and arenas, goes solo and headlines his own stadium shows. Then he rejoins his former bandmates for a final set of performances together. Its the story of Michael Jackson and the Jacksons. Its also the story of Romeo Santos and Aventura, a band formed in the Bronx in the 1990s that brought bachata, music from the Dominican Republic, to listeners worldwide.

title: Pentagon Releases Small Portion of Photos From Detainee Abuse Cases
description: WASHINGTON  The Pentagon on Friday released 198 photographs from detainee abuse investigations in the Afghanistan and Iraq wars. The pictures, taken more than a decade ago during the Bush administration, consist largely of close-up views of scrapes and bruises on detainees bodies.

title: Cyanotypes: Photographys Blue Period
description: Cyanotype, a 19th-century photographic printing process, is making a resurgence, notably in an exhibition at the Worcester Art Museum.

title: Review: Regression: Memory Isnt All Its Cracked Up to Be
description: In the late 1990s and early 2000s Alejandro Amenbar directed two of the most striking and dynamic genre movies of the time, 1997s knotty and terrifying virtual-reality/time travel tale Abre los Ojos (Open Your Eyes) and 2001s innovative but in many respects gratifyingly old-fashioned ghost story The Others.

title: Cyanotype, Photographys Blue Period, Is Making a Comeback
description: The Phoenix artist Annie Lopez wanted to stand out among her contemporary peers. Instead of trying to invent something utterly new, she has been turning to a 174-year-old photographic printing process  cyanotypes, once used for copying architectural drawings  and giving it her own distinctive twist.

title: Marco Rubio Is Endorsed by The Las Vegas-Review, Owned by Sheldon Adelson
description: Senator Marco Rubio of Florida won the endorsement on Friday of The Las Vegas-Review, Nevadas largest newspaper, an important boost in a state that could play a key role in his efforts to win the Republican presidential nomination.

title: Argentina Reaches Debt Deal With 2 Hedge Funds
description: Argentina has offered to pay $6.5 billion to a group of hedge funds holding bonds it defaulted on 14 years ago in a historic effort by the nation to put a bitter legal battle behind it.

title: In Rome, a Grand Welcome for 2 Long-Deceased Saints
description: ROME  Along the broad boulevard leading to St. Peters Square, the faithful pressed forward. Nuns pointed cellphone cameras. Others stood on tiptoes, trying to catch a glimpse. Squadrons of police officers restrained the crowds and blocked traffic, as motorists could do little except step out of their cars and watch the show.

title: Candidates Make Rounds in New Hampshire Before Primary
description: The states voters got a closer look at the Republican and Democratic candidates as a prelude to Tuesdays events.

title: City History, and Vantages, Often Overlooked
description: America begins in New York, Kenneth T. Jackson, the Columbia University professor and editor of the Encyclopedia of New York City, likes to say. Now comes the journalist and author Fergus M. Bordewich to engagingly revive the forgotten story of the nearly 18 months that New York was the nations first capital in The First Congress: How James Madison, George Washington and a Group of Extraordinary Men Invented the Government (Simon & Schuster, $30).

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing: Bernie Sanders, Denver Broncos, Syria
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Feel the Bern? Maybe Not on Tinder
description: When used as intended, Tinder, the mobile dating application, can provide many things: actual dating, long-term relationships, casual sex, new friends, mindless entertainment or validation that at least the occasional stranger finds you minimally attractive.

title: The Praying Mantis, a Friend and Foe of New York City Gardens
description: Perplexed urbanites might suspect that the frothy, walnut-size blobs attached to shrubs, fence posts and grass stems this time of year are insect-related. But not many guess that these are the egg masses of praying mantises.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Tommy Hilfiger Drills Deep and Hits Fashion Pay Dirt
description: When ship manifests and immigration rosters fail to produce an aha moment in the popular PBS genealogy whodunit, Finding Your Roots, the shows host, Henry Louis Gates Jr., often has a sleuth card up his sleeve. Go to the DNA. Buried in our genes lie clues to origin stories  or, anyway, the basis for tidy pie charts diagraming blood quantum.

title: Supporters Gather at Funeral for Oregon Protester
description: KANAB, Utah  The mourners and sympathizers came from across the West on Friday, in pickups flying American flags, to attend the funeral here of LaVoy Finicum, the one member of a band of armed protesters in Princeton, Ore., who was killed last week after a car chase with the authorities.

title: The Top 10 Moments From Mens Fashion Month
description: Designer musical chairs, a Vine star in Milan, David Bowie tributes  and more highlights.

title: Brazil Finds Zika Virus in Human Urine and Saliva, but Risk Is Unclear
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Brazilian scientists said Friday that they had detected the presence of the Zika virus in samples of human saliva and urine, a first for Brazil.

title: Pleading the Case to Get Parking Tickets Dismissed
description: Two cigarettes into his brief afternoon break, Brian LaRoche, 35, glanced at a parking ticket on a Verizon van parked on John Street in Lower Manhattan, and offered his assessment.

title: New York Welcomes Calvin Kleins New Underwear Hunk and YouTubes Tyler Oakley
description: Occasionally, and especially when ones own gym visits have receded into the distant past, one finds oneself face-to-navel with greatness.

title: Not Elegance but Survival
description: Polygon Elite, founded and led by Sergei Maslikhov, offers lessons in the ancient Russian martial art known as Systema Rukopashnii Boi.

title: Teaching a Medieval Russian Martial Art in a Flatiron Basement
description: The desert boot of the instructor weighed heavily on the sternum of a student lying on a thin layer of industrial carpeting. In this low-slung and windowless room, five others were on the ground, awaiting their turn under the boot of their teacher, Sergei Maslikhov. The man under his heel grimaced but bore Mr. Maslikhovs weight stoically.

title: How Some Mobile Apps Have Led to Sex Crimes and Scandals
description: Law enforcement officials are increasingly concerned about apps that offer users greater anonymity and reach.

title: Wildly Popular App Kik Offers Teenagers, and Predators, Anonymity
description: The allegations are beyond chilling: two Virginia Tech freshmen charged with the premeditated kidnapping and killing of a 13-year-old girl who, authorities say, communicated with her murderer online.

title: What Were Reading  Special Super Bowl Edition
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Outrage Grows as Italy Investigates Students Death in Egypt
description: CAIRO  The furor surrounding the death of an Italian student whose body was discovered Wednesday on an Egyptian roadside grew Friday as Italian investigators flew to Cairo to help find his killers, and it emerged that the young man had secretly written from Egypt for a left-wing Italian newspaper.

title: Street Style at New York Fashion Week: Mens
description: Fashion on the streets during the final day of the mens shows in New York City.

title: An Old Cathedral and a Daily Aperitivo
description: On any given weekend, NoLItas tastefully curated boutiques are brimming with avid shoppers. Over on the Bowery, the New Museum draws contemporary art lovers. Seekers of spiritual atonement  or the merely curious  slip into the Basilica of St. Patricks Old Cathedral, a historic sanctuary on the corner of Mott and Prince Streets.

title: The Classic Ballet Flat Grows Up
description: Modern interpretations of the classical slipper, with ankle laces and pointed toes.

title: Conflicting Economic Indicators Challenge Feds Policy Makers
description: WASHINGTON  The contrast between the improving health of the labor market and the weakness of other economic indicators poses a challenging quandary for the Federal Reserve.

title: Eight Boldly Striped Bags for Spring
description: Formally ladylike shapes get a burst of energy from the sportiest of patterns.

title: How Val DiFebo, C.E.O. of Deutsch NY, Spends Her Sundays
description: When huge numbers of Americans sit down to watch the Super Bowl and its high-profile ads this weekend, Val DiFebo will have had a hand in some of what they see. Ms. DiFebo, 54, is the chief executive of the ad agency Deutsch NY, whose parent company has delivered well-remembered spots, including one with a chorus of dogs barking the Imperial March from Star Wars, to past Super Bowls. For this years big game, look for Deutschs Taco Bell spot. A Bronx native, Ms. DiFebo lives in Douglaston, Queens, a waterfront community between Bayside and Little Neck, with her husband, J. Dixon Byrne, 64, an actor; their son, Bryan, 11; and their Yorkshire terrier, Murphy.

title: Former N.A.A.C.P. President Endorses Bernie Sanders
description: Benjamin T. Jealous, a prominent black leader and former N.A.A.C.P. president, endorsed Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont for president on Friday and vowed to increase his support among black voters in South Carolina, a crucial primary state, as well as across the country.

title: Montclair Bread Company Has Sunday Treats All Week Long
description: The first time Rachel Crampsey wrote her name, it was in buttercream. Before I could hold a pencil, I could hold a pastry bag, said Ms. Crampsey, the owner and head baker of the Montclair Bread Company in Montclair.

title: Friday Night Music: Crusaders on the Attack
description: Originally I was thinking of Ted Cruz  and what I really wanted was the destruction of Pskov, but unfortunately the only version I could find didnt have the Prokofiev :( Still, I guess this works for my current mood, one way or another:

title: Evening Hours | Quadrille Ball and a Librarys Anniversary Gala
description: The Germanistic Society of America danced the night away, and the New York Public Library for the Performing Arts had its 50th anniversary gala.

title: Hillary Clintons Campaign Resists Releasing Transcripts From Goldman Speeches
description: In response to a question at Thursday nights debate, Hillary Clinton said she would look into the possibility of releasing transcripts of her paid remarks to banking, corporate and financial services companies like Goldman Sachs.

title: How to Wear a Slip Dress  in the Daytime
description: This spring, the bygone garment is now the star attraction.

title: Agencies Battle Over What Is Top Secret in Hillary Clintons Emails
description: WASHINGTON  Some of the nations intelligence agencies raised alarms last spring as the State Department began releasing emails from Hillary Clintons private server, saying that a number of the messages contained information that should be classified top secret.

title: Hillary Clinton Lobbied on Health Care as Secretary of State, Emails Show
description: WASHINGTON  On Christmas Eve in 2009, Secretary of State Hillary Clinton was awake before dawn to personally monitor a critical moment in the nations history.

title: Debate Over the Release of an Email From Hillary Clintons Server
description: An email released by the State Department from Hillary Clintons private server that she used while secretary of state was the subject of letters from the State Department to a congressional leader.

title: Bronx Shootings Echo at Officer Liangs Trial in Stairwell Killing
description: Before the jury entered a courtroom in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn on Friday, prosecutors and defense lawyers at the trial of Peter Liang, a police officer whose gunshot killed an unarmed man in the stairwell of a housing project, approached the judge.

title: C.D.C. Defends Advice to Women on Drinking and Pregnancy
description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention defended a recommendation that sexually active women refrain from drinking alcohol if they are not using birth control after it spurred a strong backlash, with many women saying they considered the suggestion insulting, severe and impractical.

title: Ukrainian Ex-Premiers Visit to Washington Highlights Obstacles Facing Peace Pact
description: WASHINGTON  Yulia V. Tymoshenko, a former prime minister of Ukraine who now leads a minority party in Parliament, said on Friday that she and her allies would staunchly oppose constitutional changes that the United States and European powers view as crucial to carrying out a peace agreement with Russia.

title: Shootings in Public Housing Project Highlight Risks of Stairwell Patrols
description: Malik Chavis made himself at home in the red brick apartment building in the South Bronx, even though it was his girlfriend who lived on the seventh floor. He would often hang out in the stairwell, a can of beer or cigarette in hand, neighbors said.

title: Warren Moon, Who Helped Clear Way for Black Quarterbacks, Recalls His Struggles
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Warren Moon sits there in the hotel lobby with his black beret and black shirt, recounting, at my request, tales of his days as one of the great and dominant quarterbacks of his time.

title: Immigrant Killed in Manhattan Crane Collapse Recalled as Decent and Humble
description: The life of David Wichs, the 38-year-old trading firm employee who was killed Friday morning when an enormous construction crane crashed onto a street in Lower Manhattan, was distinguished by the kinds of achievements that figure in many immigrant dreams.

title: The Things We Love to Loathe
description: When it comes to bringing us all together, I dont think anybody is better at it than Martin Shkreli.

title: Michigan Water Regulator Fired for Role in Flint Crisis as Fallout Continues
description: A high-ranking Michigan regulator was fired Friday for her role in the drinking water crisis in Flint, broadening the fallout from a situation that has endangered the health of children, prompted criminal investigations and become an issue in the presidential campaign.

title: Roger Goodell Insists Football Is Safe: Theres Risk in Life
description: It was disclosed this week that two football greats, quarterbacks Ken Stabler and Earl Morrall, were the latest of dozens of players found to have had a degenerative brain disease linked to repeated head hits.

title: Marco Rubio Turns Toward the Personal on the Campaign Trail
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  To hear his rivals tell it, Senator Marco Rubio is a robotic candidate, soullessly spitting out canned lines on the stump  constantly scripted and controlled, in the words of Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, who has derided him as the boy in the bubble.

title: New Stanford President Has Biotech Connection
description: Over the years, Stanford Universitys incoming president, Marc Tessier-Lavigne, has developed a career that successfully melds science, business and academia.

title: Super Bowl I Recording Linked to Job Repairing Tape Machines
description: On Jan. 15, 1967, Martin Haupt went to work and tape-recorded Super Bowl I  a decision that he, alone, in the United States might have made.

title: U.S. Judge Approves Extradition of Former Salvadoran Colonel
description: MEXICO CITY  In a ruling that revisits one of the most notorious events of El Salvadors brutal civil war, a United States federal judge has ordered the deportation of a former Salvadoran colonel accused in the murder of six Jesuit priests, a housekeeper and her teenage daughter.

title: Donald Trumps Campaign, Billed as Self-Funded, Risks Little of His Fortune
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Donald J. Trump once boasted that he could someday be the only person to turn a profit running for president. He may be closer than anyone realizes.

title: Yale Wears Down Columbia in a Battle of Unlikely Ivy League Leaders
description: NEW HAVEN  The mood inside the John J. Lee Amphitheater on Friday evening felt mostly like impatience. Fans filled rickety wooden bleachers that have ached for success. Basketball dominance in the Ivy League has been cyclical for the past 40 years or so. The cycles always seemed to miss Columbia and Yale.

title: Taiwan Mobilizes Army to Search Rubble After Earthquake
description: BEIJING  A 6.4-magnitude earthquake struck southern Taiwan early Saturday, killing at least seven people, trapping dozens more inside a toppled residential building and casting a somber mood across the country as families gathered to celebrate the Lunar New Year.

title: The Republican Refusal to Aid Flint
description: The water crisis in Flint, Mich., has elicited a lot more hand-wringing and apologies than concrete actions to provide for the needs of children and adults whose health may be damaged by water from pipes that are leaching lead into taps all over the city. The state government, whose officials caused this crisis, has been loath to commit substantial funds to long-term needs, and Congress, under the control of Republicans, is finding excuses not to rescue this poverty-stricken, majority-black city of nearly 100,000 people.

title: New York City Council Votes to Raise Members Pay
description: The City Council voted on Friday to give its members a raise of nearly a third over their current base salaries, the first pay bump for elected officials in New York City since 2006, while enacting a series of reforms  some of which would apply only to future city lawmakers.

title: For Hillary Clinton, 6 Goals on To-Do List in New Hampshire
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Hillary Clinton knows exactly what she needs to do to pull off a surprise victory in the New Hampshire primary on Tuesday, her advisers say. But it is not clear she has enough time  or enough voters open to hearing her message  to make it happen.

title: An Investment in Colombias Peace
description: President Obama hosted President Juan Manuel Santos of Colombia in the White House this week to celebrate the imminent signing of a peace agreement that could end one of the longest-running conflicts in history.

title: The Sincerest Form of Flattery
description: Immature poets imitate; mature poets steal, T. S. Eliot said, meaning that the best poets seek to improve on lasting ideas. It would seem that the Democratic presidential primarys mature poet is Hillary Clinton, who has been adopting the progressive words, and style, of her rival Bernie Sanders. The Vermont senators longstanding call for revolution against a system rigged against the poor and middle class resonates with young Democrats who jam convention halls to hear his booming, Brooklyn-accented voice. Some Democrats say its great that Mr. Sanders is nudging Mrs. Clinton to the left. Others say shes merely parroting the races true progressive.

title: Summer Job
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Quite a lot of fresh entries today, courtesy of David Steinberg.

title: Eddie DeBartolo Jr., a Gifted but Flawed Human Being, Seeks a Spot Among the Immortals
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Eddie DeBartolo Jr. is nervous. So nervous that he often cant sleep past 2:45 a.m. His mind is racing as he wonders how this Super Bowl weekend will turn out.

title: Autocorrect and the Tao of Texting
description: OF all Internet memes, one of the most enduring involves autocorrect, the smartphone gremlin that can turn text exchanges into a game of chance. There are websites and books devoted to autocorrects mishaps, not to mention shirts, mugs and calendars printed with popular autocorrected messages.

title: Rangers Rookie Dylan McIlrath Makes a Big Impression
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  A first-round draft pick by the Rangers in 2010, defenseman Dylan McIlrath is starting to realize his N.H.L. promise with a physical presence, a stay-at-home defensive mind-set and an occasional dose of offense.

title: In Art Forgery Trial, Expert Witness Says Knoedler Gallery Relied on Fakes for Profit
description: For its final 18 years, Knoedler & Company, the 165-year-old business that once reigned as New Yorks oldest art gallery, largely depended on profits it made from the sale of fakes attributed to Abstract Expressionist masters such as Jackson Pollock and Willem de Kooning, an accounting expert testified on Friday in Federal District Court in Manhattan.

title: Judge Deals Blow to New Rodeo Circuit, but Lets Antitrust Suit Continue
description: A federal district judge ruled Thursday that new bylaws meant to protect the long-established Professional Rodeo Cowboys Association from competing rodeo circuits are enforceable, a blow to a group of top rodeo athletes planning a satellite circuit this year.

title: T-Shirt Weather in the Arctic
description: WE crested the northern rim of Alaskas Brooks Range, and from the windows of our truck looked out across the undulating foothills toward the Arctic Ocean. Instead of seeing snow as we had in years past, we were greeted by a landscape already green with spring.

title: Lorna Jorgenson Wendt, 72, Defender of Rights of Corporate Ex-Wives
description: Lorna Jorgenson Wendt, whose high-stakes, highly publicized divorce settlement of 1997 engendered a national conversation about the economic worth of corporate spouses, died on Thursday in Stamford, Conn. She was 72.

title: Edgar D. Mitchell, Sixth Moonwalking Astronaut, Dies at 85
description: Edgar D. Mitchell, who became the sixth man to walk on the moon as a member of NASAs first lunar mission devoted exclusively to scientific research, died on Thursday at a hospice in West Palm Beach, Fla. He was 85.

title: Without Carmelo Anthony, Knicks Put Up a Valiant Fight, Then Fade
description: Carmelo Anthony was hunched over on the end of the Knicks bench wearing a gray jacket and dark tie as he watched the tense final moments against the Memphis Grizzlies on Friday.

title: Marlow W. Cook, Senator Who Groomed Mitch McConnell, Dies at 89
description: Marlow W. Cook, a moderate one-term Republican senator from Kentucky who gave Mitch McConnell his start in Washington politics but later criticized him for moving sharply to the right, died on Thursday at his home in Sarasota, Fla. He was 89.

title: What to Watch Saturday
description: Hulu is streaming Hoop Dreams, an immersive three-hour documentary. Jim: The James Foley Story recounts the life of the murdered journalist. PBS NewsHour tries to explain the mathematical formula used to select presidential nominees, and the Republican candidates debate in New Hampshire. And theres always Cops.

title: Corrections: February 6, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Videos Made by Civilians Fleeing Aleppo Show Scenes of Devastation
description: Tens of thousands of civilians have fled the city of Aleppo and its environs in recent days as the Syrian military, backed by the punishing air power of Russian jets, made an aggressive push into a region of the country that long ago fell from government control.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: This is not the way to go about things. My message to the academy was just this: I, Angie, voter, wrote them: I VOTE FOR PERFORMANCE. ... NOT RACE.

title: Rescue Efforts Continue as Toll Rises in Taiwan Earthquake
description: TAINAN, Taiwan  Firefighters and other rescue personnel worked through the night and into Sunday morning here in southwestern Taiwan to find survivors of Saturday mornings earthquake after learning that as many as 130 people from a collapsed 17-story apartment tower could not be accounted for.

title: Sweating the Effects of Antiperspirants
description: Q. If it is natural for the body to sweat to get rid of toxins (and to cool itself), can antiperspirants harm the body?

title: Returning to a Gentler Gotham
description: Sixteen years ago, on the winds of enormous debt and general disenchantment, I left New York. I had lived there for nearly a decade but was so broke from student loans and other indulgences (like paying rent) that I convinced myself I had no choice but to move to the Midwest. The plan worked. I spent several years in Lincoln, Neb., got out of debt, and then moved to Los Angeles, where I lived for another 13 years.

title: Stitching Together Lives and Fashion in Liberia
description: MONROVIA, Liberia  On the first day that Archel Bernard opened her spanking-new high-fashion-with-a-Liberian-twist factory, some guy pretending to be a deaf beggar came in and stole her iPhone.

title: Dear Google, Is There a Shrink for That?
description: What does it take to feel understood?

title: As Flint Fought to Be Heard, Virginia Tech Team Sounded Alarm
description: BLACKSBURG, Va.  The young scientists, mostly in their 20s and counting the semesters until their next degree, had drawn an audience so large that it spilled from the auditorium on the Virginia Tech campus into two overflow rooms.

title: Wanted in China: More Male Teachers, to Make Boys Men
description: FUZHOU, China  The history class began with a lesson on being manly.

title: High Lead Levels Were Detected in Nearly 400 Flint Homes, and There May Be More
description: Maps show properties that registered lead levels above the federal threshold for drinking water.

title: Cover Crops, a Farming Revolution With Deep Roots in the Past
description: When Mark Anson came home with his hair on fire after a seminar on the seemingly soporific topic of soil health, his younger brother, Doug, was skeptical.

title: 2 Radio Journalists Attacked by Gunmen in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Two radio journalists were hospitalized, one of them in a coma, after being attacked by gunmen in northern Afghanistan, the police and one of the victims said Saturday. It was the latest in a series of attacks on members of the Afghan news media.

title: The Week on Instagram
description: Photos posted this week on @nytimes took our Instagram followers from a train in Ecuador to the Iowa caucuses.

title: How Sumner Redstone Went From Army Cryptographer to Media Mogul
description: As Sumner M. Redstone cedes the chairman posts at CBS and Viacom, one of the business worlds most combative moguls is quietly stepping off the corporate stage.

title: A Little Variety
description: A LITTLE VARIETY PUZZLES  This weeks puzzles include:

title: Farhad and Mikes Week in Tech: Start-Ups and the Circle of Life
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: The Feds Best-Value Schools
description: With tuition soaring, return on investment is the issue du jour. Even the Department of Education has an R.O.I. ranking of sorts. Crunching data from its College Scorecard, it praises 23 colleges and universities for high earnings and low net price (cost of attendance minus grant aid) for low-income students. The 10 here had the highest returns.

title: North Korea Launches Rocket Seen as Cover for a Missile Test
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Defying warnings of tougher sanctions from Washington, North Korea launched a rocket on Sunday that Western experts believe is part of a program to develop intercontinental ballistic missile technologies.

title: When a Contractor Does Harm
description: Paying for a Contractors Damage

title: Our Man in New Hampshire: Donald Trump Defies Tradition
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  I could have gone for a gyro, but the only thing on the menu was Donald J. Trump.

title: In Defense of Funny Diagrams (Wonkish)
description: Brad DeLong asks a question about which of the various funny diagrams economists love should be taught in Econ 101. I say production possibilities yes, Edgeworth box no  which, strange to say, is how we deal with this issue in Krugman/Wells. But students who go on to major in economics should be exposed to the box  and those who go on to grad school really, really need to have seen it, and in general need more simple general-equilibrium analysis than, as far as I can tell, many of them get these days.

title: How to Watch the G.O.P. Debate
description: Heres how we analyzed the Republican debate, and our live fact checks.

title: Ted Cruz Sets Sights on Marco Rubio, Not Donald Trump, in New Hampshire
description: NASHUA, N.H.  Ted Cruz and his team are smarting over the attention paid to the third-place finisher in Iowa, Marco Rubio, joking that bronze is the new gold.

title: In the Republican Debate, Heres What to Look For
Faith in Agency Clouded Bernie Sanderss V.A. Response
description: There were reports of secret waiting lists to hide long delays in care. Whistle-blowers said as many as 40 veterans had died waiting for appointments. And Congress was demanding answers.

title: Super Bowl 50: Heres How the Panthers Will Beat the Broncos
description: SANTA CLARA, Calif.  On the eve of Super Bowl 50, it feels as if we know a great deal about the Panthers and the Broncos, that is largely because they were so remarkably consistent this season.

title: Variety: A Melodic Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Many of you are music aficionados and probably know way more about jazz than I do, but I can certainly appreciate what WYNTON MARSALIS has done for the music industry.

title: Air Travel Between U.S. and Zika-Affected Areas
description: Air travel has been a factor in the spread of Zika virus, but some countries are better at detecting and preventing the spread of diseases.

title: On the Road to Super Bowl 50
description: Take a drive down Highway 101 from San Francisco to Santa Clara to experience the sights between the City and the Super Bowl.

title: Fining Bankers, Not Shareholders, for Banks Misconduct
description: Ho-hum, another week, another multimillion-dollar settlement between regulators and a behemoth bank acting badly.

title: Hickey Freeman: Fall 2016
description: Season two of the revived Hickey Freeman showing at NYFW.

title: Dodges Recalled Because of Risks in Changing Tires
description: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles is recalling almost 505,000 2011-16 Dodge Chargers, including about 442,000 in the United States, because the vehicle might fall off the jack when a tire is being changed, according to a report by the automaker posted on Saturday on the website of the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration.

title: Jeb Bush Supporters  Debate Advice: Throw That Punch
description: BEDFORD, N.H.  The man who stood at Jeb Bushs rally here Saturday morning had not a question but a comment.

title: Pakistans Hand in the Rise of International Jihad
description: TUNIS  PRESIDENT ASHRAF GHANI of Afghanistan has warned in several recent interviews that unless peace talks with Pakistan and the Taliban produce results in the next few months, his country may not survive 2016. Afghanistan is barely standing, he says, after the Taliban onslaught last year, which led to the highest casualties among civilians and security forces since 2001.

title: Jeb Bush Will Protect America, Says Big Brother George W.
House Fires in the Bronx Kill Two People
description: A young entrepreneur with dreams of opening a business and an older immigrant described as a neighborhood matriarch were killed early Saturday in separate house fires that broke out just blocks apart in the Bronx, officials said.

title: Adam Grant, a Workplace Magician, Reveals His Secrets
description: Before becoming the youngest tenured professor at the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania in 2011, when he was 29, Adam Grant was a professional magician.

title: Vanguard, a Champion of Low Fees, Faces a Peculiar Tax Challenge
description: Vanguard may have committed a sin while pursuing a virtue.

title: We Have a Win-a-Trip Winner!
description: Must be something in the Notre Dame water! For the second time, a Notre Dame student has won my annual win-a-trip contest, in which I take a student with me on a reporting trip to the developing world. The winner this year is Cassidy McDonald, a junior from Madison, Wis., who is majoring in marketing and minoring in journalism. She has worked for CBS News and Wisconsin State Journal, where one of her leads sparked a subreddit page: I love you, Cassidy McDonald. And that lede? Here goes: Wisconsin cheesemakers found their whey Friday at the American Cheese Society Competition in Providence, Rhode Island, where they did better than gouda they did grate.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Sadism, not Sport, in Stabbing of Bulls

title: Queens, One of a Kind
description: After moving to Astoria in 2012, Bryan Formhals began photographing homes, intersections and trains in the area, elements that he says lend to the boroughs unique landscape.

title: A Journey Through Queens With the Photographer Bryan Formhals
description: Take the residential loft aesthetic: open space, clean lines, flat surfaces, an impersonal industrial voice. Apply it to the great urban outdoors. Now you have the borough of Queens, as seen through the lens of the landscape photographer Bryan Formhals, 39, who has been shooting the borough since he moved to Astoria from Greenpoint, Brooklyn, in 2012. The landscape reminded me of when I was living in Los Angeles, said Mr. Formhals, a Minnesota native who lived on the West Coast before moving to Brooklyn in 2009. With the elevated trains and the two airports, you have the sense of people traveling through the air over Queens, and even on the ground theres an element of people on the move. It felt very contemporary, even more so than Brooklyn. It felt like a city on the verge.

title: Revaluing Family Treasures for the Taxman
description: On Friday, a bright red 1957 Ferrari rolled onto a stage in Paris and sold for 32 million euros, or about $35.8 million, making it, by some measures, the most expensive car ever sold at auction.

title: Rafael Bosch: Sweets as Strength Training
description: Rafael Bosch,22, is a candy maker at Hillside Candy in Hillside, N.J.

title: At the Performing Arts Center in Purchase, a Debut for Dawn Upshaw
description: Scrambling to fulfill a commission that would mark the Minnesota Orchestras 100th anniversary, the composer Osvaldo Golijov came up with a plan: Combine three of his chamber pieces into a single orchestral work and recruit the soprano Dawn Upshaw, who had debuted the pieces, to be his soloist.

title: Taking Stock of a Fixer-Upper in The Substance of Bliss
description: A modest patch of suburban hell is surveyed in Tony Glazers new play, The Substance of Bliss, which is having its world premiere production at New Jersey Repertory Company in Long Branch.

title: Free Ticket to Super Bowl 50? No, Thanks, Hell Watch at Home
description: SANTA CLARA, Calif.  Jamie L. Matthews may be the only mayor in the United States to host the Super Bowl and yet have no interest in attending the game that will be played in his city.

title: Cuomo Moves Against Therapy That Claims to Make Gay Children Straight
description: ALBANY  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York on Saturday announced a series of measures intended to eliminate so-called conversion therapy, a practice that claims the ability to reverse same-sex attraction in some people but that has been widely discredited by scientists and criticized by gay-rights groups.

title: Electability
description: If you are still on the fence in the Democratic primary, or still persuadable, you should know that Vox interviewed a number of political scientists about the electability of Bernie Sanders, and got responses ranging from warnings about a steep uphill climb to predictions of a McGovern-Nixon style blowout defeat. And all of them dismiss current polls as meaningless.

title: Antics Aside, Terrell Owens Stands Out for His Achievements
description: As Sundays Super Bowl approached, Cam Newton defended the antics of the Carolina Panthers by pointing out that an N.F.L. play usually lasts for only four to six seconds and saying that anyone looking to judge him or his team should focus on what they do during that time, rather than being distracted by the irrelevant things that happen between plays.

title: At the Heckscher Museum, a Celebration of Men at Work
description: On the face of it, a painting of some of the founding fathers laboring over the Declaration of Independence would seem to have little in common with the image of a drink-swilling, red-nosed court jester before he starts his on-command tomfoolery.

title: Iran Panel Reverses Disqualification of Election Candidates
description: TEHRAN  An Iranian vetting committee on Saturday reversed a decision to disqualify more than 1,500 candidates who had registered to run in parliamentary elections scheduled for Feb. 26. It is unclear how many of the newly approved candidates are considered to be reformists, who are opposed by Iranian hard-liners.

title: On the Mound: Observant. At Bat: Ultra-Orthodox.
description: You know youre in for something out of the ordinary from the get-go. There are plenty of plays that begin with a narrator addressing the audience directly, but at The Chosen, the current offering at Playhouse on Park in West Hartford, we are being addressed in Hebrew. If the title rings a bell, it should  the play is adapted from Chaim Potoks popular 1967 novel of the same name. The narrator is quick to rescue the non-Hebrew speakers in attendance, for, like all good memory-play narrators, he wants us to hear his story. This one is about growing up in a Jewish neighborhood in Brooklyn in the 1940s, with news of the war in Europe and Big Band music on the soundtrack of daily life.

title: Not Just a Death, a System Failure
description: On the day before my mother died, she gave my father a list of demands. He wrote them on the back of an envelope and showed them to me as he left the intensive care unit. There, in his clear block handwriting, it read:

title: Give Up Your Data to Cure Disease
description: HOW far would you go to protect your health records? Your privacy matters, of course, but consider this: Mass data can inform medicine like nothing else and save countless lives, including, perhaps, your own.

title: Gordon Ballard
description: Gordon Ballard is executive director of the International Association of Oil & Gas Producers, whose members produce more than half of the worlds oil and more than a third of its gas.

title: Holding Sentencing Reform Hostage
description: An opportunity to pass the most significant federal criminal justice reform in a generation may be slipping away  despite the tireless efforts of many top Republicans and Democrats in Congress, as well as a rare exhortation from President Obama during last months State of the Union address.

title: Ted Cruz Wont Be Denied
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  ANOTHER Ted Cruz rally, another Ted Cruz rant about the medias failure to give him his due. I endured one in the tiny town of Weare, N.H., on Thursday afternoon and had two thoughts.

title: Hillary Battles Bernie Sanders, Chick Magnet
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  HILLARY CLINTON first grabbed the national spotlight 47 years ago as an idealistic young feminist, chiding the paternalistic establishment in her Wellesley commencement speech.

title: The Last of the Bushes
description: GEORGE H. W. BUSH was the first politician I ever disliked. I was 12, my parents were loyal Democrats, and every night wed watch the news, cheer for whatever Bill Clinton was saying on the trail, and then glower at the screen when Peter Jennings went to Brit Hume, then the White House correspondent, for an update on what the incumbent president was up to.

title: America Is Flint
description: WE have been rightfully outraged by the lead poisoning of children in Flint, Mich.  an outrage that one health expert called state-sponsored child abuse.

title: Real Compassion in College Admissions
description: THE college admission process is always stressful, often unfair and may well reward the wrong values. But the recommendations released last month by a Harvard Graduate School of Education project called Making Caring Common will only make things worse.

title: Sweetheart, Get Me Readers
description: With a new TV mini-series debuting last week, everybody was talking about O.J. Simpson, the football star who fell from grace. The Times wanted in  so editors and writers quickly developed a list-like article that compiled the papers original coverage of the 1990s murder case, and offered it to readers on Facebook and other social media platforms.

title: Dont Break Up the Banks. Theyre Not Our Real Problem.
description: IN the movie The Big Short, Steve Carell plays a slightly altered version of me. In real life, I am a portfolio manager and financial services analyst who over a 25-year career has, at times, been highly critical of bank behavior.

title: Yes, Im Fat. Its O.K. I Said It.
description: WHY do you use the word fat?

title: Football, So Beautiful for Fans, Scars Players With Dementia
description: This Sunday evening marks the 50th playing of the Super Bowl, which began as a far simpler interleague rivalry and evolved into a national feast day for football fans to binge on the balletic action before giant television screens and worship the game across nacho bowls. Memory for detail, so important to sports fans, will be on display as viewers recall the exploits in Super Bowls past of Joe Namath and so many other gifted athletes.

title: Congress Starts to Get Serious About Online Privacy
description: Congress could soon vote on a bill that would require law enforcement agencies to get a search warrant from a judge to obtain emails, photographs and other documents Americans have stored online. This important legislation would update the law to reflect how people use the Internet today.

title: Iranian Commander Dismisses Saudi Role in Syria
description: TEHRAN  A top Iranian commander reacted with ridicule to Saudi Arabias suggestion that it was prepared to take part in ground operations in Syria, saying Saturday that the kingdom would not dare send troops there.

title: Knicks Scuffle, Regress and Look Inward as Losses Mount
description: The message from Coach Derek Fisher was much the same after another loss. Competed hard. Difficult opponent. Missed opportunities.

title: Economists Against the Draft
description: WASHINGTON  THE Defense Departments decision to let women serve in every part of the military has left just one major distinction between the roles of men and women: Men are required to sign up for the draft when they turn 18. Women are not.

title: Irrationality in Politics
description: Readers discuss a letter urging Americans to try to bridge the political divide and reclaim the place of reason in our political life.

title: Cavaliers Try to Push Pace, but Change Is Slow
description: When Tyronn Lue took over as the coach of the Cleveland Cavaliers last month, he raised eyebrows by questioning the conditioning of his players and openly wondering if they could keep up with his vision for the team.

title: Rejected Campaign Buttons
description: Some campaign swag that didnt make the cut.

title: How a Medical Mystery in Brazil Led Doctors to Zika
description: Something strange was happening last August in the maternity wards of Recife, a seaside city perched on Brazils easternmost tip, where the country juts into the Atlantic.

title: What 74 Years of Crossword History Says About the Language We Use
description: The world may have become more globalized, but the venerable puzzle now relies less on international words and place names.

title: Zika virus
description: Zika virus

title: John L. Tishman, Builder Who Shaped American Skylines, Dies at 90
description: John L. Tishman, a master builder of the 20th century whose Tishman Realty and Construction Company transformed the skylines of Chicago, Detroit, Los Angeles and New York, died on Saturday at his home in Bedford, N.Y. He was 90.

title: Review: Raga Indian Cuisine in Croton-on-Hudson
description: In October, Raga Indian Cuisine began operating in a bright little shopping strip on Croton-on-Hudsons Maple Street. The dcor is simple, and the design touches left by the previous occupant, a Spanish restaurant, like an Iberian wrought iron gate under a bricked archway, also work well for Raga.

title: Review: At Wlffer Kitchen in Sag Harbor, a Winemaker Puts Food First
description: On an island practically teeming with vineyards, it was only a matter of time before a winery-owned restaurant sprang up on the East End. In July, Wlffer Estate Vineyard opened Wlffer Kitchen on Main Street in Sag Harbor.

title: Federal Judge Orders Abortion Foes Not to Release Secretly Filmed Videos
description: In a sharp rebuke, a federal judge on Friday issued a preliminary injunction ordering abortion opponents not to release videos they had secretly made at meetings of abortion providers, and he added that the opponents claims that such organizations were illegally selling fetal tissue were baseless.

title: Priest Abuse Victim Is Suspended From Vatican Panel
description: ROME  A high-profile Vatican commission on the prevention of child sexual abuse voted on Saturday to temporarily suspend one of its members, an outspoken victim of clerical abuse who accused the church of failing to deliver on its promises of reform and accountability.

title: Amanda Kessel, Top College Player Out of Action Since Sochi, Returns
description: MINNEAPOLIS  On the second shift of her first hockey game in almost two years, University of Minnesota right wing Amanda Kessel collided twice with North Dakota players and fell to the ice. Both times, she picked herself up and jumped back into the play.

title: Review: Local and Fresh Without the Pretense at Mill Street Bar & Table
description: Though he embraces the use of local sources, Geoff Lazlo, managing partner and the executive chef of Mill Street Bar & Table in Greenwich, likes to keep things simple. So he doesnt overwhelm diners with information,  la the waitress in Portlandia, about the provenance of each and every item on his menu.

title: As Rubio Waffles, Two Floridians in the House Seek Bipartisan Climate Solutions
description: Given Floridas special vulnerability to rising seas and other consequences of human-driven global warming (which I first wrote about in 1988), its not surprising that one of the first efforts to break the partisan impasse in the House around this issue has come from two lawmakers from the south end of that state  Republican Representative Carlos Curbelo and Representative Ted Deutch, a Democrat.

title: Airlines Reap Record Profits, and Passengers Get Peanuts
description: Helped by falling oil prices, airlines are reporting record profits, but for many passengers this sudden bonanza has meant little more than extra bags of free peanuts and pretzels.

title: Beyonc Releases Surprise Single Formation Ahead of Super Bowl Performance
description: Beyonc is not coming to the Super Bowl empty-handed. A day before her planned performance at Sundays game, the singer released a new single, Formation, along with a music video that invokes Hurricane Katrina and black pride (I like my negro nose with Jackson 5 nostrils, she sings.

title: Rep. Chris Gibson, a Republican, Explores a Run for New York Governor in 18
description: United States Representative Chris Gibson, a Republican from upstate New York who has become a sharp critic of Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, said he plans to create a committee to prepare for a potential run for governor in 2018.

title: Chinese Zookeepers on the Year of the Monkey
description: China is home to a wide range of monkeys and other primates, but with the wild ones largely in remote or mountainous areas, zoos offer the best chance for many Chinese to see some up close in this Chinese Year of the Monkey. In anticipation of especially large crowds in coming days, the Nanjing Hongshang Forest Zoo, in the eastern province of Jiangsu, is celebrating the start of the Lunar New Year on Monday with a week of educational events about their primates, some of which are endangered and under special protection. Several of the animals are being shown to the public for the first time.

title: Adding Insult
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  The Super Bowl is definitely this weekend. You might have thought that it was last weekend, but I can tell you with great confidence that it was not. So lets all just move on and chat about the puzzle so you can watch some football and enjoy all of the amazing Super Bowl snacks you prepared.

title: Officials Seek Cause of Fatal Crane Crash in Lower Manhattan
description: The long metal necks dotting the New York skyline have become familiar symbols of the citys development rush in recent years. But as one of those cranes lay crumpled on a narrow Lower Manhattan street, toppled after a deadly collapse on Friday, the image of the machine took on a jarringly different meaning.

title: Miriam Cedarbaum, U.S. Judge, Dies at 86; Sentenced Martha Stewart
description: Miriam Goldman Cedarbaum, a federal judge in Manhattan who presided over the trial that sent the domesticity expert Martha Stewart to prison for lying to the government about her sale of stock in a friends company, died on Friday at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Weill Cornell Medical Center in Manhattan. She was 86. Her son Daniel confirmed her death.

title: Eighth G.O.P. Debate: Analysis
Guantnamo Prisoner Sent Home to Morocco Remains in Legal Limbo
description: WASHINGTON  Younis Shokuri, a Moroccan detainee at the Guantnamo Bay prison, said he feared being repatriated to his native country. But the Moroccan government told the United States that it would probably release him without charges 72 hours after any transfer. So last September, Mr. Shokuri went home  reluctantly, but voluntarily.

title: El Salvador Arrests Ex-Military Officers in 1989 Jesuit Killings
description: MEXICO CITY  Breaking years of inaction over one of the most emblematic cases from El Salvadors brutal civil war, Salvadoran police have begun to arrest former military officers who are accused in the killings of six Jesuit priests, a housekeeper and her teenage daughter.

title: Prison Official in Washington State Resigns Over Early-Release Error
description: The top corrections official in Washington State resigned on Saturday amid a political dispute over a computer coding error that allowed an estimated 3,000 inmates to be released early over 13 years.

title: What You Missed in the Debate
Frank Finlay, 89, Is Dead; Was Iago to Oliviers Othello
description: Frank Finlay, an Academy Award-nominated English actor known for his screen appearances as Iago in Othello and Porthos in The Three Musketeers, died on Jan. 30 at his home in Weybridge, England. He was 89.

title: Yale Educator Recounts Painful Experience of Halloween Email Furor
description: NEW HAVEN  Dodging 5-year-olds at the Calvin Hill Day Care Center here, Erika Christakis admired how the teachers celebrated free play as a route to intellectual inquiry, listened to children rather than preaching and stood back to let them find their own way.

title: The Vote for Bankruptcy Reform that Haunts Hillary Clinton
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  As Hillary Clinton fights off intense criticism over her ties to Wall Street, a central question has gone unanswered: Has she ever taken any action that favored the financial industry?

title: Kunduz Residents Live in Fear of Talibans Return
description: KUNDUZ, Afghanistan  Farhad Azyanfar, a student of Dari literature at the university in Kunduz, watched in fear as a few hundred Taliban fighters overran and defeated a larger but demoralized government force to capture this northern city in September.

title: Cam Newton Reserves Coveted Souvenir for Young Panthers Fans
description: When Cam Newton of the Panthers scores  a frequent occurrence this season as he became the first quarterback in N.F.L. history to throw for more than 30 touchdowns and rush for more than 10 in a single season  he makes a point of giving away the football to a young Carolina fan.

title: What Americans Are Searching For on Debate Night
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  In the St. Anselms College gym-turned-media center, waiting for the start of the last Republican debate before the New Hampshire primary, the Google-sponsored Internet connection is slow  go figure. But there are many, many Google-sponsored statistics, screens, virtual-reality viewers and 3D panoramic video cameras available to pass the time. The latter will allow the several hundred assembled journalists to photograph each other, but not the candidates nor the debate, because that takes place on another part of the campus.

title: What to Watch Sunday
description: Its a lazy day, and there are several movies on the schedule. Take your pick of comedy (Pineapple Express), drama (Quadrophenia) or adventure (King Kong). Or watch them all.

title: Church Confronts Abuse Scandal at a Famed German Choir
description: REGENSBURG, Germany  Udo Kaiser was 8 years old, brimming with energy and a bell-clear soprano voice when he arrived at the boarding school of the famed boys choir that bears this citys name. Before his first day ended, he had been struck by a teacher.

title: Dukes Absence From the Top 25 Is Likely to Be Brief
description: DURHAM, N.C.  Barack Obama was the junior senator from Illinois. The Oklahoma City Thunder were in Seattle and called the SuperSonics. Taylor Swift played country music.

title: Man Is Slashed in the Face at a Bronx Subway Station After an Argument
description: A man was slashed in the face at a Bronx subway station early on Saturday morning, the police said.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Children with normal faces up to the eyebrows, and then you have no foreheads and very strange heads. The doctors were saying, Well, I saw four today, and Oh thats strange, because I saw two.

title: Ben Carsons Debate Recovery
description: It seemed to be sleepy as usual for Ben Carson, but wow, did he rally.

title: After Revelation He Had C.T.E., Ken Stabler Is a Poignant Hall of Fame Addition
description: While generally a cause for celebration, Saturdays announcement of the class of 2016 for the Pro Football Hall of Fame carried a somber tone as Ken Stabler, a Super Bowl-winning quarterback for the Oakland Raiders, was elected days after it was publicly revealed that he had had Stage 3 chronic traumatic encephalopathy, or C.T.E., a degenerative brain disease, before his death in July.

title: New York State to Investigate Radioactive Groundwater at Indian Point
description: New York State will investigate high levels of radioactive contamination found in the groundwater at the Indian Point nuclear plant, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said on Saturday.

title: Ted Cruz Doubles Down on Carpet Bombing
description: Lets carpet bomb Jihadist University.

title: Emboldened by Protests, Black Lives Matter Activists Move From Street to Ballot
description: ST. LOUIS  Within days of the fatal police shooting of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Mo., in August 2014, Maria Chappelle-Nadal huffed amid a crush of protesters, waving a cardboard cutout of the white governors face above her head.

title: In Republican Debate, Rivals Jab at Marco Rubio to Try to Slow His Rise
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Senator Marco Rubio of Florida was hammered as callow, ambitious and lacking in accomplishment during the Republican presidential debate here on Saturday night, as Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey led an all-out assault to try to halt Mr. Rubios growing momentum ahead of the critical New Hampshire primary on Tuesday.

title: Transcript of the Republican Presidential Debate
description: Following is a transcript of the Republican debate, as transcribed by the Federal News Service.

title: Super Bowl 50 Highlights and Analysis
Beyonc in Formation: Entertainer, Activist, Both?
description: On Saturday afternoon, Beyonc released Formation, her first new song since 2014, on Tidal and YouTube in advance of her Sunday appearance at the Super Bowl 50 halftime show at Levis Stadium in Santa Clara, Calif. The songs subject is familiar Beyonc self-affirmation, and the video is among the most politically direct work shes done in her career, with implicit commentary on police brutality, Hurricane Katrina and black financial power. Jon Caramanica, a pop music critic for The New York Times, Wesley Morris, The Timess critic at large, and Jenna Wortham, a staff writer for The New York Times Magazine, discussed the songs sound, the videos look and the way that Beyonc increasingly blends the aesthetic and the political. Here are excerpts from their conversation:
