description: BUCHAREST, Romania  The highest court in Romania upheld a 20-year prison term on Wednesday for a 90-year-old former warden from the countrys repressive Communist past who had overseen brutal treatment of prisoners, including routine beatings and starvation.

title: Traditionalists Rebuffed as Parliament Turns the Page on Parchment
description: LONDON  For centuries, acts of Parliament and other important documents have been inscribed on vellum, a parchment made from calfskin. Magna Carta, which King John signed 800 years ago last year, was written on vellum. So was the Domesday Book compiled in 1086, 20 years after William the Conqueror sailed across the English Channel.

title: Deutsche Banks Opaque Balance Sheet Clouds Its Position
description: Deutsche Banks vast and opaque balance sheet is holding it back. Media reports that the German lender was considering buying back senior debt to strengthen its balance sheet sent its shares  and those of European peers  soaring on Wednesday. But Deutsches shares are still down 35 percent since early January.

title: A Multifront Republican Battle in South Carolina
description: MOUNT PLEASANT, S.C.  Donald J. Trumps rivals for the Republican presidential nomination dug in Wednesday for a hard fight in the South Carolina primary, where Mr. Trump will seek to gain a clear upper hand in the 2016 race after his smashing victory in New Hampshire.

title: Big City Book Club
description: Matthew Thomass We Are Not Ourselves, a multi-generational saga of Irish immigrant life in New York, was the subject of an online discussion on Feb. 11, 2016.

title: When Women Fire Back, Are They Ferocious? When Is a Critic a Scold?
description: Last week, The Times prominently displayed an analysis piece which explored the matter of sexist language and speech in the presidential campaign. Through interviews and other research, it showed how negative words such as shrill or shouting have been applied to Hillary Clinton, but not to her male rivals.

title: Chris Christie Drops Out of Presidential Race After New Hampshire Flop
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey, a once-commanding figure in the Republican Party who struggled to attract support for his presidential campaign but unsettled the race with his strident attacks on Senator Marco Rubio of Florida, ended his run for the White House on Wednesday.

title: Coaching Stars to Avoid a Racist Against Whites Moment
description: Earlier this awards season, at a ceremony for one of Hollywoods guild prizes, a prominent filmmaker who does not have a dog in the fight mulled over whether to chat with the media. After seeking the advice of a friend, who replied, Not unless you want to talk about diversity, the filmmaker stood down.

title: Department of Justice Sues Ferguson, Which Reversed Course on Agreement
description: WASHINGTON  The Department of Justice filed a civil rights lawsuit against Ferguson, Mo., on Wednesday, less than a day after the city rejected an agreement to overhaul its beleaguered criminal justice system and address allegations of widespread abuses by its police department.

title: Ex-Los Angeles Sheriff, Lee Baca, Pleads Guilty to Lying in Corruption Inquiry
description: LOS ANGELES  Lee Baca, the former Los Angeles County sheriff who resigned in 2014 amid a growing corruption scandal in his department, pleaded guilty on Wednesday to making false statements to the federal authorities who were investigating the jail system he oversaw.

title: Candy, Fit for a Valentines Day Sleepover
description: If anyone knows about gifting for Valentines Day, its the lingerie-designer-turned-candy-maker Maayan Zilberman. Her former fashion line, the Lake and Stars, blurred underwear with outerwear; her new project, Sweet Saba, delights in the mix-up between sculpture and candy. It was a very seamless shift, the sharply manicured Zilberman says of her new endeavor. Candy, like lingerie, has its biggest market around Christmas and Valentines. I think if you have the same sensibility and the same customer, its just like saying you have a new dish on the menu.

title: Whats the Deal With Cruz and Kids?
description: Is there any limit to Senator Ted Cruzs willingness to exploit small children  his own and now others  in embarrassing and peculiar ways to further his bid for the Republican presidential nomination? Based on his latest TV ad, Playing Trump, which features three kids playing with a Donald Trump doll and robotically mouthing Cruz campaign talking points, the answer is clearly No.

title: Drug Traffickers Turn to New Type of Courier: Seniors
description: WASHINGTON  In what law enforcement officials describe as a new front in international smuggling, global traffickers and cartels are increasingly turning to a new source for couriers to smuggle drugs across international borders: vulnerable American older adults.

title: False Convictions
description: To the Editor:

title: Filters That Add a Dash of Dazzle to Smartphone Photos
description: When I learned about photography years ago, one of my favorite tricks with the camera was to use a filter  perhaps a color gel or a diffuser  to add a special effect to the final photograph.

title: Autopsy Shows the N.H.L.s Todd Ewen Did Not Have C.T.E.
description: When the former N.H.L. enforcer Todd Ewen died in September, reportedly of a self-inflicted gunshot, his brain was sent to researchers. Years of memory loss and undiagnosed depression led to speculation that Ewen, 49, had chronic traumatic encephalopathy, a degenerative brain disease caused by repeated blows to the head.

title: Cruelty to Elephants
description: To the Editor:

title: Marco Rubio Is Robotic, but Not Out of It
description: Dont blame message discipline for Marco Rubios lightning-fast collapse from triumphant in Iowa to disappointed in New Hampshire. Even his opponents chalked up the I, Robot routine in Saturdays debate to message discipline. But thats a smear against one of the most effective tools any candidate has in his campaign arsenal. Mr. Rubio stumbled because he took the practice to an absurd extreme.

title: Sales and Deals for Fashion Week and Valentines Day
description: Didnt manage to score tickets to Yeezy Season 3? Cheer up: There are many more ways to take part in the fashion week festivities. On Thursday from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m., the e-commerce aggregator Lyst will team up with Uber on a giveaway celebrating the diversity of New York style. Enter the code FINDNYFW in the app for the chance to request a goody bag filled with items shoppable on Lyst (like, say, an oh-so-downtown Maiyet geometric block scarf) tailored to the neighborhood youre in.

title: The Landscape After New Hampshire
description: To the Editor:

title: The Republican Mess
description: In 1996, Pat Buchanan  running as a populist, a protectionist, an outsider  won three of the first four Republican primary season contests, taking caucuses in Louisiana and Alaska, finishing a close second in Iowa, and then winning New Hampshire outright.

title: An Exhibition That Proves Video Games Can Be Art
description: In April 2010, a brouhaha erupted in the gaming community that still reverberates today: The film critic Roger Ebert had opined that video games could never truly be counted as art. Let me just say that no video gamer now living will survive long enough to experience the medium as an art form, he wrote on his blog. But three months later, in an erudite follow-up titled Okay, Kids, Play on My Lawn, he recanted. Great works of art, he speculated, could instruct me about life, love, disease and death, principles and morality, humor and tragedy. Ebert admitted that he hadnt spent enough time with video games to know if they could, indeed, evoke these feelings. I dont know if they can be inspired to transcend themselves, he wrote. Perhaps they can. How can I say?

title: Carly Fiorina Drops Out of Republican Presidential Race
description: Carly Fiorina, 61, the former chairwoman of Hewlett-Packard, suspended her presidential campaign Wednesday, announcing her decisions on social media after poor showings in the New Hampshire and Iowa nominating contests.

title: A Rap Video With a Side of 3D-Printed Jewelry
description: In June 2014, the industrial designer Clia Elmasu and the multidisciplinary artist Nelly Zagury  longtime friends and intermittent collaborators  made a pact over Skype. I said, If I quit my day job, you quit yours. I quit; you quit, Elmasu, now 29, remembers. Nelly said, O.K., Ill quit, and I asked, You sure? And that started it all. Zagury, 28, chimes in, Our initial idea was two parts: a hip-hop musical and doing crazy props. A year and a half later, the French-born, Brooklyn-based duo has created the first 3D-printed music video. Elmasu and Zagurys jewelry brand, Holy Faya, regularly worn onstage by FKA twigs, is a fortuitous byproduct.

title: G.M. Recalls Trucks Because of Brake Pedal Issue
description: General Motors is recalling about 478,000 trucks, including almost 427,000 in the United States, because the brake pedal could fall off, the automaker said on Wednesday.

title: Experts Study Zikas Path From First Outbreak in Pacific
description: HONG KONG  Yap Island, a speck of land in the Western Pacific best known for using huge stone discs as currency, was facing a medical mystery.

title: Times Reporter: I Would Never Cut a Deal Like That
description: Heres an ugly term: Transactional journalism  also known as a quid pro quo.

title: Great Free Resources for Teaching Election 2016
description: Updated | Oct. 5, 2016

title: Ojai Festival Names Future Directors
description: The Ojai Music Festival  the innovative California gathering that puts itself in the hands of a different music director each year  announced this week that it would have an eclectic group of stewards for the five seasons leading to its 75th anniversary in 2021.

title: Natixis Acquires 51% Stake in Peter J. Solomon Co.
description: Buried in the latest quarterly earnings report from Natixis, the big French bank, was some surprising news: The firm has acquired a majority stake in one of the United States oldest boutique advisory shops.

title: And Then There Were Four: Phone Booths Saved on Upper West Side Sidewalks
description: A work crew pulled up to the northwest corner of West End Avenue and 101st Street on Wednesday morning and approached an oblong glass box that looked so anachronistic that a passer-by might have wondered if it simply had dropped out of the sky.

title: 5 New York Hotel Bars That Melt Away the Winter Blues
description: When the February air is biting and Manhattans avenues seem never-ending, few pleasures compare with ducking into a hotel bar and sinking into a club chair beside a fire.

title: NATO to Expand Military Presence in Europe to Deter Russians
description: BRUSSELS  The defense ministers from all 28 NATO countries approved a plan on Wednesday to enhance the alliances military presence in Central and Eastern Europe, part of its expanding efforts to deter Russian aggression, according to NATOs secretary general, Jens Stoltenberg.

title: Marc Andreessen Apologizes After Facebook Disavows India Comments
description: Marc Andreessen, a Silicon Valley venture capitalist and board member of the social network Facebook, has long been one of its vocal supporters. On Wednesday, Facebook did not welcome that support.

title: Google Car Exposes Regulatory Divide on Computers as Drivers
description: SAN FRANCISCO  It appears that Google has persuaded federal regulators that  in some situations at least  the Tin Man has a heart.

title: Giants Cut Will Beatty and Geoff Schwartz, and Jon Beason Retires
description: Days after the Giants season ended, the owner John K. Mara declared the roster undertalented and soberly put the onus for rebuilding the team on General Manager Jerry Reese.

title: A Fashion Crowd Celebrates Chinese New Year
description: Monkey masks are an unusual New York Fashion Week accessory. But they were de rigueur Monday night at Indochine, the French-Vietnamese hot spot in NoHo, where a Chinese New Years dinner was hosted by Dao-Yi Chow, the co-designer of Public School and DKNY.

title: Tessa Thompson Is Just Like Us: She Discovers Designers on Instagram
description: Plus: much like the little black dress, the little black scarf is going everywhere; Carolina Herrera's latest capsule collection and art meets leather goods in the new Lizzie Fortunato bag collaboration with the painter Sally King Benedict.

title: Mine Kills Civilians as Fighting Heats Up in Eastern Ukraine
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  Fighting that had been quiet for several months between Russia-backed insurgents and government forces has picked up in eastern Ukraine, punctuated by regular artillery shelling, the use of land mines and other tactics that have put civilians at risk.

title: Twitter User Growth Stalls, and the Chief Pledges to Make Fixes
description: When Jack Dorsey returned last year as chief executive of Twitter, the social media company he co-founded, he had a mandate: Right a sinking ship.

title: How a Junk-Food-Obsessed Instagram Chef Does Valentines Day
description: Everything about the Instagram celebrity chef Jacques La Merde is a little bit off. First, the faceless Instagrammer attracted thousands of followers (currently, 122,000), many of whom assumed La Merde was a man. But a recent episode of Top Chef revealed the account is run by the Toronto-based chef Christine Flynn. Many also assumed that La Merde was poking fun at the food world with an integration of Bugles and Drumsticks into daintily composed plates, mimicking complex dishes that might come out of Noma or Eleven Madison Parks kitchens. In actuality, Flynns elaborate experiments in plating culture were exactly that  experiments. I wasnt allowed to eat junk food growing up, she says.

title: Streamlining the Universal Remote Device
description: IF youre of a certain age, you may recall what you had to do to watch television: You turned the set on.

title: The Portland of Portugal
description: In Portugals second most populous city, medieval townhouses stack up beside the Douro River like Legos, and churches wear their blue-and-white azulejo tiles outside as well as in. Settled by the Romans, and famous for its port wines, which became a favored export to England via the 1703 Methuen Treaty, Porto was a lucky beneficiary of its countrys vast, centuries-spanning empire  look to the Baroque, blinding-gilt interior of the Church of So Francisco for evidence. Its riverside location made it an important industrial center in the 1700s and 1800s.

title: MetLife Makes Its Case Against Too Big to Fail Label
description: WASHINGTON  The too big to fail label is finally having its day in court.

title: Review: On Those Who Cant, Stalking the Halls of Lower Education
description: At this rate, by the end of the decade every comedy troupe in North America will have its own television series about misbehaving educators.

title: At the Grammy Awards, a History of Old-Guard Resistance to Change
description: The slate of best new artist nominees at the 2011 Grammy Awards was the most stacked in recent memory: Justin Bieber, a teen heartthrob who would go on to become the only relevant solo male pop star of the 2010s so far; Drake, at the beginning of his quest to fully meld hip-hop and R&B; Mumford & Sons, a band that delivered roots rock with arena muscle; and Florence & the Machine, glam art-rock innovators.

title: Review: A Cabinet of Curiosities at the Joyce
description: The choreographer Alwin Nikolais came to modern dance late after studying piano and working in scenic design, puppetry and acting. Looking back now, it makes sense. Nikolais, who died in 1993, was ahead of his time in his vision of theater as a place where sound, light and movement work in concert to give birth to jewel-like spectacles. He was long accused of dehumanizing dance; yes, there can be shapes instead of bodies and masks instead of faces, but theres no denying the heart in his choreography, however peculiar, playful or grisly it is.

title: Some Auto Insurance Premiums Penalize Home Renters, Study Finds
description: What does owning a home have to do with car insurance? Quite a bit, when it comes to the rates consumers pay for auto coverage, a new analysis finds.

title: Versace Through the Years
description: Donatella Versace is the one designer who has consistently challenged the paradox of power and sex  and shes done it with a laugh, a cigarette and a billion dollar business.

title: Stakes in Nevada Rise for Hillary Clinton as Caucuses Near
description: LAS VEGAS  The Democratic presidential caucuses in Nevada were supposed to be an afterthought: lost in the shadows of high-profile battles in Iowa and New Hampshire, and fought in a state far off in the West where voters have a long, warm history with Bill and Hillary Clinton.

title: Review: In My Father, the Pornographer, Chris Offutt Opens Up
description: Families, a therapist once told me. They keep us in business.

title: China Injects a Heavy Dose of Ideology Into New Years Eve Gala
description: BEIJING  Too handsome! Arent they handsome, the actor Ju Zhaojie cooed as dozens of soldiers, from an honor guard of the Peoples Liberation Army, stamped off the stage, issuing earsplitting shouts.

title: Mylan in $7.2 Billion Deal for Meda, a Swedish Drug Maker
description: After several attempts a few years ago to acquire Meda, a Swedish drug maker, Mylan finally found the price to solidify a deal: $7.2 billion.

title: In the Pop-Up Kitchen With Albert Adri
description: The Catalan chef brought T into the Domino kitchen, at the Caf Royal hotel, to test recipes for his forthcoming 50 Days event.

title: A Preview of Chef Albert Adris Much-Anticipated London Pop-Up
description: This Friday, the beloved Catalan chef Albert Adri (who is, of course, Ferran Adris little brother) will cook in London for the first time with a pop-up at the Caf Royal hotel. Unlike the five diverse restaurants he runs in Barcelona  which range from a perpetually sold-out avant-garde tapas bar called Tickets, to Hoja Santa, a modern Mexican table that was just awarded a star in the 2016 Michelin guide to Spain  the two-month-long pop-up will serve a prix fixe menu devised entirely by him.

title: Fox News Draws 4.2 Million Viewers for New Hampshire Primary Coverage
description: Fox News drew 4.2 million viewers for Tuesday nights coverage of the New Hampshire primary, the second-highest viewership for primary or caucus night coverage for any cable network dating to 2000. It was the highest rating for coverage of the New Hampshire primary for any cable network going back those 16 years.

title: Better Call Roberto: Alagna Steps In to Manon Lescaut
description: The tenor Roberto Alagna was sleeping the morning after singing Pagliacci at the Metropolitan Opera last month when the companys general manager, Peter Gelb, telephoned with a potential crisis on his hands. Jonas Kaufmann, one of the biggest stars in opera, had just withdrawn from a coming new production of Puccinis Manon Lescaut. Would Mr. Alagna step in?

title: Asahis Beer Buy: Trying to Escape Demographic Destiny
description: Anheuser-Busch InBev is getting the better of Asahi of Japan on three middling beer brands. While the $2.9 billion price tag is a bit lower than expected, the Japanese brewers acquisition of Peroni, Grolsch and Meantime clocks in at what may be some 25 times one measure of operating profit. The deal is only justifiable under the demographic logic of the buyers shrinking home country.

title: AmfAR Gala to Honor Harvey Weinstein
description: The producer Harvey Weinstein is being honored Wednesday night at the annual amfAR gala, which serves as the unofficial kickoff to New York Fashion Week. Charli XCX and Icona Pop will perform  they collaborated on the 2012 hit I Love It  and a charity auction will take place during dinner. Last year, the event raised $2.25 million for AIDS research. Previous honorees include Bill Clinton, Elizabeth Taylor, Diane von Furstenberg and Elton John. More information can be found at amfar.org.

title: Education May Cut Dementia Risk, Study Finds
description: The risk of developing dementia is decreasing for people with at least a high school education, according to an important new study that suggests that changes in lifestyle and improvements in physical health can help prevent or delay cognitive decline.

title: Five Designers to Watch at New York Fashion Week
description: A handful of designers debuting  and a few to keep an eye on.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing: Donald Trump, Janet Yellen, Chris Christie
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Review: New York Philharmonics Chinese New Year, From Breezy to Languid
description: Hidden messages conveyed in an ancient, enigmatic language are the subject of Tan Duns Nu Shu: The Secret Songs of Women, which capped the New York Philharmonics Chinese New Year celebration at David Geffen Hall on Tuesday. This languid, melancholy work for solo harp, orchestra and what its composer calls micro films is the result of Mr. Tans own field research into a nearly extinct language and calligraphy used for 700 years by women from a village in his native Hunan province.

title: The Boycott Before: Rap and Resentment at the 1989 Grammys
description: It can be said quite often: Hip-hop did it first.

title: Kendall and Kylie Jenner Party for Their Fashion Brand
description: When young designers want to unveil their first collection, they may hold a fashion show, perhaps during fashion week. But not if youre Kendall and Kylie Jenner.

title: Pictures of the Day: Bulgaria and Elsewhere
description: Bulgaria and More  Photos of the Day

title: Benjamin Millepied Opens Up on Leaving Paris Opera Ballet
description: PARIS  No questions? Stphane Lissner, the general director of the Paris Opera, asked the 200 or so journalists assembled on Wednesday morning for the announcement of the Operas 2016-17 season. There was the briefest pause. Well, thank you, he said, leaving the podium immediately with the music director Philippe Jordan and the director of dance, Benjamin Millepied.

title: Review: Bellinis La Sonnambula, Sung by Promising Young Voices
description: Over the last few years, the Juilliard School has become a hotbed for inventive opera productions. So its hard not to wish that the beautiful concert performance of Bellinis La Sonnambula on Tuesday evening at the schools Peter Jay Sharp Theater had been staged.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Feb. 10, 2016  Photos of the Day
description: Photos from Bulgaria, Yemen, Afghanistan and Germany.

title: U.S. and Europe Reach Agreement on Derivatives Regulation
description: An agreement between American and European regulators over the $553 trillion derivatives market could bring relief to banks and large clearinghouses, which had faced the threat of higher costs and disrupted trading.

title: Three Ways to Quit a Campaign
description: This is the time when candidates who never had a shot at the Republican nomination but were hanging in through New Hampshire drop out of the race. Or as they say, suspend their campaigns  a term of art coined in the last few cycles so that they can go on raising money even though they are not actually running anymore.

title: Orpheus Chamber Orchestra Announces Next Season
description: The Orpheus Chamber Orchestra announced Wednesday that its next season at Carnegie Hall would include a mix of classical works and new pieces, and feature performances with soloists including the pianists Christian Zacharias and Fazil Say, the violinist Vadim Gluzman and the cellist Alisa Weilerstein.

title: Effort to Replace a Plaintiffs Lawyer in G.M. Case Is Rejected
description: The federal judge overseeing hundreds of claims against General Motors related to a defective ignition switch has rejected an effort to replace Robert C. Hilliard, one of the lead plaintiffs lawyers on the case.

title: HBO Now Has 800,000 Paid Streaming Subscribers, Time Warner Says
description: HBOs stand-alone video streaming service has attracted about 800,000 paying subscribers since starting last April, the premium cable network said Wednesday, the first time it has disclosed numbers for the service.

title: Leslie Bassett, Pulitzer Prize-Winning Composer, Dies at 93
description: Leslie Bassett, a Pulitzer Prize-winning composer known for his lush sonorities and ecumenical instrumentation, died on Feb. 4 in Oakwood, Ga. He was 93.

title: Senate Approves Penalties for Aiding North Korean Nuclear Program
description: WASHINGTON  In an effort to derail North Koreas nuclear ambitions, the Senate on Wednesday unanimously approved strict sanctions intended to limit Pyongyangs ability to finance warheads and missiles.

title: Behind the Scenes With Vfiless 2016 Finalists
description: Six young designers from around the world will take part in tonights runway show.

title: Behind the Scenes With Six of Fashion Weeks Emerging Designers
description: Earlier this week, six young designers from around the world convened in an empty retail space in SoHo to prepare their debut collections at New York Fashion Week. They were the winners of the sixth Vfiles Runway competition  which will be held tonight at Spring Studios  and have come from Italy, Switzerland, Ukraine, Holland and India. More than a few of them are in New York for the first time.

title: SolarCity and Other Rooftop Providers Face a Cloudier Future
description: Just two years ago, SolarCity and other rooftop solar providers were Wall Street darlings, and prospects for growth were flying high, as enthusiasm for solar power was seemingly boundless.

title: Young Bombers Kill 58 at Nigerian Camp for Those Fleeing Boko Haram
description: MAIDUGURI, Nigeria  When three girls showed up Monday at a camp for people who had fled the militant group Boko Haram, they were welcomed and offered a place to sleep.

title: Stop Bernie-Splaining to Black Voters
description: Now that Iowa and New Hampshire are vanishing in the rearview mirror, the Democratic contests shift more West and South  beginning with Nevada and South Carolina, states that have significantly more Hispanic or black voters, respectively, who at this point disproportionately favor Hillary Clinton to Bernie Sanders.

title: Yemen: Airstrike Kills Family in Capital
description: Two television journalists were killed late Tuesday, along with their three children, when an airstrike carried out by the military coalition led by Saudi Arabia hit their house in Sana, the capital, witnesses said. The journalists, Suaad Hujaira, 30, and her husband, Muneer Alhakami, 37, worked for Yemen TV, a state channel controlled by Yemens Houthi rebels and critical of the Saudis military intervention in Yemen. The coalition, which has been fighting the Houthis since March, has been accused of killing hundreds of civilians in airstrikes that are often indiscriminate, human rights groups say. Mr. Alhakami and Ms. Hujairas house was in a residential neighborhood in Sana, far from any obvious military target, residents said.

title: Man Convicted of Killing 3 Brooklyn Merchants in 2012
description: A traveling clothing salesman was convicted on Wednesday of fatally shooting three merchants in Brooklyn, a series of apparently random attacks in 2012 that had shopkeepers on alert for months.

title: Twitter, to Save Itself, Must Scale Back World-Swallowing Ambitions
description: Twitter is the worlds most important social network.

title: Cuomos Proposal Seeks Confidentiality for Minors With H.I.V.
description: Among the recent patients at the Childrens Hospital at Montefiore in the Bronx was a 17-year-old with H.I.V. who put off his treatment until he turned 18, because he was worried his parents would kick him out and not pay for his medications if they found out about his status. At SUNY Downstate Medical Center in Brooklyn, doctors wanted to prescribe Truvada, the preventive H.I.V. pill, to a 16-year-old girl who was dating a man who was H.I.V. positive. But she did not receive it because she could not qualify for state assistance to pay for it.

title: Russian Intervention in Syrian War Has Sharply Reduced U.S. Options
description: MUNICH  For months now the United States has insisted there can be no military solution to the Syrian civil war, only a political accord between President Bashar al-Assad and the fractured, divided opposition groups that have been trying to topple him.

title: Security Fears Hang Over African Marathons
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Samba Fayes training for Sundays inaugural marathon here includes runs along Dakars scenic coastal road, where there has been a noticeable increase in armed security at upscale hotels and shopping areas after recent terrorist attacks in Burkina Faso and Mali.

title: Where Campaigns Go to Die
description: The Iowa caucuses and the New Hampshire primaries are the first tests presidential hopefuls face every four years, and for a lot of candidates, its the beginning and the end.

title: Technology Manager Gets 3 Years Probation in CityTime Scheme
description: It was one of the biggest frauds ever carried out against the City of New York, and a blot on former Mayor Michael R. Bloombergs reputation for managerial and technological savvy. On Wednesday, the criminal prosecutions spawned by the case, involving a computerized payroll system called CityTime, reached a quiet denouement when a federal judge in Manhattan sentenced a computer specialist at the center of the scheme to three years probation.

title: Judge Refuses to Grant Mistrial in Akai Gurley Case
description: Lawyers defending a New York City police officer accused of killing an unarmed man inside a Brooklyn housing project sought on Wednesday to have the case declared a mistrial, arguing that a last-minute theory introduced by prosecutors was inflammatory.

title: Canada: Another Human Foot Washes Ashore
description: The British Columbia Coroners Service said Wednesday that it had opened an investigation after a human foot washed up on the provinces shoreline, the 13th since 2007. Like most of the other cases, the current one involves a foot wearing a running shoe. It was found by a hiker on Vancouver Islands Botanical Beach on Sunday. The coroners office said the foot became detached from the body because of prolonged immersion in water. The style of the running shoe that was found was first sold in North American stores in March 2013, indicating that the death occurred sometime after that date. The coroners office confirmed that 10 of the 12 feet in earlier cases came from seven people who have been identified. It said that foul play was not evident in the other cases.

title: Pennsylvania to Start Impeachment Proceedings for Attorney General
description: HARRISBURG, Pa.  The Pennsylvania House voted overwhelmingly on Wednesday to begin impeachment proceedings against Attorney General Kathleen Kane, who survived a separate attempt by Senate Republicans to oust her using an arcane constitutional procedure not invoked here since 1891.

title: Did the Supreme Court Just Kill the Paris Climate Deal? Maybe. We Explain.
description: Answers to questions about the courts decision to temporarily block the Obama administrations effort to regulate emissions from coal-fired power plants.

title: Modern Love: The Podcast | The Plunge
description: Welcome to the fifth episode of Modern Love: The Podcast, brought to you by The New York Times and WBUR. This week, youll hear the actress Dakota Fanning read a 2013 Modern Love essay by Natalie Lindeman titled Celebrating the Upside of an Emotional Plunge, about a teenager who finds the silver lining (and love) after falling 100 feet into one the countrys steepest canyons.

title: Dweller on the Upper Mississippi
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  As a person who is fairly visual, I like to imagine that when I come across a particularly tough crossword clue, a question mark appears above my head until my brain deciphers the answer. As soon as I figure out the answer, that question mark is replaced by an energy-saving and eco-friendly light bulb. I should probably cut down on the video games.

title: F.B.I. Agents Encircle Holdouts at Oregon Standoff
description: SEATTLE  F.B.I. agents moved in on Wednesday night to encircle the last four holdouts at a federal wildlife refuge in eastern Oregon that has been occupied since early January by armed antigovernment militants.

title: Two Maryland Deputies Are Killed in Panera Bread Shooting
description: Two sheriffs deputies were killed Wednesday in a shooting that started at a restaurant in a shopping center in Abingdon, Md., and ended near an apartment complex, the authorities said. The suspect was also killed in the exchange of gunfire.

title: Police See Possible Hate Crime in Stabbing of Jewish Man in Brooklyn
description: A 25-year-old Jewish man dressed in Hasidic clothing was stabbed in the back on Wednesday as he walked along a street in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn, and his assailant was being sought in what the police were investigating as a possible hate crime, officials said.

title: New York City to Review a Nuisance Law That Has Led to Evictions
description: The Police Department will review the circumstances under which it forces people from their homes using New York Citys nuisance-abatement law, a legal weapon that has been used for decades to shut down drug dens, brothels and other criminal operations, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Donald Trump Takes Aim at Ted Cruz Again
description: Donald J. Trump released an ad Wednesday attacking Senator Ted Cruz of Texas as the two prepare to square off in South Carolina, after splitting the first two Republican nominating contests.

title: Nets Look to Turn the Page on Misery. Maybe Next Week.
description: The Nets were 1.3 seconds away from their 40th loss of the season Monday when Joe Johnson banked in a 3-pointer as time expired to defeat the Denver Nuggets. The thrill of victory  a rare sight inside Barclays Center this season  sent the owner Mikhail D. Prokhorov (also a rarity inside the arena) out of his luxury-box seat, arms extended high in the air as he hollered and celebrated.

title: Gov. Rick Snyder Asks Michigan Lawmakers for More Aid for Flint
description: Gov. Rick Snyder of Michigan asked state lawmakers on Wednesday to approve $195 million more in aid for Flint, where tainted water has caused health problems and prompted calls to rapidly fix the citys crumbling infrastructure. But the governors request did not include funds to replace every lead service line in the city, as Flints mayor has insisted is necessary.

title: Kanye Wests Yeezy Season 3 Extravaganza
El Chapo Could Be Tried in Brooklyn Court for Drug Trafficking, Official Says
description: If Mexico agrees to extradite the notorious drug trafficker known as El Chapo to the United States, he would be tried in federal court in Brooklyn, a law enforcement official said on Wednesday.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | panoramic
description: panoramic  \pa-n-ra-mik\  adjective

title: No Serious Injuries After Bus Carrying Argentine Soccer Team Crashes
description: Players from a top Argentine soccer team received emergency treatment after their bus crashed and overturned in Venezuela following a match in the Copa Libertadores, South Americas premier club tournament. Huracn, a team from Buenos Aires, defeated Caracas F.C. on Tuesday night to secure a berth in the Copas second round. But on the way back to the airport, the brakes on the teams bus failed, club officials said. The bus flipped, and several players and members of the clubs staff were hurt, although none of the injuries appeared serious.

title: Federal Grand Jury Begins Hearing Evidence in Eric Garner Case
description: Federal prosecutors began presenting evidence on Wednesday to a grand jury in Brooklyn in the death of Eric Garner, an unarmed black man who died after being placed in a chokehold by a white police officer in Staten Island in July 2014, according to a person briefed on the matter.

title: What to Watch Thursday
description: Csar Award? Check. Oscar nomination? Alas, no. Kristen Stewarts portrayal of a personal assistant to a French actress in Clouds of Sils Maria comes to cable. Shonda Rhimess tough cookies resume their lives midseason. And cast members of The Walking Dead talk zombies.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Social media is the laxative of the fashion system. It makes everyone digest everything so much faster: trends, product discovery.

title: Corrections: February 11, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Firing Leads to Questions on California Coasts Future
description: LOS ANGELES  The decision by the powerful commission that controls development along Californias coastline to fire its executive director threw the agency into turmoil Thursday, raising questions about why it acted and the future of the states 1,100 miles of coastal land.

title: Berlin Film Festival Includes a Focus on Immigration and Refugees
description: BERLIN  The 66th annual Berlin International Film Festival opens Thursday with the European premiere of the Coen brothers latest caper, Hail, Caesar. But the Berlinale has always been the most engag of the worlds film festivals and this years selection also reflects some of the weightier issues in Europe today: immigration and refugees.

title: Robert Mapplethorpe: In Search of Perfection
description: A two-part show of Mapplethorpes work reveals an artist who pursued perfection from his models, subjects and even his prints.

title: Yes, We Do Eat More Soup When Were Sick
description: When two companies matched their data, they found the correlation.

title: Robert Mapplethorpe: In Search of Perfection
description: How should we think about the work of Robert Mapplethorpe today  post-sadomasochism, beyond the culture wars and after the first wave of the AIDS epidemic? What does Robert Mapplethorpe have left for us?

title: Outrage Over an Italian Students Murder in Egypt
description: Italy is in an uproar over the torture and murder in Egypt of Giulio Regeni, a 28-year-old Italian doctoral student at Cambridge University who disappeared in Cairo on Jan. 25 and whose half-naked, battered body was found in a ditch Feb. 3, hours after Italian officials appealed directly to President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi of Egypt for help in locating the missing student.

title: Hillary, Bernie and History
description: Its a sad time for Hillary Clintons fans. Well, I guess thats obvious, since she got clobbered in New Hampshire. But its the way she went down that was particularly painful. Bernie Sanders got more than half the womens vote, mainly because younger women raced off to his corner in droves.

title: All Praise the Women of Menopause
description: For some women, menopause is no big deal. Some say they barely notice it. My mother, long ago, described her menopause this way: My periods just started gettin lighter and lighter, and my harmones  settled down, and then one day  pfft! It was over.

title: The G.O.P. Created Donald Trump
description: The betting markets now say that the most likely Republican nominee for president is a man who mocks women, insults Latinos, endorses war crimes like torture, denounces party icons and favors barring people from the United States based on their religion.

title: The Court Blocks Efforts to Slow Climate Change
description: The Supreme Courts extraordinary decision on Tuesday to temporarily block the Obama administrations effort to combat global warming by regulating emissions from power plants was deeply disturbing on two fronts.

title: Lets End the Peril of a Nuclear Winter
description: IN the early 1980s, American and Russian scientists working together outlined a stark vision of the Cold War future. In a battle between the two superpowers, smoke from fires ignited by nuclear explosions would be so dense that it would block out the sun, turning the earth cold, dark and dry, killing plants and preventing agriculture for at least a year.

title: What Lies Ahead for Donald Trump
How Smartphones Are Killing Off the Fashion Show
description: The first big show of New York Fashion Week will not take place in a traditional space. It is not even on the traditional schedule, which lists roughly 150 shows stretching from Thursday morning to next Thursday night.

title: What Bernie Sanders Needs to Carry His Success Into Other States
description: The Bernie Sanders coalition is starting to look interesting.

title: Tracing the Bishops Culpability in the Child Abuse Scandal
description: Pope Francis commission on the clergys sexual violation of children had a timely private screening in Rome last week of Spotlight, the Oscar-nominated film about the pedophilia scandal in Boston. The film offers the Vatican, if it will listen, an emphatic lesson in accountability. It dramatizes the decision by The Boston Globe to do more than enumerate the scope of the scandal by reporting on cases involving scores of abusive priests. The scandal was tracked up the church hierarchy to Cardinal Bernard Law, who eventually had to resign his leadership when the news media, not the church, documented his role as a protector of abusive priests.

title: News Qs | Brazilians Shrug Off Zika Fears to Revel in Carnival Fun
description: The following lesson activities are based on the article Brazilians Shrug Off Zika Fears to Revel in Carnival Fun.

title: Rachel McAdamss Red Carpet Looks
description: The more avant-garde the outfit, the sharper Ms. McAdams looks.

title: Rachel McAdams Tries Short Hair, Sheer Textures and Elie Saab
description: Rachel McAdams, 37, is perhaps best known for her lead roles in lighthearted films like Mean Girls and The Notebook, yet shes tackled meatier fare recently: as a boxers doomed wife in Southpaw and a hard-hitting reporter in Spotlight, for which she has been nominated for her first Academy Award.

title: Fashion Week: Happy Kanye West Day
description: Did you feel the slight tremble rippling through the cosmos this morning? Did you puzzle for an extra minute over which shirt to wear?

title: Room for the Dog on the Upper East Side
description: After Emilie Gossiaux graduated from  Cooper Union in 2014, she started interning at the Metropolitan Museum of Art on the Upper East Side.

title: Student Question | How Much Do You Worry About Taking the SAT or ACT?
description: The SAT has gotten a major redesign, and many high school students are nervous.

title: The Road to the Top of the World
description: In the Arctic, roads are magical. They appear in the fall and melt in the spring. Others, buckled by permafrost, undulate in the snow. Many are invisible to the naked eye  caribou migration routes that exist only by instinct. During the sunless, frigid winter, the Arctic Ocean becomes one vast road for polar bears and snowmobiles.

title: In the Democratic Debate, Heres What to Look For
description: Heres our coverage of the sixth Democratic debate, and our live fact checks.

title: Oaxacas Native Maize Embraced by Top Chefs in U.S. and Europe
description: SANTA ANA ZEGACHE, Mexico  In the birthplace of maize, nobody seemed to need Juan Velascos crop.

title: Bernie Sanders Intrigues South Carolina Town That Loves Hillary Clinton
description: ORANGEBURG, S.C.  When Helen Duley was asked whom she would vote for in the South Carolina primary, she answered as if the very question were absurd.

title: Britain, Better Off Out of Europe
description: Valentines Day is the traditional feast of love. But this February, Britons are more fixated on a political divorce.

title: How the Dirt Cure Can Make for Healthier Families
description: Dr. Maya Shetreat-Klein has a message for the parents of small children: Dont be afraid of dirt.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start the day.

title: A Doctor in the Neighborhood
description: One of the main premises of health care reform is that everybody needs to have a primary care doctor, ideally in the community. I happen to live right near my clinic, so I often see many of my patients on the street. This can be good or bad. There have been innumerable times when a meeting on the street has added an important element to medical care  reminders of missed visits, lost prescriptions, continuing issues that would not have otherwise made it to my office.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Ferguson, Janet Yellen, Kanye West
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Google Will Further Block Some European Search Results
description: In its continuing game of hide-and-seek with European privacy regulators, Google is about to make more changes to how people view its search results in Europe.

title: For 12 Photographers, an Anxious Gaze on Israel and the West Bank
description: For 25 years, Frdric Brenner traveled the world, finding Jews to photograph. In every place he went, whether it was a singles weekend in the Catskills or an ancient stone dwelling in Yemen, he sought to uncover a buried trace of his own past. What had been silenced and ignored by my family, I had to excavate, he said during a visit to New York last month.

title: Funding Dispute Clouds Agreement Over Drug Crisis
description: The nations drug crisis has grabbed the attention of the presidential candidates and of Congress, as Republicans and Democrats are eager to be seen responding to a problem that has hit many of their communities hard.

title: Kichin
description: A Korean takeout shop under the Marcy Avenue subway stop in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

title: At Kichin in Brooklyn, Korean Fried Chicken and Mighty Rice Balls
description: Unpeel the wax paper and there is a fat, charred wedge of rice, prickly with bacon shards, its nori sleeve puckered from a bout on the grill. At the center is treasure: smoked Cheddar and a soft-boiled quail egg, ready to spill.

title: Morning Agenda: Dollar Weakens on Fed Caution
description: DOLLAR WEAKENS ON FED CAUTION | Janet L. Yellen sounded more worried about the nations economy on Wednesday than she did at her last public appearance in December,Binyamin Appelbaum reports in The New York Times.

title: New York Today: Where to Eat Alone
description: Good morning on this teeth-chattering Thursday.

title: Total, French Oil Giant, Tries to Weather Plummeting Prices
description: LONDON  In a period of sharply lower oil prices, the French company Total fared better in the fourth quarter than some of its peers, reporting adjusted net income on Thursday that beat analyst expectations.

title: School Bus Crash in Western France Kills 6 Students
description: PARIS  Six students were killed in western France on Thursday morning when their school bus and a heavy truck collided, officials said.

title: Trial of Reinhold Hanning, Ex-Auschwitz Guard, Opens in Germany
description: BERLIN  Reinhold Hanning, a 94-year-old former Nazi charged with being an accessory to the murder of at least 170,000 people who perished at a concentration camp in Poland, refused to make any statements as his trial opened on Thursday in Germany, even as a survivor directly urged him to break his silence.

title: Kentucky Ex-Governor Aims to Halt Rollback of Obamacare Changes
description: The former governor who made Kentucky a national leader in health care expansion under the Affordable Care Act is moving to protect that legacy from his successor, who has set out to dismantle parts of it.

title: Danielle Steel: By the Book
description: The author, most recently, of Blue says Alex Haley was her mentor. We both wrote late at night, and when my phone rang at 3 a.m., I always knew it was him, making sure I was working.

title: Three Pantry Staples With the Power to Transform
description: The world brims with noteworthy threes. There are the primary colors, the legs on a stool. There are thesis, antithesis, synthesis; Roosevelt, Churchill and Stalin at Yalta. There are the love triangles of Helen of Troy, of Anna Karenina  and of most of us, at some time in our own epic journeys. There were three Magi, bearing gold, frankincense and myrrh. But in daily life, where our needs are physical as often as intellectual and spiritual, no trinity is more useful than the gastronomic trinity of olives, capers and dried chiles. Each has a forcefulness belied by its small size, and together they can sit on a pantry shelf, waiting to be called on  which makes them as indispensable, on a small scale, as Ahabs (three) mates aboard the Pequod and decidedly more successful at their aim.

title: The Killing of Warren Weinstein
description: As soon as Alisa Weinstein answered her cellphone last April and heard her sister Jens voice, she sensed what was coming. Its been confirmed, Jen said. Alisa stood motionless at the foot of her bed in her tiny San Francisco apartment; just a moment before, she was getting ready for work as a researcher at Uber. She knew what her sister meant: The government was now certain that their father, Warren, was dead, executed by his jihadi captors. She felt herself crumpling, she remembers, but quickly went into automaton mode. She told Jen that she didnt want any details. She didnt want to think about how he had been killed.

title: Review: In Zoolander 2, All Is Still Vanity
description: If you took away the extravagantly gaudy trappings of the overproduced, chaotic, not very funny comic circus that is Zoolander 2, you would still have a surefire basic concept. Derek Zoolander (Ben Stiller), an airhead model forever pursing his lips, striking poses and practicing his telekinetic blue-steel glare in the mirror, is a Chaplinesque Everyman in a delusional bubble. The prevalence of outrageous male vanity was the dirty little secret in the first Zoolander that lent the film its satirical bite. In the 15 years that have passed since then, it is anything but a secret in a world of competing buff, preening dandies.

title: Review: Deadpool, a Sardonic Supervillain on a Kill Mission
description: Jokes and bullets are tossed like confetti in Deadpool, a feverishly eager-to-please comic-book movie about a supervillain who suits up like a superhero. In uniform, the title character, an ordinary mercenary turned freakishly powerful mercenary, may look a little like Spider-Man, at least to the comic-book agnostic. But Deadpool is far more psychotic than heroic, which he cheerfully establishes by painting the screen red with one kill after another. He points, shoots, jokes (repeat), often while cracking wise right into the camera.

title: What Caused This Otherwise Healthy Retirees Debilitating Cough?
description: His chest pain, combined with his hacking cough, suggested that he had pneumonia. But there was no sign of infection. So what was it?

title: On Java, a Creative Explosion in an Ancient City
description: After the tropical thunder rolls across south Java comes the rain, and each drop has a character. Some sweep across the bamboo roof in high-pitched volleys, and some plop into the puddles one by one, luminous, like silver. Others hit the dried banana leaves with a solid, resonant thunk.

title: North Korea to Freeze Souths Assets at Kaesong Industrial Park
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea said on Thursday that it would freeze all South Korean assets at a joint industrial complex the South shut down to retaliate for a recent nuclear test and a rocket launch by the North.

title: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts Quarterly Profit Jumps 53%
description: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts said on Thursday that its fourth-quarter after-tax profit rose 53 percent despite a quarter of tumult in the stock market.

title: First Draft Focus: Throwback Thursday  The More Things Change
NATO Will Send Ships to Aegean Sea to Deter Human Trafficking
description: BRUSSELS  With more than a million migrants having reached Europe in the last year and many more on the way, NATO stepped into the crisis for the first time on Thursday, saying it would deploy ships to the Aegean Sea in an attempt to stop smugglers.

title: Taiwanese City Moves Against Builders Holdings After Earthquake
description: HONG KONG  The city government of Tainan in southwestern Taiwan announced Thursday night that it had identified at least 30 real estate holdings across the island belonging to the developer of an apartment complex that collapsed in an earthquake last Saturday, and had told local government agencies to monitor the holdings to prevent their sale.

title: HSBC Rescinds Pay Freeze for 2016 but Keeps Hiring Ban in Place
description: LONDON  HSBC has changed course on its decision to freeze pay this year.

title: Joel Grey, a Broadway Eminence, Comes of Age at 83
description: The view of the Hudson River from Joel Greys apartment on West Street is enchanting, even on a murky day, with a drizzle of rain fogging the long wall of high windows. But during a recent interview Mr. Grey rarely looked in that direction. He was focused instead on his new memoir, Master of Ceremonies, published by Flatiron Books this month.

title: Dorothy Parker at the Movies
description: Dear Diary:

title: British Police Chief Says Sexual Abuse Complaints May Face More Skepticism
description: LONDON  After months of embarrassing revelations that the police had failed to challenge dubious claims of child sexual abuse committed by prominent Britons, the head of Scotland Yard announced on Thursday that the authorities might no longer be encouraged to believe every complaint.

title: Steve Kerr Leads Warriors Chase of a Record He Helped Set
description: PHOENIX  If Steve Kerr were any more muted on Wednesday night, he would have been a chromatic gray on the color wheel. His Golden State Warriors had just handed the host Suns a 112-104 setback to maintain their edge over the 1995-96 Chicago Bulls in the season-long race for the grand prize of immortality. The reigning N.B.A. champion Warriors had notched victory No. 48 in their 52nd game. Twenty years ago, the Bulls started 48-5 on their way to a record 72-win regular season.

title: Two Cooks, Two Kitchens, Two Organizing Plans
description: My kitchen wasnt awful. Many nights, the clutter on the counter was arranged quite neatly. Most of the cabinets closed. We could cook in it, and did, with joy.

title: Delivery Start-Ups Face Road Bumps in Quest to Capture Untapped Market
description: DoorDash, one of a multitude of start-ups with a mobile app that lets people order and get food sent to their doorsteps, relies on contract drivers like Brian Navarro to make the deliveries. The problem is that workers like Mr. Navarro dont always stick around.

title: Dont Forget Darfur
description: Northampton, Mass.  Darfur may have dropped out of international headlines, but that does not mean the region enjoys peace. Far from it. A renewed escalation of violence by the Sudanese government against non-Arab ethnic groups threatens to compound a humanitarian disaster that, according to United Nations estimates, over the past 13 years displaced more than 2.7 million people in Darfur and an additional 380,000 refugees to eastern Chad.

title: Why Twitter Is Like a Deli With Good Pastrami
description: Twitters earnings on Wednesday were by no means a surprise. The companys revenues were still going up over the last three months of 2015, but the number of people who use it stopped growing.

title: At Least 49 Inmates Killed in Mexican Prison Riot
description: MEXICO CITY  The fight took less than an hour. At the end of it, at least 49 followers of two rival gang leaders lay dead, stabbed and beaten to death in an overcrowded, aging prison in the northern city of Monterrey.

title: Grayson Fund Brochure
description: A document dated June 2013 details the capabilities that it says Representative Alan Grayson brings to the hedge fund he continued to run despite his return to Congress.

title: Email Shows Concern About Alan Graysons Hedge Fund
description: Email correspondence from June 2015 between Representative Alan Grayson and his campaign manager at the time involves concern among his staff about the political damage Mr. Graysons hedge fund could cause his Senate bid.

title: Alan Graysons Double Life: Congressman and Hedge Fund Manager
description: WASHINGTON  The hedge fund manager boasted that he had traveled to every country in the world, studying overseas stock markets as he fine-tuned an investment strategy to capitalize on global companies suffering because of economic or political turmoil.

title: Using Older Hardware With Windows 10
description: Q. Will the installation of Microsofts Windows 10 require me to install different drivers for my scanner and printer?

title: U.S. Voters Strike Back Against Political Status Quo
description: A backlash has been building gradually among American voters for years against stagflation, the middle-class squeeze, cross-border trade deals and Wall Street bailouts.

title: Morgan Stanley to Pay $3.2 Billion Over Flawed Mortgage Bonds
description: Morgan Stanley will pay $3.2 billion to strike a settlement with state and federal authorities over the Wall Street firms creation of mortgage-backed bonds before the financial crisis.

title: Lincoln Center Hall of Fame Names First Inductees
description: There is no hall yet, but Lincoln Centers nascent performing arts hall of fame now has the fame part down. It announced Thursday that its first class of inductees would include Louis Armstrong, Plcido Domingo, Yo-Yo Ma, Audra McDonald, Leontyne Price and Harold Prince.

title: 1916: Shake-Up in Wilson Cabinet
description: NEW YORK  With the resignation of Mr. Lindley M. Garrison, the Secretary of War, and of Mr. Henry Breckinridge, the Assistant Secretary of War, and with the submarine outlook worse than at any time since the war began, the Administration is rocked to its very foundations.

title: Indian Soldier Rescued After Siachen Avalanche Dies
description: NEW DELHI  An Indian infantryman whose unlikely survival in an avalanche touched off celebrations across the country died Thursday morning at a military hospital in New Delhi.

title: Wall of Love Commemorates Paris Attacks
description: In an effort to heal their neighborhood, residents of the 10th Arrondissement invited street and graffiti artists to paint on a blocklong wall near two cafes that were attacked.

title: Hispanic Group Backs Harry Reids Chosen Successor in Nevada
description: The Latino Victory Fund, a Democratic-leaning group looking to elect Hispanics to higher office, made its first Senate endorsement on Thursday in a crucial swing state where the 2016 presidential race is moving toward  Nevada.

title: What Two Black Holes Colliding Sounds Like
description: These chirps are gravitational waves converted to audible sounds. The faint thump matches the gravitational waves frequencies. The louder chirp is a higher frequency better suited to human ears.

title: LIGO Hears Gravitational Waves Einstein Predicted
description: About a hundred years ago, Einstein predicted the existence of gravitational waves, but until now, they were undetectable.

title: Gravitational Waves Detected, Confirming Einsteins Theory
description: A team of scientists announced on Thursday that they had heard and recorded the sound of two black holes colliding a billion light-years away, a fleeting chirp that fulfilled the last prediction of Einsteins general theory of relativity.

title: 1941: War Looms Over Bulgaria
description: SOFIA  Bulgarian statesmen are watching, powerless to alter the course of events, as the spectre of war looms ever larger over their country. In diplomatic quarters here it is regarded as only a matter of days, or at best weeks before Bulgaria, like so many other small countries of Europe, becomes involved in the world conflict. There are few people in Bulgaria who do not fervently desire peace. But if Fuehrer Adolf Hitler has decided to move this way  and it is widely believed that he has  there will be no choice between war and peace. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Feb. 12, 1941

title: Oscars Heart May Be in Hollywood, but His Accent Is British
description: LOS ANGELES  The movies themselves seem pass in California now, Christopher Rand wrote in Los Angeles: The Ultimate City, published in 1967. Brushing aside Hollywood in a single paragraph, he added that the heart and soul of the movie business seems simply to have left L.A., mainly for foreign countries.

title: New York Police Are Using Covert Cellphone Trackers, Civil Liberties Group Says
description: Covert cellphone tracking devices, which have proliferated in law enforcement agencies across the nation, have been used by the New York Police Department on at least 1,000 occasions since 2008 in the course of investigating rapes, murders and other crimes, as well as in searches for missing people, according to documents obtained by the New York Civil Liberties Union.

title: Below the Line: A Daily Ordeal in the Makeup Chair
description: Mad Max: Fury Road. The Revenant. The 100-Year-Old Man Who Climbed Out the Window and Disappeared. One of these films may not be quite like the others. Perhaps little-known here, the Swedish film The 100-Year-Old Man was a hit in its home country and is in contention alongside the other films for the best hair and makeup Oscar.

title: James Woods Clears Hurdle in Effort to Unmask Twitter User
description: To those who spend enough time on the Internet, anonymous attacks come with the territory, like mosquito bites in the tropics. But some bites have serious consequences.

title: Oregon Standoff Ends as Last Militant Surrenders
description: PRINCETON, Ore.  They implored the last holdout in the armed occupation of a wildlife refuge here to think about the Holy Spirit. They explained that the First Amendment was about freedom of speech and the Second was about the right to bear arms, and said that they were in that order for a reason. They asked him what he thought Jesus would have done in his situation.

title: Cleveland Drops Attempt to Collect $500 From Tamir Rice Family
description: Nearly 15 months after a Cleveland police officer fatally shot Tamir Rice, 12, while the boy was playing with a pellet gun near a recreation area, a document appeared online showing that the city was suing to collect $500 for his last dying expense  the cost of his emergency medical treatment.

title: The San Pedro la Laguna Finals
description: Although soccer remains Guatemalas top sport, San Pedro la Laguna has embraced basketball, which has a link to the Mayans.

title: Guatemalan Athletes Are Dribbling, and Not Only With Their Feet
description: SAN PEDRO LA LAGUNA, Guatemala  The gleaming artificial-turf soccer stadium in the hills above this picturesque town, tucked along the southwest shores of volcano-ringed Lake Atitln, may be a paean to a soccer-loving culture.

title: Bruce Springsteen Autobiography Born to Run Set for September
description: Bruce Springsteen is not out of new material just yet.

title: Eleven Models  From All Over  to Watch This Season
description: On the first day of New York Fashion Week and the fall/winter 2016 shows, T and the casting director Arianna Pradarelli pick the runways most exciting new faces  some making their debuts, others a few seasons in.

title: Vince Gilligan and Peter Gould on Better Call Saul, Bob Odenkirk and Fan Tattoos
description: Once mostly anonymous, the producers who oversee top television series have sometimes become as well known as the actors who star in them. On occasion, The Times will pose questions from readers (and pose some of our own) to notable show runners, and post their responses.

title: Readers Respond to Redesigned, and Wordier, SAT
description: Is it unfair to some students that the redesigned SAT, being rolled out next month, will include longer and harder reading passages and wordier math problems than before? Anemona Hartocolliss article on the topic drew more than 900 responses from readers.

title: Carmakers Retreat From Quirky Designs as Millennials Embrace Mainstream
description: It was not too long ago that automakers were tripping over themselves in pursuit of younger buyers, offering boxy wagons and small, jellybean-shape city cars. The Scion xB, the Honda Element, the Nissan Cube: All were funky departures for Generation X from the dowdy minivans of their parents.

title: Katy Perry on Grammy Parties, a New Album and Keeping Calm Online
description: For the first time in eight years, Katy Perry is not attending the Grammy Awards. But she is planning a party.

title: Donald Trump Announces Endorsements, but Doesnt Name Them
description: Rolling out endorsements from elected officials is a ritual of presidential campaigns, a sign a candidate is embraced by party leadership. Donald J. Trump added a twist on Thursday by announcing that dozens of Georgia officials endorse him, but only naming four of them.

title: Nigeria Vexed by Boko Harams Use of Women as Suicide Bombers
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Of all the mysteries surrounding Boko Haram, the marauding militant jihadist group that has terrorized Nigeria and its neighbors, the use of women and girls as suicide bombers is among the most vexing.

title: Defending a Video Game Designer
description: My sweet, smart and responsible husband makes video games for a living. It is a controversial industry. Upon hearing his profession, many people begin long, angry monologues about how much they disapprove of his work. Their manners and politeness tend to evaporate. Is there a way to politely acknowledge these peoples feelings while exiting the conversations quickly?

title: Video Review: With the RC F, Lexus Abandons Its Beige Image
description: When talk turns to high performance in cars, Lexus seldom springs to mind. Yes, it has built the passionate IS F sedan. Who wouldnt want an LFA supercar? Still, Lexus hasnt attracted the kind of attention that BMW M, Cadillac V and Mercedes AMG cars have.

title: Hillary Clinton Gets Backing From Black Democrats in Congress
description: The political arm of the Congressional Black Caucus endorsed Hillary Clinton on Thursday in what has become a tight race for the Democratic presidential nomination, providing an institutional boost as she battles with Senator Bernie Sanders for the support of black voters.

title: 5 Arrested in Connection With East Village Gas Explosion
description: The gas explosion that killed two people and destroyed three buildings last spring in the East Village was a catastrophic consequence of a scheme by a landlord who had installed an illegal gas line and hid the setup from inspectors, all in a bid to hold onto tenants and their high rents, prosecutors said on Thursday.

title: Adriana Lima, Candice Swanepoel and Karlie Kloss Transform Into Marvel Superheroes
description: Supermodels have gotten supermakeovers.

title: Mark Rylance, Onstage Again in Nice Fish
description: Accepting a 2008 Tony Award for his hilarious performance in Boeing Boeing, Mark Rylance offered some curious advice in his speech: When you are in town, wearing some kind of uniform is helpful, policeman, priest, etc., he began. The perplexing speech was actually a poem by the Minnesota poet Louis Jenkins; Mr. Rylance used another in 2011. Unlike flying or astral projection, walking through walls is a totally earth-related craft, he began, accepting a Tony for his performance as the hedonistic Johnny (Rooster) Byron in Jez Butterworths Jerusalem.

title: Melissa Mark-Viverito, Council Speaker, Vows to Pursue New Criminal Justice Reforms
description: The speaker of the New York City Council, Melissa Mark-Viverito, vowed on Thursday to pursue a new round of criminal justice reforms aimed at shrinking the jail population to such a degree that officials could eventually contemplate shuttering the citys scandal-plagued jail complex on Rikers Island.

title: The Boston Modern Orchestra Project Fought Bloat  and Won
description: BOSTON  Cast your eye over the orchestral landscape, and the big picture could be seen as one of institutional malaise: deficits, labor strife, cowardly programming. All of which makes it imperative to celebrate those ensembles that, through luck, skill and diligence, pull off what the symphonic behemoths too rarely achieve: diverse repertoire and financial equilibrium.

title: Did You Get Tickets? Beyonc, Adele and Other Big Tours Unleash Emotional Storm
description: General ticket sales for Beyoncs Formation world tour dont open until next week, but advance sales have provided a taste of what to expect: lots of emotion  good and bad  pouring out on social media.

title: Saint Laurent in Los Angeles
description: The fashion house Saint Laurent presented its collection in L.A. to a crowd of celebrities.

title: Donald Trumps Campaign Pulls a Negative Ad on Ted Cruz
description: On Tuesday, Donald J. Trumps campaign started running a negative ad in South Carolina against Senator Ted Cruz that was searing, describing the winner of the Iowa Republican caucuses as a fake and a Washington insider.

title: Marcel Broodthaers, a Knot of Riddles in a MoMA Retrospective
description: Im no good at anything. I am 40 years old. So wrote the Belgian poet Marcel Broodthaers, who up until 1964, had been supporting himself, barely, as a bookseller and photojournalist (lots of pictures of the Brussels Worlds Fair), while making short, strange films and publishing avant-garde poetry.

title: No P in Arabic Means No Palestine, Israeli Lawmaker Says
description: JERUSALEM  One of the many things that divides Israelis and Palestinians is the letter P.

title: The Grammys: What Makes an Album of the Year?
description: Long-shot wins, unscripted moments and strange celebrity interactions are among the best reasons to watch awards shows like the Grammys, which are on CBS on Monday. The album of the year category is where they turn up surprisingly often.

title: Hillary Clinton, Seeking Black Vote, Cites Systemic Racism
description: Hillary Clintons campaign released an ad Wednesday focusing on a broken criminal justice system, as she seeks to consolidate support among the African-American communities in South Carolina ahead of the Democratic primary there.

title: A Lair That Houses 400 Pairs of Sunglasses
description: In discussing his latest commission, the first U.S. flagship for Gentle Monster, opening today, Rafael de Crdenas mentions the Korean eyewear brands molar-encrusted styles as a symbol of its irreverence: The glasses are  they really  some have teeth on them, he says. Gentle Monster wanted the store to be very disruptive.

title: The New Power Dressing
description: I have a working definition of power, which came to me in an anecdote about Prince. One night at the end of last summer, according to someone who was there, Prince, the elusive chanteur, went to a concert in New York. Twenty minutes into the show, he decided he wanted McDonalds French fries. Fifteen minutes after that, McDonalds French fries were served to him on a white china plate. He ate standing up. Power like that has no uniform.

title: Dont Blame Pakistan for ISIS
description: To the Editor:

title: Ancient War in Japan, Followed by a Renaissance
description: The Kamakura period in Japan (1185-1333) was a time of social and political disaster, with warrior clans from across the country lined up, for the first time, against imperial forces. During the resulting civil war, the unthinkable happened: The Buddhist temples in the ancient city of Nara were destroyed.

title: For Claude Shannon Brings Brainy Dance to the Kitchen
description: What happens when a student of neuroscience and a former quantitative analyst make a dance? Liz Santoro, a choreographer who studied neuroscience at Harvard, and Pierre Godard, a theater technician and director with a background in applied mathematics, have been collaborating for five years, and their minds work well together. Their 2014 work Relative Collider, for three ultraprecise dancers (Ms. Santoro included), revealed tightly structured systems of movement and text governed by codes not easily deciphered. The works inscrutability was its strength.

title: Ignore the GPS. That Ocean Is Not a Road.
description: Earlier this month, Noel Santillan, an American tourist in Iceland, directed the GPS unit in his rental car to guide him from Keflavik International Airport to a hotel in nearby Reykjavik. Many hours and more than 250 icy miles later, he pulled over in Siglufjordur, a fishing village on the outskirts of the Arctic Circle. Mr. Santillan, a 28-year-old retail marketer from New Jersey, became an unlikely celebrity after Icelandic news media trumpeted his accidental excursion.

title: In Sunset Song, a Hard Life Amid Cruel Beauty
description: As in most films by the British director Terence Davies, there is a sorrowful stillness at the heart of Sunset Song, the opening-night selection of the Film Society of Lincoln Centers annual series Film Comment Selects, on Wednesday, Feb. 17. This screen adaptation of the Scottish author Lewis Grassic Gibbons 1932 novel is aligned with Mr. Daviess somber, semi-autobiographical reveries about his lonely childhood and adolescence in grim, post-World War II London.

title: Mavis Staples No Longer Wants to Make You Cry
description: CHICAGO  Awards and mementos fill the walls of Mavis Stapless apartment in a high-rise on the South Shore here. Next to a window with a long view over a choppy Lake Michigan on a rainy, windy February afternoon, there was the platinum single of the indelible 1972 Staple Singers hit Ill Take You There. There was a tambourine with Princes trademark glyph, a souvenir of the two solo albums he produced for her on his Paisley Park label. There was a photo of Ms. Staples with the Obama family, autographed by the president with thanks for a magical evening when she performed at the White House for a PBS soul-music special. And on a small table sits my one Grammy, Ms. Staples said, for her 2010 album You Are Not Alone.

title: What Travelers Need to Know About Zika and Dengue
description: Outbreaks of the mosquito-borne diseases Zika and dengue arent slowing down: The Zika virus continues to spread throughout the Caribbean and Brazil, and the mayor of Hawaii County, Billy Kenoi,  declared a state of emergency on the Big Island on Monday in response to the increasing number of dengue cases there. Here is what you need to know if you are contemplating or already have plans to travel to a destination affected by either disease.

title: Scanning Borders, Israel Surveys New Reality of Tunnels and Terror
description: MOUNT HERMON, Golan Heights  Israels military commanders are rethinking their concept of border security as they watch the reality of what is happening on the other side changing in front of their eyes.

title: BCBG: Fall 2016 RTW
description: BCBGs fall collection.

title: Brock Collection: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Looks from the latest collection.

title: Karlie Kloss, Blake Lively and Jay Z at amfARs Fashion Week Kickoff
description: amfAR honors Harvey Weinstein at its annual gala before New York Fashion Week; 2 Chainz and MADE hosts trap-house themed bash at Milk Studios.

title: Disney Unit Cited in Harrison Ford Accident During Star Wars Filming
description: LOS ANGELES  In the British equivalent of fines levied by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration, a Disney subsidiary was charged on Thursday with four safety breaches on the Pinewood Studios set of Star Wars: The Force Awakens.

title: 36 Hours in Houston
description: Americas youngest city offers a potpourri pot of cuisines, quirky shops and art with both global and local reach.

title: Why It Wont Be Easy or Cheap to Fix Flints Water Crisis
description: Updated Feb. 17

title: A Parasite, Leopards, and a Primates Fear and Survival
description: Many of our primate ancestors probably ended up in the bellies of big cats. How else to explain bite marks on the bones of ancient hominins, the apparent gnawing of leopards or other African felines?

title: Indictment in East Village Gas Explosion
description: Five people were arrested in connection with a blast on Second Avenue last year that killed two men; four of those arrested were charged with involuntary manslaughter.

title: How to Watch the Democratic Debate in Milwaukee
description: Heres our coverage of the sixth Democratic debate, and our live fact checks.

title: Improving Startup Time in the NYTimes Android App
description: Improving application startup and load time has been a priority for The New York Times Android development team, and were not alone. As device manufacturers continue to offer faster and more fluid experiences, users expect their native apps to be faster still.

title: Syrias Lost Generation
description: To the Editor:

title: Six Killed in Shooting Rampage in Saudi Arabia
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia  An assailant shot and killed six employees inside an education administration building in southern Saudi Arabia on Thursday, the Saudi Interior Ministry said.

title: Electric Daisy Carnival Announces 2016 Citi Field Lineup
description: David Guetta, Afrojack, Zedd, Kaskade, DJ Snake, Dillon Francis and Eric Prydz will be among the more than 60 performers at Electric Daisy Carnival, the electronic music festival that will be held at Citi Field in Queens on May 14 and 15, the events organizers announced on Thursday.

title: Gimmicky Crossword Clues
description: To the Editor:

title: Reader Idea | Reading Macbeth Through the Lens of Ferguson
description: Whom do we trust, and why?

title: Federal Reserve Wont Backpedal on Interest Rates, Janet Yellen Says
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve and financial markets are having a difference of opinion.

title: Pandora Is Said to Have Held Talks About Selling Itself
description: Pandora Media, the largest Internet radio service, has held discussions about selling the company, according to people briefed on the talks.

title: The Nuances of Mendoza
description: A growing number of Argentine producers are trying to move beyond traditionally fruity wines to explore the subtleties of the regions terroir.

title: To Move Beyond Malbec, Look Below the Surface
description: TUNUYN, Argentina  The view from Bodega Catena Zapatas Adrianna Vineyard, almost 5,000 feet high in the Uco Valley south of Mendoza, is nothing short of magnificent.

title: When Family Fortunes Beget Vicious Power Struggles
description: Consider the plight of Shari Redstone, the daughter of the billionaire media mogul Sumner Redstone.

title: John Kasich Says Negative Tone of Jeb Bushs Campaign Could Hurt Family Name
description: PAWLEYS ISLAND, S.C.  Gov. John Kasich of Ohio, edging toward more direct confrontation with former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida, said on Thursday that Mr. Bush was risking tarnishing the Bush family name because of the negative tone of his campaign.

title: At Creatures of the Wind, Lips Speak the Loudest
description: When girls feel really confident and just want to use one beauty trick  the lip is the beauty trick, explained Creatures of the Winds lead makeup artist, Mark Carrasquillo, backstage at the fall/winter 2016 show. To his point, he outlined models lips with a deep burgundy lip liner (NARS Velvet Lip Liner in Belle Mare) followed by a coat of similarly hued semi-matte lipstick (NARS Audacious Lipstick in Bette, Ingrid or Charlotte are all good options).
