title: At Alexander Wang, Blunt Bangs and Minimal Makeup
description: As a continuation of last seasons theme, the beauty looks at Alexander Wangs fall/winter 2016 show honed in on models individuality. For makeup, Diane Kendal gave each one a minimal look inspired by youth cultures adoption of high fashion. Youthful, but worn-in nonetheless  like theyve been up all night partying, she said. (A similar theme to last seasons Marc Jacobs look, too.) The main focus was on eyes: Kendal filled lids in with chocolatey brown shadow (NARS Dark Angel Velvet Shadow Stick) up to the contour. She then diffused the shadow around the entire eye area with moisturizer, using just her fingers, and finished them off with a touch of lip balm for a subtle sheen.

description: Party shoes! Take it from someone who knows: Alex Wang.

description: RANCHO MIRAGE, Calif.  The death of Justice Antonin Scalia on Saturday set off an immediate partisan battle over a vacancy that could reshape the Supreme Court for years to come, as President Obama vowed to nominate a successor and Senate Republicans called on him to let the next president fill the seat.

title: Kristaps Porzingis Quick to Make a Believer of Team Worlds Coach
description: TORONTO  Ettore Messina, an assistant coach with the San Antonio Spurs, was only vaguely familiar with Kristaps Porzingis until this weekend. Messina, of course, had coached against Porzingis in two games this season, both wins for the Spurs. But Friday was their first meaty opportunity to get to know each other.

description: TORONTO  Commissioner Adam Silver said Saturday that his personal views on the so-called Hack-a-Shaq tactic used by N.B.A. coaches had evolved.

Trump for insulting the Bush family and ridiculed the idea that Mr. Trump could be commander in chief during a contentious and sometimes nasty Republican presidential debate in Greenville, S.C., on Saturday, a week before a crucial primary in the state.

title: The Legendary Photographer Who Inspired a Fall Collection
description: The designer Carin Rodebjer has always preferred facts to fiction. I love people and their stories, and I always find the most interesting stories in real life. Since I was a kid, I was reading biographies and watching documentaries, she says. I tend to navigate towards other artists who work with reality in some way.

title: Justice Antonin Scalias Supreme Court Legacy
description: Justice Antonin Scalia, who died on Saturday at the age of 79, served on the Supreme Court for 30 years and made as big a mark on the court and on American law and politics as some of the chief justices under whom he served. It took about 10 minutes after the announcement of his death for the right wing to start screaming that the Senate should not confirm a replacement while President Obama is in office.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: It has been 80 years since an election-year vacancy has been filled and the politics of the court has changed drastically since those days.

title: Obama to Nominate Scalia Replacement Over Republicans Objections
description: RANCHO MIRAGE, Calif.  President Obama said Saturday that he planned to submit a nominee to replace Justice Antonin Scalia on the Supreme Court, rebuffing Republicans who have called for him to leave the choice to the next president.

description: Here is a list of potential Supreme Court nominees to replace Justice Antonin Scalia, who died on Saturday.

description: Hillary Clinton called Senator Mitch McConnells statement that the next president, not President Obama, should appoint a successor to Justice Scalia disappointing and totally out of step with our history and our constitutional principle.

description: After letting Simon and Garfunkel speak for him in one ad, Senator Bernie Sanders has turned over his latest to his supporters, several of whom created a 60-second spot titled Together.

title: Antonin Scalia, Conservative Legal Giant
description: Antonin Scalia, dead unexpectedly this weekend at 79, was not the most politically powerful justice during his three decades on the Supreme Court. That distinction belonged to the courts two swing votes, Sandra Day OConnor and then Anthony M. Kennedy, respectively the philosopher queen and king of our fraying republican order.

title: Hillary Clinton, Shifting Line of Attack, Paints Bernie Sanders as a One-Issue Candidate
description: HENDERSON, Nev.  Hillary Clinton set out on Saturday to blunt one of Bernie Sanderss most potent arguments against her, attacking the Vermont senator as a one-note rival whose relentless focus on Wall Street excess and exorbitant political spending would do little to improve the lives of Americans.

title: Texas Ranch Where Scalia Died Is Rugged Oasis for the Famous
description: HOUSTON  The closest community to the West Texas resort where Justice Antonin Scalia died is barely even a place anymore: It is a virtual ghost town where perhaps only a dozen people still live. And when a silver hearse drove across the rocks outside the Cibolo Creek Ranch on Saturday, it was from a funeral home at least an hour away.

title: Scalias Supreme Court Seat and the Next Frontier in Political Hardball
description: It takes no feat of imagination to guess how the debate about replacing Justice Antonin Scalia, who died unexpectedly on Saturday, will take shape. Within a couple of hours of news of his death, Mitch McConnell, the Senate majority leader, joined by fellow Republicans like Ted Cruz, said that Justice Scalias seat on the United States Supreme Court should remain vacant until after the November presidential election.

description: Mr. Altuzarras who is credited for reinventing the womens coat in 2012, presents his fall looks.

title: How Long Does It Take to Confirm a Supreme Court Nominee?
description: Republicans and Democrats are arguing over whether President Obama, whose term expires in 342 days, should try to fill Justice Antonin Scalias seat.

title: Republican Candidates Unite Against Obama on Replacing Scalia
description: GREENVILLE, S.C.  The death of Justice Antonin Scalia on Saturday thrust the Supreme Court to the center of the already-volatile Republican presidential race, with the partys candidates asserting that President Obama should not nominate a successor as they sought to court conservatives who have driven the partys discourse in the current campaign.

title: G.O.P. Candidates Call for Delay in a Supreme Court Appointment
description: It came as no real surprise that all six Republican presidential candidates called for President Barack Obama to hold off on nominating a Supreme Court justice to replace Antonin Scalia, who died Saturday, portraying the appointment as a crucial opportunity to determine the direction of a raft of ideologically charged cases currently being considered by the high court.

Cantor Shayna De Lowe officiated. On Feb. 19, Michael Kostroff, a friend of the couple, is to lead a ceremony with Jewish and Christian elements at Villa del Mar in Las Terrenas, Dominican Republic.

description: Justice Scalia, 79, was nominated to the Supreme Court in 1986. His theories, initially viewed as idiosyncratic, gradually took hold, and not only on the right and not only in the courts.

description: The New York Times checks assertions from the Republican candidates during Saturdays debate in Greenville, S.C.

title: Free Spirit
description: Fashion seems a little like the Wild West right now. Perhaps in part thanks to ever-multiplying shows and the numerous collections designers must create to keep up with demand, theres a sort of free and pioneering spirit blowing through the season. You can channel a prairie girl, a sister wife, a cyberpunk, a kooky intellectual. You can dress mannish, sexy or demure. Basically, if you wanted, you could wake up and put on a flowing floral dress or a futuristic short skirt or a tailored suit  in a solid, a floral, stripes, plaid or some clashing combo thereof  and in many places, at many kinds of jobs, head out to work. That freedom is exciting, and a form of power.

title: Republican Debate Takeaways: Saturday Night Fighting
description: GREENVILLE, S.C.  The Republican candidates debated on Saturday night as if it were one last chance to break through and take down their opponents  and for a few of them, it probably was.

title: Who Won the Debate? Florida Candidates Bask in Sunny Reviews
description: The Republican primary debate on Saturday night was perhaps the most contentious face-off of the 2016 campaign, as the candidates shouted at, accused and insulted each other, while enduring frequent booing from the audience. Critics and commentators thought the night was won by Jeb Bush, a former governor of Florida, who delivered a strong performance just a week before the South Carolina primary, and Senator Marco Rubio of Florida, who bounced back from his flop at last weeks debate. As for the losers, Senator Ted Cruz of Texas was seen as flat at times under the heat of ad hominem attacks, while Donald J. Trumps tirades appeared to be wearing thin. Here is a sampling of comments from the chattering class.

title: Fashion Week: Shows to Share With Your Valentine
description: Envy the brunch crowd, Fashion Week faithful. For them is the 11 a.m. application of bacon, eggs over easy, caf au lait. For you, a bracing, near-Arctic day of traversing Manhattan for shows. If theres one thing Fashion Week lacks, its the proverbial day of rest.

title: A Blended Family Survival Guide
description: Almost 20 years ago, when our five kids were all in elementary school, Rique and I blended our families. Thats the word the parenting industry uses. Blend. Talk about euphemism. There is no stress in the word blend. Its one utterly pleasant syllable.

title: 1891: General William Sherman Dies
description: NEW YORK  General Sherman died at ten minutes to two oclock this afternoon [Feb. 14]. Death got the upper hand of the old warrior early in the morning, and at half-past five the change was so marked that messengers were hastily sent for Drs. Janeway and Green.

description: Dear Diary:

title: Afghanistan Had Record Civilian Casualties in 2015, U.N. Says
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Taliban suicide attacks and a fierce battle for the northern city of Kunduz made 2015 the worst year for Afghan civilian casualties since the United Nations began tracking the data, officials said on Sunday, in a sobering reminder of the cost of the conflict at a time when the prospect of peace seems as distant as ever.

title: Justice Antonin Scalia and the Dead Constitution
description: WHETHER or not you agreed with the man, there is no question that Justice Antonin Scalia changed the United States Supreme Court, the way that the Constitution and laws are interpreted and the image of a Supreme Court justice far more than President Ronald Reagan could ever have foreseen when appointing him.

title: 1941: U.S. Tells Citizens to Leave Far East
description: SHANGHAI  Apprehension was aroused in a large section of the American community here today [Feb. 13] when Consul General Frank P. Lockhart issued a circular to all Americans here reiterating the advice of the State Department that American women, children and men whose presence here is not essential withdraw to the United States in the interest both of their own safety and of national security.

title: Threes a Trend: Black Velvet
description: Silky, black velvet made several appearances on the runways in the first few days of New York Fashion Week. First, Adam Selman  a designer known for his use of color and print  showed a head-to-toe black velvet jumpsuit, in a relatively dark collection. Jason Wu interpreted the fabric into a puffer sweater with fur trim and a ladylike slit pencil skirt. And a few hours later, Fernando Garcia and Laura Kim of Monse showed their sophomore collection. It was filled with interesting evening wear  including a floor-length, drapey black velvet number that showed off hints of skin.

title: Syrian Officer Gave a View of War. ISIS Came, and Silence Followed.
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Ours was an unusual, sometimes operatic, correspondence that unfolded over more than a year. Abu al-Majd, a Syrian police officer who was being deployed more and more often like a soldier, texted at all hours, sending news from the front lines and grumbling about boring, sunbaked patrols, his complaints sometimes punctuated by expressions of terror, pride or doubt.

title: Key Questions and Answers About Antonin Scalia and His Legacy
description: Justice Antonin Scalia died on Saturday during a hunting trip in Texas. He was the longest serving member of the Supreme Court, appointed in 1986 by President Ronald Reagan. He leaves behind a substantial legal legacy and a host of questions. Here are answers to a few:

title: A Crumbling Coney Island Landmark Is Getting a Makeover
description: In a parking lot a few hundred yards beyond Coney Islands Parachute Jump, where customers floated toward the ground until the 1960s, lie pieces of the future: big white trusses. If they had come with an instruction manual, it would say, Lots of assembly required.

title: Justice Antonin Scalias Death, and a Political Fight
description: To the Editor:

title: At Alexander Wang, Youth Culture Storms Through Church
description: The designers fall/winter collection, shown at St. Bartholomews on Park Avenue, mingled tweeds, streetwear and prison references.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Tome: Fall 2016
description: Ryan Lobo and Ramon Martin, who waited 13 years to become designers, present their fall collection.

title: Staying the Course in an Unnerving Presidential Race
description: As the results of the New Hampshire primary rolled in last week, a charter member of Washingtons Republican establishment received a one-word message from a colleague: despair. Its a safe bet that there was a comparable Democratic exchange.

title: Your Daily Fashion Week Recap for Sunday, Feb. 14
description: 1. Alexander Wang commented on todays youth culture and its various appropriations of high fashion, wrote Laura Neilson, combining streetwear and tweeds in his fall/winter collection that walked at St. Bartholomews on Park Avenue. The beauty look(s) differed from woman to woman. The makeup artist Diane Kendal created a chocolatey-brown glossy eye, and the hairstylist Guido Palau didnt hesitate to grab the scissors and hair dye, completely transforming the model Katie Moore.

title: 1891: Oscar Wildes Valentine
description: In February 1891, the European edition of The New York Herald published the following letter from Oscar Wilde, responding to a review of his play, Guido Ferranti. The play is otherwise known as The Duchess of Padua. It ran for three weeks in January 1891 and has rarely been performed since.

title: Review: Better Call Saul, Quirky and Absorbing in Season Opener
description: Season 2 of Better Call Saul begins where Season 1 did: in purgatory, which happens to be a Cinnabon in Omaha. Saul Goodman (Bob Odenkirk), once Walter Whites skeevy lawyer, relocated there to save his skin after the bloody denouement of Breaking Bad. Like last years opening sequence, its a lovely, mournful short film, scored this time to the country standard Funny How Time Slips Away.

title: Victoria Beckham: Fall 2016
description: Ms. Beckham, who grew her team from three people to 350 over the course of her career, presents her latest designs.

title: Threes a Trend: Extra-Warm Shearling
description: Winter has finally arrived on the East Coast  just in time for fashion week. But judging from the shows so far, anyone kicking themselves for not investing in a polar-vortex shearling will have something to look forward to next season. At Kanye Wests Yeezy show, there was a covetable butterscotch-colored cropped version; at Lacoste, creative director Felipe Oliveira Baptista showed a convertible, hooded navy coat with zips at the waist that can shorten or lengthen. And at Altuzarra, one jacket came with black and oxblood vertical stripes and oversize pockets. The message is clear: The shearling is the must-have coat of the season.

title: Joe Jonas, Naomi Campbell and Adrien Brody Celebrate Diesels New Store
description: A new boutique on Madison Avenue is the occasion for three parties.

title: Joe Jonas, Naomi Campbell and Adrian Brody Celebrate Diesels New Store
description: The brand Diesel had not one but three events on Saturday night. The night began at Diesels new Madison Avenue boutique, where Renzo Rosso, the president of OTB Group, Diesels parent company, posed with Naomi Campbell. Here are the photos.

title: Public School: Fall 2016
description: Maxwell Osborne and Dao-Yi Chows fall collection.

title: Syria Accord Looms Over Europe Security Meeting
description: MUNICH  The failure of world powers to quell the five-year conflict in Syria, the Russian military intervention there and the spread of Islamic terrorism overshadowed an annual security conference here, which came as Europe falters ahead of a new effort to cope with its refugee crisis.

title: At Victoria Beckham, Slick Ponytails and a Soft Palette
description: The overall aesthetic is a modern woman today, the hairstylist Guido Palau said this morning of the beauty identity hes helped to build in recent seasons at Victoria Beckham. Almost kind of futuristic, but not in a fantastical way; in a very wearable way. True to that ideal, for fall/winter 2016 he crafted an army of artful, slicked-back ponytails, tied at the nape of the neck with thin black string. The style was worn long, regardless of hair length  short-haired models were given extensions  and was shellacked in front with layers of Redken Triple Take Hairspray 32, sprayed at close range to create a hard jewel-like texture. Selectively curling the ponytails with a one-inch iron lent the hair a loose movement  not curls, just bends, as Palau said, and a softness to counter the hairlines abundance of product.

title: Taraji P. Henson on Alexander Wang, Cookie and the Oscars
description: There was an oddly somber feel to preshow proceedings at Alexander Wang this season, his usual downtown crowd muffled in big black coats under the cool cloistered ceilings of St Bartholomews Church on Park Avenue. The Wang Gang had shown up in their droves to support their friend on Saturday night, including Kylie Jenner and her rapper boyfriend Tyga, the singer Beth Ditto, Zo Kravitz and Taraji P. Henson, the actress lately known for playing the ferocious matriarch Cookie Lyon in Empire. Head to toe in a black and studded Alexander Wang shift dress, Ms. Henson appeared delighted to be at the designers show for the very first time.

title: Egyptian Appeals Court Orders New Trial for Officer Convicted of Manslaughter
description: CAIRO  An appeals court on Sunday overturned the manslaughter conviction of a police officer in the death of a poet and activist whose shooting during a protest march became a national scandal.

title: Pregame Drills Lacked Flash, but Now Theyre Jam-Packed
description: Brian Rohleder was perhaps the last player expected to have an impact on Kansas States opening game of the 2014 N.C.A.A. tournament.

title: After Antonin Scalias Death, Fierce Battle Lines Emerge
description: WASHINGTON  An epic Washington political battle took shape on Sunday after the death of Justice Antonin Scalia as Senate Republicans dug in and said they would refuse to act on any Supreme Court nomination by President Obama. But the White House vowed to select a nominee within weeks.

title: At Fashion Week, Emily Ratajkowski Gets Political
description: At the Altuzarra show on Saturday night, the style and spirits of the assembled crowd were a little the worse for wear after temperatures had plunged to zero and many had been forced to stand outside at the Moncler show an hour earlier. Emily Ratajkowski, who shot to fame with the Blurred Lines music video in 2013, was in a sympathetic mood.

title: Moncler Embraces Winter. The Crowd, Not So Much
description: It was around 6:45 on Saturday evening, and I was standing on the second-floor balcony of the David H. Koch Theater, overlooking the Lincoln Center Plaza  and I was freezing.

title: Ranch Owner Recalls Finding Justice Antonin Scalias Body
description: HOUSTON  When Justice Antonin Scalia did not respond to a knock at the door of his suite at the Cibolo Creek Ranch at 8:30 a.m. on Saturday, John B. Poindexter, the propertys owner, was not alarmed.

title: Donald Trump Holds Firm on Criticism of George W. Bush
description: The morning after the Republican presidential primary debate, Donald J. Trump said he had no regrets about saying that the George W. Bush administration lied in taking the nation to war in Iraq, despite the criticism Mr. Trump received.

title: Vanessa Moody Transforms at Derek Lam
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Fall/Winter 2016 Fashion Week in New York.

title: Mourning Lincoln Wins Book Prize
description: Mourning Lincoln, the historian Martha Hodess account of how ordinary Americans lamented (or celebrated) the assassination of the Great Emancipator, has won the Gilder Lehrman Lincoln Prize, which is awarded annually by Gettysburg College and the Gilder Lehrman Institute of American History. The prize, for the finest scholarly work in English on Abraham Lincoln, carries a $50,000 cash award.

title: Estelle Parsons Takes Role in New Israel Horovitz Comedy
description: Estelle Parsons, the five-time Tony nominee who won an Oscar for Bonnie and Clyde and starred in the Israel Horovitz play My Old Lady, is reuniting with the playwright for Out of the Mouths of Babes, a new Off Broadway comedy.

title: Elie Tahari: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Mr. Taharis latest collection.

title: Golden Bride to Return for Second Engagement
description: The Golden Bride is preparing for another march down the aisle.

title: What Have We Learned Since 2008?
description: Presentation at CUNY this Friday. Slides here.

title: Man Pleads Not Guilty in Stabbing of Woman and Her Daughters on Staten Island
description: The man accused of stabbing his girlfriend and two of her daughters to death at a Staten Island motel being used to house homeless people was arraigned on Sunday on three counts of murder and one count of attempted murder.

title: Hood by Air: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Shayne Oliver who gets his inspiration from the street, presents his latest collection.

title: Micklethwaits Balancing Act, After a Year as Bloomberg Editor in Chief
description: In recent weeks, John Micklethwait, the editor in chief of Bloomberg, has sometimes felt, as he put it, like a character in a Graham Greene novel. Theres an element of theres no perfect answer to it.

title: Tracy Reese: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Ms. Reeses latest collection.

title: Derek Lam: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Mr. Lams latest designs.

title: Deadpool Breaks Box Office Records for R-Rated Film
description: LOS ANGELES  Welcome to the A-list, Deadpool.

title: Super PAC Follows Jeb Bush in Taking Donald Trump to Task
description: Up until now, Right to Rise, the super PAC supporting Jeb Bush, had focused most of its negative advertising on Senator Marco Rubio and Gov. John Kasich. On Friday, the group altered course, running two negative ads against its candidates favorite debate foil: Donald J. Trump.

title: Review: La Sylphide Is City Ballets Bittersweet Valentine
description: Peter Martins isnt one of those choreographers who loves love. He doesnt get carried away by sentimentality. So its no surprise, but kind of refreshing, that he brought back his staging of La Sylphide  a ballet about a sylph who lures a young Scotsman away from his fiance and, in the final heartbreaking moments, loses her wings, goes blind, keels over and dies  to New York City Ballet just in time for Valentines Day weekend. I hate cheap red hearts, too.

title: Will Merkel Pay for Doing the Right Thing?
description: BERLIN  A former German chancellor, Gerhard Schrder, recently called Angela Merkels decision to open the door to an unlimited number of refugees a mistake and offered this verdict: Merkel had a heart, but no plan.

title: Trial of Chads Ex-President Is Punctuated by His Noncooperation
description: PARIS  Most mornings since September, the former president of the African nation of Chad was woken at dawn in his specially refurbished prison quarters for a trip he loathed.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Feb. 15
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Tuesdays auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Wednesday.

title: The Daily Shoe: Victoria Beckham
description: Victoria Beckham offered yet another great mens wear-inspired flat at her fall/winter 2016 show this morning, but its this chunky-heeled boot with a buckle that stood out  especially for how good it will look with all the new midcalf skirts.

title: The Daily Bag: Victoria Beckham
description: The luxurious fur bags at Victoria Beckham are so covetable the models dont even want to let them go.

title: Liberal Love for Antonin Scalia
description: Antonin Scalia was my hero. He was deeply conservative. He belittled lawyers. His opinions, especially in dissent, could be downright nasty. No justice in the Supreme Courts history insulted his colleagues more, or more memorably. He was as aggressive and outspoken as I am reserved and cautious. He was a smoker. He was, in short, everything I am not. But I have looked up to him for years.

title: For Hangmen and Escaped Alone, Connecting Threads in London
description: LONDON  Martin McDonagh has been sharpening his hooks. Not the kind that one of his homicidal characters might use to flay the flesh of an enemy (or relative), but the sort that a cunning dramatist plunges deep into a theatergoers attention and refuses to release until the final curtain.

title: Review: Kanye Wests The Life of Pablo, Songs of Praise and Self
description: Its unlikely well get a song as singular as Kanye Wests Ultralight Beam anytime soon, so best to linger on it, feel out its grooves and curves, allow it to seep into the pores.

title: Brooks Brothers: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Looks from the Brooks Brothers Collection.

title: In Grammy Race, the Band Highly Suspect Marvels at Its Surprising Double Shot
description: For a little-known band, one Grammy nomination might be explained away as a fluke. Scoring two simultaneous nominations is harder to comprehend, especially in mainstream categories like rock, which tend to favor household names. (Some recent winners: Beck, Foo Fighters, Green Day, Led Zeppelin.)

title: Review: In lvaro Enrigues Sudden Death, a Farcical Duel With Topspin
description: Writing with his customary intensity about his favorite sport, David Foster Wallace described tennis as chess on the run, beautiful and infinitely dense. In his droll and erudite new novel, Sudden Death, lvaro Enrigue provides his own distinct take on that chess-on-the-run notion and elevates it to an even more exalted level. Pitting two late Renaissance giants against each other, he transforms their match into a clash of ideologies, a contest that von Clausewitz might have described as a continuation of both war and politics by other means.

title: Slideshow: Off the Runway
description: Scenes from the fourth day of New York Fashion Week.

title: The Upmarket Tracksuit
description: The upmarket tracksuits, hoodies and other willfully subversive signifiers of survivalist chic have shown up on the New York Fashion Week runways. Here are some examples.

title: The Tracksuit Reborn
description: Its high time Seventh Avenue reclaimed ownership of a trend that European designers have been exploiting for a season or more. The upmarket tracksuits, hoodies and other willfully subversive signifiers of survivalist chic that were shown for spring at Vetements and Chlo, among others, have made their way stateside in force.

title: The Lone Wolf at the Westminster Dog Show
description: Dr. Richard Meen fully grasps the monastic nature of his powers. On Tuesday night, just 30 minutes before the best-in-show competition at the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show at Madison Square Garden, he will descend from his sequestered post in the Warwick Hotel in Manhattan to decide, alone, which of the animals is the purest of the purebreds.

title: A Leisurely Return for the New York State Legislature
description: ALBANY  The scene in the State Capitol last week bore all the hallmarks of democracy at work: advocates and lobbyists pushing their causes, earnest interns scurrying about, and protesters making insistent pleas for funds for everything from housing to hepatitis C.

title: An Unwanted Bill
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  They say its lonely at the top and I would dare say that no position is lonelier than that of the president of the United States, especially when it comes to making decisions that affect the rest of the free world. Today, we can almost literally see some of those past presidents on their ladder to success in David Kahns crossword.

title: Sies Marjan: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Looks from Sies Marjan

title: HomeAway, a Home Rental Service, Mocks the Competition
description: Guests cringe on a couch while a bathrobe-clad homeowner clips his toenails. A couple wakes to find that another homeowner has been watching them sleep. A woman at the bathroom sink gags when she spies a bar of soap riddled with strange hairs.

title: New York Fashion Week: Baja East and Altuzarra in Pictures
description: A photo diary of the fall/winter 2016 collections that were presented yesterday.

title: The Week in Kanye West
description: Kanye West debuted his new album, "The Life of Pablo," and his Yeezy Season 3 collection with Adidas during a loud, controversy-filled week.

title: Jonathan Simkhai: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Mr. Simkhais, the 2015 CFDA/Vogue fashion winner presents his latest fall looks.

title: Esperanza Aguirre, an Official in Spains Governing Party, Quits Amid Corruption Claims
description: MADRID  Esperanza Aguirre, the longstanding leader of the Popular Party in the Madrid region, resigned on Sunday amid investigations into mounting allegations of corruption within Spains governing party.

title: New York Parking Alert: Alternate-Side Rules Suspended on Monday
description: Because of Washingtons Birthday, alternate-side street-cleaning regulations will be suspended in New York City on Monday. Other regulations will remain in effect.

title: The BAFTA Awards Red Carpet
description: The British Academy of Film and Television Arts (BAFTA) had its awards ceremony on Sunday, complete with its own red carpet (of course).

title: Tombstone Survives on Spirit of the Wild West
description: Tourists come from all over the world to the small Arizona city to experience a taste of the past through guided tours and re-enactments.

title: Guns Blazing, Tombstone Is Back to Its Past
description: TOMBSTONE, Ariz.  Ken Curtis felt a stinging pain beneath the double-stitched leather holster where his Mitchell Arms pistol rests when it is not in his hands, as it was that afternoon in October. He slid a finger inside his pants. Blood oozed from a hole in his lower abdomen. Mr. Curtis took a deep breath and slipped right back into character.

title: Ted Cruz Attacks Donald Trump Over Planned Parenthood in New Ad
description: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas on Sunday released an advertisement attacking Donald J. Trump for his defense of Planned Parenthood  the most potent signal yet that Mr. Cruz views the issue as a chief vulnerability for his rival in South Carolina.

title: Revolution Is Absent From Runways
description: Given all the talk about rule breaking and the appeal of extremes and the rejection of familiar codes of behavior (yadda, yadda, yadda) that has dominated the political and cultural conversation since the 2016 presidential campaign began, it wouldnt be too outlandish to expect that some of it might find expression in fashion.

title: Fashion Week Today: For Hood by Air, Pilgrimage on a Collision Course
description: Well be bringing you highlights from the shows, from the extravaganzas to the scrappy upstarts. Here is day 4.

title: Severe Contraction and Falling Prices in Japan Signal Tough Test for Abenomics
description: Japans economy shrank in the final three months of 2015, the government said on Monday, undergoing a more severe contraction than experts had expected amid signs that global growth was stalling.

title: Diane Von Furstenberg: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Ms. Furstenberg debuts her fall collection.

title: Zika Virus Increases Concerns About Employee Safety
description: Early in her pregnancy, Whitney Peak traveled to Rio de Janeiro for her job with Leblon Cachaa, a liquor company based in Brazil. That was in October, before much was known about Zika, a mosquito-borne virus that has spread through South America and that scientists say may be linked to a birth defect and brain damage in babies.

title: HSBC to Keep Headquarters in London Instead of Hong Kong
description: LONDON  HSBC said on Sunday that it would keep its headquarters in Britain after announcing plans last year to review whether to move its home.

title: Brazil Pushes Public to Do Its Part in Fighting Zika Spread
description: SALVADOR, Brazil  Nearly a quarter of a million soldiers, sailors and other military personnel began fanning through Brazilian cities over the weekend as part of an ambitious campaign to combat the mosquitoes that are spreading Zika, the virus believed to be linked to a surge in infants born with severe brain damage.

title: Movers on Bikes
description: The Cargo Bike Collective, a loose-knit group of people who own and ride the extra-long bikes, help move items in New York City.

title: On the Move in New York, on Bicycles Built for More Than 2
description: The movers arrived at Barbara Rosss apartment on the Lower East Side of Manhattan one Friday last month, grabbing bags of clothes and shoes, framed pictures and boxes of CDs. They carried the items downstairs and loaded them onto four long-framed cargo bicycles parked on Ridge Street.

title: Edun: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Danielle Sherman presents her latest collection.

title: How America Was Lost
description: Once upon a time, the death of a Supreme Court justice wouldnt have brought America to the edge of constitutional crisis. But that was a different country, with a very different Republican Party. In todays America, with todays G.O.P., the passing of Antonin Scalia has opened the doors to chaos.

title: Not Part of Videos Script: An Arrest for Flying a Drone
description: Sean Riddle said the other inmates in the Manhattan holding cell that night were laughing  at him. Someone had overheard him talking to his court-appointed lawyer.

title: New Report of U.S.-Made Cluster Bomb Use by Saudis in Yemen
description: Human Rights Watch released a report Sunday providing new indications that Saudi Arabia has fired American-made cluster munitions, banned by international treaty, in civilian areas of Yemen, and said their use may also violate United States law.

title: Potential Nominees Obama May Consider to Fill Antonin Scalias Seat
description: The death of Justice Antonin Scalia in a presidential election year has set up a challenge for President Obama and his legal advisers. They must weigh the best person to put forward, knowing that Republican senators may block that nominee no matter who is chosen. At the same time, if a Democrat prevails in the presidential election, Mr. Obamas nominee might be confirmed in the Senates lame-duck session or would be an obvious front-runner to be renominated by his successor in 2017. Here are six contenders being discussed by close observers of judicial politics.

title: At United Pickle, Preserving the Standards of a Deli Staple
description: Not every cucumber has what it takes to be a pickle. As dozens of them tumbled from a steel hopper onto a conveyor belt in a Bronx factory, two workers enforced a strict pickle standard.

title: The Cowboy Pilgrims of Mexico
description: More 3,000 people made this years three-day journey to a mountaintop statue of Jesus, keeping alive a tradition that began more than 60 years ago.

title: Pilgrimage in Mexico Keeps a Cowboy Tradition Alive
description: SILAO, Mexico  Sheathed in colorful woolen ponchos and wearing crisp white hats, the cowboys rode their horses through green fields and blond meadows, holding banners of Christ the King and the Virgin of Guadalupe.

title: In Queens, Antonin Scalia Took Pride in Melting Pot and Confrontation
description: Justice Antonin Scalia had a range that extended from in-your-face brash to an even-more-in-your-face pugnacious. He was self-aware, describing himself as something of a shin kicker and something of a contrarian. Sure, Justice Scalia was born in Trenton  predictably, New Jerseys governor, Chris Christie, claimed him on Saturday, saying that the 79-year-old justice was a native son of New Jersey.

title: In Mexican Slum, Pope Francis Laments Economic Gap
description: ECATEPEC, Mexico  Pope Francis stepped into the heartland of Mexican inequality on Sunday, presiding over an enormous outdoor Mass in the impoverished outskirts of the capital and urging the joyous crowd not to fall prey to the wealth, vanity and pride that can create a society of the few, and for the few.

title: Kobe Bryant, in His Final Lap, Is Happy to Surrender the Midseason Stage
description: TORONTO  Before the N.B.A. All-Star Game on Sunday night, Stephen Curry told Kobe Bryant that he planned to accumulate a ton of assists by feeding the ball to Bryant as often as possible. Bryant, on the cusp of retirement with the Los Angeles Lakers, essentially advised Curry to pump the brakes.

title: Trial Illuminates Porsches Rise to Power at Volkswagen
description: FRANKFURT  A criminal trial in Germany has shed new light on how a billionaire family acquired ultimate power at Volkswagen in the years leading up to the carmakers emissions-cheating crisis.

title: Brits Off Broadway Festival Announces Lineup
description: New York theatergoers will have a chance to see a new production of the first professionally staged play by Richard Bean (One Man, Two Guvnors) when his 1999 play Toast, based on his experience working in a bread factory at age 18, is presented at 59E59 Theaters in April. The show comes to New York following a British tour, and is part of the annual Brits Off Broadway Festival, which will run April 19-July 3 and feature nine New York premieres.

title: Questions for the E.C.B. Leader, Fed Minutes and Walmart Earnings
description: Mario Draghi, the president of the European Central Bank, is likely to face questions on Monday about his response to fears of a renewed banking crisis when he appears in Brussels at a hearing of the European Parliaments Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs.

title: Jenny Packham: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Ms. Packham, who is known for dressing Kate Middleton, presents her latest designs.

title: Jeb Bush Adds a Weapon (His Brother) Despite Worries It Could Misfire
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  The brother who was never expected to become president  but did  will be trotted out Monday as a lifeline to the brother who was always expected to become president, but now may not.

title: The Supreme Court After Justice Scalia
description: When Antonin Scalia was named by President Ronald Reagan to fill a vacancy on the Supreme Court in 1986, the Senate considered the nomination for 85 days, then voted to confirm him. The tally was 98 to 0.

title: Malawi Gets Its First Grammy Nomination, With Album by Prison Inmates
description: ZOMBA, Malawi  Old, overcrowded and unsanitary, the maximum-security Zomba prison holds murderers, robbers, rapists  and Grammy-nominated singers.

title: Warren Manzi, Author of New Yorks Longest-Running Play, Dies at 60
description: Warren Manzi, a playwright whose Off Broadway thriller, Perfect Crime, remains the longest-running play in New York theater history  nearly 29 years and counting  despite the fact that critics often did not like it and theatergoers often did not understand it, died on Thursday in Lawrence, Mass. He was 60.

title: With Death of Antonin Scalia, an Already Volatile Campaign Erupts
description: In the hours after she learned about the death of Justice Antonin Scalia on Saturday, Hillary Clinton intended to confine her response to a 79-word statement extending thoughts and prayers to his family and praising his energy and passion on the bench.

title: Parade in Chinatown Raises Spirits During a Record Plunge in Temperature
description: It was worth asking whether it was jubilation stirred up by the Lunar New Year Parade or an attempt to ward off hypothermia that had people dancing on the sidewalks of Chinatown in Manhattan on Sunday.

title: Scalias Absence Is Likely to Alter Courts Major Decisions This Term
description: WASHINGTON  Justice Antonin Scalias death will complicate the work of the Supreme Courts eight remaining justices for the rest of the courts term, probably change the outcomes of some major cases and, for the most part, amplify the power of its four-member liberal wing.

title: Players Who Start March Like Lions Often Go Out Like Lambs
description: Spring training has existed in some form since the 19th century, but to this day no one really knows what to do with the statistics that are generated in that prelude to baseballs regular season. The tendency of fans to get excited about good performances while writing off bad ones as meaningless has created an ambiguity that the sport seems unable to shake.

title: Mitch McConnells Stance in Confirmation Fight Could Help and Hurt G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Mitch McConnells strategy to maintain the Republican majority has been clear: trying to prove that his party can govern. But by saying he will block a Supreme Court nominee who has not even been named, Mr. McConnell is headed toward partisan warfare instead.

title: Major Donors to Hillary Clinton Include Napster Co-Founder
description: Sean Parker, the youthful billionaire and co-founder of the music-sharing service Napster, gave nearly $300,000 to a joint fund-raising committee for Hillary Clintons presidential campaign and dozens of state Democratic parties, federal filings show.

title: New York Times Journalists Among Winners of 2015 Polk Awards
description: Seven New York Times journalists who investigated the hidden history of the Navys SEAL teams, and a 97-year-old reporter for Jet magazine were among the winners of the George Polk Awards in Journalism for 2015, which were announced on Sunday.

title: The Walking Dead Midseason Premiere: Carls Big Moment Arrives
description: I guess Carol was right.

title: Downton Abbey Season 6, Episode 7: Crash and Burn
description: This recap contains spoilers for Sundays episode of Downton Abbey.

title: At Opening Ceremony, a Contemporary Vision of the Future
description: Syd Mead, 82, has been designing the future for more than a half-century. The Los Angeles-based visual futurist and illustrator is known for creating dazzling cityscapes, flying cars, solar sailors and light cycles for such films as Blade Runner, Aliens and Tron, as well as industrial designs for cars, yachts, wristwatches and more at Ford Motor Company, Phillips Electronics and U.S. Steel.

title: Behind the Scenes at Opening Ceremonys Futuristic Show
description: For the brands fall/winter 2016 collection, designers Humberto Leon and Carol Lim partnered with the sci-fi illustrator Syd Mead.

title: Evening Hours | Chinese New Year
description: The New York Philharmonic and the China Institute celebrated the year of the monkey.

title: How a Vacancy on the Supreme Court Affected Cases in the 2015-16 Term
description: The empty seat left by Justice Antonin Scalias death leaves the court with two basic options for cases left on the docket this term if the justices are deadlocked at 4 to 4.

title: N.B.A. Game of the Week: Cavaliers at Thunder
description: Every week, The New York Times will choose one essential game to watch, highlighting hot teams, winning and losing streaks and statistical intrigue in the N.B.A.

title: Prabal Gurung: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Mr. Gurung, who brought fashion to the aid of Nepal last year, presents his fall collection.

title: Billions Season 1, Episode 5: Citizen Axe
description: Coming off his dalliance last week with the lead singer of a Ratt cover band surely its repertoire is more expansive, but its fun to imagine all-acoustic sets of songs like Round and Round and Lay It Down  Bobby (Damian Lewis) sits down for his first-ever viewing of Citizen Kane. (Quick side note: That he has a 35 mm projector in his house makes him heroic, and perhaps says something, too, about his love of tactile experiences, like biking out to collect the farm-fresh eggs hes going to cook for breakfast.) Its significant that Bobby never finishes the movie, taking one phone call before the opening credits and getting a visit from Wendy somewhere in the middle. But if hed finished Citizen Kane, he would have learned the following:

title: Vinyl Series Premiere: A Golden Ear and a Silver Tongue
description: When Richie Finestra, the record-biz operator played by Bobby Cannavale, signs up his first client, they connect by name-checking favorite musical artists: Pinetop Perkins, Skip James, Kokomo Arnold. Vinyl does the same bonding ritual with its viewers, barraging them with beloved 70s bands on the soundtrack, from Abba to Mott the Hoople, and mentioning everyone from Peter Frampton to David Geffen. Judging by its two-hour pilot, the show provides the thrill of nostalgia as effectively as Mad Men did: it remains to be seen whether it also has a story thats worthy of its production values.

title: Rangers Lead With Their Fists in a Much-Needed Victory Over the Flyers
description: Philadelphia Flyers forward Wayne Simmonds made sure to slow down before he passed the Rangers rookie defenseman Dylan McIlrath at center ice as they warmed up for Sundays game at Madison Square Garden. The two tough guys talked briefly, then went their separate ways.

title: Opening Ceremony: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Carol Lim and Humberto Leon, who picked China as their inspiration for 2016, present their latest collection.

title: Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders Court Black Voters at Las Vegas Church
description: LAS VEGAS  Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont and Hillary Clinton took their increasingly contentious battle for the Democratic nomination to a predominantly black church in Las Vegas on Sunday morning.

description: THE ARTS

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Given that the Senate is currently in recess, we dont expect the president to rush this through this week, but instead will do so in due time once the Senate returns from their recess.

title: What to Watch Monday
description: The Grammy Awards remember those who the music industry has  recently lost. Seven newly recognized breeds join the top dogs at the Westminster Kennel Club show. And 11.22.63, new to Hulu, has James Franco trying to prevent the assassination of President John F. Kennedy.

title: Obama May Meet Zika Head On in Cuba
description: WASHINGTON  As the White House considers a historic visit by President Obama to Cuba this year, a concern beyond the political and diplomatic hurdles has arisen: the Zika virus.

title: U.S. Aid for Abortions for Women With Zika
description: To the Editor:

title: O Yeah, Canada: The Border Republicans Forgot
description: The Republican presidential candidates who battled for votes in New Hampshire last week, rousing the rabble with their usual talk of scary aliens at the border, were strangely silent about the closest international boundary. They did not warn of the Canadians who flood south by the millions each year to play and work, taking our Christmas-tree-selling jobs. They did not mention the Canadian scofflaws  nearly 100,000 in fiscal 2015  who overstay their visas, the most of any nationality.

title: Flaws in the New SAT
description: To the Editor:

title: The Fire Meets the Wall
description: You dont need a firewall unless theres a fire, and a fire is precisely what the candidacy of Bernie Sanders has set off among disaffected Democrats.

title: Keep Congresss Portraits
description: To the Editor:

title: Civility in Politics
description: To the Editor:

title: The Bison Roundup the Government Wants to Hide
description: THE National Park Service is set to begin its annual roundup of wild bison in Yellowstone National Park today. A portion will be slaughtered to reduce the number of animals that migrate beyond the parks borders.

title: Is Humanity Getting Better?
description: I.

title: Dont Privatize Air Traffic Control
description: Some Republicans in the House have come up with a solution in search of a problem: privatizing air traffic control. Democrats, the Obama administration and sensible Republicans ought to oppose this measure, which would do nothing to improve the present, federally operated system and indeed could make it worse.

title: The Learning Network Is Taking a Winter Break, but Well Be Back on Feb. 22
description: Because many schools around the nation are off this week, were taking a short break ourselves.

title: Memorable Grammy Looks
description: A glimpse back at some noteworthy style moments: the good, the bad and the memorable.

title: A Mothers Reckoning, by Sue Klebold
description: [On this weeks Inside The New York Times Book Review podcast, Sue Klebold discusses A Mothers Reckoning.]

title: U.S. Rugby Sevens Team Emerges as Olympic Contender
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand  The United States won a gold medal in rugby the last time the sport was played at the Olympics  in 1924.

title: After Setbacks, Newark Alters a Program to Encourage Home Building
description: NEWARK  For the past week, on a block of North 13th Street just past the Morris & Essex Line tracks in this tumbledown city, the air has been full of diesel fuel and promise.

title: Young Latinos Power Both Democrats in Nevada Caucus Campaign
description: LAS VEGAS  Liz Hernandez learned what deportation was at age 5, when immigration officers burst into her home and hauled away her father and four uncles. Five years later, she and her mother, younger sister and infant brother, after a brief return to Mexico in a failed attempt to start a family farm, crossed the desert headed north again in a sweltering van driven by smugglers.

title: From Black-and-White Negatives, a Positive View of Harlem
description: In previously unseen photographs, the former Times photographer Don Hogan Charles Jr. reveals Harlems residents as fully rounded people, counter to the fearful perception reported in the 1960s.

title: Ehud Olmert, Ex-Prime Minister of Israel, Begins Prison Sentence
description: JERUSALEM  Describing his fall as painful and strange, Ehud Olmert became on Monday the first former Israeli prime minister to enter prison, beginning a 19-month term for bribery and obstruction of justice.

title: Support for Breast-Feeding, in a Multitude of Ways
description: In 2001, when Dr. Alison Stuebe was pregnant with her first child, breast-feeding was a personal challenge that soon morphed into a professional research interest. Her son Noah was 3 months old when she began her residency in maternal-fetal medicine at Brigham and Womens Hospital in Boston. Determined to nurse him for a year, she arrived at the hospital carrying a breast pump and, through sheer determination, more than met her goal. Noah was 2 before he was weaned.

title: Doctors Orders: Stay in Bed and Do Nothing
description: Its 3 in the morning when a lovely woman dressed in baby blue slips through a crack in the door to take my vital signs: temperature, blood pressure. She pings my knees with a rubber mallet, does a jerky massage on my feet to see if theyre swollen.

title: In The Studio | Rag and Bone
description: David Neville and Marcus Wainwright, British school friends and co-CEOs of Rag & Bone, discuss how sitting side by side in their Meatpacking District office informs their creative process.

title: Jessica Hart Gives Her Eyeglasses One Last Hurrah
description: Name Jessica Hart

title: Chinas Legal Professionals, Under Limits at Home, Note Scalias Death
description: BEIJING  The Stars and Stripes at half-staff at the United States Embassy in Beijing on Monday was not the only sign here of the death of Antonin Scalia, the American Supreme Court justice.

title: Fashion Week: Tommy Hilfigers Instapit and Jeremy Scotts Cowboys and Poodles
description: New York Fashion Week is comfortable caroming into its second half on Presidents Day Monday. (You didnt think anything so slight as a national holiday would interrupt fashion week, did you?) By Thursday, many of the gathered fashion tribe will be heading to London to continue the international jaunt. But before then, theres lots to see.

title: In the Studio with Rag & Bone
description: In episode one of season four of our In the Studio series, David Neville and Marcus Wainwright, British school friends and chief executives of Rag & Bone, discuss sharing an office, the problem with walls, and work/life balance. And thats what didnt make it into the video. (The interview has been edited and condensed.)

title: ScienceTake | How the Stick Walks
description: The delightfully improbable stick insect uses two pairs of legs to walk and the front pair to check out what lies ahead.

title: Stick Insect Helps Scientists Study How Animals Move
description: Stick insects, which look like walking twigs, are popular as pets and research subjects because theyre easy to keep, cant fly away, and move at a pace that allows observation and study.

title: SoftBank Announces Stock Buyback of About $4.4 Billion
description: HONG KONG  The multinational media and telecommunications conglomerate SoftBank said on Monday that it would buy back shares worth 500 billion yen, the biggest share repurchase it has ever made.

title: From Black-and-White Negatives, a Positive View of Harlem
description: On Aug. 8, 1966, The New York Times ran an article about how many Harlem residents wished more white people would visit to see for themselves their communitys reality. The article, by McCandlish Phillips, detailed in an almost anthropological way the Harlem of 1966 to Times readers.

title: Medical Residents, Misplaced Pride and Saner Hours
description: When one of my best friends in medical school returned from an interview for a surgical residency program, he told me how some of the surgeons there bragged that they were worked so hard that the divorce rate among their trainees was greater than 100 percent  some of them burned through two marriages.

title: Opposition Candidate Briefly Held Before Ugandas Presidential Vote
description: KAMPALA, Uganda  Ugandas leading opposition figure was arrested on Monday, three days before the East African countrys presidential elections.

title: Strong Dollar Blues
description: Gavyn Davies joins the chorus of those worried that the Fed is in denial about its interest-rate misstep:

title: Past Grammy Looks: The Good, the Bad and the Memorable
description: The Grammy red carpet is usually on the more outrageous end of the fashion spectrum, with musicians showing off their personal style. Here is a look back at some noteworthy style moments: the good, the bad and the memorable.

title: Nikita Kamayev, Ex-Head of Russian Antidoping Agency, Dies
description: MOSCOW  A former director of the disgraced Russian antidoping agency has died unexpectedly, a state news agency reported Monday, becoming the second former top official of the agency to die this month.

title: Rising Yen Adds to Abes Challenges as Japans Economy Contracts
description: TOKYO  When Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan began a campaign three years ago to turn around his countrys economy, he took aim at areas as varied as taxes, trade and women in the workplace. The campaign, given the nickname Abenomics, relied heavily on one strategy: weakening the countrys currency.

title: Republicans Risk Five Key Senate Races With Supreme Court Stance
description: The impending battle over replacing Antonin Scalia on the Supreme Court will undoubtedly loom over this years presidential contest. But it may have an even larger role in an often overlooked 2016 election contest: the fight for control of the Senate.

title: Syrian Hospitals Hit as Battlefield Grows More Chaotic
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The prospect of a wider war loomed over an increasingly chaotic battlefield in northern Syria on Monday, as fast-moving clashes pitted United States allies against one another and tensions grew between two major powers, Russia and Turkey.

title: Le procs Hissne Habr, un succs  ne pas rpter
description: DAKAR, Sngal  La semaine dernire, les acteurs du procs de Hissne Habr se sont retrouvs ici pour leurs plaidoiries finales devant les Chambres africaines extraordinaires (CAE), un tribunal cr spcialement pour juger lancien prsident du Tchad. Habr, au pouvoir de juin 1982  dcembre 1990, est poursuivi, entre autres, pour de nombreux crimes de guerre et crimes contre lhumanit commis contre ses opposants politiques.

title: Oxfords Halley Professor on How the Climate Challenge Could Derail a Brilliant Human Destiny
description: Sustained large investments in fundamental science paid off in a big way last week, as Dennis Overbye so beautifully reported in The Timess package on confirmation of Einsteins 1916 conclusionthat massive moving objects cause ripples in spacetime  gravitational waves.

title: 1941: British Parachutists Invade Italy
description: LONDON  In a brief statement the British officially admitted today [Feb. 15] that they had dropped parachute troops by plane in southern Italy on Monday night and Tuesday morning.

title: Zika Virus in Colombia Presents Complicated Choice About Abortion
description: CCUTA, Colombia  Margarita Rosa Barrios was six weeks pregnant when she began to feel the symptoms that every expecting mother here has come to dread: swollen eyes, aching joints, three days of fever. Just as she feared, she had the Zika virus.

title: How Does One Dog Recognize Another as a Dog?
description: Q. How does one dog instantly recognize another as a dog, not some other animal?

title: Donald Trump Escalates Rhetoric Before South Carolina Primary
description: Donald J. Trump, whose presidential campaign has doused the Republican Party with the verbal equivalent of napalm, has escalated his rhetoric to new levels of intensity before the crucial South Carolina primary this week. It is a vote that, if he wins, could erode the prospects of Republican leaders stopping his candidacy.

title: Documentary on Migrants Wins Praise at Berlin Film Festival
description: BERLIN  As European leaders wrestle with a wave of migrants that is testing their commitment to open borders and their democracies, a documentary about the Italian island of Lampedusa  for years the first point of arrival in Europe for hundreds of thousands migrants from North Africa  has emerged as one of the strongest films at this years Berlin International Film Festival.

title: Bluffers Guide to the Oscars: Best Actor
description: Everything you need to know about the contenders in one quick rundown.

title: Silicon Valley Gives Ex-Convict a Familiar Feeling
description: SAN FRANCISCO  If you are, for whatever reasons, seeking a large number of young white men in plaid shirts who are partial to standing desks and seminars on growth hacking and journey mapping, look no further than San Franciscos RocketSpace.

title: Left-Leaning Economists Question Cost of Bernie Sanderss Plans
description: WASHINGTON  With his expansive plans to increase the size and role of government, Senator Bernie Sanders has provoked a debate not only with his Democratic rival for president, Hillary Clinton, but also with liberal-leaning economists who share his goals but question his numbers and political realism.

title: Bernie Sanders and a First for Jews
description: ON the night of his resounding victory in the New Hampshire primary, Bernie Sanders, the first Jew ever to win a presidential nominating contest in American history, got uncharacteristically personal in his victory speech. I am the son of a Polish immigrant, he told his frenzied crowd.

title: Johnny Lattner, Heisman-Winning Halfback With Notre Dame, Dies at 83
description: Johnny Lattner, the versatile halfback who won the 1953 Heisman Trophy playing for an unbeaten Notre Dame team, died on Saturday at his home in Melrose Park, Ill., a suburb of Chicago. He was 83.

title: Anti-Gay Actions in Indonesia Threaten a Fragile Population
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  First, a senior Indonesian government minister called for a ban on gay groups on university campuses. Another official pressured smartphone instant-messaging services to drop gay- and lesbian-themed emoji, prompting one company to comply.

title: 1966: Russia Rejects Foreign Outcry
description: MOSCOW  The Soviet Union today [Feb. 15] rejected foreign criticism  including some from Western Communists  of the conviction here of writers Andrei D. Sinyavsky and Yuli M. Daniel. As the criticism poured in, Soviet officials appeared to be learning again, as they did in the Boris Pasternak case, of the power of the pen to stir international emotions. Mr. Sinyavsky and Mr. Daniel, both 40, were convicted yesterday of anti-Soviet agitation and propaganda after a four-day trial and were sentenced to a total of 12 years in a strict regime labor camp. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Feb. 16, 1966

title: Benicio Del Toro and Laura Dern Join Cast of New Star Wars Film
description: Hot on the heels of the record-setting Star Wars: The Force Awakens, the next installment of the franchise began filming in London on Monday, with Benicio Del Toro and Laura Dern joining the cast, the Walt Disney Company announced.

title: Lionel Messis Foot Sends Penalty Kick Into Lore
description: Leave it to Lionel Messi to turn a straightforward penalty kick into a breathtaking moment.

title: Woman Recalls Escape From Brooklyn Fire That Injured 4
description: She heard the screams in Polish coming from somewhere nearby  Fire! Fire!  and immediately thought of the two young women living next door, asleep on a frigid Sunday night.

title: Silk Road Market Caters to Lovers of Acceleration, Handling and Plumage
description: KASHGAR, China  In many parts of the world, pigeons are an urban pest or, at best, a tasty meal. But here in this storied, ancient outpost near Chinas border with Kyrgyzstan, they are much more: a hobby, an investment and, for some, an addiction.

title: Honolulu Biennial in 2017 to Spotlight Local and International Contemporary Artists
description: Hawaii has a population of more than 1.4 million people but not a single museum is dedicated to contemporary art, said Isabella Ellaheh Hughes, a co-founder of the first Honolulu Biennial, which will open in spring 2017.

title: 8 Recipes for the Week
description: I work every morning, all morning, sometimes in the afternoons, the novelist Jim Harrison told Esquire a few years ago. Then sometimes I hunt in the afternoons  quail, doves, grouse up north  but just to stay alive, because writers die from their lifestyle but also from their lack of movement.

title: At Victoria Beckham, Casual Corsets Meet Mens Wear
description: The designer showed a fall/winter 2016 collection that she says reveals her evolving personal style.

title: Research Hints at Promise and Difficulty of Helping People With A.D.H.D. Learn
description: Over the past few decades, cognitive scientists have found that small alterations in how people study can accelerate and deepen learning, improving retention and comprehension in a range of subjects, including math, science and foreign languages.

title: South Carolina Church Bridges Racial Gap, but Not Political Divide
description: GREENVILLE, S.C.  The members of Redemption church, a bracing blend of black and white with a smattering of Latinos, flowed into their arena-size sanctuary on one of the last Sundays before the South Carolina primaries. They prayed side by side in the glow of the animations streaming across a million-dollar video wall. They sang together, arms raised, to carefully calibrated worship music that fused strummy, sentimental rock with melismatic soul. They mingled afterward in the churchs Higher Grounds Caf & Coffee Bar, standing in line for chicken-wing lunches.

title: Slideshow: Off the Runway
description: Scenes from the fashion shows during day three of New York Fashion Week.

title: Americans and Dutch Train Senegal Commandos as Fears of Terrorism Grow
description: ST.-LOUIS, Senegal  On a hazy afternoon last week, about two dozen Senegalese commandos dressed in dark green camouflage uniforms landed their black Zodiac boats on a sandy beach and clambered ashore, their M-16 rifles at the ready.

title: An Anti-Corruption Charade in Honduras
description: WASHINGTON  Last spring and summer, huge protests set off by corruption scandals engulfed two Central American nations. In Guatemala, an investigation led by a United Nations-sponsored International Commission Against Impunity exposed a far-reaching customs corruption ring and uncovered evidence that its leader was none other than the countrys president, Otto Prez Molina. Protests in Guatemala City grew, and in September, Mr. Prez Molina resigned and was sent to jail to await trial.

title: Hood by Airs Shayne Oliver Returns to His American Roots
description: Inspired by the past year and a half spent in Italy  and our countrys founding fathers  the designer introduced a fresh yet nostalgic take on his signature streetwear.

title: New York Fashion Week: Diane von Furstenberg and Prabal Gurung in Pictures
description: A photo diary of the fall/winter 2016 collections that were presented yesterday.

title: Scalias Supreme Court Seat Has Been Vacant For More Than 400 Days
description: Since 1900, the Senate has voted on eight Supreme Court nominees during an election year. Six were confirmed.

title: The St. Petersburg Lottery
description: This weeks challenge was suggested by Adam Kucharski, a lecturer in mathematical modeling at the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine, where he studies the dynamics of infectious diseases, particularly emerging infections. Adam is also an award-winning writer, and author of The Perfect Bet: How Science and Math Are Taking the Luck Out of Gambling, the story of the mathematicians who make millions by doing the impossible: cracking the code of gambling.

title: Bard Music Festival Tackles the Puccini Paradox
description: This summers Bard Music Festival will focus on Puccini  whose works will be performed alongside those of his predecessors, contemporaries and successors  to explore the paradox of how he became one of the most successful opera composers of all time despite often being critically underrated.

title: Life Insurance Made Easy
description: As soon as somebody depends on you financially, you need life insurance.

title: Carolina Herrera: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Ms. Herreras latest designs.

title: How the Bafta Winners Do (and Dont) Foretell the Oscars
description: Huge surprises out of the British Academy of Film and Television Arts awards Sunday: Leonardo DiCaprio kissed Maggie Smith for the Valentines Day kiss cam, but Michael Fassbender would not kiss his girlfriend, Alicia Vikander, creating a moment so awkward that BBC cut it!

title: Deal on Aviation Emissions Sets Cant-Miss Goals
description: If the global goals laid out at the recent Paris climate conference are to be met, curbing aviation emissions is critical. But dont expect last weeks agreement to set the first standards for airplanes to make a big dent. In fact, it will do little to reduce the rise in emissions from airlines, the fastest-growing source of greenhouse gases responsible for climate change.

title: Uptown  but Natural  Beauty at Carolina Herrera
description: Its not about she woke up like this, or that she did it herself, said the hairstylist Orlando Pita, referring to the uptown, well-bred beauty persona behind Carolina Herreras fall/winter 2016 show. That idea was translated into impeccable blowouts and polished curls with slightly off-center parts. Using Tresemm Beauty Full Volume Mousse throughout the hair, Pita spread volume evenly for a natural  rather than Dynasty  effect. Pita and his team diffused natural frizz out of curly hair  and flatironed straight locks slightly to create a glasslike finish.

title: Verbatim: John Kasich Suggests Changing Your College Major
description: Gov. John R. Kasich of Ohio, at Grand Valley State University in Allendale, Mich., on Monday, relating the story of a discussion with a political science major  he told the student he knew of lots of available jobs in such studies, eventually, like, at Nordstrom.

title: 1952 | Scalia, 16, Attacks the Democrats
description: It was a presidential election year and Antonin Scalia figured in it  in a very small way.

title: U.S.-Owned Plane Carrying Corpse and Cash Is Impounded in Zimbabwe
description: It was supposed to be a routine refueling stop in Zimbabwe by an American-owned cargo plane, traveling to South Africa from Germany. Then airport officials noticed blood spattered on the fuselage and found a corpse and a small fortune in South African cash inside.

title: New Jersey Mayors One-Man Mission to Help Cuban Migrants Draws Scrutiny
description: Felix Roque was impatient. At the end of December, Dr. Roque, a pain specialist and the mayor of West New York, N.J., canceled his appointments and got on a plane to Costa Rica.

title: Hedge Fund Managers Spot an Opportunity Amid Market Volatility
description: Stock markets are plunging. The price of oil is in turmoil. And hedge funds just came off their worst year since the peak of the financial crisis in 2008.

title: Wild Tomatoes Repel Whiteflies, Study Finds
description: Whiteflies are the scourge of many farms, damaging tomatoes, peppers, eggplants and other crops. Now, researchers in Britain report that a species of wild tomato is more resistant to the pest than its commercial counterparts.

title: Tasked With Combating Opium, Afghan Officials Profit From It
description: GARMSIR, Afghanistan  The United States spent more than $7 billion in the past 14 years to fight the runaway poppy production that has made Afghan opium the worlds biggest brand. Tens of billions more went to governance programs to stem corruption and train a credible police force. Countless more dollars and thousands of lives were lost on the main thrust of the war: to put the Afghan government in charge of district centers and to instill rule of law.

title: Misha Nonoo and Opening Ceremony Party on Valentines Day
description: Karolina Kurkova and Caroline Vreeland at Valentines Day cocktails; Rosario Dawson and Chinese dragons at Opening Ceremonys after-party.

title: Misha Nonoo and Opening Ceremony Party on Valentines Day
description: Misha Nonoo and Alexander Gilkes hosted a Valentines party at their Greenwich Village home Sunday night. The Brazilian model Lais Ribeiro and her mom posed in the heart-shaped photo booth.

title: Ted Cruz Ad Goes After Donald Trumps Stance on Planned Parenthood
description: Ted Cruzs campaign has opened a new line of criticism against Donald J. Trump, running an ad called Currency for Mr. Trumps positions in favor of Planned Parenthood.

title: Your Daily Fashion Week Recap for Monday, Feb. 15
description: 1. Hood by Airs Shayne Oliver brought a hodgepodge of materials to the runway  including fur, leather (regular and patent), plastic wrap, rubber and bag tags  for the brands fall/winter 2016 show, titled Pilgrimage. Ive been trying to create new silhouettes that bring HBA more into a fashion context, the designer said. See more photos from the show.

title: Q. and A.: Steps Toward Settling Puerto Ricos Debt
description: How much of Puerto Ricos overall debt is because of the Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority?

title: Pro-Jeb Bush Group Cancels Some Advertising in Super Tuesday States
description: Right to Rise, the super PAC supporting Jeb Bush that has dominated the ad-spending battle so far, has canceled up to a third of its ad reservations in March 1 primary states, according to media buying sources.

title: At Puerto Ricos Power Company, a Recipe for Toxic Air, and Debt
description: As a lab director at Puerto Ricos power authority, Abraham Ortiz uncovered what he suspected was a pattern of lawlessness in the authoritys purchasing department, a secretive place where officials controlled contracts to buy billions of dollars worth of oil.

title: Meet Den  a Breezy, Bohemian New Brand
description: The direct-to-consumer, contemporary line stocks casual staples inspired by the founders Santa Barbara upbringing.

title: Ted Cruz Calls Donald Trumps Sister, a Judge, an Extremist
description: AIKEN, S.C.  Senator Ted Cruz took aim on Monday at the judicial record of Donald J. Trumps sister, calling her a radical pro-abortion extremist unfit for the Supreme Court.

title: A New, Bohemian Line  with Empowerment Built In
description: When both Margaret Kleveland and her sister Katherine had children within the space of just over a year, it quickly became clear to them that their corporate jobs in fashion werent going to cut it any longer. We had always talked about starting a label together, but it was always one of those things we thought would happen down the road, says Katherine, who formerly served as the Executive Vice President of Design at Joie. It wasnt until Margaret, who worked in design and development at B&B footwear design, had a son in the summer of 2015 that the two women decided to finally launch their brand. We had a phone conversation and we were just like, Its time, lets do it.

title: The Author Pat Conroy Announces He Has Pancreatic Cancer
description: The lyrical Southern novelist Pat Conroy, whose books include The Prince of Tides and The Great Santini, announced Monday that he had pancreatic cancer.

title: What Would Scalia Want in His Successor? A Dissent Offers Clues
description: WASHINGTON  What sort of person would Justice Antonin Scalia have wanted President Obama to name as his successor? We know more than you might think.

title: Colorado Planned Parenthood Clinic Reopens After Deadly Attack
description: COLORADO SPRINGS  The Planned Parenthood clinic attacked in November by a gunman professing anti-abortion views reopened on Monday with a packed schedule of patients and no end to the pressures on it: Two protesters stood nearby, holding signs and accusing the organization of harming women and killing babies.

title: The Corset Comeback
description: At New York Fashion Week, a telling handful of designers are romancing the corse. Here are some examples.

title: The Corset: Back in Form
description: Victoria Beckham slashed and sliced it; Rihanna laced it up like a high-top sneaker at Fenty x Puma; Laura Vassar and Kristopher Brock of the Brock Collection rendered their version in courtly brocade.

title: Our Brains Remember the Good Stuff
description: The human brain is attracted to things that were once pleasing even if they no longer are, researchers report. Study participants were asked to find red and green objects on a computer screen filled with different colored objects. They received small rewards for finding the objects: $1.50 for the red ones and 25 cents for the green ones.

title: Tommy Hilfiger: Fall 2016
description: Mr. Hilfigers latest fall looks.

title: Grammys 2016: Highlights and Analysis
Future Earns His Third Straight No. 1 With EVOL
description: For the third time in less than seven months, Future is on top.

title: Opening Ceremony Sees the Future. And It Hovers.
description: Trend proposals come flying down the runway during New York Fashion Week at incredible speed, but even among that melee, hydroponic space agriculture is bound to stand out.

title: Threes a Trend: Reimagined Check
description: As we hit the halfway point of New York Fashion Week, a few trends have begun to emerge: Several runways have featured playful check prints  recast every which way. At Suno, a beautiful jacket and pleated skirt came in muted tartan; at Victoria Beckham, where many looks included woven jackets, a checkered dress with cutouts was a standout. Jason Wu, meanwhile, showed a navy coat that recalled parochial school  but elevated with yellow and gray stripes.

title: Congress Girds for What It Loves Most: A Battle Royal Over Supreme Court Pick
description: WASHINGTON  The outbreak of political conflict over whether the Senate should even consider President Obamas choice to replace Justice Antonin Scalia on the Supreme Court jolted awake a capital that was settling in for a sleepy, humdrum year in the shadow of the raucous and unpredictable presidential campaign.

title: Review: Cleveland Orchestra Plays Mozart, and to Its Strengths
description: Less than a month after bringing an astonishing, hair-trigger program to Carnegie Hall  a wintry new vocal cycle by Hans Abrahamsen and a sensitive yet turbocharged Shostakovich performance  the Cleveland Orchestra returned on Sunday with something completely different.

title: Grand Central Terminal Goes Dark After Power Failure
description: It could have been a set from a zombie movie, hulking forms emerging from shrouded subway stairs, wandering aimlessly into the light. Hungry and confused.

title: Letters From Pope John Paul II Show Deep Friendship With Woman
description: WARSAW  The future Pope John Paul II, Karol Wojtyla, began a friendship with a Polish-American philosopher in 1973 that lasted the rest of his life. She hosted him when he visited New England and translated a book of his, and they stayed in touch, off and on, until his death in 2005.

title: Donald Trump Calls Ted Cruz Unstable and Dishonest
description: Liar. Liar. Nuts. Unstable. Liar.

title: Starting Windows 10 Without a Password
description: Q. Can I change the settings on my Windows 10 laptop so that I dont have to enter a password every time I start the computer?

title: More Republicans Say Theyll Block Supreme Court Nominee
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Republicans on Monday began to close ranks behind a vow by Senator Mitch McConnell, the majority leader, to block consideration of any nominee to replace Justice Antonin Scalia, who died over the weekend, for the remainder of President Obamas term.

title: Verbatim: Donald Trump on Dreamers
description: Donald J. Trump, referring to the children of undocumented immigrants at a news conference in South Carolina.

title: Ads From Pro-Cruz Group Attacking Marco Rubio Are Pulled in South Carolina
description: Television stations in South Carolina have pulled an ad from Stand for Truth, the super PAC supporting Senator Ted Cruz, after a legal review.

title: No Comment Necessary: Mitch McConnell on the Supreme Court, Then and Now
