description: A new study provides more evidence that eating high-cholesterol food does not increase the risk for heart disease.

title: Infighting Dilutes Push in Britain to Leave E.U.
description: LONDON  Old-fashioned, upper class and with a habit of spouting Latin quotations, the British lawmaker and European Union critic Jacob Rees-Mogg is affectionately known in Parliament as the honorable member for the early 20th century.

title: Chinas Deal Makers Have Disappointed
description: The ghosts of past failures haunt Chinas new mergers and acquisitions players.

title: Where to See Ballet and Puppet Theater in Yogyakarta
description: As covered in a recent article, Yogyakarta in Indonesia has become a vibrant center of art, dance and puppet theater. Here is how to get the most out of a visit.

title: Uncanny Moments from the Westminster Dog Show
description: Yes, some owners resemble their dog. The annual dog show revealed emotional similarities as well.

title: Uncanny Moments from the Westminster Dog Show
description: Sure, its deeply amusing when owners look like their dogs, and try to complement them with their attire in the show ring. (Liberace must have been gazing down fondly on the 140th Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show this year, what with its abundance of gold lam, silver filigree and suits that sparkled.)

title: Channing Dungey to Succeed Paul Lee as Chief of ABC Entertainment
description: LOS ANGELES  A long-running internal battle among ABC executives over creative control and future strategy led to the ouster on Wednesday of the networks entertainment president and the elevation of a pair of his lieutenants.

title: Supreme Court Vacancy Has Left and Right Ready to Pounce
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas senior adviser and his top lawyer were blunt with liberal activists on a strategy call as they jumped into what political professionals in Washington expect to be one of the hardest-fought Supreme Court battles in a generation.

title: F.D.A. Deals Setback to Catalyst in Race for Drug Approval
description: WASHINGTON  A Florida company involved in an unusual race for approval of a drug that treats a rare neuromuscular condition had a setback on Wednesday, after federal regulators said they needed more information before deciding whether to approve it.

title: Xuly Bet: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Lamine Kouyat presents his fall collection.

title: International Pop: The Usual Suspects and More
description: International Pop, which opens Wednesday, Feb. 24, at the Philadelphia Museum of Art, lays waste to the idea of Pop Art as a mostly American  or even American-British-German  phenomenon. Beginning with one of Jasper Johnss 1958 Flag paintings, this revisionist show, which originated at the Walker Art Center in Minneapolis, includes the usual suspects from either side of the Atlantic. But it encompasses many more unusual artists who responded to the rise of consumer culture, popular media and various forms of imperialism while also experimenting with new art forms during the turbulent 1960s and 70s.

title: A Marathon Evening of Prokofiev Piano Concertos at BAM
description: Its not often that Prokofiev fans have a chance to hear all five of his Piano Concertos in one evening. On Wednesday, Feb. 24, Valery Gergiev conducts the Mariinsky Orchestra in a marathon performance featuring five pianists, beginning with George Li playing the single-movement Concerto No. 1. Alexander Toradze will perform the fiendishly difficult, fascinating second concerto, dedicated to a close friend of Prokofievs who committed suicide. The pianist Sviatoslav Richter described the Intermezzo of the brooding work, which has a huge, roiling cadenza, as evoking a dragon devouring its young.

title: Fed Officials, at Meeting, Found Economic Outlook Cloudy
description: WASHINGTON  Federal Reserve officials threw up their hands in January, deciding that they could not decide whether market turmoil would impede domestic economic growth.

title: Sendaks Wild Things, Via Spike Jonze
description: It wasnt easy for Spike Jonze to create his 2009 adaptation of Maurice Sendaks 1963 classic, Where the Wild Things Are, about a lonely boys escape to a fantastical island populated by fearsome if benign monsters. His original conception for the film  which ends the Nitehawk Cinemas Little Bookworms series on Feb. 27 and 28 (Saturday and Sunday)  was too dark for Warner Bros., and the giant supporting characters, offspring of Jim Hensons Creature Shop, had animatronic issues. But the director persisted, and the movie, written by Mr. Jonze and Dave Eggers and offering gentle songs by Karen O of the Yeah Yeah Yeahs, became a classic of its own. The newcomer Max Records plays the hero, Max, but its the ensemble behind the beasts (including Forest Whitaker, Lauren Ambrose, Catherine OHara and Chris Cooper) who sparkle. As Maxs buddy Carol, James Gandolfini (Tony Soprano himself) had perhaps the most tender role of his career. Ages 6 and up. (136 Metropolitan Avenue, Williamsburg, Brooklyn; nitehawkcinema.com.)

title: Girls? Arent They Women Yet?
description: When last we saw our Girls, they were growing up. Marnie (Allison Williams), having been abandoned at their showcase by Desi (Ebon Moss-Bachrach), stepped onstage to find her voice. Jessa (Jemima Kirke), after witnessing the agony of birth, decided to become a therapist. Shoshanna (Zosia Mamet), faced with the option of moving in with Scott (Jason Ritter), chose to take a job in Japan. And Hannah (Lena Dunham)  after tearfully rebuffing Adam (Adam Driver) in his plea to get back together  was seen, six months later, kissing a new guy, Fran (Jake Lacy), in the snow.

title: At Michael Kors, I Woke Up Like This Beauty Sticks
description: Michael Korss models are known to have a healthy, sun-kissed glow. But this season, the shows makeup artist, Dick Page, traded consistently bronzed complexions for a leftover-from-the-night-before look. Inspired by what off-duty models might look like in real life, Page didnt remove any of their existing eye makeup  at times leftover from previous shows  before getting to work. He then closely lined lids with either a black, brown or navy hue before smudging it with his fingers.

title: Makeover Set for Police Building at Heart of a Sleeker Times Square
description: The identical mosaic tile maps of New York City on the sides of the police substation in Times Square hark back to a different era. Some of the Monopoly-like symbols among the tiles that once helped tourists locate landmarks are gone. So, too, are a number of those landmarks, like the old Metropolitan Opera House.

title: Blackhawks Rally Past Rangers in Ryan McDonaghs Return
description: A day before visiting the White House to mark their third Stanley Cup victory in six seasons, the Chicago Blackhawks stopped by Madison Square Garden on Wednesday.

title: Celebrating When Hip-Hop Had Its Crossover
description: First, the hairsplitting: I Love the 90s is an excellent concept for a tour of came-and-went hip-hop-meets-pop dynamos, but in this lineup, which comes to New York and New Jersey this week, the Technicolor end of the late 1980s is the real touchstone. Thats when the croaky-voiced Tone Loc was at his peak, when Kid n Play and Salt-N-Pepa were perfecting their dance moves, when Rob Base was fine-tuning his chants.

title: Lady Gaga Applauds Brandon Maxwell, and Kirsten Dunst Dances With Rodarte
description: Brandon Maxwell hosts a show and after-party at the Monkey Bar on the Upper East Side, while the Rodarte sisters, Kate and Laura Mulleavy, hold an after-party at Berlin in East Village.

title: Mari Giudicellis Debut Shoe Collection
description: The model launches her eponymous brand of loafers and mules this week.

title: Blake Lively Talks About Michael Kors
description: Michael Kors has made a fortune from perfecting a certain look that is all his own. Camel coats, deep tans and a glossy blowout? So Michael Kors. Tan leather bag and shoes? Very, very Michael Kors. Bare legs in winter because you have a car waiting for you in the snow outside? The definition of Michael Kors.

title: Lady Gaga Applauds Brandon Maxwell, and Kirsten Dunst Dances With Rodarte
description: Brandon Maxwell held a party immediately following his runway show at the Monkey Bar on the Upper East Side. Lady Gaga attended, giving her former stylist and friend a standing ovation as the models streamed out for the finale. And at the Berlin bar in the East Village, the Rodarte designers gathered their friends, including Kirsten Dunst and Tavi Gevinson, to celebrate their collection and Kate Mulleavys birthday.

title: Find Out Whats New in Smartphones at Mobile World Congress
description: EVERY year, the smartphone world gathers in Spain for a giant trade show called Mobile World Congress, M.W.C. for short. Thousands of exhibitors show off their current and coming wares, including smartphones, wearable technology and new apps.

title: Spanish Unit of Chinas ICBC Raided in Money Laundering Case
description: The Spanish police raided the Madrid subsidiary of one of Chinas largest banks on Wednesday and arrested five of its directors as part of a broad investigation into money laundering.

title: Russia Sues Ukraine in London Court Over Unpaid Debt Claim
description: MOSCOW  Russia filed a lawsuit against Ukraine in the London High Court on Wednesday over $3 billion in unpaid loans, escalating a legal battle that is adding to the geopolitical tensions between the two countries.

title: Nikki Haley Endorses Marco Rubio as South Carolina Prepares to Vote
description: CHAPIN, S.C.  Senator Marco Rubio received the endorsement Wednesday of South Carolinas governor, Nikki R. Haley, a stamp of approval that could prove significant as his campaign tries to break out ahead in the states primary on Saturday.

title: Argentina Battles Major Outbreak of Dengue as Mosquito Population Swells
description: BUENOS AIRES  Argentina is grappling with its worst outbreak of dengue in seven years as the population of Aedes aegypti mosquitoes, which also transmit the Zika virus, expands in the subtropical northeast of the country.

title: 73-Story Tower Would Be Brooklyns Tallest by Far
description: Scrutiny is about to begin of a proposal for the tallest tower in Brooklyn, one that would be impossible to ignore.

title: A New Shoe Brand Focuses on the Classics
description: The model Mari Giudicelli is best known for her work for brands such as Maryam Nassir Zadeh, Ulla Johnson and Eckhaus Latta  shes appeared in countless runway shows, magazine editorials and ad campaigns. But now, shes becoming a designer in her own right: on Friday, she will debut her eponymous shoe line  a selection of classic, simple loafers and flats in suede and exotic skins.

title: Once No. 4, Juan Martn del Potro Starts Over Again at 1,041st
description: DELRAY BEACH, Fla.  Eleven months was long enough for Juan Martn del Potro to ponder whether he wanted to attempt another comeback from wrist surgery. One match into his return from his fourth wrist operation, he appeared satisfied with his decision.

title: Teaching Climate Change
description: To the Editor:

title: Housing Aid for Homeless
description: To the Editor:

title: Ted Cruz Rebuffs Donald Trump Ad Lawsuit Threat
description: SENECA, S.C.  He read aloud from a cease-and-desist letter. He presented the video evidence. He said he looked forward to deposing his chief rival for the Republican nomination.

title: Police Seek Suspect After Fatal Brooklyn Shooting
description: The police on Wednesday were searching for an assailant who fatally shot a Brooklyn man during an argument outside an apartment building that has a history of drug activity.

title: Privacy and Cable TV
description: To the Editor:

title: Explaining Apples Fight With the F.B.I.
description: Tuesday evening, a federal court ordered Apple to help the F.B.I. unlock an iPhone used by one of the attackers who killed 14 people in San Bernardino, Calif., in December.

title: Vatican Sex Abuse Panel
description: To the Editor:

title: Sandy Alderson, Feeling Better, Is Focused on Health of Pitchers and Wright
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  A few days after the Mets clinched the National League East in September and General Manager Sandy Alderson was doused with champagne, looking happier than he had in years, he was told he had cancer. He dealt with the news quietly as he fine-tuned his roster and had two more champagne baths in the Mets run to the World Series.

title: Seeking a More Humane Way to Die
description: To the Editor:

title: Heartburn Drugs Tied to Dementia Risk
description: The popular heartburn drugs known as proton pump inhibitors have been linked to a range of ills: bone fractures, kidney problems, infections and more. Now a large new study has found that they are associated with an increased risk for dementia as well.

title: Aid Deliveries Begin to 5 Besieged Syrian Towns
description: GENEVA  More than 100 trucks laden with emergency food and medicine began deliveries on Wednesday to tens of thousands of desperate Syrians in five locations besieged for months by the civil war, United Nations officials and relief workers reported.

title: Mile 13 in the Deployment Marathon
description: The hardest part of the journey is the first step, right? Respectfully, I disagree; I think its the steps in the middle. Weve just passed the halfway point in my Navy husbands seven-month deployment (preceded by over a year of constant in-and-out travel for training, called work-ups), and instead of sprinting to a finish line, it feels like my 5-year-old daughter, 3-year-old son and I are crawling along a never-ending trail.

title: Ex-Eurythmic Dave Stewart, the Zelig of Pop
description: We all know Six Degrees of Kevin Bacon: How many steps does it take to connect any famous person to the ubiquitous character actor?

title: A Powerful Elektra, Sheep at the Armory and Other Spring Classical Highlights
description: Speculation swirls around any new production at the Metropolitan Opera. But the companys staging of Strausss Elektra, opening on April 14, has been awaited with particular eagerness, and has already been deemed a milestone in the career of its director, Patrice Chreau.

title: Ratmansky and Lil Buck on the Spring Dance Calendar
description: Some kinds of climate change are good. The eight-week repertory announced by American Ballet Theater for its annual spring season at the Metropolitan Opera House is the best news for this company in more than 25 years. More than that, it refreshes the whole New York dance environment. Instead of relying chiefly on fare choreographed over a century ago in inadequate productions (as it once did), the company is giving extensive time to important 20th- and 21st-century ballets.

title: A Former Tween Idol, Reborn Off Broadway
description: Nat Wolff arrives at Joe Allen, the Midtown restaurant thats served as a hangout for off-duty actors for over 50 years, with a gash on his finger. The 21-year-old is currently starring in a revival of Sam Shepards 1978 Pulitzer Prize-winning play Buried Child at the Alice Griffin Jewel Box Theatre, and at the previous nights performance  during a scene in which his character, Vince, violently hurls glass bottles against a wall  he looked down to find a pool of blood at his feet. To many, Wolff is best known for his roles as a teenager blinded by cancer in The Fault in Our Stars and as the lead opposite Cara Delevingne in last summers Paper Towns, both adaptations of John Green novels. By contrast, Shepards drama, about three generations of a Midwestern family coming to grips with an economic depression and personal tragedy, marks a step up in intensity. I insisted when we started that we use real glass in the play, Wolff says, examining his hand. But now Im not so sure.

title: Cliffside Home Will Go to Los Angeles County Museum of Art
description: LOS ANGELES  Soon after Michael Govan took his job as the director of the Los Angeles County Museum of Art in 2006, he began talking about acquiring a major work of architecture for the museum to oversee, preserve and open up to visitors. Now, almost 10 years into his job, he has managed to make his first acquisition: The Sheats-Goldstein residence, an angular glass-walled home designed by John Lautner that comes complete with a nightclub, tennis court and a skyspace installation by the artist James Turrell in its backyard.

title: No Flower is Getting More Love This Season Than the Daisy
description: Expect a floral explosion as spring looks start to arrive in stores.

title: Be Cautious When Choosing a Tax Preparer
description: Consumers looking for someone to handle their income tax returns may not know that many paid tax preparers arent required to have special training or pass a test to prove their expertise. So its important to do some research before handing over your financial information.

title: Photos of the Day: Turkey and Elsewhere
description: Turkey and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Paris Doesnt Get Sweatpants, Yet. So A.P.C. Brought Its Own to New York.
description: Jean Touitou of A.P.C. is as close as contemporary fashion comes to a saloniste. The outspoken founder of the label, whose stores reliably dot the cool neighborhoods of the globe, declines runways and shows his collections in group presentations that he narrates, microphone in hand, often pausing to quote from Proust or digress into discussions of his late cousins genius unpublished novel. They are not without incident (as when he stumbled into a fiasco of race relations and political correctness by quoting his friend and collaborator Kanye West), and they are never without interest.

title: Feb. 17, 2016  Photos of the Day
description: Photos from Turkey, Uganda, Russia and Germany.

title: Naian Gonzlez Norvind Reaches for High Notes in Her Requiem
description: Lately, the Faur Requiem has weighed heavily on Naian Gonzlez Norvinds mind. So have the requiems of Mozart, Dvorak and Verdi.

title: University of Texas Sets Parameters for Concealed Handguns on Austin Campus
description: Despite his own reservations, and those of much of his staff and student body, the president of the University of Texas at Austin on Wednesday announced rules that will allow concealed handguns to be carried on campus, including in classrooms.

title: Sarah Charles Lewis Bids for Posterity in Tuck Everlasting
description: Sarah Charles Lewis is only 11, but already she has a position on immortality: If offered a liquid that would allow her to live forever, but keep her always at her current age, she would decline.

title: 2016-02-15-Report
description: A policy governing concealed carry on campus was developed to comply with a new state law.

title: UT Austin s Campus Carry Policies Office of the President the University of Texas at Austin
description: In an open letter, Gregory L. Fenves, president of the University of Texas at Austin, announces a policy that will generally allow concealed carry, which has been prohibited on the campus.

title: Why Teenage Girls Roll Their Eyes
description: Many people can roll their eyes, but adolescent girls have practically monopolized the ocular gesture as a form of communication. Adults on the receiving end of an eye roll are often offended, and sometimes thats just what the girl had in mind. But frequently, its not. Eye-rolling serves a variety of purposes, and the meanings behind the mannerism tell us a lot about what its like to be a teenager.

title: Zainab Jah, Eclipsed Star, Is Ready for Battle
description: In Eclipsed, which begins previews Feb. 23 at the Golden Theater, Zainab Jah plays Maima, an AK-47-toting soldier who has given herself the name Disgruntled. But one evening at a South Brooklyn bistro, plates of oysters arrayed before her, Ms. Jah seemed content. Im greedy, she said, with enthusiasm and without apology.

title: For Director Lileana Blain-Cruz Things Are Going Swimmingly
description: The director Lileana Blain-Cruz didnt so much stand up as pop out of a chair in New York Theater Workshops rehearsal studio. She then danced across the floor toward the actors Alex Breaux and Lucas Caleb Rooney. Im going to switch something up for you, she nearly sang, suggesting a change in the fight scene they were rehearsing for Red Speedo, now in previews at the theater.

title: Open Letter from the University of Texas at Austin
description: In an open letter, Gregory L. Fenves, president of the University of Texas at Austin, announces a policy that will generally allow concealed carry, which has been prohibited on the campus.

title: 2016-02-15-Report
description: A policy governing concealed carry on University of Texas campuses was developed to comply with a new state law.

title: Review: Herlin Riley Commands Attention on New Direction
description: New Direction

title: Pope Francis Visits U.S.  Mexico Border
Review: Michael Pollan and Pangs of Guilt, Not Hunger
description: Michael Pollan is food-shaming us again, this time in a four-part Netflix docu-series. Its a gentle sort of shaming, and informative, but unless youve previously been converted to Pollanology through his books (The Omnivores Dilemma) or his other screen appearances (Food, Inc.), youll come away feeling mighty guilty about what you eat.

title: Review: In Every Song Ever, Ben Ratliff Helps the Listener Discern
description: Complaining that theres too much good art and entertainment being made at the moment seems churlish  how could that be a problem? Yet its undeniable that there is something curiously oppressive about the current bounty, something paralyzing about our ease of access to it. Television is one field where what ought to be a boon feels increasingly like a bane: With scores of new shows each season, keeping up with whats good gets to seem like a chore. If anything, the overload in music feels even more unmanageable.

title: Acel Moore, Founder of Black Journalists Organization, Dies at 75
description: Acel Moore, a Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist who co-founded the National Association of Black Journalists and awakened his white colleagues and their readers to everyday life in black communities, died on Friday at his home in Wyncote, Pa., near Philadelphia. He was 75.

title: Channing Tatum Gives Hail, Caesar! a Tap-Dancing Kick
description: What turned into one of the most memorable dances on film in recent years started modestly with this description, said its choreographer, Christopher Gattelli: Burt Gurney does a number on a ship with a mop.

title: The Look: Anna Suis Frothy Baby-Doll
description: In the early 1980s, Anna Sui was a young fashion hopeful toiling, mostly unsung, on Seventh Avenue, her look largely influenced by the style and the music of the London youth quake. Flash forward a decade, and a chain of lucky circumstances introduced the Chinese-American designer to her first brush with fame.

title: At Narciso Rodriguez, Sculpture-Adorned Earlobes
description: Narciso and I have a similar aesthetic and we look at women in the same way, says the jewelry designer Ana Khouri, referring to her friend and collaborator Narciso Rodriguez. Given her formal training as a sculptor, Khouri views her pieces as not only dressing the body, but making a connection with the body. She adds that Rodriguez, too, is very conscious of lines and forms.

title: Lela Rose: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Looks from the Lela Rose Collection.

title: Facts & Figures: Januarys Record-Breaking Heat
description: Last month was the warmest January worldwide since recording began in 1880. Whats more, the temperature anomaly for January  a measure of how much the temperature differedfrom an average of past temperatures for the month  was also the largest ever calculated.

title: Ted Cruz in Virtual Tie With Donald Trump in New National Poll
description: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas has erased Donald J. Trumps lead in a new national poll that could signal a significant shift in the race for the Republican nomination with primary election season in full swing.

title: Testosterone Gel Has Modest Benefits for Men, Study Says
description: More than a million men have smeared testosterone gels on their bodies in recent years, hoping it would rejuvenate them, energize them, and increase their libido. But until now, there has never been a rigorous study asking if there were any real benefits to testosterone therapy for healthy men with so-called low T.

title: Boss Women: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Jason Wu, the Taiwanese-born designer, presents his fall womens collection.

title: DKNY: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Maxwell Osborne and Dao-Yi Chows second collection for DKNY.

title: The Thinking Womans Runway
description: It was snowing outside, speckling the stiletto boots and soaking the tights of the fashion folk, and inside, snow lay lightly on the ground for Thom Brownes show, deep in the bowels of a Chelsea art gallery where Mr. Browne had recreated Washington Square circa the Henry James years.

title: Every Minute Counts on the Way to Opening Night
description: On one recent Tuesday, we spent an hour each with a dozen upcoming Broadway shows as they worked under looming deadlines. From the costume shop to the first curtain call, here's how the steps and stories, the stitches and salesmanship come together.

title: Review: Twelfth Night by Filter Theater, Set at the Frat
description: Who needs cakes and ale when you have pizza and lager? In the best bits of Twelfth Night, presented at the Skirball Center for the Performing Arts in association with the Royal Shakespeare Company, the British troupe Filter Theater reimagines Shakespeares comedy as a frat bacchanal. Theres even an improvement on beer pong.

title: Review: Denes Varjon, a Hungarian Pianist, at Zankel Hall
description: A sparsely attended concert at Zankel Hall on Tuesday evening by the Hungarian pianist Denes Varjon demonstrated the difficulty of marketing an artist who may be admired by musicians and industry professionals but is not well known among a broader audience in this country.

title: Ex-Deutsche Bank Analyst to Pay $100,000 Over Ratings
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission on Wednesday settled with a former stock analyst over accusations that he had failed to tell investors what he really believed about the value of a companys shares he was promoting.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing: Donald Trump, iPhone, Hillary Clinton
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Review: Join or Die With Craig Ferguson  Historic Errors
description: The informational side of television has its standard documentary programming and its standard talk shows, but lately it has also sprouted a sort of mumblecore hybrid of the two. People with varying qualifications prattle about a subject in a way thats supposed to be entertaining, occasionally bumping into an illuminating fact or idea while doing so.

title: As Demographics in Cambodia Shift, Youth Seek Political Change
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia  Thy Sovantha, Cambodias youngest political star, is still seething.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Review: Jack Garratt Chops, Croons and Wobbles
description: Phase

title: Review: BJ the Chicago Kid Waxes Reflective on In My Mind
description: In My Mind

title: Yahoo Closes Online Magazines, a Costly Experiment by Marissa Mayer
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Marissa Mayer, the embattled chief executive of Yahoo, is gutting one of her signature projects: A cluster of digital magazines devoted to topics like food, autos, real estate, travel and technology.

title: Review: Dave Holland Trio in a Bracingly Uncorked Evening at the Village Vanguard
description: Opening night of a newly incorporated jazz groups residency can be a crapshoot. Conventional wisdom holds that as time progresses, the music will only get better. But there are provisos and exceptions, most of which were manifest in the Dave Holland Trios jubilant, blazingly exploratory first set at the Village Vanguard on Tuesday night.

title: Bill Cosby Sued Accusers Lawyers on Eve of His Criminal Hearing
description: On the eve of a critical hearing in his criminal case earlier this month, Bill Cosby sued the two lawyers for the woman who accused him of drugging and sexually assaulting her, according to court records.

title: John Kasich Turns His Sights on New England
description: BLUFFTON, S.C.  Gov. John R. Kasich of Ohio, who has competed in South Carolina while also looking ahead to more hospitable primary states, is not planning to stay here on Saturday when Republican voters go to the polls.

title: Harper Beckham, the 4-Year-Old Street-Style Star
description: The newest street-style fashion star has been photographed dining at Balthazar and Nobu, shopping at Barneys, vacationing in Marrakesh and the Napa Valley and going to the ballet in London. She favors Chlo, Marc Jacobs and Zara, and seems to have an occasional fondness for the color pink.

title: Long-Shot Nominees and Their Oscars Fatigue
description: Shortly after the curtain fell on the 2010 Academy Awards, Michael Barker, the co-president of Sony Pictures Classics, bumped into the French director Jacques Audiard, and was startled to find him grinning from ear to ear. Mr. Audiards film, A Prophet, had just lost the best foreign-language film Oscar to A Secret in Their Eyes, and yet the filmmaker, Mr. Barker said, could not have looked more pleased.

title: Off the Runway: Feb. 17
description: What you need to know from the seventh day of New York Fashion Week.

title: Popes Presence Crosses Border Into U.S., Even if He Doesnt
description: EL PASO, Tex.  In Mexico, Ciudad Jurez was naturally consumed with the visit by Pope Francis on Wednesday. But across the border here in West Texas, its sister city, El Paso, was equally swept up.

title: Law Center Finds Surge in Extremist Groups in U.S. Last Year
description: Extremist groups thrived in the United States last year as the divisive rhetoric of national political leaders fueled Americas anxieties over the countrys shifting demographics, according to a report by the Southern Poverty Law Center.

title: A Designer Pop-Up and Brandon Maxwell at Bergdorf Goodman
description: On Thursday, be sure to check out the Bergdorf Goodman pop-up of Beau Souci, a line founded by Paola Russo, owner of the Los Angeles concept boutique Just One Eye. Designed by Aurlie Larrousse, who graduated from Studio Berot in Paris, it marries French chic with SoCal cool in looks like a gold and silver watersnake leather skirt ($2,750) paired with a plain white tee ($140).

title: Erykah Badu, Debut Fashion Week Stylist
description: At the Pyer Moss show at Milk Studios on Saturday, a quintet played classical music in hospital gowns, a jacket had the message You dont have any friends in LA written across the breastplate, and the final model held a sign that said: My demons won today. Im sorry.

title: The Olsen Twins Expand Their Empire With New Eyewear
description: Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen rolled into the Oliver Peoples Madison Avenue boutique on Tuesday night for a party celebrating their first eyewear collaboration. Perhaps not surprisingly, given the reluctance of The Row designers to engage much with the public or the press, they have cheekily named a pair of $340 oversize tortoise sunglasses Dont Bother Me.

title: The Blowout Parties of New York Fashion Week
description: Blame it on the arctic blast, on awards season, on fashion weeks very influence hanging in the balance.

title: Off the Runway: Fashion Week, Day 7
description: Above, Jennifer Hudson snaps a photo from the front row of the Michael Kors show. Click on the slide show above for more images from the seventh day of New York Fashion Week.

title: A Novel Plan for Health Care: Cutting Costs, Not Raising Them
description: As employees know all too well, health insurance companies have one surefire way to lower costs: Ask their customers to pay more.

title: Mayor de Blasios America: A Pastrami Sandwich From Carnegie Deli
description: For Mayor Bill de Blasio, happiness is a warm pastrami sandwich.

title: Threes a Trend: Plastic and Rubber
description: Streetwear has officially embraced the weird for fall/winter 2016, with runways dominated by oversize silhouettes, tough boots and pieces wrought in nylon and rubber that appear to be made of plastic bags. At Hood by Air (center), arguably the seasons most talked-about show so far, a duffle coat was matched with rubber bottoms and rubber boots. Last night, the minimalist Narciso Rodriguez (right) added a refreshing edge to his show with a silk and wool trench coat that boasted a plasticky sheen. And today, Maxwell Osbourne and Dao-Yi Chows second collection for DKNY (left) was filled with tomboyish pieces like a nylon anorak with matching pants.

title: Voters in South Carolina Give Jeb Bush Some Campaign Advice
description: SUMMERVILLE, S.C.  Jeb Bush has reached the point in his floundering presidential campaign where voters are offering him unsolicited advice.

title: That time when they said...
description: Reviewing past statements by lawmakers on judicial nominations reveals how easily they alternate positions based on control of Congress or the White House.

title: Marchesa: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Keren Craig and Georgina Chapman present their latest looks.

title: Senators Limber Up for a Dexterous Flip on Judicial Nominees
description: WASHINGTON  The long-serving senator professed outrage. How dare the opposition refuse a vote on a high-level presidential judicial nominee.

title: Early Behavior Therapy Found to Aid Children With A.D.H.D.
description: Children with attention-deficit problems improve faster when the first treatment they receive is behavioral  like instruction in basic social skills  than when they start immediately on medication, a new study has found. Beginning with behavioral therapy is also a less expensive option over time, according to a related analysis.

title: Accusation at Indiana University Triggers Review of Sexual Misconduct Cases
description: Indiana University Bloomington will review the handling of 18 sexual misconduct cases after the associate dean who led hearings on the cases was publicly accused of sexually assaulting a woman.

title: Chinese Missiles in South China Sea Underscore a Growing Conflict Risk
description: WASHINGTON  Chinas deployment of surface-to-air missiles on a disputed island in the South China Sea, at the very moment that President Obama is trying to buttress American influence in the region, underscores the growing risk of conflict among the Chinese, their neighbors and the United States.

title: Apples Stance Highlights a More Confrontational Tech Industry
description: The battle between Apple and law enforcement officials over unlocking a terrorists smartphone is the culmination of a slow turning of the tables between the technology industry and the United States government.

title: Three Former New Jersey Governors Ask the State to Reopen the Sheridan Case
description: In the 11 months since a county prosecutor in New Jersey ruled the violent deaths of John and Joyce Sheridan a murder-suicide, their disbelieving family has been waging a determined effort to have the case reopened. On Wednesday, friends of the family released a letter supporting their cause that was signed by some 200 people  including three former governors, a former state Supreme Court justice and several former high-ranking prosecutors.

title: Pope Francis at the Border
description: Pope Francis trip to Mexico ended on Wednesday in Ciudad Jurez, a city once made hellish by drug violence and still gripped by poverty and crime. He did not seem afraid, and brought with him only smiles and hugs, and words of solace and encouragement.

title: Manhattan Prosecutor Asks to Be Recused From Spitzer Inquiry
description: The Manhattan district attorney has moved to recuse himself from the criminal investigation into an allegation that former Gov. Eliot Spitzer assaulted a 26-year-old woman at the Plaza Hotel, saying the close ties between his office and Mr. Spitzer had created an apparent conflict of interest.

title: Delta, in Alliance With Danny Meyer, Aims to Elevate Airline Food
description: It is no secret that airlines are waging an increasingly pitched battle for the biggest-spending passengers who fly in premium classes: The carriers have deployed amenities like fluffy feather duvets and spa treatments.

title: Legal Heavyweights Enter Round 3 in New Jersey Gambling Case
description: PHILADELPHIA  Before the United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit began the important business on Wednesday of deciding whether New Jersey could offer legal wagering on sports, Judge Thomas L. Ambro offered a tribute to Justice Antonin Scalia, listing his many contributions to the law.

title: Audit Faults New York City for Not Using Vacant Lots for Affordable Housing
description: New York Citys scarcity of inexpensive land is often cited as an impediment to building more affordable housing, but the comptrollers office has identified more than 1,000 city-owned vacant lots across the boroughs that have been sitting idle, most for more than 30 years.

title: Jordan Spieth and Rory McIlroy Resume Fight for Top Spot
description: LOS ANGELES  A 12-year-old Jordan Spieth sat glued to the television for the 2006 Rose Bowl, between No. 2 Texas and top-ranked Southern California. The game had the requisite star power and drama for a marquee event in this entertainment capital of the world.

title: Nikki Haley Endorses Marco Rubio, Aiming to Project Vibrant New G.O.P.
description: CHAPIN, S.C.  Senator Marco Rubio of Florida on Wednesday won the coveted backing of South Carolinas governor, Nikki R. Haley, bringing together two of the youngest Republican rising stars at a moment when their party is facing difficult questions about whether instead to look to its past or to political outsiders for leadership.

title: Andrzej Zulawski, Rebellious Film Director, Dies at 75
description: Andrzej Zulawski, a Polish director who blended surrealism, horror and psychic excess in the emotionally savage films The Important Thing Is to Love, Possession and My Nights Are More Beautiful Than Your Days, died on Wednesday in Warsaw. He was 75.

title: Blacks See Bias in Delay on a Scalia Successor
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  As he left Martha Lous Kitchen, a soul food institution here on Wednesday, Edward Gadsden expressed irritation about the Republican determination to block President Obama from selecting Justice Antonin Scalias replacement on the Supreme Court.

title: Albany Again Has Stony Brooks Number as Winning Streak Ends at 18
description: ALBANY  As the wins pile up for Stony Brook again this season, the Seawolves remain haunted by the question that has troubled them for five agonizing years, beginning with when they first reached the cusp of the N.C.A.A. tournament: Can they finally win when it matters?

title: William H. Tankersley, Watchdog for CBS Taste Standards, Dies at 98
description: William H. Tankersley, who defined broadcast standards for CBS during a volatile period of change in mores on television and in American society, doing celebrated battle with envelope pushers like Norman Lear and the Smothers Brothers, died on Feb. 5 in Scottsdale, Ariz. He was 98.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: One could say that Daesh has won because its goal has been to sow trouble, and they have succeeded.

title: With Much Unsettled for Nets, Brooklyn Complex Is a New Center of Gravity
description: Mikhail D. Prokhorov smirked as guests were served an array of refreshments at a ceremony Wednesday for the opening of the Nets new practice site in the Sunset Park neighborhood of Brooklyn.

title: Rikers Guard Charged With Lying in Inmates Death Pleads Guilty
description: A New York City correction officer on duty at Rikers Island when a homeless veteran overheated before dying in his cell pleaded guilty on Wednesday to a felony charge that she lied about checking on inmates that night, the authorities said.

title: Trial Starts in Attack at Exhibit of Anti-Islam Cartoons
description: PHOENIX  Federal prosecutors opened their case here on Wednesday against a man accused of being the mastermind behind a thwarted attack last year at an anti-Islam cartoon exhibit in Texas that left two gunmen dead in a shootout.

title: Modern Love: The Podcast | Magically Interrupted

title: Charges Dismissed Against 6 Ex-Employees of Rentboy.com

Mom tackles addiction with the help of the surgeon general. And the Republican and Democratic presidential candidates answer questions at town hall meetings.

title: Apple Letter on iPhone Security Draws Muted Tech Industry Response
description: After a federal court ordered Apple to help unlock an iPhone used by an attacker in a December mass shooting in San Bernardino, Calif., the companys chief executive, Timothy D. Cook, penned a passionate letter warning of far-reaching implications beyond the case.

description: NEW YORK

title: Toyota Recalls Nearly 3 Million RAV4s Over Seatbelt Separation
description: TOKYO  Toyota recalled nearly three million RAV4 sport utility vehicles worldwide on Thursday, saying their rear seatbelts could be severed in a crash, leaving passengers unprotected.

title: Ingram Micro Sold to Chinese Company for $6 Billion
description: HONG KONG  Tianjin Tianhai, a Chinese shipping group, will buy the technology distributor Ingram Micro for $6 billion in the latest mega-deal involving a Chinese company.

title: Racial Gerrymandering in North Carolina
description: The North Carolina legislature is hurriedly redrawing the lines of two congressional districts that had been gerrymandered along racial lines and ruled unconstitutional by a Federal District Court. Unless the Supreme Court steps in, the Republican-controlled legislature must draw new maps by Friday, in time for the March 15 state primary, under an order from the district court.

title: Republicans See How Long They Can Hold Their Breath
description: Maybe wed better refrain from having any new opinions until after the election.

description: One of the more interesting features of the Democratic primary process is the generational divide among support for candidates  older Democratic voters generally prefer Hillary Clinton, and younger ones overwhelmingly prefer Bernie Sanders.

title: How to Break a Party
description: Beginning with the Tea Party wave and continuing through the not-Romney musical chairs of the 2012 Republican primary and the battles over debt limits and fiscal cliffs, most coverage of the Republican Partys internal divisions during the Obama era fell into an easy groove: There was the establishment, and there was the base.

title: Americas Stacked Deck
description: Its a little bizarre this political season to see wealthy candidates in both parties denouncing our political system for representing mostly the interests of, well, wealthy people.

title: Chinas Missile Provocation
description: Chinas decision to station surface-to-air missiles on a disputed island in the South China Sea is the latest in a series of provocative acts that is fueling regional tensions. This unwise move raises new doubts about President Xi Jinpings pledge not to pursue militarization in a vital waterway and passage for $5 trillion in annual trade.

title: Resetting the Post-Scalia Supreme Court
description: In the days since Justice Antonin Scalias death, there has been plenty of talk about the substantial impact his absence will have on the Supreme Courts docket. Id like to shift the focus to the Roberts court itself.

title: How to Win an Election
description: Every election cycle, were asked to make monumental decisions about which people and policies should control our country, and we have to sort through a barrage of information to arrive at our selections. Often, we pick the candidate who breaks through the noise with a message that resonates with us. The politicians that prevail politicians are excellent storytellers.

title: Shedding a House to Buy an Upper East Side Apartment
description: Shortly after they married in 1983, Morgan and Susan Snyder moved to Westchester County to be near Mr. Snyders job. We discovered the city once we got to Westchester, Mrs. Snyder said.

title: Scuba Diving in Thailand: A Balancing Act
description: Last spring, when my 22-year-old son Forrister and I pulled on wet suits and shouldered scuba tanks for our first night dive, wed been aboard the Chinese junk in the Indian Ocean off Thailand for all of 24 hours. As our launch shuttled us out to smooth granite rocks just peeking above the surface near Island No. 9 in the Similan archipelago, I wondered whether Id made a terrible mistake. Even including that days three dives, the sum total of Forristers diving experience amounted to only seven.

title: A Supreme Court With Merrick Garland Would Be the Most Liberal in Decades
description: It should be no surprise that Justice Antonin Scalias death has led to a political fight. His replacement on the court could lead to a historic change in the courts balance of power.

title: Chase Elliott, a Hall of Famers Son, Gains Respect Quickly
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla.  Years ago, in a perhaps prescient moment, a family friend decided that the name William Clyde Elliott II did not fit a young boy. So he nicknamed the lad Chase, and the moniker stuck.

title: Deadlocks and Rearguments: Whats Ahead for the Supreme Court
description: What lies ahead for the Supreme Court when it returns to the bench on Monday, a week after the death of Justice Antonin Scalia?

title: Fashion Week: We Hardly Knew Ye
description: It went by in the blink of an eye, as it always does: There went Kanye West, there went Rihanna, there went Alexander Wang, all the best and buzziest of New York Fashion Week. They have deposited us here, on its final day. But not before the biggest names  they for whom first names alone suffice  come out.

title: Nigerias Booming Film Industry Redefines African Life
description: ASABA, Nigeria  Sitting on a blue plastic stool in the sweltering heat, Ugezu J. Ugezu, one of Nigerias top filmmakers, was furiously rewriting his script as the cameras prepared to roll. Cut! he shouted after wrapping up a key scene, a confrontation between the two leading characters. Then, under his breath, he added, Good as it gets.

title: A Bronx Precinct Where Killings Persist
description: The strangers slept no more than a dozen steps apart in a housing project in the South Bronx  she on a cot pushed up against the wall in the living room of her ailing mothers apartment, and he in a narrow, airless hallway of the building, on the threshold of his familys door.

title: Long Sleeves and Bug Spray in So Paulo
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  Last December, I suddenly found myself in possession of two bottles of the most precious liquid in town: Exposis Extrme, an extra-strong insect repellent. Its deemed the best protection against the Aedes aegypti mosquito, which transmits dengue, chikungunya and, now, the Zika virus. Its active ingredient is icaridin, which also repels ticks and the mosquitoes that carry malaria. Id bought the bottles earlier in the year, during an outbreak of dengue fever, in the hope that a high-quality bug spray would keep me safe from the virus. (It didnt. I came down with dengue, anyway.)

title: Syria's White Rose
description: BERLIN  At the end of Bertolt Brechts Life of Galileo, there is a sharp exchange. Andrea Sarti, a student of the astronomer, says, Unhappy is the land that breeds no hero. To which Galileo shoots back: No, Andrea. Unhappy is the land that needs a hero.

title: The Worlds Best News Photos
description: An update regarding two winning photographers using pseudonyms for their entry names has been added below.

title: The Worlds Best News Photos for 2015
description: The World Press Photo contest winners were announced, with a moody black-and-white image depicting the hardship of the Syrian migration crisis winning photo of the year.

title: Proenza Schoulers Arty Processes
description: When youre spending hundreds of thousands of dollars to stage a fashion show, the fine points matter  not just the clothes, but the when, the where and the how, too. So it was hardly a coincidence that Proenza Schoulers fall show happened to be at the Whitney Museum of American Art on Gansevoort Street.

title: Turkey Blames Kurdish Militia for Ankara Attack, Challenging U.S.
description: BAGHDAD  In blaming a Syrian Kurdish militia supported by the United States for a deadly car bombing in Ankara, Turkey added new urgency on Thursday to a question its president recently posed to the Obama administration: Are you on the side of a NATO ally  Turkey  or its enemies?

description: Name Michele Herbert

title: Charlotte Rampling Lets Tailoring Do the Talking
description: By now the English actress Charlotte Rampling, 70, has little left to prove. She modeled, sang and partied as an emblem of the Swinging Sixties. She starred in foreign art house films like The Night Porter and in American comedies like Woody Allens Stardust Memories. She has spoken her mind to the press for decades.

description: Readers respond to fashion's season of existential crisis.

description: In the world of insta-pundits and unmonitored comments, newspaper editorials may seem quaint, evoking cranky gentlemen of a certain age banging away with wrath on their keyboards about the incandescent issues of the day.

title: OatMeals
description: The hot breakfast cereal is reborn as an indulgence in Greenwich Village.

title: Hot Cereal 30 Ways at OatMeals in Greenwich Village
description: For much of human history, oats were thought of, pityingly, as weeds. The Bible passes over them in silence. The Greeks and Romans snubbed them as a sickly form of wheat. They were fed to horses and, later, to castoff orphans in the workhouses of Victorian England, as grains afloat in murky water, under the name gruel.

title: New York Today: Working the Wee Hours
description: Updated, 10:01 a.m.

title: Hospital Raid by Afghan Forces Is Said to Kill at Least 3
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Afghan security forces, possibly accompanied by NATO advisers, raided a hospital south of Kabul and abducted and then killed at least three men suspected of being insurgents, hospital officials and residents said on Thursday.

title: Chinas New Wedding Vows: To Have, Hold and Not Violate National Interests
description: BEIJING  Does it block traffic? Disrupt normal life? Is the guest list too long? The feast too lavish?

title: Hairy Panic (a Plant) Strikes Australian Town of Wangaratta
description: A plant known as hairy panic has left parts of a small town in southeastern Australia overwhelmed with tumbleweeds, and global news media attention, with residents and journalists recording bizarre scenes of dry, yellow grass piling up around cars and doorways.

title: Food Lessons From Families of Kids With Allergies
description: I always think that my kids eat healthier because of their allergies, said Cristina Henriquez, a writer who lives in Chicago. Her children are 8 and 3 and, between them, are allergic to eggs, peanuts, fish, shellfish, dairy and tree nuts. Theres very little processed food in their house, she notes, and they eat out very rarely.

title: Hillary Clinton Ad Makes an Emotional Pitch to Hispanics
description: With days to go before Nevada caucuses, the Hillary Clinton campaign has released an advertisement, titled Brave, that features a single, poignant moment from the campaign trail to highlight the candidates position on immigration.

title: A Black Police Officers Fight Against the N.Y.P.D.
description: Every morning before his shift, Edwin Raymond, a 30-year-old officer in the New York Police Department, ties up his long dreadlocks so they wont brush against his collar, as the job requires. On Dec. 7, he carefully pinned them up in a nautilus pattern, buttoned the brass buttons of his regulation dress coat and pulled on a pair of white cotton gloves. He used a lint roller to make sure his uniform was spotless. In a few hours, he would appear before three of the departments highest-ranking officials at a hearing that would determine whether he would be promoted to sergeant. He had often stayed up late worrying about how this conversation would play out, but now that the moment was here, he felt surprisingly calm. The department had recently announced a push to recruit more men and women like him  minority cops who could help the police build trust among black and Hispanic New Yorkers. But before he could move up in rank, Raymond would have to disprove some of the things people had said about him.

title: A New California Cuisine
description: Travis Lett is a bearded, hippie-chic chef who runs a trio of popular restaurants in the beachside community of Venice, Calif. The flagship is Gjelina, a loud, fashionable and vegetable-centric neighborhood spot as well known for the attractiveness of its clientele as for its pizzas and salads, slathered toasts and smoky pastas. The restaurant is an aspirational lifestyle camp, replete with fire pit and sloe-eyed waiters.

title: Letter of Recommendation: XpresSpa
description: Getting permission to travel by air should not be as degrading as it is. As a matter of course, you  with your wide eyes and genuine smile and clear conscience and valid identification  are bombarded by invisible rays that reveal explicit details of your anatomy. You are made to endure unwanted touching, particularly if, like me, the scanning of your body invariably leads to follow-up searches of the tip of your head and the seat of your pants. Every single time. Then, the blue latex gloves come out, and even if you have the presence of mind to ask that they put on a new pair to comb through your hair and conduct something that is not not a rectal exam  no penetration, not exactly, and yet  they will be resentful. And though they will acquiesce, they will punish you for your request by going extra rough on both your tender head and your poor, weary rear.

title: Shaun White Says ESPN Kept Him Out of X Games Over Criticism
description: Shaun White said remarks he made to Forbes magazine in the fall led ESPN to forgo inviting him to the Winter X Games in Aspen, Colo., last month. The comments followed weeks of speculation about why White, the most famous and accomplished athlete in snowboarding, was absent from one of the biggest showcases for his sport.

title: Looking at Edvard Munch, Beyond The Scream
description: Visit Oslo in midwinter and high summer and youll know the atmospheric sources of Edvard Munchs art: barely broken darkness, and sunlight you cant escape. Both are evoked in Munch and Expressionism at the Neue Galerie, where paintings and prints by Munch and his younger German contemporaries glow and flare like lamps against midnight-blue walls.

title: Seth Rudetsky, Broadways Go-To Guy, Flirts With Disaster!
description: Seth Rudetsky is not a household name except on Broadway, where he is so well known and well connected that he is sometimes referred to as the mayor of the place. A hazard of being around him is that you feel you have spent the rest of your life in slow motion. Mr. Rudetsky, who is 48 and likes to say he suffers from adult A.D.D., is a multitaskers multitasker. Several days a week he is the afternoon D.J. on Seths Big Fat Broadway, a show on Sirius/XM satellite radio, where he is also the host of a weekly talk show, Seth Speaks, not to be confused with Seths Broadway Chatterbox, a weekly talk show he does live at the Midtown cabaret Dont Tell Mama, or Rhapsody in Seth, his one-man autobiographical play, or, for that matter, This Week in the Life of Seth Rudetsky, a weekly column he writes for Playbill.com.

title: Clashes and Surprises Emerge in Prelude to South Carolina Primary
description: Its becoming easier to see how the Republican race will shape up after the South Carolina primary on Saturday. Its less clear how it will shake out.

title: Why Am I Obsessed With a Cellphone Game About Collecting Cats?
description: Neko Atsume: Kitty Collector is a cellphone game about collecting cats. It is not a complicated game. It is, in fact, barely a game at all. And yet I have become obsessed with it.

title: Whats at Stake as Britain and E.U. Discuss How to Maintain a Union
description: Leaders of the European Union nations will meet on Thursday and Friday in Brussels in an effort to agree on changes to rules intended to persuade Britain to remain a member of the bloc.

description: The author, most recently, of Black Deutschland read Othello early: It was important to me that we were there, proof that we had been on the mind of the exalted William Shakespeare.

description: The 1960s were the inspiration at Michael Kors, but with a fresh streak of rebellion. This chalk white chain bag strikes the perfect balance between Mod and modern.  MALINA JOSEPH GILCHRIST

description: Nike has terminated its relationship with Manny Pacquiao, the champion boxer who is campaigning for the Senate in the Philippines, one day after he publicly apologized for calling people in gay relationships worse than animals during an interview with a local broadcaster.

title: A Cabdrivers Take on Guns
description: Dear Diary:

title: 2 Los Angeles Police Officers Accused of Repeated Sexual Assaults
description: Two officers from the Los Angeles Police Department have been charged with repeatedly sexually assaulting four women over the course of more than two years, prosecutors said on Wednesday.

description: IBM is looking to enhance the growth of its Watson Health business with the $2.6 billion purchase of Truven Health Analytics, which has data on the cost and treatment of more than 200 million patients.

title: Drakes New Album, Prepared by Moody Sensualists
description: On the Friday before Valentines Day, as Drake was getting ready to coach Canadas team to a victory over the United States in the N.B.A.s celebrity All-Star Game in Toronto, his longtime musical partner Noah Shebib, known as 40, was in his studio not far away, prepping for another night of work on Views From the 6, the forthcoming Drake album scheduled to be released in April.

title: Anthony Braxtons Tempo Emphasizes the Upbeat
description: At 70, the composer, saxophonist, pianist and inveterate musical big-picture-ist Anthony Braxton sounds ebullient.

title: Video Found in Belgium of Nuclear Official May Point to Bigger Plot
description: PARIS  A suspect linked to the Nov. 13 Paris attackers was found with surveillance footage of a high-ranking Belgian nuclear official, the Belgian authorities acknowledged on Thursday, raising fears that the Islamic State is trying to obtain radioactive material for a terrorist attack.

title: Spring Preview: Music Festivals Where Experiments Meet the Beat
description: The best music festivals dont strive to offer something for everybody. They go deep, programming live performances like a set by an inspired disc jockey, where each selection responds to and illuminates the rest. They dont confine themselves by genre, but they do flaunt their particular aesthetics, with the promise that the main draws and the unknown quantities are worth hearing side by side.

title: Donald Trump Flaunts Real Estate Prowess With Campaign Yard Signs
description: GREENVILLE, S.C.  Donald Trump delights in breaking the rules of presidential politics.

title: Ontario Farmers Fight to Send a Herd of Ex-Cons Back to the Pen
description: KINGSTON, Ontario  It is easy to pick out the short-timers from the lifers on Jeff Peterss beef and pork farm. The 14 black-and-white Holstein dairy cows stand in sharp contrast to the farms regular herd of chocolate brown Limousin beef cattle in the open winter barns.

title: Privacy vs. Security, Battle Lines Drawn
description: The tech industrys battle with the United States government over encryption has reached a fever pitch.

title: Windows 10 Upgrade Options for Vista Users
description: Q. My somewhat ancient Hewlett-Packard laptop is running Windows Vista, and I never see Vista mentioned in articles about upgrading operating systems. Can it be upgraded to Windows 10?

title: Walmart Profit Fell 8% in 4th Quarter
description: Walmart said on Thursday that profit fell about 8 percent last quarter, and it lowered its sales forecast for this year, citing a strong dollar and the costs of a plan to close more than 200 stores worldwide.

title: 1941: U.S. Emphasizes Japans Deeds
description: WASHINGTON  Sumner Welles, Under Secretary of State, told Japan today [Feb. 18] that deeds speak louder than words, by way of comment on statements from Tokio in the last twenty-four hours tending to minimize the Japanese threat to Singapore and the Dutch East Indies and to deflect the blame for anxiety upon Great Britain and the United States.

title: Angela Raiola, Big Ang of TVs Mob Wives, Dies at 55
description: Angela Raiola, the formidable but lovable reality TV star known as Big Ang who attracted a cult following on VH1s Mob Wives, died early Thursday in Manhattan. She was 55.

title: Review: Race Chronicles Jesse Owenss Rise to Olympic Glory
description: The ingredients of Race, a studiously uplifting biopic of Jesse Owens, the phenomenal star of the 1936 Olympic Games in Berlin, remain as volatile as they were 80 years ago, although nowadays they are camouflaged. This true story of an impoverished black youth from the streets of Depression-era Cleveland who ascends to greatness by shattering track-and-field records and undercutting Adolf Hitlers racist agenda is a safe, by-the-numbers tribute.

title: A Make-or-Break Moment for Marco Rubios Candidacy
description: CHAPIN, S.C.  Aglow in floodlights and beaming with confidence, Senator Marco Rubio of Florida and Gov. Nikki R. Haley of South Carolina looked every bit like a potential national ticket here on Wednesday, giving his supporters a glimpse of what many Republicans have long coveted: a multicultural new look for a party hungry to be competitive in November.

title: Holding Out Hope for Room to Win the Oscar for Best Picture
description: LOS ANGELES  Surprises almost never happen anymore at the Academy Awards. The vote-mongering machinery and punditry have grown too powerful.

title: When Cancer Treatment Offers Hope More Than Cure
description: We joked that she had nine lives.

title: Los Angeles Hospital Pays Hackers $17,000 After Attack
description: It sounds like the plot of a Hollywood thriller, but the all-too-real scenario played out this month at a large Los Angeles hospital: Hackers seized control of critical computer systems and the hospital paid a $17,000 ransom to release them.

title: Paul Graham and Seizing the Everyday Moments
description: Stare, wrote Walker Evans, the canonical 20th-century photographer. It is the way to educate your eye, and more. Stare; pry; listen; eavesdrop. Die knowing something. You are not here long.

title: Obama Going to Cuba; First Visit by U.S. President in 88 Years
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas decision to travel to Cuba next month and meet with President Ral Castro reflects his determination to do as much as possible before he leaves office to pry open the historic and ideological barricades that have separated the United States from its neighbor since the Cold War.

title: Marco Rubio Objects as Supporter Calls Hillary Clinton a Traitor
description: GREENVILLE, S.C.  An audience member at a rally for Senator Marco Rubio called Hillary Clinton a traitor, prompting an objection from the candidate.

title: Review: American Girls, on the Secret Online Lives of Teenagers
description: The murder last month of a 13-year-old Virginia girl  who had communicated with one of her suspected killers through Kik, the popular messaging app that offers its users anonymity  has reignited worries about teenagers use of social media. It is only the latest in a wave of stories that underscore the hazards facing young people in cyberspace.

title: CBS Poll Shows Donald Trump Keeping Lead Nationally
description: A new national poll from CBS News found that Donald J. Trump still holds a dominant lead atop the Republican field of presidential candidates, suggesting that he remains in a strong position ahead of the coming wave of primary elections.

title: Golden State Warriors Are Somehow Exceeding Expectations
description: After a six-day break for dunking over mascots and a 196-173 exhibition game, the N.B.A. season finally resumed on Thursday night. The symbolic halfway mark of the season is always an appropriate time to take stock. Preseason hopes have been dashed for some, while excitement is rising for others.

title: The Daily Shoe: Proenza Schouler
description: Proenza Schouler capped off one of the best shows in New York with these boots that laced up the back. As the favorite designers of the art world crowd, their orange heel seems like an abstract nod to their girls.

description: Brook Lopez had to do some research on Thursday when he learned that the Nets had hired Sean Marks to be their new general manager.

title: 1966: Refugees Flee From Viet Cong
description: BONG SON, South Vietnam  Nearly half of the An Lao valleys 10,000 residents chose to abandon their rich rice paddies today [Feb. 18] and flee from the Viet Cong. Men, women and children clutched U.S. soldiers and begged to be flown to safety. More than 4,500 refugees have streamed out of the valley since soldiers of the US 1st Air Cavalry Division came in ten days ago, a cavalry spokesman said. Today, the last cavalry troopers left the valley. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Feb. 19, 1966

title: YouTube Runs Out of Ad Inventory in Nevada and South Carolina
description: Political advertisers hoping to attach their ads to YouTube replays of Taylor Swifts Grammy speech may be out of luck in Nevada and South Carolina: Theres essentially no reserve inventory left on the popular platform ahead of the coming primary elections and caucuses there.

title: Donald Trump Turns His Fire on Nikki Haley

title: Wonkery Has A Well-Known Liberal Bias
description: Matthew Yglesias says that the Sanders campaign wont care about the warnings from top Democratic economists that its numbers are nonsense, and that it doesnt need to care. That may or may not be true  my guess is that making growth claims that are even more outlandish than those of the Republicans, and having made it impossible for progressive policy experts to offer a full-throated defense of your position, would do more harm in a general election than he imagines.

title: The Daily Jewel: Proenza Schouler
description: Proenza Schouler unearthed fools gold, tigers eye and other gemstones for its artsy, totally groovy mismatched earrings.

title: Pope Francis Suggests Donald Trump Is Not Christian
description: ABOARD THE PAPAL AIRLINER  Inserting himself into the Republican presidential race, Pope Francis on Wednesday suggested that Donald J. Trump is not Christian because of the harshness of his campaign promises to deport more immigrants and force Mexico to pay for a wall along the border.

title: Chinas Foreign Exchange Reserves Dwindling Rapidly
description: HONG KONG  As markets around the world have churned, China has long taken comfort in having what in the financial world amounts to a life preserver: its vast holdings of other countries money.

title: PEN World Voices Returns With Focus on Mexico
description: The PEN World Voices Festival has announced the schedule for its 12th annual program, from April 25 through May 1. This year the festival  begun after Sept. 11, 2001, to celebrate international literature  will include a focus on the culture and social issues of Mexico. The playwright and essayist Sabina Berman is organizing the Mexican program with the festivals director, Laszlo Jakab Orsos.

description: Please join T in welcoming our new fashion director, Marie-Amlie Sauv.

description: In the week since Kanye West debuted his new album, The Life of Pablo, with an elaborate listening session-fashion show at Madison Square Garden, the music has earned rave reviews, been featured on Saturday Night Live and inspired a rebuke from Taylor Swift onstage at the Grammy Awards.

title: Lech Walesa Faces New Accusations of Communist Collaboration
description: WARSAW  Lech Walesa, the former shipyard worker who helped bring about the collapse of Communism in Poland and then served as the countrys president, faces new accusations that he was an informant for the secret police during the Communist era.

title: SB Nation Removes Article Criticized as Sympathetic to Convicted Rapist
description: Soon after the sports website SB Nation published an article on Wednesday about Daniel Holtzclaw, a former Oklahoma City police officer convicted of raping multiple women, an editor who worked on the piece sent a laudatory email to a group of writers.

title: Donald Trump Calls Popes Criticism Disgraceful
description: Donald J. Trump said it was disgraceful that Pope Francis questioned his faith on Thursday and suggested that his presidency would be the answer to the Vaticans prayers because he would protect it from terrorists if elected.

title: Shame and Guilt Drives Several New Productions, Which Is Good for Us
description: Until the snake slithered into the picture, the Garden of Eden was a drama-free zone. It wasnt just that theater requires an audience of more than beneficent animals and foliage. How could anyone put on a gripping play without the essential elements of sin and the feelings it inspires? Wheres the drama, in other words, in a world without guilt?

title: Left-Field Musicals Take Center Stage
description: Not so long ago, it seemed as though some kind of legislation had been passed decreeing that Broadway musicals could come in only a handful of styles. The musical adapted from a popular movie. The nostalgia-driven show recycling songs from pop charts past. The Disney family spectacle. The pop-opera born of the British invasion in the 1980s, whose legacy held sway despite the failure of many imitators.

title: As Uganda Votes, Polling Stations Open Hours Late and a Candidate Is Arrested
description: KAMPALA, Uganda  Ugandans went to the polls on Thursday to choose presidential and parliamentary candidates in an election riddled with irregularities even before voting began.

title: U.S. Expands Restrictions on Visa-Waiver Program for Visitors
description: WASHINGTON  The Department of Homeland Security on Thursday added three countries to a growing list that would prohibit people who have visited those nations in the past five years from entering the United States without a visa.

title: Why Left-of-Center Wonks Are Skeptical of Bernie Sanders
description: Bernie Sanders has a problem with the liberal wonkosphere  or, more precisely, the liberal wonkosphere has a problem with Bernie Sanders.

title: Californias Gas Gusher is Stanched, But Where are Tougher U.S. Rules on Leaks?
description: What does it take to jog federal and state leaders to toughen rules curbing industrial pollution? When the industry is energy and the pollutant, methane, is invisible to the naked eye, it seems to take an awful lot.

title: Ralph Lauren: Fall 2016 RTW
description: The latest designs from Mr. Lauren.

title: On Instagram, a Street Artist Creates a Global Gallery
description: This is the first in a series of interviews with the creators of some of the most-followed accounts on Instagram  those who travel for a living, whether it be surfing down the coastline in Chile, organizing a participatory art project in Paris, or orbiting the Earth.

title: Poll Watch: A Sharp Partisan Divide Over Supreme Court Vacancy
description: The public is split on whether President Obama should nominate a new Supreme Court justice before his term ends, according to a CBS News poll released on Thursday  and that divide falls almost entirely along party lines.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Race
description: Stephen Hopkins narrates a sequence from his film Race, featuring Stephan James as Jesse Owens.

title: The Artist Who Dared to Paint Irelands Great Famine
description: HAMDEN, Conn.  It is called An Gorta Mor, or the Great Hunger, an evocative term that still fails to convey the full horror of the Irish potato famine, perhaps the single worst catastrophe in 19th-century Europe. Between 1845 and 1852, Ireland lost more than a quarter of its population to starvation, disease and emigration, while its English overlords hemmed, hawed and, in at least one prominent case, cited Gods will as justification.

title: Sidewalk Compliments
description: Occasionally, a guy in the street signals that he needs my attention. So I take off my earphones to hear what he has to say. He could be looking for directions in the big city. But usually, its, Excuse me, I just have to tell you how attractive you are. This annoys me, as if my purpose in life is to be pretty. I get that no one likes rejection. So Go away is not a polite response. But Thank you sends the wrong message. I am not thankful. These comments ruin my groove. Thoughts?

title: A.C.L.U. Challenges Kansas Voter Law Requiring Proof of Citizenship
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  In a test of Kansas wide-ranging voter registration law, a federal lawsuit filed on Thursday challenged a provision that required residents to provide proof of citizenship when they register to vote.

title: Stephen Hopkins Narrates a Scene From Race
description: The biopic Race looks at the life of the Jesse Owens, following him through his competition in the 1936 Olympic Games in Berlin, where he grabbed the worlds attention by winning four gold medals in track and field.

title: Weiner to be Shown in New Directors/New Films Series
description: Weiner, the documentary about Anthony Weiner and his wife, Huma Abedin, as they deal with a texting scandal, will make its way to New York as part of the New Directors/New Films series, organizers announced Thursday.

title: Women Denied Entry to Volleyball Event: Thats the Real Crime
description: Farah had been looking forward to this week.

description: GREENVILLE, S.C.  Moments after Senator Marco Rubio left the stage at a rally on Thursday, one of his top advisers summoned reporters and handed each of them a sheet of paper.

description: At the end of 2008, during the depths of the global financial crisis, two top officials at the law firm Dewey & LeBoeuf invited a young colleague, Zachary Warren, to dinner at Del Friscos, a Midtown Manhattan restaurant. Mr. Warren was 24 years old, a couple of years out of Stanford and headed to law school at Georgetown in the fall.

title: To Turn Out the Youth Vote
description: To the Editor:

title: Antonin Scalias Legacy, and the G.O.P. Stance on a Successor
description: To the Editor:
