description: Staples adorned classic Chelsea boots at Christopher Kanes show, for a cool (and slightly punk) look.

title: Bill Gates, the Impatient Optimist, Lays Out his Clean-Energy Innovation Agenda
description: Bill Gates added clean energy and climate change to his agenda in 2010 with a TED talk on the need for energy miracles, during which he uncapped a jarful of blinking fireflies in place of the mosquitoes he liberated in a malaria talk the year before.

title: MarquesAlmeida: Fall 2016
description: The 2015 winners of the LVMH prize, Marta Marques and Paulo Almeida present their latest collection.

title: Shake-Up Atop Tribune Publishing After a Big Investor Arrives
description: After taking over as the chief executive of Tribune Publishing in 2014, Jack Griffin withstood a string of controversies and criticisms and a decline in the companys share price to about $7 from nearly $25. The one thing he could not survive was a new investor who initially seemed like a potential savior.

title: China Maintains Respect, and a Museum, for a U.S. General
description: CHONGQING, China  Early in his tenure as commander of the United States World War II mission in China, Gen. Joseph W. Stilwell expressed a grudging fondness for the damp, ramshackle capital deep in the countrys southwest that would be his base for the next several years.

title: Bill Gates Weighs In on Apples Clash With the F.B.I.

description: President Obama sent his plan to Congress to shutter the prison in Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, and he has 5 months left to close it. What are some options for the endgame?

description: Scenes from the designers recent presentation in Kiev.

title: Ted Cruz Takes a More Aggressive Stance on Illegal Immigration
description: Senator Ted Cruz, with his campaign in turmoil and under pressure not to fall further behind Donald J. Trump, hardened his stance on illegal immigration on Monday, backing the idea that law enforcement should actively hunt down and deport millions of undocumented people.

title: Investigation Summary in the Shooting of Kenneth Releford
description: A Houston Police Department internal affairs report on the shooting of Kenneth Releford by Officer Jason W. Rosemon.

title: Gronk Cruise: 700 Patriots Fans, 13 Bars and One Rob Gronkowski
description: A three-day cruise to the Bahamas full of Patriots fans, with the fun-loving Rob Gronkowski as the star attraction. Who thought this was a good idea?

title: A Young Ukrainian Designer Cheerfully at Home in Milan
description: Its easy to feel rapturous about Milan at the Casa Galimberti, an Art Nouveau building richly painted with women posing under fruit trees. Sitting in the cafe on the ground floor on a recent afternoon, Marianna Senchina, a 25-year-old designer from Ukraine, is upbeat about the much-maligned city. Milan is full of beauty, but its in the details, she says, taking a quick sip of her espresso. People here enjoy the minute aspects of daily life  eating, conversation, dressing  even elderly women love to dress impeccably, maybe more than anyone else in the city.

title: 1916: Massive Attacks Near Verdun
description: Two things are evident from the French official communiqus issued yesterday: first, that the German offensive north of Verdun has developed into an important battle over a forty-kilomtre front; second, that French troops are holding their ground with magnificent courage and inflicting enormous losses upon the enemys very large effectives. Fighting of the most desperate and murderous description took place yesterday between Malancourt and tain, and certain German units were killed to a man.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Feb. 24, 1916

title: Internal Affairs Report on the Shooting of Omar and Rolando Ventura
description: A 2011 Houston Police Department report on a shooting by Officer Jose Coronado, Jr.

title: FIFA: Hotelier, Landlord and, Yes, Soccer Overseer
description: ZURICH  Luxury apartments, some with views of the Alps, are available in a new 10-story building here, with leases starting March 1. Tenants monthly rent payments  ranging from $3,000 to $8,000  will go to an unusual landlord: a limited-liability company owned by FIFA, soccers global governing body.

title: Christopher Kane Brings London Fashion Week to an Eclectic Ending
description: LONDON  What defines preciousness these days: gems or privacy, gold or time? The answer is in the eye and experience and desires of the individual, which creates a conundrum for a designer who is making a garment that will be valued and kept for years (at least in theory).

title: Syrian Government and Rebel Group Agree to Partial Cease-Fire
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The Syrian government and a major opposition group said on Tuesday that they will observe a conditional pause in fighting set to begin Saturday, but they also made clear that they expected the exercise to make little difference in the civil war.

title: Russia and Germany Cling to Fragile Business Ties
description: BERLIN  Martin Wansleben surveyed the crowd here last Friday, some 400 German and Russian businesspeople and politicians. Lauding the Russian economics minister for attending, he waxed nostalgic for the days of better relations and lucrative trade.

title: Adviser to Koch Brothers to Join Marco Rubios Campaign
description: Marc Short, the head of Freedom Partners, a nonprofit group that oversees the donor network of Charles and David Koch, is leaving his post to advise Senator Marco Rubios presidential campaign, two people briefed on the move said Tuesday.

title: Golden Memories
description: Matt OBrien has a very nice piece about Ted Cruz and the gold standard, and its end line is very good:

title: Jane the Virgin Season 2, Episode 12: Is Jane Still a Virgin?
description: Before we go deep into the big plot development in Janes life, lets get the others out of the way. One of the most heartbreaking story lines dealt with Rogelios proposal to Xo. They are in love but at a crossroads because he wants children and she doesnt. Xo has already raised Jane (Rogelio wasnt involved with Janes childhood) and is ready to pursue her personal interests, like singing.

title: Death of 13 Bald Eagles in Maryland Prompts an Investigation
description: The authorities are investigating the largest die-off of bald eagles in Maryland in three decades after 13 carcasses were found on the states Eastern Shore.

title: In Mens Dressing, Reinventing So-Cal Chic
description: Daring, intuitive combinations of bold retro prints give the classic California skater vibe a fresh kick.

title: London Stock Exchange in Merger Talks With Deutsche Brse
description: Four years ago, Deutsche Brse called off an effort to merge with the parent of the New York Stock Exchange after European antitrust regulators threatened to block the combination.

title: 1941: Duce Says Nazi Troops in Libya
description: ROME  American help cannot possibly save Great Britain from defeat at the hands of an invincible Axis military machine, Premier Benito Mussolini told 5,000 Roman Fascists in the Adriano Theater here this afternoon [Feb. 23] and countless thousands more who heard the speech by radio in all parts of Italy and in Germany.

title: Policy Shifts on Refugees Lead to Clashes Between Migrants and Police
description: PARIS  A decision by the Macedonian authorities to block thousands of Afghan asylum seekers from crossing into the country from Greece set off clashes between migrants and the police on Tuesday, highlighting the challenges facing European nations as they seek to check the flow of people to the Continent.

title: Realistic Growth Prospects
description: God, I cant wait for the primary to be over, one way or the other. But it does seem to me that I should talk a bit about what a progressive reasonably can say about prospects for economic growth under a better policy regime.

title: Spike Lee, in Radio Ad, Endorses My Brother Bernie Sanders
description: Senator Bernie Sanders has a fellow son of Brooklyn making new radio ads on his behalf: Spike Lee.

title: Unlikely Battle Over Fracking Intensifies in Florida
description: MIAMI  With geology akin to a wet sponge and fragile underground aquifers that supply almost all its drinking water, Florida has never been considered part of the agitated battle over fracking as a technology for extracting oil and gas.

title: Major David Hockney Show Planned for Tate Britain
description: LONDON  Tate Britain will host a major exhibition dedicated to the artist David Hockney in 2017, the museum announced.

title: London Fashion Week: Erdem, Burberry and Christopher Kane in Pictures
description: A photo diary of the fall/winter 2016 collections that were presented yesterday.

title: European Tech Scene Begins to Feel Silicon Valleys Woes
description: LONDON  At the offices of Deliveroo, a food delivery start-up with headquarters in an upmarket neighborhood here, signs of activity are everywhere. The communal kitchen hums with 20-something developers. A gold-painted scooter, which the co-founder William Shu once used to make deliveries, stands in the center of the office as people bustle about.

title: Landmark Status Is Urged for 30 New York City Properties
description: The neon Pepsi sign on the Queens waterfront, the Bergdorf Goodman department store on Fifth Avenue and parts of the Green-Wood Cemetery in Brooklyn are on their way to becoming New York City landmarks. They are among 30 properties scattered across the five boroughs that the Landmarks Preservation Commission, at a marathon meeting on Tuesday, decided were worthy of protection.

title: Little Pepper
description: Fiery flavors at this Sichuan restaurant in College Point, Queens.

title: Little Pepper Packs More Than Heat in College Point
description: Little Pepper began life a dozen years ago in the competitive Chinese nucleus of downtown Flushing, Queens. Five years ago, Cheng Ying Wu and her husband, Gui Ping Huang, the owners, moved it northwest to College Point, where its nearest rival is a graffiti-scrawled storefront across the street selling takeout chop suey and chow mein. Little Pepper is not entirely free of American Chinese food, but its pork lo mein is not one of its chief attractions.

title: Mogul Seeks $30 Million From California to Give Beach Access
description: A Silicon Valley venture capitalist, locked in a battle with the State of California over access to a prime stretch of beach that was popular with surfers, swimmers and fishermen before he bought it and closed it, has proposed a price to restore public access: $30 million.

title: Cape Coverage
description: Capes have proven to be a real trend on the fall 2016 runways in London.

title: Trumps Letter to Giuliani and the Response
description: Donald J. Trump wrote a letter to Rudolph W. Giuliani in 1996 with two checks totaling $6,900 to support the mayor in his re-election bid. The money was returned, according to Mr. Giulianis public archives.

title: Donald Trump in New York: Deep Roots, but Little Influence
description: It is impossible to miss when you fly into New York City and spot the golf course in the shadow of the Whitestone Bridge. It is hard to avoid when you stroll along Fifth Avenue, or venture past the skating rink or carousel in Central Park. And it is there in bright lights, no less, when you pass the sleek hotel near the entrance to the Holland Tunnel: the name of Donald J. Trump.

title: Behind Ted Cruzs Campaign Manager, Scorched Earth and Election Victories
description: For weeks, the labels have hung over Ted Cruzs presidential campaign like dirty laundry: Deceitful. Cynical. Willing to do anything to win.

title: Take Two: James Franco and Augusten Burroughs
description: James Franco and Augusten Burroughs face off on face masks, cheeky dishware and more.

title: The Case for the Cape
description: LONDON  There has been much chatter in recent seasons about the great gender crossover, that deliberate erosion on the runways of a once-rigid demarcation between conventionally feminine and masculine clothes.

title: The Plan for Closing Guantnamo Bay Prison
description: The Defense Department is submitting this plan to Congress for closing the prison at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba. President Obama said the proposal has his whole support.

title: How Should Asian-Americans Feel About the Peter Liang Protests?
description: Read in Chinese |

title: Questions Linger Over Russias Endgame in Syria, Ukraine and Europe
description: MOSCOW  The partial truce that Russia and the United States have thrashed out in Syria capped something of a foreign policy trifecta for President Vladimir V. Putin, with the Kremlin strong-arming itself into a pivotal role in the Middle East, Ukraine floundering and the European Union developing cracks like a badly glazed pot.

title: The Latest in Science Fiction and Fantasy
description: In a typical young adult disaster novel, society collapses and survival depends on a young womans guts (and maybe her ability to pick a good love interest). Yet too often the world seems to end, and to exist, only for pleasantly middle-class communities, nuclear families and otherwise normal people by the standards of American media: white, straight, cisgender, abled and at least well-off enough that square meals arent rare. Everybody else is mysteriously gone long before the apocalypse comes.

title: Old Hollywood Buildings Get Makeovers and Turn Creative
description: LOS ANGELES  The former prop house at 720 North Cahuenga Boulevard was once old Hollywood. Into the 1990s, it housed props from police shows like Hill Street Blues.

title: Until There Is Justice, by Jennifer Scanlon
description: Jennifer Scanlons biography of the African-American activist Anna Arnold Hedgeman, who died in 1990, is long overdue. Over her career, Hedgeman pushed for civil rights legislation with Martin Luther King Jr.; pressured New York City politicians to make good on their promises for equal opportunity in housing, employment and education; and featured prominently in national politics, serving as the Democratic Partys strategist for organizing the black vote in the 1948 election, and as an appointee in health and human services after World War II. Her feminism informed her decision to be a founding member of the National Organization for Women (NOW), yet she also sustained ties with the more moderate National Council of Churches. Nevertheless, despite her influence, Hedgeman remains relatively unknown.

title: Ben Carson Says Obama Cant Identify With Black Experience Because He Was Raised White
description: Ben Carson, the retired neurosurgeon whose presidential campaign is on life support, said in an interview that was published on Tuesday that President Obama does not identify with the black experience because he was raised white.

title: Sunnys Nights, by Tim Sultan
description: There are many pitfalls to writing a memoir about a bar. Theres predictability. Theres the temptation to glorify the atmosphere, to overromanticize the drinking or the salt-of-the-earthiness of the patrons. Theres the idea that everything about drunks and drinking has already been written perfectly by Bukowski, so forget it.

title: How to Get Rid of a Tattoo Youve Outgrown
description: Years after Carly Cardellino quit her college sorority, she couldnt leave behind one piece of it: a teal star and a red heart outlined in black, the groups symbol, which she had spent $50 to have tattooed on her left foot during her sophomore year.

title: Removing Ink: Do You Need a Doctor?
description: In essence, laser tattoo removal is touching a wand to a patch of skin. The procedure is regulated by states, many of which allow laser operators to work after as little as 16 hours of hands-on training.

title: The Sunny Side of Los Angeles
description: If the nation has a capital of breakfast R&D, this could be it.

title: Los Angeles: City of Breakfast
description: LOS ANGELES  One thing becomes clear when you go out for breakfast here, whether you join the hordes waiting in line at Sqirl, Rpublique and Eggslut, or linger among the regulars sipping cold brew and finessing their Instagram still lifes on the patio at Gjusta, in the booths at Jon & Vinnys, and up and down the white picnic tables of Trois Familia:

title: Kurdish Fighters Rescue Swedish Teenager in Iraq
description: BAGHDAD  Kurdish special forces rescued a teenage Swedish girl from Islamic State-controlled territory near the city of Mosul, officials said on Tuesday.

title: Off the Runway, London Fashion Week
description: Mulberrys hall of mirrors, fine detailing at J.W. Anderson and Alexander McQueen, Paul Smiths projections and more.

title: The Big Beat Celebrates Fats Domino, Rocks Reclusive Giant
description: Elvis Presley often referred to Fats Domino as the real king of rock n roll, but this octogenarian musical royal has led a relatively sedate life, especially compared with high-flying contemporaries like Chuck Berry, Jerry Lee Lewis and Little Richard. Perhaps thats why this New Orleans piano legends impact is often overlooked.

title: Karlie Kloss and Natalia Vodianova at Fabulous Fund Fair
description: Supermodels and fashion designers raise money for the Naked Heart Foundation in London.

title: When in Bangkok, Consider a Thai Tattoo
description: After years of shuttling guests to Buddhist temples to be inked by monks trained in an ancient style called sak yant, the Siam Hotel decided to invite a former monk named Ajahn Boo to set up a studio in its spa. According to sak yant tradition, the design and placement of these enduring souvenirs  believed to offer mystical powers, protection and luck  are mostly in the hands of the tattooer. The American tattoo artist Scott Campbell recently experimented with a similar concept, offering free tattoos to anyone willing to blindly put their arm through a hole in a wall and accept whatever he created.

title: G.O.P. Senators Say Obama Supreme Court Pick Will Be Rejected
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Republican leaders said Tuesday that there would be no confirmation hearings, no vote, not even a courtesy meeting with President Obamas nominee to replace Justice Antonin Scalia, all but slamming shut any prospects for an election-year Supreme Court confirmation.

title: CBS Films Aims to Recreate Shootout After Boston Marathon Bombing
description: For a coming film about the 2013 Boston Marathon bombing, CBS Films is seeking permission to recreate the night of terror in Watertown, Mass., the suburb where police engaged in a shootout with the bombers.

title: The Great Bagel Diaspora
description: Though New Yorkers have long insisted that the only real bagels can be found in the five boroughs (with a begrudging acknowledgment of Montreals skinnier, sweeter version), young bakers in the farthest corners of the world are making serious dough.

title: Group Predicts 17 Percent Increase in Latino Vote From 2012
description: The number of Latino voters has been steadily rising in presidential elections, and now the Naleo Educational Fund, a national bipartisan Latino group, has estimated that at least 13.1 million Latinos will vote in November, a 17 percent increase over their turnout in 2012. That would increase their composition of the countrys electorate to 9 percent.

title: Egyptian Military Calls Toddlers Life Sentence for Murder a Mistake
description: CAIRO  As alibis go, this one would seem to be airtight: Your honor, my client was only a year old at the time of the crime.

title: Woman Exonerated After Serving 10 Years for Manslaughter Conviction
description: In a gray suit, her short hair neatly curled, Vanessa Gathers sat in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn on Tuesday, beaming as the judge spoke words she had waited nearly two decades to hear: The manslaughter conviction for which she had spent 10 years in prison was vacated, the judge said, after an investigation revealed that her confession to the crime was false.

title: 3 Steps to Brewing a Better Cup of Coffee
description: Changes in roasts, brewing gear and brewing techniques have made things interesting in the morning.

title: Rivals No More, Marco Rubio and Jeb Bush Talk and Agree to Meet
description: LAS VEGAS  Since Jeb Bushs withdrawal from the presidential race on Saturday, endorsements from prominent Republicans have been piling up for Senator Marco Rubio of Florida.

description: The University of Oklahoma said Tuesday that it had agreed on the terms under which it will return a Pissarro painting to a Jewish family whose relatives had their artworks looted by the Nazis.

title: Squire Patton Boggs to Acquire San Francisco Law Firm
description: Squire Patton Boggs, a law firm that was built on powerhouse lobbying in Washington but later encountered turbulence as the legal economy shifted, is acquiring a smaller firm based in San Francisco, Carroll, Burdick & McDonough.

description: At the risk offlogging adead parrot, let me rise briefly to the defense of my pundits fantasy from yesterday against Noah Millmans withering attack. Millman makes two arguments against Marco Rubio offering John Kasich the veep slot. First, that it would help Ted Cruz:

title: Estela Owners Branch Out With Caf Altro Paradiso
description: Caf Altro Paradiso The airy, generously windowed, high-ceilinged space for the new restaurant from Ignacio Mattos and Thomas Carter is a far cry from Estela, their railroad flat overlooking East Houston Street. Though thoroughly Italian, with 1930s modern light fixtures copied from the main post office in Palermo, Sicily, it also suggests a welcoming Parisian brasserie, all in keeping with its Art Deco-era building. Like the setting, Mr. Mattoss cooking respects tradition (Its the foundation for the classics, he said) but allows him to go lighter at many junctures. One example he cited is his amatriciana, which uses lardo in place of guanciale and spaghetti alla chitarra instead of bucatini. Also on the menu are a fennel salad with olives and provolone, mushroom and onion fritto misto with lemon; and grilled swordfish with artichokes, raisins and almonds. Mr. Mattos covers Italy from north to south, including the liver-and-onion classic fegato alla Veneziana: 234 Spring Street (Avenue of the Americas), 646-952-0828, altroparadiso.com.

title: N.H.L. This Week: Third Outdoor Game Has a Back Story
description: Every Tuesday, The New York Times will look at the week ahead in the N.H.L., highlighting hot  or not so hot  teams and players. (All times Eastern.)

title: Nilou Motamed Is the New Editor of Food & Wine Magazine
description: Three months after Dana Cowin announced her resignation as editor of Food & Wine magazine, the magazines parent company, Time Inc., named Nilou Motamed as her successor. She will start on March 14, and the July issue will be the first under her imprint.

title: Measuring Donald Trumps Supporters for Intolerance
description: Exit poll data from the South Carolina primary revealed that nearly half the Republicans who turned out on Saturday wanted undocumented immigrants to be deported immediately. Donald Trump won 47 percent of those voters.

title: No Grand Opening Planned for $4 Billion Transit Hub
description: The ceremonial groundbreaking for the World Trade Center Transportation Hub in 2005 drew in the federal transportation secretary, four United States senators (Hillary Clinton among them), the governors of New York and New Jersey, the mayor of New York City and two Nassau County homing pigeons masquerading as doves.

title: Facts & Figures: Majority of Americans Say Senate Should Vote on Supreme Court Nominee
description: Fifty-six percent of Americans think the Senate should consider and vote on President Obamas nominee to replace Justice Antonin Scalia on the Supreme Court, according to a recent Pew survey. Thirty-eight percent think the process should be delayed until the next president is elected, as Mitch McConnell and other Republicans in the Senate have argued.

title: Tension on the Red Carpet: Looking Ahead to the Oscars
description: The Oscars are days away and you can bet your bottom dollar that every single prognosticator, contender and awards campaigner is fried. That includes me.

title: The Secret to Good Toast? Its Your Freezer
description: Toast lovers, I have a modest proposal for you: Do not bother with bad bread. Say goodbye to sweet, cottony, lightweight toast, the kind that squishes under a butter knife or slumps under a blanket of jam.

title: U.S. Strikes Help Break Impasse and Restore Power to Kabul
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  United States airstrikes have helped to break a bloody impasse between Afghan troops and Taliban militants north of Kabul, allowing repair crews to reach downed power lines and restore electricity to the capital after more than three weeks of disruption, an Afghan official said on Tuesday.

title: Queens Man, 40, Sentenced for Killing His Parents
description: A Queens man was sentenced in State Supreme Court on Tuesday to 50 years to life in prison for beating and drowning his mother and then, more than a year later, smothering his father in his bed.

title: C.D.C. Investigating 14 New Reports of Zika Transmission Through Sex
description: Health authorities in the United States said they were investigating 14 new reports of the Zika virus possibly being transmitted by sex, including to pregnant women. If confirmed, the unexpectedly high number would have major implications for controlling the virus, which is usually spread by mosquito bites.

title: Merger of Time Inc. and Yahoo Could Repeat a Disaster
description: If tragedy plus time equals comedy, what does Yahoo plus Time equal? Maybe the same thing, or worse.

description: Exploring an exotic underworld off Thailand, which includes pharaoh cuttlefish, bigeye snapper and myriad other types of fish.

title: To Carry the Day, Racers Must Fill Their Packs Carefully
description: INTERNATIONAL FALLS, Minn.  In this race, the weather forecast is watched more closely than the clock. Held here in January near the Canadian border, a change in temperature can have a demoralizing effect on the competitors in the Arrowhead Ultra 135.

title: Finra Begins a Review of Brokerage Firm Culture
description: The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority has begun a formal review of cultural values at more than a dozen brokerage firms, including how executives identify rogue employees whose actions contradict company policy.

title: Plan to Prop Up Oil Prices Wont Have Support From Saudis
description: HOUSTON  Saudi Arabias petroleum minister on Tuesday ruled out the possibility that a recently announced oil production freeze by several countries might lead to cuts to reverse the plunge in oil prices.

title: Treating Attention Deficit
description: To the Editor:

title: A Guide to This Weeks Extraordinary FIFA Congress
description: ZURICH  In a sport that has been noticeably slow to embrace technology, it should not be surprising that Fridays vote for soccers highest office  FIFA president, which entails leading a multibillion-dollar organization atop the worlds most popular game  resembles a small-town student council election.

title: Whole Grain Blueberry Muffins
description: Julia Moskin makes whole grain blueberry muffins with a crunchy orange streusel top.

title: A Good Muffin Doesnt Have to Be Bad for You
description: The New American Breakfast is, no doubt, a wonderful thing. Bone broth, green juice, salmon jerky and medium-chain triglyceride oils will soon make us a faster, thinner and sharper nation. The Old American Breakfast  with sweet indulgences like sticky buns, doughnuts, pancakes and waffles  has been labeled hazmat by nutrition authorities, and rightly so.

title: Girl, 2, Found Dead Under Bed After Brooklyn Fire
description: A fire swept through an apartment in Brooklyn on Tuesday morning, but firefighters were able to get it under control quickly. The authorities said it was extinguished within about 30 minutes, and they were soon able to clear the scene.

title: Signature Bank Sued Over Connection to Ponzi Scheme
description: Signature Bank has been a darling of Wall Street in the 15 years since it opened its first branch in Manhattan.

title: Peter Mondavi, Who Helped Put Napa Valley on Wine Industry Map, Dies at 101
description: Peter Mondavi Sr., who, with his brother, Robert, made the Charles Krug winery an early leader in the Napa Valleys rise as a great wine region before the two had a bitter falling out, died on Saturday at his home in St. Helena, Calif. He was 101.

title: What Roles Get Black Actors to the Oscars?
description: Heres a look at roles performed by black artists who have been nominated for a best actress or best actor Oscar  and what they have in common.

title: Threes a Trend: Dark, Romantic  and Lacy
description: Goth was all over the runway in New York  and the trend popped up again in London, but with a romantic touch. At Preen by Thornton Bregazzi (left), the designers Justin Thornton and Thea Bregazzi showed a tulle and silk dress layered over a pair of sequin hot pants. at Alexander McQueen (right), Sarah Burton included a sweet sheer cocktail number with a Victorian collar and billowy sleeves. And at Erdem (center), a floor-sweeping look, made out of different panels of sheer fabrics, was stitched with embroidered flowers.

title: In Court, Man Accused of Hate-Crime Killing Blames the Victim
description: Danny Robinson remained resolute as he sat in the witness box in a Manhattan courtroom on Tuesday and fielded a barrage of questions from Elliot Morales.

title: Race in America: Your Stories
description: A series of videos featuring personal stories that reflect the breadth of experiences in the United States.

title: Review: Iggy Pop Salutes David Bowie at Tibet House Concert
description: Iggy Pop turned the 26th annual Tibet House U.S. Benefit Concert into a full-fledged rock show at Carnegie Hall on Monday night. When the band started the blues shuffle of David Bowies The Jean Genie, the audience was eager to dance, clap, whoop and sing along, and soon there was a rush of fans down the aisles. For a Carnegie crowd, it was the equivalent of a riot.

title: Judiciary Committee Letter Opposing Supreme Court Hearings
description: Republican senators on the Judiciary Committee sent this letter to the Senate majority leader, Mitch McConnell, vowing not to hold hearings on a nominee to replace Justice Antonin Scalia.

title: Seize the Morning: The Case for Breakfast
description: I used to work nights. You can draw that card at a newspaper, same as you might in a hospital or police station, in a factory or a financial house doing business in markets that hum while the rest of America sleeps. I did not cook dinner much then. Night work makes cooking dinner more than a chore. Often, it makes it impossible.

title: Nudges Arent Enough for Problems Like Retirement Savings
description: Why dont Americans save more for old age? Even when their employers promise to match their savings, workers often fail to salt away their earnings for the future, inexplicably leaving money on the table.

title: Feb. 23, 2016  Photos of the Day
description: Photos from Greece, Russia, Spain and Italy.

title: 30 Years After Revolution, Some Filipinos Yearn for Golden Age of Marcos
description: MANILA  As Filipinos prepare for the 30th anniversary on Thursday of the People Power revolution that toppled Ferdinand E. Marcos, the Marcos family legacy is undergoing a political renaissance by those who claim it was a golden age of peace and prosperity.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Fernando Cardenal, Nicaraguan Priest Who Defied Pope, Dies at 82
description: The Rev. Fernando Cardenal, a son of privilege who embraced Latin Americas poor as a revolutionary priest and brazenly defied Pope John Paul IIs order to quit Nicaraguas leftist cabinet in the 1980s, died on Feb. 20 in Managua. He was 82.

title: TodayTix Makes Inroads Into Broadways Ticketing Business
description: A theater industry start-up that is trying to corner a share of the byzantine Broadway ticketing business has raised nearly $16 million in venture capital and has expanded beyond New York to four other American cities and to London.

title: Review: The Lonely City, a Personal Study of Urban Isolation
description: Its impossible to walk for long in New York City without passing someone who looks sad and alone and shrunken, like a snail thats been salted. Some days, you suspect you are that snail.

title: Viacom Says It Will Sell a Stake in Paramount
description: Viacom announced on Tuesday that it was pursuing a deal to sell a minority stake in its Paramount Pictures film and television studio after being approached by several strategic investors.

title: Review: Maria Hassabis Plastic Sends Dancers Crawling Through MoMA
description: It takes about 15 seconds, walking at a relaxed pace, to descend the stairs leading from the atrium of the Museum of Modern Art to the ground-floor lobby. On Sunday afternoon, the dancer Oisin Monaghan spent over an hour on that route, sliding down the steps through a glacial series of reclining, prone and seated poses. Visitors came and went, with some pausing to study his often-motionless body  was he sleeping? injured?  and others passing by unfazed. When he reached the bottom, he stood up and walked away. The next day, he would do it again.

title: Indias Literary Festivals Multiply Amid Anxiety Over Free Expression
description: JAIPUR, India  Literary notables including Margaret Atwood, Aleksandar Hemon and Thomas Piketty came to this northern city toward the end of January, appearing before large crowds at the Diggi Palace, an 18th-century complex temporarily filled with tents, food kiosks and bookstores. Some 330,000 people showed up, breaking the attendance record and once again making the Jaipur Literature Festival the largest event of its kind in the world.

title: A Composer and His Wife: Creativity Through Kink
description: The OkCupid message Mollena Williams received in December 2013 was, in some ways, standard. It was complimentary: Wow  your profile is great. It was confident: I am an artist, very successful (probably member of the top 10 or 20 in my genre in the world). It was polite, signing off with warm wishes.

title: As News Media Changes, Bernie Sanderss Critique Remains Constant
description: More than three decades before he became a familiar face on Sunday morning shows, cable television news and the late-night comedy circuit, Bernie Sanders made no secret of his contempt for commercial TV.

title: The Rest of the World Gets a Breather as Republican Presidential Candidates Attack One Another
description: Immigrants, Muslims, Syrian refugees and the poor got a relative pass this week as the Republican presidential front-runners instead attacked one another.

title: Review: In The Last Class: A Jazzercize Play, Clutching to the Past
description: My students are my success! the Jazzercise instructor cries as they move to the music. My students are my success!

title: The Model Whose Lips Spurred Racist Comments Speaks Out
description: By the time New York Fashion Week wrapped up late last week, the model Aamito Lagum, 23 years old and a native of Kampala, Uganda, had walked the runway for J. Mendel, Tadashi Shoji, Kanye Wests Yeezy line and Ohne Titel, even winning a coveted spot as the show closer for Zac Posen.

title: JPMorgan Tries to Calm Investors on Its Outlook and Oil Defenses
description: JPMorgan Chase executives painted a positive picture of the American economy and the banks business at their annual investor day, but they failed to beat back the pessimism that has battered bank shares and the broader stock market in recent months.

title: Chinese Deals Feel the Chill From Washington
description: As growth slows at home, more and more Chinese companies are looking to do deals in the United States. And they are increasingly running smack into the American national security apparatus.

title: Fired M.T.A. Driver Rode Off in Bus After Being Told Not to Smoke, Police Say

description: WASHINGTON  As the Senate banking committee convened earlier this month to listen to testimony from Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, Senator Sherrod Brown of Ohio, the highest-ranking Democrat on the committee, all but dusted off the chairs and shook moths from the curtains.

title: Against Barcelona, Arsenal Gives Up 2 Goals and Possibly All Hope
description: LONDON  More than 50 years ago, European soccers governing body instituted a quirky regulation designed to break ties in the two-game, home-and-home aggregate series that are so common in soccer. The away-goals rule, as it has become known, is, on the surface, quite simple: If two teams score the same number of goals over two games, the team that scores more away from home advances.

title: Barbara M. Clark, New York Assemblywoman, Dies at 76

title: Where to Put Sewage Tank Snags Gowanus Canal Cleanup

description: Dan OBriens The Body of an American, a lyrical, untidy and ultimately poignant work of theater is a ghost story. It is also a true story.

title: Review: In Dot, a Fading Matriarch Brings a Family Together
description: One minute, Dottys eyes are clear, and her mind is as steely sharp as her tongue. A minute later, clouds seem to shroud those big, bright peepers, and she has the bewildered look of a toddler whos lost track of her mother at the mall. Dotty (Marjorie Johnson), the widowed matriarch of a black middle-class family from Philadelphia, is 65, and although she mostly avoids directly admitting it to anyone  sometimes even to herself  she has Alzheimers.

title: Goes Underwater
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  I dont know about you, but I knew this fun, midweek puzzle by Ruth Margolin was going to be trouble for me as soon as I had difficulty solving 1 Across. That kind of thing will shake the confidence of even a veteran solver, but we have a lot of new solvers joining us every day, so lets talk about it.

title: Bonnie Raitt on Time, Loss and Renewal on Dig in Deep
description: The Ones We Couldnt Be, the final track on Bonnie Raitts soul-rattling new album, Dig in Deep, is a rueful hymn to what might have been. My glass is raised for all the ways/We tried to get it right, she sings, sifting through the remnants of a relationship that could be romantic or familial.

title: Takata Faked Test Data a Year After Airbag Recalls, Report Says

title: 'The People v. O.J. Simpson Episode 4: The Rise of Cochran
description: Didnt O. J. Simpson have so much fun in the early 90s? Dancing in formation to C+C Music Factory in a club, snorting lines of cocaine off womens breasts, flooding the V.I.P. area with Robert Kardashian and all of their new club friends. Its almost too bad a trial for double murder ruined all of his fun. At least, thats what this flashback was meant to illustrate  the stark contrast between O.J.s formerly opulent life and his currently bleak prison situation. Instead it has me asking: Who eats oysters in a dance club?

title: Sergey Kalinin Helps the Devils Fortify Their Playoff Bid

He said he knew he had notched a Gordie Howe Hat Trick.

title: Nepal: Plane Carrying 23 Is Missing
description: A passenger plane carrying 23 people lost contact minutes after takeoff and is missing in mountainous territory, officials here said. The plane, a Tara Air flight from Pokhara to Jomsom, took off at 7:50 a.m. and vanished 11 minutes later, said Pavan Gautam, an air traffic controller at the Tribhuvan International Airport in Kathmandu. Mr. Gautam said two helicopters had been deployed for search and rescue operations. Among the 23 people on board were two infants, he said.

A few terrifying encounters with the bears, though, changed his mind about that.

title: Scandals

There was my personal bankruptcy; then, how I had to leave Princeton because of my drunken brawls with colleagues. I thought that was as good as it was going to get. But now Im hearing that Ive received lavish favors from Donald Trump, including stays at his properties and gaming chips.

title: Echo Echo, by Marilyn Singer
description: Marilyn Singers ingenious reverso poems are child-friendly feats of verbal pyrotechnics: They can be read from the top down or the bottom up, with just small changes of punctuation and capitalization. Reading in each direction yields a completely different meaning and point of view. Singer keeps the poems to a dozen or so mostly short lines, some just one word long, so they look spacious on the page and are easily accessible to younger child readers. Her first two collections, Mirror Mirror and Follow Follow, retold classic fairy tales. Now shes plunging into Greek mythology with Echo, Echo, and the results are just as much fun, no matter the age of the reader. The economical summary of each myth at the bottom of the page is a special bonus for those of us who can never quite keep straight certain crucial details and plot lines. After spending time with this book, I may never again confuse Eurydice and Persephone.

title: Bringing Artisanal Baking Down South
description: As any barbecue connoisseur, dedicated sopper-up of potlikker, hot-chicken junkie or tracker of buttermilk pie can tell you, a culinary revival is underway in the South. Over the past decade, the regions comprising that corner of the country have been archiving and building on their agrarian heritage and gastronomic contributions. Amid the keepers of the pit-masters flames are a few pioneers, like Atlantas Ben and Jennifer Johnson, who see the wave of revitalization as a chance to integrate newer dining trends and foreign flavors into their city.

title: 1941: London Rehearses Gas Attack
description: LONDON  London had its first test alarm with real but non-lethal gas today [Feb. 24]. Air-raid precautions workers splashed a small quantity of diluted mustard gas in a roped-off section of Pimlico, and then went to work to demonstrate how the various units would function in case of a real gas alarm. For several hours the wrecked section of the street, from which the public was barred, was filled with grotesque masked figures clothed in anti-gas uniforms  rubber capes, trousers, boots and gloves, tin helmets and the all-important gas mask.New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Feb. 25, 1941

title: 1966: Wilson Bars Spy Exchange
description: LONDON  Prime Minister Harold Wilson was reported today to have rejected a jailed Briton in exchange for Peter and Helen Kroger, two Americans serving 20 year sentences in Britain for spying for the Soviet Union. An authoritative source said the Russians made the suggestion for the exchange through diplomatic channels. Specifically they asked that a British lecturer, Gerald Brooke, detained for five years on charges of helping to distribute anti-Soviet propaganda, should be swapped for the Krogers, whose real names are Lona and Morris Cohen.New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Feb. 25, 1966

title: This Spring, All About Robert Mapplethorpe and Tom of Finland
description: In her memoir Just Kids, Patti Smith recounts a day in the 1960s when she and her then-boyfriend Robert Mapplethorpe scoured the used-paperback stalls of Times Square, looking for inspiration. Robert, she writes, found a few loose pages from a portfolio of sketches of Aryan boys in motorcycle caps by Tom of Finland. Touko Tom of Finland Laaksonens work  stylized drawings of hypermasculine gay figures that turned postwar gay stereotypes on their head  would come to have a great impact on Mapplethorpes famously explicit photographs of male nudes, which were at the center of the culture war of the late 80s and early 90s. (Jesse Helms famously waved them on the Senate floor as an argument against public funding for the arts.)

title: The Outcome of the Landmark Meeting
description: New York Citys Landmarks Preservation Commission took a step toward deciding the fates of 95 properties that have been stuck in limbo.

title: A New Home for Pace Gallery in Palo Alto
description: For the last two years, the Pace gallery has used a former Tesla showroom in Menlo Park, Calif., to showcase technology-driven or innovation-heavy installations in what they called a pop-up gallery. Exhibitions have featured work by Alexander Calder, Tara Donovan and the Japanese group teamLab.

title: Make Breakfast.
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Review: School of Seven Bells Has a Final Album With a Sad Back Story
description: SVIIB

title: Aroldis Chapman Unlikely to Be Barred During Yankees Preseason
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Any suspension of Yankees reliever Aroldis Chapman by Commissioner Rob Manfred under Major League Baseballs domestic violence policy would be unlikely to begin before opening day, according to a baseball official who spoke on the condition of anonymity.

title: Bernie Sanders Ties Hillary Clinton to Poverty Caused by Welfare Reform
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont began his day of campaigning Wednesday by criticizing Hillary Clintons support of welfare reform in 1996, accusing her of backing legislation that ultimately increased poverty levels and led more Americans to face economic anxiety.

title: Bare Lit Festival, for Minority Writers, to Make Debut in London
description: The Bare Lit Festival, which is devoted to minority writers, willhaveits debut Friday in central London.

title: Questlove Tries His Hand at Housewares
description: Ahmir Questlove Thompson knows a thing or two about tables that turn. Its fitting, then, that the Roots frontmans first non-music, non-sneaker-related design takes the form of a Lazy Susan. The idea came to him after the Les Ateliers Courbet founder Melanie Courbet brought a rotating tray to one of Thompsons so-called food salons; they partnered on a set of handcrafted round, black-and-white inlaid Corian meant to resemble the strobe disks employed by D.J.s to ensure a perfect 33 and 1/3 r.p.m.

title: Profile in Style: Questlove
description: The musical polymath talks about his (several) other passions, his unintentional signature look and what obscure music genre hes collecting now.

title: Questlove on His Signature Look  and What Hes Collecting
description: The musical polymath talks about his (several) other passions, his unintentional signature look and what obscure music genre hes collecting now.

title: U.S. Asks Tech and Entertainment Industries Help in Fighting Terrorism
description: Obama administration officials met with executives of major technology and entertainment companies in Washington on Wednesday to discuss combating the activities of violent extremists online, according to industry and government officials.

title: One Is Not Enough: 3 Fellows Named to Honor David Carrs Legacy
description: The applications, more than 600 of them, came from all over the world, and from every corner of journalism. A magazine writer in Nigeria who focused on the exploitation of women. A computer data specialist from Texas. A videographer in Colombia and a documentarian in Myanmar. Undergraduates from Duke, Temple and Iowa State.

title: With E.U. Paralyzed, 10 Nations Try to Stem Migrant Flow
description: BERLIN  Austria and nine Balkan states on Wednesday agreed on several measures to choke off the flow of refugees from Greece, effectively imposing their own response to the migrant crisis while the European Union has been paralyzed over what to do.

title: Im Mad Today... Andrew Rosenthal on Gitmo and Trump. And the Good News.
description: Im mad today about the fact that the United States Senate and United States House of Representatives are about to miss an opportunity to close down the Guantnamo Bay prison camp, says The Timess editorial page editor, Andrew Rosenthal, in this short podcast on the news: the good, the bad and the most maddening.

title: Texas Court Dismisses Criminal Case Against Rick Perry
description: HOUSTON  The highest criminal court in Texas dismissed a case against former Gov. Rick Perry on Wednesday, apparently ending the long-running abuse-of-power accusations that dogged Mr. Perry during his failed run for the Republican nomination for president. In its ruling, the court tossed the one remaining charge against Mr. Perry and upheld the previous dismissal of a second charge by a lower court.

title: Treating Incontinence in Women with Osteoporosis
description: Many women with osteoporosis also suffer from incontinence. Now a Canadian clinical trial has found that simple pelvic floor muscle training can significantly reduce leakage episodes.

title: Guccis 70 Shades of Renaissance
description: MILAN  It began with some boosterism and a success story; with lobster and lambs lettuce and lots of chiffon. Political power met economic power in a tag-team display of mutual appreciation as the big guns came out for the first day of Milan Fashion Week. Then Alessandro Michele, the creative director of Gucci, put some silk poppies on top.

title: Lessons From Game Theory: What Keeps Kasich in the Race?
description: The Republican establishment has a problem. It is headed for a car crash.

title: Marco Rubio Gets Partys Blessing, but Not Voters
description: Senator Marco Rubio has persuaded wealthy donors, Republican Party elders and his colleagues in Congress that he represents their best chance to overtake the seemingly invincible force that is Donald J. Trump.

title: A Radical Idea to Rebuild a Shattered Libya: Restore the Monarchy
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  The deserted royal palace here, hidden behind locked gates and an overgrown garden, stands as a monument to Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis virulent rejection of Libyas monarchy.

title: Gucci: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Alessandro Michele shows his fall designs.

title: Five Spring Trends for Men
description: Conventional classics come undone for a look of louche elegance.

title: The Oscar Party No One Knows
description: LOS ANGELES  Bryan Cranston, Lou Gossett Jr., Harry Hamlin, Lou Diamond Phillips, Patrick Warburton, Dan Lauria, Samm Levine and Alex Trebek were sitting at a large oval table in the dining nook of a Westside condo on a recent Wednesday night, playing seven-card stud poker.

title: Exploring Tuscany in Winter
description: Absence  of crowds, cars and commotion  can make the heart grow fonder for the Tuscan off-season.

title: Senate Republicans Lose Their Minds on a Supreme Court Seat
description: Following the death of Justice Antonin Scalia, Senate Republicans apparently believe they can profit by creating a political crisis that the nation has never seen before. On Tuesday, the leadership doubled down on its refusal to take any action on any nominee from President Obama to replace Justice Scalia.

title: Banca Privada Gets Money-Laundering Designation Dropped
description: Small overseas firms often feel helpless against American regulators, some of which render edicts after opaque and secretive processes.

title: London Fashion Week: MarquesAlmeida and Ashley Williams in Pictures
description: A photo diary of the fall/winter 2016 collections that were presented Monday.

title: Israeli Soldiers Accidentally Kill Army Officer While Trying to Stop Attack
description: JERUSALEM  Israeli soldiers accidentally shot an army officer in the West Bank on Wednesday while they were trying to thwart an attempted stabbing, the Israeli military said. The officer, who was hit in the chest, died of his wounds.

title: Pennsylvania Governor, Tom Wolf, Says He Has Prostate Cancer
description: Gov. Tom Wolf of Pennsylvania has a treatable form of prostate cancer that was thankfully detected early, he announced on Wednesday. He will continue to serve as governor while undergoing treatment that will last several months.

title: At Yosemite, a Waterfall Turns Into a Firefall
description: For a few weeks in February if the conditions are just right, for about 10 minutes around sunset, one waterfall in Yosemite National Park looks more like its opposite  a firefall.

title: New York City Can Require Sodium Warnings, Judge Rules
description: Saying information is power, a judge on Wednesday upheld a measure in New York City requiring some restaurants to warn consumers about high levels of sodium in foods.

title: Storms Batter the South
description: Gov. Rick Scott of Florida spoke in the aftermath of a severe weather system that tore through the South, spurring tornadoes in his state and in Louisiana. Storms continued to threaten the East Coast on Wednesday.

title: My Firsthand Encounter With Donald Trumps Free Media Machine
description: The other day, a host on MSNBC asked me if Donald J. Trump had a good enough campaign operation to win in Nevada. One thing Mr. Trump had going for him, I pointed out, was that he was very good at getting the news media to give him free airtime.

title: Swedish Aid Group Seeks Inquiry Into Afghan Hospital Raid
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A Swedish aid group has demanded an independent investigation of a raid on a hospital in Afghanistan last week in which it said that three people, including a boy, were summarily executed by Afghan forces who were accompanied by NATO troops.

title: Dr. Robert Califf Wins Senate Confirmation to Run F.D.A.
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas pick to run the Food and Drug Administration, Dr. Robert M. Califf, was finally confirmed for the job by the Senate on Wednesday, in a vote of 89 to 4, after weeks of opposition from a handful of lawmakers who had blocked his nomination over what they said was the agencys poor record on prescription painkillers.

title: Getting YouTube Stars to Sell Your Product
description: YouTube influencers are a sought-after breed. One word from these connoisseurs of cool, these heralders of hipness, and traffic to a website or store soars, products fly off shelves and brands become blockbusters overnight.

title: The Best Apps for Delivering Celebrity News
description: Everyone loves a bit of celebrity-watching, and the Oscars give us plenty of excuses to do so. One great way to keep on top of all the gossip is through an app, and there are plenty of them out there catering to our curiosity about the Academy Awards and the entertainment industry.

title: Shadow of Human Rights Abuse Follows Contender in FIFA Vote
description: ZURICH  Nothing has rocked international soccer quite like the waves of arrests made across several continents last year as the United States announced bribery and corruption charges against the men running the sport, the worlds biggest and richest. But as the organization that governs global soccer gathers this week to choose a new president, a leading contender risks stirring up another source of controversy for the sport: human rights.

title: Fay: Fall 2016 RTW
description: The labels fall 2016 collection.

title: Top 10 Moments From London Fashion Week
description: Piles of jewels on the runway, Alexander McQueens return to London  and a few new designers to watch.

title: Alberta Ferretti: Fall 2016 RTW
description: The labels latest collection.

title: Classic English-Made Shoes for Men, Without the Heft
description: As a woman who designs mens wear, Paula Gerbase has grown accustomed to being perceived as a novelty  especially since her 2014 appointment as the first-ever artistic director of the beloved 150-year-old British shoemaker John Lobb. But Gerbase is no gimmick: She grew up fascinated by Savile Rows legacy and the way men build their wardrobes, and spent the first six years of her career designing bespoke mens suiting. At John Lobb, shes brought a keen eye to the houses archives. The lightweight, unlined suede shoes in her new spring collection reject the idea that English-made footwear must be hefty  but retain classic codes like buckles, hidden stitching and overlaid saddles.

title: Looking On the Bright Side of Trump
description: No, folks, Im not retracting any of my it wont be Trump predictions just yet, but in the interest of staying au courant with my fellow pundits in the wake of last nights Nevada steamrolling lets stroll for a moment in a world where Donald Trump actually wins the nomination. Michael Brendan Dougherty hasa good columnon all the ways that this would be a disaster for theconservative movement  how it would weaken the influence of conservatisms major institutions (by exposing how inessential their ideas and imprimatur are to actually winning power in the G.O.P.), how it would turn the rights personnel and policy minds against one another (some would throw in with Team Trump, others wouldnt, and the recriminations would be vicious), and how it would create a particular crisis for the pro-life movement, because Trumps conversion on the issue is far less convincing than those of previous nominees like Mitt Romney or George H.W. Bush, and one way or another his nomination would probablyguarantee that genuinelyanti-Roe justices would be reduced to a tiny rump on a consolidated, progressive Supreme Court.

title: Sara Maino at Italian Vogue: Highlighting Emerging Designers
description: You will rarely see me at the big shows, those blockbuster events with a starry front row. That is really not my scene, Sara Maino, senior editor at Italian Vogue and scion of one of the most powerful families in Italian fashion, said on the eve of fashion week. Her aunt (and boss) is Franca Sozzani, the longtime editor in chief at Italian Vogue, and her mother is Carla Sozzani, founder of the Milan super-boutique 10 Corso Como.

title: I Dont Drink Coffee. Should I Start?
description: As someone who doesnt drink coffee, Im sometimes forced to ponder whether Ive escaped an unhealthy addiction or if Ive just been asleep my whole life.

title: Sedition Arrests in India Inflame Old Free-Speech Tensions
description: NEW DELHI  Over the years, the thousand-acre campus of Jawaharlal Nehru University has seen too many protests by its leftist student body to count, most of them petering out without incident. But one staged this month seems to have struck a raw nerve.

title: British Panel Focuses on Tenniss Self-Policing
description: Nigel Willerton, head of the Tennis Integrity Unit, told a British parliamentary committee Wednesday that he would recommend that tenniss anticorruption program have greater independence from the sports governing bodies in the future.

title: Obamas Scotusblog Post: Reading Between the Lines
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas Wednesday morning post on Scotusblog was more notable for the forum than for its message, which we have heard before as he considers a nominee to replace Justice Antonin Scalia. But it was nonetheless a valuable summary of what Mr. Obama is looking for in a justice as well as a glimpse of his view of the constitutional responsibilities of the president and the Senate.

title: Spotlight Journalists Grapple With Big-Screen Portrayals
description: Journalistic objectivity be damned. Im hoping it wins the entire lot.

title: Calorie Counts on the Kids Menu
description: One kid-favorite Panera cinnamon crunch bagel: 430 calories. Add a medium low-fat strawberry banana smoothie (260 calories) or even just a lemonade (240 calories), and your 7-year-old is well into his 1,600-calorie budget for the day.

title: Nature Is Enough
description: To the Editor:

title: For Inmates, a Step Up With College
description: To the Editor:

title: Delhi Water Crisis Exposes a Fragile Infrastructure
description: Running water was restored on Wednesday to parts of Indias capital region, after protesters sabotaged a major canal in a dispute over preferential treatment for certain social castes.

title: The FIFA Longshots: Prince Ali, Monsieur Champagne and Mr. Sexwale
description: The FIFA presidential election that will take place Friday in Zurich increasingly looks to be a two-man race between Sheikh Salman bin Ebrahim al-Khalifa, the president of the Asian Football Confederation, and Gianni Infantino, the general secretary of UEFA, the sports governing body for Europe. But there are three other candidates in the race. Here is a look at where they stand, how they faltered and what might come next:

title: President Obama, Guest Blogger
description: On Wednesday morning, President Obama released a short, seven-paragraph explanation of what he is looking for in a Supreme Court nominee.

description: Shift

title: Review: Mitsuko Uchida Plays Notes as Delicate as a Cranes Legs
description: One challenge of performing a piano recital in a large space like Carnegie Hall is creating an intimate atmosphere, which Mitsuko Uchida did on Tuesday night, producing a sound world sometimes so delicate that listeners bent their necks to hear.

title: European Union Updates Bank Stress Test Beyond Pass/Fail
description: BERLIN  European regulators provided details on Wednesday for the latest stress test aimed at measuring the ability of the regions lenders to survive a financial crisis or severe economic downturn.

description: To the Editor:

description: Lets start a few blocks up from the new WANT Les Essentiels de la Vie store in the West Village, at A.P.C.

description: To the Editor:

description: Peter R. Orszag, a former cabinet official in the Obama administration turned investment banker, has joined Lazard as a senior deal maker, the company announced on Wednesday.

title: Obamas Duty to Fill Supreme Court Seat
description: To the Editor:

title: Review: Thomas Crawford and the American Classical Orchestra Perform a Haydn Opera
description: There can be little doubt that Haydns operas have been seriously undervalued, at least since Antal Doratis wonderful series of recordings with the Lausanne Chamber Orchestra in the late 1970s. But do any of these operas rival Mozarts, as the conductor Thomas C. Crawford would have you believe?

title: Trump and Ryan, Matter and Antimatter
description: As House speaker, Paul D. Ryan will chair the Republican National Convention this summer. Many of his views are diametrically opposite the frontrunner for the nomination, Donald J. Trump.

title: Republican Race Puts Donald Trump and Paul Ryan on Collision Course
description: WASHINGTON  Speaker Paul D. Ryan, chairman of the Republican National Convention, recent vice-presidential candidate and the highest elected Republican in the country, has one goal for this year: to form a conservative policy agenda for the Republican presidential nominee to embrace.

title: Great Clash: Donald Trump vs. Paul Ryan
description: A look at how the Republican speaker of the House and the party's nominee for president differ on issues including immigration, entitlements, and trade.

title: Review: In Prey, Rosie Cavaliero Takes Up a Pair of Pursuits
description: Rosie Cavaliero would seem to be the star of Prey, a fairly entertaining British crime series making its debut on BBC America on Thursday. Her picture is on the website, and shes the only actor who appears in all six episodes. But shes not, exactly  she receives second billing to two different men, John Simm (Episodes 1-3) and Philip Glenister (4-6).

title: Donald Trump, Addressing Evangelicals, Questions John Kerrys Familiarity With the Bible
description: VIRGINIA BEACH, Va.  Donald J. Trump is certain that Secretary of State John Kerry has not read his 1987 best-seller on business.

title: Forget President: The More Important FIFA Vote Is on Reforms
description: FIFA will hold two important elections on Friday at its latest all-expenses-paid gathering in Zurich. Most of the attention will be on the second vote, to pick the organizations new president. Fans, though, should pay closer attention to the first one.

title: Fausto Puglisi: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Mr. Puglisis fall designs.

title: John Kasich Says He Can Beat Donald Trump, One on One
description: GULFPORT, Miss.  Gov. John Kasich of Ohio vowed Wednesday to remain in the Republican race, declaring himself the partys only hope of defeating Donald J. Trump.

title: Tips and Myths About Extending Smartphone Battery Life
description: Ashlei Temeas family trip to Disneyland last Thanksgiving break turned into a nightmare when her smartphone battery hit empty.

title: Falling Oil Prices Force Cutbacks at Smallest Companies
description: SEMINOLE, Okla.  The plunging price of crude has inflicted pain in the Oklahoma oil patch, and now it is threatening to take out the smallest of the small operators, those that have survived decades of booms and busts.

title: Falling Oil Prices Force Cutbacks at Smallest Companies
description: Small operators in several states are cutting back on expenses to try to hold down debt.

title: Donald Trump Keeps Winning. Heres What Could Make Him Lose.
description: Donald J. Trump has snatched three straight victories, built a powerful lead in national polls and knocked several opponents out of the 2016 presidential race. His path to the Republican nomination looks wider than ever. But it could still contain pitfalls and roadblocks. Here are some of the ways he could still stumble.

title: Amazon Puts Spotlight on The Fashion Fund
description: On Thursday, Amazon Fashion will unveil a shopping destination featuring the spring collections of the 2015 CFDA/Vogue Fashion Fund contenders just in time for The Fashion Fund Series 3 premiere on the Internet retailers streaming service. Youll find sweet picks like a Jonathan Simkhai radial gingham dress ($445), Brother Vellies ankle-strap sandals ($435) and a Gypsy Sport mixed media cap ($132) from the three winners, and items from all of the remaining seven finalists. At amazon.com/FashionFundShop.

title: John Gleeson, Prominent Judge, Said to Be Joining Debevoise & Plimpton
description: John Gleeson, a prominent federal judge and former prosecutor who handled one of Wall Streets biggest criminal cases, is set to become a partner at Debevoise & Plimpton, according to people briefed on the matter.

title: Review: Rita Wilsons Peaceful Easy Feeling
description: Some say it is never too late to be what you might have been. And if youre a performer with the drive and resources of Rita Wilson, whose new show opened at Caf Carlyle on Tuesday night, that hope is not just a fantasy but a real possibility. Many of us live, at least some of the time, in the musical dream world of our teenage years. And for Ms. Wilson, that place is the Southern California lotus land of the 60s and 70s distilled in songs heard on a car radio.

title: Following a Punjabi Indian Family, a Missing Distinguished Novelist and More
description: By Sathnam Sanghera

title: Jeb Bush Apologizes to Donors for Failure of His Campaign
description: A tired-sounding Jeb Bush apologized to his major financial backers in a brief conference call on Wednesday afternoon, saying he never expected his presidential campaign to end so early, and in such disappointment.

title: Pictures of the Day: Macedonia and Elsewhere
description: Macedonia and More  Photos of the Day

title: Simon & Schuster Creates Imprint for Muslim-Themed Childrens Books
description: As a young Pakistani-American Muslim girl growing up in Connecticut, Zareen Jaffery used to devour novels by Beverly Cleary and Judy Blume, hoping those stories would offer some clues for how to fit in.

title: Feb. 24, 2016  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Macedonia, Greece, Syria and Italy.

title: Crossing Borders, Confronting Boundaries
description: There are different ways to cover a story about migrants. Sometimes you interview people about their experiences and talk to officials, then stitch together an article with composite perspectives and experiences told secondhand.

title: Mitt Romney Says Donald Trump Should Release His Tax Data
description: Mitt Romney emerged from political hibernation on Wednesday and issued a challenge to Donald J. Trump: Show us your taxes.

title: Credit Unions Turn Borrowers Into Savers
description: Saving money by taking out a loan may sound counterintuitive, but a program offered by some credit unions is aimed at having consumers do just that.

title: Senate Republicans and the Supreme Court: Where Is This Headed Exactly?
description: Hi, John,

title: Escape to California in Style
description: Luckily, laid-back Cali-vibes can be secured without ever setting foot on a plane  not that any of the items here wouldnt be best enjoyed if you did.

title: Review: BalletBoyz Get Ready to Rumble
description: Few dance troupes are named more informatively than BalletBoyz. When the Royal Ballet principal dancers Michael Nunn and William Trevitt founded the company in 2000, they called it George Piper Dances, but the distinctive appeal indicated by the nickname they eventually adopted was already evident. They prefaced their performances with short, demystifying films in which they appeared as ordinary blokes with cheeky senses of humor. Then they danced with gorgeous, far-from-ordinary technique.

title: Review: Animal Collective, in Joyful Pursuit of Sensory Overload
description: Build it up, take it apart. Fatten it up, slim it down. A long-running band develops a history and reacts against it  especially a band as self-conscious about sound as Animal Collective, which has just released its 11th full-length album since it emerged in 2000, Painting With (Domino).

title: The Might-Have-Beens of Marijuana
description: Former Attorney General Eric Holder, in a newly released interview conducted after he left office, said he was in favor of reclassifying marijuana as something less than a Schedule I controlled substance comparable to heroin. This was hailed as encouraging news by marijuana enthusiasts who immediately askedwhy Mr. Holder didnt push for this change when he was running the Justice Department.

title: Review: Pandemic Explains How to Host the Perfect Pathogen Party
description: Sometimes, the best approach to a book about deadly pathogens is to read it in a slightly dissociated state  it allows you to marvel at the cunning adaptability of microbial life, rather than contemplate the far creepier possibility of your own doom. In her introduction to Pandemic: Tracking Contagions, From Cholera to Ebola and Beyond, Sonia Shah, a science writer whose previous books include The Fever and The Body Hunters, does not seek shelter in euphemisms or shy away from scary numbers. Instead, she cites a study in which 90 percent of epidemiologists say they believe a global pandemic will sicken one billion and kill up to 165 million within the next two generations.

title: How Mario Batali Does Breakfast
description: Depending on who you ask, Chelseas Maritime Hotel could be seen as proof of the architect Albert C. Ledners inspired vision  or a monolithic monument to 1960s kitsch. Originally designed as a hiring hall for the National Maritime Union, the 11-story, porthole-adorned tower has since served as a shelter for runaways and as housing for the New York Service Center for Chinese Study Fellows, before opening as a fashionable hotel in 2003.

title: Roberto Cavalli: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Peter Dundas shows his fall collection for Roberto Cavalli.

title: Review: Mariinsky Ballet in Raymonda, Searching About for a Perfect Suitor
description: WASHINGTON  Is the Mariinsky Ballet of St. Petersburg breaking records this week? I hope so. Between Monday and this coming Sunday, it is to perform eight programs in four theaters, in three cities on both sides of the Atlantic.

title: Mr. Purple, a Trendy Hotel Bar on the Lower East Side
description: Follow any trend to its exhausted end, and you may end up at Mr. Purple, a lounge on the 15th floor of the Hotel Indigo on the Lower East Side. Its the kind of place where buzzwords like reclaimed wood, small-batch spirits and regionally brewed craft beer feel like PowerPoint concepts introduced in a focus group.

title: Carla Hayden Nominated to Head Library of Congress
description: WASHINGTON  Carla D. Hayden, the longtime head of Baltimores library system and an advocate for the privacy rights of library users, was nominated by President Obama on Wednesday to lead the Library of Congress.

title: Governors Unite in the War Against Opioids
description: State governments are at the front lines of the countrys epidemic of drug overdose deaths. Thats why it is important that the National Governors Association says it will come up with  protocols for dispensing prescription painkillers that are among the biggest sources of addiction and abuse in the country.

title: Macklemore & Ryan Lewis Return to the Hip-Hop Fray
description: To be Macklemore & Ryan Lewis is to be scrutinized ceaselessly. The most consequential white hip-hop act since Eminem, this Seattle duo became a pop sensation, hip-hop curio and sociocultural lightning rod in 2012 on the back of the quirky breakthrough Thrift Shop. The boisterous and off-kilter track turned out to be the first in a string of four Billboard top 15 hits, two of which went to No. 1.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Labor Unrest Stirs in Russia as an Economic Chill Sets In
description: NIZHNY TAGIL, Russia  Workers in this city that calls itself the birthplace of the trains gained fame some years back for helping birth something far different: President Vladimir V. Putins drive to crush and marginalize a budding democracy movement. Recently, after a year with little or no work in the citys giant train factory, they staged a protest of their own, aimed straight at Mr. Putin and his wealthy cronies in the industrial sector.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing: Donald Trump, Republican Party, iPhone
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Q. and A.: Timothy Olyphant, a Tough Lawman, Goes Country Onstage
description: Countless words have been spilled on the subject of Timothy Olyphant and the Stare: that faint narrowing of those fathomless eyes, shorthand that one of his gunslinging lawmen  say, Raylan Givens of Justified or Seth Bullock of Deadwood  is about to blow a bad guy to smithereens.

title: Doping Claims Involving Chinese Track Stars Re-emerge, Decades Later
description: BEIJING  Lunar New Year blessings in red and gold at the entrance to the Chinese Athletics Association wish visitors Glorious Business Improving Year by Year and Splendid Future Reaching Up and Up.

title: Prosecutors Will Move to Dismiss Charges in Brownsville Rape Case
description: Prosecutors in Brooklyn plan on moving to dismiss first-degree rape charges against all five teenagers accused of attacking an 18-year-old woman on a playground in Brownsville, Brooklyn, in January, officials said on Wednesday.

title: At Cavalli, Individual Beauty With a 70s Vibe
description: Todays Roberto Cavalli show was set inside the 16th-century Palazzo Spinola in Milan, where giant chandeliers hung overhead and every cornice was covered in gold leaf. And the collection didnt shy away from extravagance either: Clothes were dripping with beads, sequins and tiger prints, harking back to a 19th-century bohemian spirit. Backstage, the hairstylist Duffy explained the philosophy behind the hair look for the season. Its Peters girl, he said, referring to the brands designer, Peter Dundas. Shes very cool, very relaxed. He turned to 70s London  and, more specifically, the famous store Biba  as an inspiration for the free-spirited opulence of the collection.

title: Review: A Bronx Tale: The Musical Doo-Wops Down Mean Streets
description: MILLBURN, N.J.  The tug of war for the soul of a young man on the mean streets of the Bronx may not sound like a subject that sings. But Chazz Palminteris A Bronx Tale, originally a solo show, later a movie, and after that a solo show once again on Broadway, has proved to be comfortably malleable material. Now it has been given a hefty infusion of music and dance and  presto!  the familiar-as-red-sauce story, with most of its rough edges intact, can be found finger-snapping and doo-wopping its way across the stage of the Paper Mill Playhouse here, with plans, no doubt, for a quick trip through the Lincoln Tunnel to the big time.

title: Vanessa Moody Transforms at Cavalli
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Fall/Winter 2016 Fashion Week in Milan.

title: Oscars Too Boring? A Guide to Spicing Them Up
description: This is the last Carpetbagger column of the Oscar season, praise be, and there is absolutely nothing left to say. Well, maybe a couple of things. Final Oscar voting has closed, all thats left to get through are a few parties, the red carpet and finally, on Sunday night, the ceremony.

title: Struggle Over Supreme Court Pick Enters a New Level of Hardball Politics
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Democrats were slightly surprised when Republicans told the White House budget director this month not to bother making the ritual presentation of a spending plan. They were absolutely astonished when Senate Republicans took the power struggle to an entirely new level by announcing that they would not even shake hands with a Supreme Court nominee selected by the duly elected president of the United States.

title: Apple Is Said to Be Trying to Make It Harder to Hack iPhones
description: WASHINGTON  Apple engineers have begun developing new security measures that would make it impossible for the government to break into a locked iPhone using methods similar to those now at the center of a court fight in California, according to people close to the company and security experts.

title: What Microsofts Xamarin Purchase Says About the Cloud Computing Fight
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Microsoft announced on Wednesday that it was buying Xamarin, a company that helps software developers write applications for mobile devices. The price was not disclosed, but is believed to be more than $300 million.

title: Kesha Speaks Out About Dr. Luke Case as Adele Voices Support
description: The pop singer Kesha spoke out on Wednesday for the first time since her legal fight with the producer Dr. Luke became the talk of the music industry, earning the singer public encouragement from her brand-name peers, including Lady Gaga, Miley Cyrus and Taylor Swift.

title: In an Improving Economy, Places in Distress
description: As the most prosperous communities in the United States have gotten richer since the end of the Great Recession in 2009, economic conditions in many distressed areas have deteriorated even further.

title: Michael Skakels Lawyer Says Trial in Killing of Martha Moxley Wasnt Fair
description: HARTFORD  More than 40 years after 15-year-old Martha Moxley was found beaten to death near her home in Greenwich, Conn., a lawyer for the man convicted in the killing laid out a litany of reasons that his client, Michael C. Skakel, did not get a fair shake during his 2002 trial.

title: Commodities Agency Advised to Drop Plan to Limit Futures Contracts
description: A long-running fight between regulators seeking to curb speculation in the commodities markets and traders is heading into its next round.

title: Clinton, Sanders and Southern Voters
description: Bernie Sanderss campaign is making incredible strides, but huge hurdles remain.

title: Assessing the Shifting Military and Political Calculus in Libya
