description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Fall/Winter 2016 Fashion Week in Milan.

title: The Myth of the Hero Teacher
description: Maybe you have had the fantasy: Chuck your day job to teach in a public school in a blighted neighborhood. The money is lousy, of course, but thats part of the fantasy  no one wants to turn around the lives of poor children just for a paycheck. Then you decide that maybe today is not the day, and go back to your life. Sound familiar?

title: Paul L. Whalen, Architect, at Home in Greenwich Village
description: Living in a Greenwich Village apartment with a distinguished pedigree is something Paul L. Whalen savors. I am very aware of being in a Bing & Bing building, he said, referring to the developers who built numerous apartment buildings in Manhattan during the early 20th century. Bing & Bing buildings offer the formal qualities of grand Upper East Side apartments on a practical scale. They were designed for single people or young couples. They have classic layouts, often with fireplaces and rooms large enough to furnish nicely.

title: What I Love | Paul L. Whalen
description: Paul L. Whalen, a partner in Robert A.M. Stern Architects, lives in a prewar Bing & Bing building in the West Village.

title: Where the Art Starts
description: Apple Art Supplies, in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, has served art and design students in the neighborhood for 15 years.

title: Apple Art Supplies in Brooklyn Is Hub for Matte Knives and Gossip
description: On a short stretch of DeKalb Avenue near the campus of Pratt Institute in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, is a trio of establishments essential to students: a pizzeria with good, cheap slices; a diner with an all-day breakfast and free refills of coffee; and Apple Art Supplies.

title: A Top N.H.L. Rookie Skates In From the Heat
description: Shayne Gostisbeheres unusual journey from South Florida to the N.H.L. actually started in Montreal in the 1950s when a woman named Cleo Brodeur went to the doctor seeking a treatment for severe asthma.

title: Review: Black Sabbaths Metal Sance of Fear, Dread and Joy
description: The freaked-out entrance line of the first song of the first Black Sabbath album, sung by Ozzy Osbourne over the guitarist Tony Iommis creepy-crawly interval of a tritone, is: What is this that stands before me?

title: Washington Streetcar Stumbles Could Benefit de Blasios Plan
description: WASHINGTON  The empty streetcars started their test runs down H Street more than a year ago, a slow-rolling taunt for a fast-changing neighborhood left to wonder when the line might finally open.

title: Margin of Victory Will Matter as Clinton Counts on Black Voters in South Carolina
description: After three contests, Hillary Clinton leads Bernie Sanders by the slimmest of margins in the Democratic primary, 51 to 50 in delegates.

title: The T Takes on Four Oscar-Nominated Writer/Directors
description: Household names and newcomers alike have made it onto the 2016 Academy Awards ballot  and into the pages of T. Ahead of Sunday nights ceremony, a guide to the some of the talent weve met along the way.

title: Jersey City Warehouse Converted to Rental Lofts
description: When the Butler Brothers building rose near the Jersey City waterfront 111 years ago, the immense brick structure was a testament to the citys manufacturing prowess. Shaped like the letter E, the eight-story warehouse spanned a square city block and was a distribution center for the Chicago-based companys catalog business and its Ben Franklin five-and-dime stores and Federated stores.

title: Modera Lofts, Jersey City
description: The 1905 Butler Brothers Building at 350 Warren Street in Jersey City is being converted to 366 residential lofts.

title: Before There Was Trump, There Was Gingrich
description: The New York Times columnist Gail Collins recently wrote a takedown of Donald Trump. Her focus was Mr. Trumps rationale for his professed support of Obamacare. I dont want people dying on the streets, he said.

title: Whats the Point of Moral Outrage?
description: HUMAN beings have an appetite for moral outrage. You see this in public life  in the condemnation of Donald J. Trump for vowing to bar Muslims from the United States, or of Hillary Clinton for her close involvement with Wall Street, to pick two ready examples  and you see this in personal life, where we criticize friends, colleagues and neighbors who behave badly.

title: Feb. 26, 2016  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Syria, Iran, Macedonia and Germany.

title: Photos of the Day: Syria and Elsewhere
description: Syria and More  Pictures of the Day

title: At Max Mara, A Bauhaus-Inspired Twist
description: The fall/winter 2016 collection included stripes, sweaters  and lots of bold color.

title: Betting Markets Weigh the Odds of Vice President Christie
description: Chris Christies surprise endorsement of Donald Trump on Friday immediately set tongues wagging about whats in it for him. After all, Mr. Trump has said of Mr. Christie that there could certainly be a place for him as his running mate.

title: Questions Nag in Sweden 30 Years After Leaders Assassination
description: GOTEBORG, Sweden  Three decades after Prime Minister Olof Palme was gunned down on a Stockholm street, his unsolved killing continues to reverberate through Swedish politics and society.

title: Soprano Gets Two More Turns at Met Butterfly
description: Ana Mara Martnez, who received rave reviews earlier this month when she filled in for an ailing soprano in the title role of Puccinis Madama Butterfly at the Metropolitan Opera, will extend her run and sing the role two more times, the company announced on Friday.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: These Days, John Baldessari Cribs From the Masters
description: LOS ANGELES  Having taught many generations of Los Angeles artists, John Baldessari proudly displays a few of their creations on the walls of his large studio in Venice. One piece, by Analia Saban, consists of white paper cleverly made to look like a stained gym towel.

title: Friday Night Music: White Rabbit
description: Definitely a good week to start dropping acid, although it might be hard to tell the difference.

title: Review: Baiba Skride Wrestles Bartoks Art of Darkness
description: Young musicians are often told they should wait to perform certain works that require technical or psychological maturity, like late Beethoven or Schubert. The piece the Latvian violinist Baiba Skride, 34, yearned to play as a student was Bartoks Violin Concerto No. 2, but her teachers deemed it too emotionally taxing.

title: English National Operas Chorus Votes to Strike
description: LONDON  Chorus members at the English National Opera here voted on Friday to strike over proposed layoffs and salary cuts.

title: Review: Jason Isbell, Slowing Down to Feel the Americana
description: Its standard practice for a band to play its songs a little faster in concert than on record, as a matter of courting excitement or surrendering to it. Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit tacked the other way on Thursday at the Beacon Theater, in his first of two consecutive nights there: digging deep furrows and hunkering down.

title: Allergic to Dogs on a Flight? What Travelers Need to Know
description: A 7-year-old boy and his parents were asked to leave their Allegiant Air flight from Bellingham, Wash., to Phoenix last week after the boy developed an allergic reaction to a dog, a service animal, on the plane, according to several news reports. The flight was delayed about 90 minutes and some passengers were said to have applauded when the child was leaving.

title: Review: Mariinsky Celebrates a Prima Ballerina
description: The Mariinsky Ballet has been variously known as the wellspring of ballet classicism and the finest home of ballet romanticism. On Thursday, however, it became the celebrant of sensationalist kitsch in the triple bill that opened its four-program season, A Tribute to Maya Plisetskaya, at the Brooklyn Academy of Music. The evening was bizarre in several ways.

title: Versace: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Donatella Versaces vision for fall 2016.

title: Donald Trump and Chris Christie Start a Bully Bromance
description: Those who have witnessed Gov. Chris Christies performance both in New Jersey and in the national arena over the past couple of years almost could have seen Fridays sweaty embrace of Donald Trump coming. Almost.

title: Review: The New@Graham Series Is Helped by an App
description: Did you know that the Martha Graham Center for Contemporary Dance has a free downloadable mobile app? I didnt until Thursday night, when the Graham company hosted a virtual tour of its latest technological endeavors, in particular its new partnership with the Google Cultural Institute.

title: Rauschenberg Foundation Eases Copyright Restrictions on Art
description: Museumgoers tend to be unaware of the vast network of copyright protections that underlie images of much of Modern and contemporary art, until they try to shoot a cellphone picture of a favorite painting and receive an embarrassing tut-tut from a guard.

title: Review: Ill Never Love Again, From a Teenage Girls Diary
description: Should it choose to adopt the Broadway business model for self-promoting souvenirs, the Bushwick Starr could surely do a brisk trade in I Am Clare buttons. These artifacts might be sold, along with the usual choices of bottled beer, from the bar in what passes for a lobby in this tiny walk-up theater in Brooklyn.

title: Evening Hours | The Orchid Dinner, the Viennese Opera Ball and More
description: Plus: the Purim Ball and the annual winter ball hosted by the Museum of the City of New York.

title: Success Academy Loses in Pre-K Battle With de Blasio Administration
description: Success Academy suffered a defeat in a high-profile skirmish with New York City on Friday, when the state education commissioner ruled that the city could require the charter school network to sign a contract to receive funding for its prekindergarten program.

title: Review: City of Glass, Down a Rabbit Hole of Meta-Noir
description: In City of Glass, an adaptation of Paul Austers 1985 novel by Untitled Theater Company No. 61, a wrong number plunges a thriller writer into a mystery of his own. When a man first telephones Daniel Quinn (Robert Honeywell), asking to speak to the detective, Paul Auster, Quinn informs the caller of his mistake. But the next time the phone rings, Quinn pretends to be Auster and soon finds himself embroiled in the tale of a monstrous father, a damaged son and an alluring wife.

title: Pradas Wistful Tough Girls
description: The labels fall/winter show incorporated iconic markers of femininity like brocade, roses and pearls  but the effect was still unsettling.

title: Review: You See The Encounter With Your Ears
description: LONDON  Someone is blowing in your ear, and it isnt anybody in your immediate vicinity. You can feel this distant persons breath (hot) and his urgency (hotter), and the sound of him is all over the place  behind you, before you, to either side of you, close and distant, shouting and whispering, sometimes in several voices at once.

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing: Sepp Blatter, Academy Awards, Syria
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Review: Mozart, a Little Bit Symphony, a Little Bit Opera
description: You would think that a Mozart symphony should be heard as an entity, a single composition in four parts. But at concerts in that composers day, it was fairly common for movements of a symphony to be interspersed with opera arias, orchestral dances and whatnot.

title: The Young Minimalist Designer Being Compared to Armani
description: All weather reports indicated spring on a recent Saturday in Milan, but Februarys gloomy cloud cover said otherwise. Still, Lucio Vanotti, the 40-year-old minimalist clothing designer, appeared for a stroll in Parco Sempione with his perpetual sidekick, a tiny taupe-colored, bowlegged Italian greyhound named  in true minimalist fashion  Clean. Both man and dog were dressed rigorously in black, but color was all around  it was Carnival week, and brightly costumed children threw thick trails of rainbow confetti on the parks walkways.

title: Donald Trump Might Not Keep Paying for His Campaign Himself, Chris Christie Suggests
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey told his finance team late Friday that he anticipates that Donald J. Trump, who often boasts that he is funding his own campaign, will begin to solicit campaign contributions as the race heads into a general election if Mr. Trump becomes the nominee.

title: Bill Cunningham | Shaggy Streets
description: The fur (faux and natural) was flying on the runways and on the guests at the recent New York collections, despite anti-fur sentiments. There were patchworks of fur everywhere, and at Marc Jacobs, three or four different furs were combined into single coats. Zero-degree weather during fashion week only encouraged the fur-bearing.

title: Ted Cruz, Running a Distant Third in Fridays Insult-a-Thon, Still Takes His Shots
description: NASHVILLE  Donald J. Trump plucked a mega-endorsement from across the Hudson River. Senator Marco Rubio established himself as the front-runners new chief tormentor, insulting Mr. Trumps spelling and questioning his bladder control.

title: Baseballs First Threshold
description: The first day of spring training is often linked with the smell of fresh-cut grass. Cut grass means well-manicured baseball fields. Well-manicured baseball fields mean we are about to get serious.

title: Marines Toast Iwo Jima Veterans on Anniversary of Flag Raising
description: Angelo Ciotta, 90, leaned against the bar inside a restaurant in Queens as fellow Marines offered a series of taut salutes and a bottle of red wine  a Marine Corps-themed vintage called Jarhead Red.

title: A Better Way to Control the Banks
description: Nearly eight years after the financial crisis, behemoth banks still dominate the global economy. They are still immensely complex, highly leveraged and politically powerful. They are still difficult, if not impossible, to manage and supervise. For those reasons, they remain a threat to the economy, and the notion of breaking them up appeals to many voters, policy makers and politicians.

title: Rejected Proposals for Penn Station
description: As the city considers overhauling the station, it seems like a good time to review ideas that didn't make the cut last time.

title: A Georgia Bill Shields Discrimination Against Gays
description: After Indianas disastrous attempt last year to enact a religious-freedom law protecting business owners and others who refuse to serve same-sex couples for religious or moral reasons, one might reasonably have assumed that other states contemplating similar legislation would be chastened into dropping it.

title: Two Deaths, One Overlooked, Remain Unsolved After Jouvert Festival
description: It was a little after midnight when Denentro Josiah peeked into his parents bedroom in their Bronx home and told his mother he was heading to Brooklyn for the street party taking place before the West Indian American Day Parade, she recalled.

title: Feds Transparency May Give Investors False Confidence, Economists Say
description: The Federal Reserve may be guilty of sharing too much information.

title: Mets Zack Wheeler, Recovering From Surgery, Practices Patience
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  As Matt Harvey threw a routine bullpen session this week, Zack Wheeler stood 10 feet behind him, holding a clipboard. With each pitch Harvey threw, Wheeler marked a box on a sheet of paper, indicating where it was. Coaches typically fill out the form, but Wheeler figured that if he was just standing around, why not help?

title: Officials Report 9 New Cases of Zika Virus Among Pregnant Women Tested in U.S.
description: Nine pregnant women in the United States have tested positive for the Zika virus, American health authorities reported Friday. One of the women gave birth to a baby with microcephaly, a defect that has been associated with the virus, and at least one other had an abortion after severe brain atrophy was detected in the fetus.

title: Retired Police Sergeant Pleads Guilty to Tapping Into Confidential Databases for Money
description: A former New York City police sergeant pleaded guilty on Friday to conspiracy, admitting that he had accepted money to tap into restricted law enforcement databases to furnish information to a former officer who was working as an investigator for criminal defense lawyers.

title: For a Yankees Prospect, Training Camp Involves Part Healing, Part Hope
description: TAMPA, Fla.  While the Yankees were on the baseball fields on Friday, throwing, catching, running and hitting, Greg Bird was doing none of those.

title: George C. Nichopoulos, Elviss Last Doctor, Dies at 88
description: Dr. George C. Nichopoulos, Elvis Presleys personal physician in the decade before his death in 1977, who lost his medical license for overprescribing addictive drugs for years to numerous patients, died on Wednesday in Memphis. He was 88.

title: Apples Privacy Fight Tests Relationship With White House
description: WASHINGTON  Timothy D. Cook, the chief executive of Apple, was relentless during a private meeting of tech giants and President Obamas top national security officials last month. Encrypted devices like the iPhone are here to stay, he insisted. Law enforcement needs to find a way to do its job in a new world.

title: Unclassified Clinton Emails May Have Consequences for a Key Deputy
description: WASHINGTON  In May, 2011, John Kerry wrapped up a trip to Pakistan intended to calm tensions over the secret raid that had killed Osama bin Laden just weeks before. But as he took off to fly to Dubai, the Central Intelligence Agency carried out a pair of drone attacks in North Waziristan.

title: Buy Local? South Bronxs New Councilman Makes It a Habit
description: The newest member of the New York City Council, Rafael Salamanca Jr., will be sworn into office in a new blue suit. Like most everything in his life, it has a South Bronx connection.

title: Syria Truce Comes With Price, but Not for Assad
description: WASHINGTON  If the temporary cease-fire in Syria begins to take hold on Saturday, despite the low expectations of the American and Russian officials who negotiated the agreement, it will be a landmark event. For the first time, diplomacy will have succeeded in abating the killing and misery that have already led to more than 250,000 deaths and millions of refugees pouring out of the shattered country.

title: Emails Show Michigan Aides Worried About Flints Water a Year Before Acting
description: A full year before the state took significant action, some top aides to Gov. Rick Snyder of Michigan were alarmed at the quality of Flints water, with a lawyer for the governor calling the notion of drinking it downright scary, newly released emails show.

title: Trump Meets the Mean Boys
description: Chris Christie has endorsed Donald Trump! Well, really, what did you expect? Hes a sworn enemy of Marco Rubio, and we have long since established that nobody likes Ted Cruz.

title: Andy Bathgate, Standout on Dismal 1950s Rangers, Dies at 83
description: Andy Bathgate, the hockey Hall of Famer whose scoring touch gave Ranger fans something to cheer about while watching usually lackluster teams in the 1950s and early 60s, died on Friday in Brampton, Ontario. He was 83.

title: B&H Electronics Store Sued for Discrimination of Hispanic Workers
description: For the second time in nine years, the owners of B&H Photo Video, a popular electronics store in Manhattan, have been sued by the federal government for discriminating against Hispanic workers.

title: Alfred E. Mann, Pioneer in Medical Devices, Dies at 90
description: Alfred E. Mann, who started medical device companies that pioneered in the development of pacemakers for erratic hearts, insulin pumps for diabetics, cochlear implants for the deaf and retinal implants for the blind, died on Thursday in Las Vegas. He was 90.

title: Buna Ziua and Mad Props
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  There is only one way that I know of to gain a toehold in a Saturday crossword, and that is to scan and re-scan the clue list for an entry that you definitely know. Sometimes, you might have to perform this exercise two or three times before you find a single entry to write into the grid.

title: Elias Demetracopoulos, 87, Dies; Journalist Linked Greek Junta to Nixon
description: Elias Demetracopoulos, an enigmatic journalist who fled Greece after a military coup in 1967 and accused the ruling right-wing junta of illegally funneling a half-million dollars into Richard M. Nixons 1968 presidential campaign, died on Feb. 16 at a nursing home in Athens. He was 87.

title: John Kasich Says Hes Surprised but Unfazed by Chris Christies Endorsement of Donald Trump
description: MEMPHIS  John Kasich, the only governor remaining in the Republican presidential field, said on Friday that he was a little bit surprised that Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey decided to endorse Donald J. Trump.

title: The Revenant Author Michael Punke Has a Day Job
description: There are five literary adaptations in the Oscar race for best picture this year, including movies based on Emma Donoghues Room and Colm Tibns Brooklyn. But among the hopeful novelists who will be closely watching Sundays Academy Awards ceremony, only one has negotiated a $1.3 trillion global trade deal.

title: Knicks Find Balance and Break Free Fall
description: When Kurt Rambis took over as interim coach of the Knicks this month, he set a lofty goal of steering the team with a 23-31 record to the playoffs.

title: Dean at University of Texas Resigns in Part Over Handgun Law
description: A highly regarded dean at the flagship campus of the University of Texas announced this week that he was leaving the school in part because of his concerns over a new state law allowing people to carry concealed firearms in classrooms and other buildings on public college campuses.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: A new era has been started as we speak. You will be proud of FIFA. You will be proud of what FIFA will do for football.

title: Corrections: February 27, 2016
description: WEEKEND ARTS

title: Eddie Einhorn, a Creator of College Basketball on TV, Dies at 80
description: Eddie Einhorn, who created a sports network that propelled national interest in college basketball, laying a foundation for the immense popularity of the annual tournament known as March Madness, died on Wednesday in Norwood, N.J. He was 80.

title: What to Watch Saturday
description: Our best-picture Oscar catch-up concludes with The Big Short, Adam McKays thrill ride through the 2008 financial crisis. And Essence magazine honors black women in Hollywood.

title: Milan Fashion Week: The Weekend
description: MILAN  Saturday starts in a highly civilized fashion at 9:30 a.m. with a show by Bottega Veneta, one of Kerings star performing brands, which happens to have some of the best baristas in the business at its sleek headquarters on the Via Privata Ercole Marelli here.

title: Suicide Bombings in Afghanistan Kill at Least 26
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Two separate suicide bombings in Afghanistan on Saturday left at least 26 people dead and nearly 50 injured, officials said, days ahead of expected talks between the government and the Taliban.

title: Our Best Comments of the Week
description: In this new feature, well list the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment.

title: For Some Men, Mark Zuckerberg Is a Lifestyle Guru
description: Anyone who has ever taken to social media to announce a self-improvement project knows that your friends cannot be relied upon to hold you accountable. Almost as soon as you proclaim your intention to learn French or cut out carbs, the world moves on, leaving you with only your empty promises and scone crumbs on your shirt.

title: Lupita Nyongo and Trevor Noah, and Their Meaningful Roles
description: The most intriguing stars seem to appear from out of nowhere.

title: Poll Watch: Trump Tries to Court Hispanic Voters
description: Donald J. Trump bragged during Thursdaynights Republican debate that he had won almost half the Hispanic vote intheNevada caucuses on Tuesday.Nobody else was close, he said. Looking forward, he said, I will do really well with Hispanics.

title: Bottega Veneta: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Designs for fall 2016 from the mind of Tomas Maier.

title: The Week on Instagram
description: Photos posted this week on @nytimes took our followers from Yosemite National Park to fashion week in Milan.

title: Inside the Republican Partys Desperate Mission to Stop Donald Trump
description: Get live updates about the Florida primary.

title: Antonio Marras: Fall 2016 RTW
description: The latest collection from Antonio Marras.

title: Hillary Clinton Wins South Carolina Primary
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  Drawing overwhelming support from the African-American voters who deserted her here eight years ago, Hillary Clinton won her first resounding victory of the 2016 campaign in South Carolina on Saturday, delivering a blow to Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont as their fight turns to the 11 states where Democrats vote on Tuesday.

title: The Daily Shoe: Versace
description: Donatella Versace and a kitten heel arent exactly synonymous. And yet these zip-up ankle boots are just as sexy as one of her many vertiginous designs.

title: A Little Variety
description: A LITTLE VARIETY PUZZLES  This weeks puzzles include:

title: Farhad and Mike Hash Out the Weeks Big Topic: Apple
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: G-20, Rejecting Major Policy Shifts, Plays Up Basic Strengths
description: SHANGHAI  Through the winter, world financial markets have tumbled and churned with a succession of worries. The Chinese economy seemed to be faltering. Commodity exporters like Russia and Brazil suffered sharp slowdowns. And with oil prices falling, banks that have lent heavily to energy companies could be hurt.

title: Dropping the Curtain on a Singing Neighbor
description: Ask Real Estate is a weekly column that answers questions from across the New York region. Submit yours to realestateqa@nytimes.com.

title: Equality in Marriages Grows, and So Does Class Divide
description: The Don Drapers of the world used to marry their secretaries. Now they marry fellow executives, who could very well earn more than they do.

title: The Daily Bag: Tods
description: We love the classic Tods satchels fall look: stitched up and strung with tassels.

title: Threes a Trend: Multicolored Oversize Knits
description: This season, oversize multicolored knits  historically the opposite of cool  have caught our attention. In London, where we first saw the trend take shape at Joseph, the designer Louise Trotter showed sweaters in baggy proportions  including this childlike alphabet version that felt more thrift-store cool than designer. At Prada, a classic mosaic knit was made luxurious with the addition of fur cuffs. And at Etro, horizontal stripes and frayed edges recalled the grunge heyday  to great effect.

title: The Daily Jewel: Sportmax
description: These metal crescent earrings perfectly complemented Sportmaxs sculptural fall collection  as they would almost any outfit.

title: Boston Suburb Bars Filming at Site of Post-Marathon Shootout
description: The makers of a movie about the Boston Marathon bombing have scrapped plans to film the traumatic shootout scenes on location in Watertown, Mass., because the town has decided not to cooperate.

title: The Cases for Public Investment
description: One of the annoying aspects of the Sanders/Friedman flap was the assumption of many Sanders supporters that anyone who doesnt accept extravagant economic projections is against a big program of public investment. Actually, it was destructive as well as annoying; aside from being an insult to progressive economists who believe in infrastructure but also believe in arithmetic, it created at least the possibility that other people would take the crash-and-burn of a particular piece of analysis as evidence that the whole case for spending more is wrong.

title: Milan Fashion Week: Marco de Vincenzo, Etro and Versace in Pictures
description: A photo diary of the fall/winter 2016 collections that were presented Friday.

title: In Good Old Days, Donald Trump Says,  Campaign Protesters Got More Than Just an Escort Out
description: OKLAHOMA CITY  The crowd at Donald J. Trumps rally here Friday night quickly began booing the young protester clad in the KKK supports Trump T-shirt, who was escorted from the event.

title: Jil Sander: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Jil Sanders take on fall 2016.

title: Violence in Syria Abates on Day 1 of Cease-Fire
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Violence significantly decreased in much of northern and western Syria on Saturday, the first day of a truce brokered by the United States and Russia, even amid reports of scattered violations, including incidents of bombing, shelling and at least one aerial attack.

title: Variety: Diagramless Puzzle
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Are you one of those D.I.Y.ers, someone who would rather build something yourself than be content with a mass-produced object? Have we got a variety puzzle for you.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Curtain Call Remembered Fondly

title: Warren Buffett, in Annual Letter, Rejects Candidates Message of U.S. Decline
description: Warren E. Buffett took aim on Saturday at the negative drumbeat of this years presidential campaign, saying that the view that children today would not live as well as their parents was dead wrong.

title: FIFA, Knowing Prosecutors Are Watching, Makes Some Changes
description: ZURICH  Soccers governing body used an election on Friday to try to break with the past. FIFA chose a new president, the Swiss administrator Gianni Infantino, while approving reforms intended to overhaul the multibillion-dollar organization that the American authorities said last year was overrun with criminals.

title: Early Results Show Reformists and Moderates Drawing Votes in Iran Elections
description: TEHRAN  Preliminary results released Saturday in Iran indicated that reformist and moderate candidates were set to expand their influence after two important elections, state news media quoted the Interior Ministry as saying.

title: Warren Buffett Vows to Stick to Friendly Strategy, Rebuffing Activism
description: Activist investors may be on the rise and takeover efforts may have become more aggressive, but Warren E. Buffett is committed to a strategy he has pursued for the better part of 51 years.

title: What Its Really Like to Risk It All in Silicon Valley
description: Before Nathalie Miller decided to walk away from Instacart, the grocery delivery start-up now worth more than $2 billion, she made a spreadsheet to analyze how much money she was leaving on the table.

title: Disney Introduces Demand-Based Pricing at Theme Parks
description: LOS ANGELES  For the first time, tickets to Walt Disney World in Florida and Disneyland in California will cost more during holidays and some weekends  up to 20 percent more  than during slower periods, as the bursting-at-the-seams parks seek to spread out demand.

title: Ensconced in Family, Top Prospect Tries to Grow Into a Man, and a Met
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  In the fall of 2013, after the Mets selected Dominic Smith out of high school with the 11th overall pick in the first round and gave him a $2.6 million contract, one of his first big purchases was a new six-bedroom, five-bathroom home in a gated community here. It was about 10 minutes from the Mets spring training facility, and it was big enough that his mother, two siblings and a young nephew could live with him. Smith was only 18, after all.

title: I.R.S. Calling to Demand Cash? Dont Pay Up. Hang Up.
description: A tax adviser in Orlando, Fla., named Craig Smalley received a call about 10 months ago from a panicked client. Someone from the I.R.S. had just phoned, she said, to say a warrant for her arrest had been issued for failure to pay back taxes.

title: Lindsey Vonn Suffers Hairline Fracture to Knee
description: Lindsey Vonn, the American skier who is leading the overall World Cup standings as part of a spectacular comeback season, sustained a hairline fracture of her left knee Saturday during a high-speed crash in a super-G race at Soldeu-el Tarter, Andorra.

title: Republican Candidates Deeply Entrenched Against Gun Controls
description: Realistically, no one studying politics should have expected the remaining Republican presidential contenders to speak up at their latest debate about the nations harrowing problem of mass shootings.

title: The Sad Demise of the Summer Job
description: President Obama touched on a national crisis last week when he called on business leaders to help connect young people with summer jobs that give them not just money, but also valuable work experience. Private companies can help. But they are hesitant to hire inexperienced applicants at a time when seasoned, middle-aged workers who lost good jobs during the recession are desperate for any work. The only solution to youth unemployment is for Congress to reinstate some version of the summer jobs program it abandoned in the late 1990s.

title: Abdifatah Mohamud: Captain of the Call Center
description: Abdifatah Mohamud, 30, is a supervisor for Alliance Data Systems in Columbus, Ohio.

title: That Coke Can Is Back
description: HOLLYWOOD  THEY were dramas that drilled into the most sensitive parts of the national psyche, searing and dividing us with lurid sexual images and racial grievances as old as the nation.

title: If Donald Trump Changed Genders
description: IMAGINE, for a moment, the presidential candidacy of a rich, brash real estate magnate and reality TV star named Donna Trump.

title: Showdown on Abortion at the Supreme Court
description: The decades-long crusade to end legal abortion in America after Roe v. Wade has again reached the Supreme Court.

title: From Obama to Trump
description: THE spectacle of the Republican Partys Trumpian meltdown has inspired a mix of glee and fear among liberals  glee over their rivals self-immolation, and fear that what arises from the destruction will be worse.

title: Who Are the Gay Evangelicals?
description: THE anti-gay ideology that has long held sway in American evangelicalism seems to be crumbling. Conservatives insistence that the Bible proscribes homosexual acts and their claim that protecting gay rights infringes on their own religious liberty have depended on another assumption not found in Scripture: that homosexuality is not a biologically rooted identity but a sinful temptation, an addiction that one must control.

title: Why Courts Shouldnt Ignore the Facts About Abortion Rights
description: At the core of the most important Supreme Court abortion case in a generation is a series of questions about facts. In deciding the constitutionality of a law that would shut down most abortion clinics in a state in the name of protecting womens health, which facts about the laws rationale and its impact may a court consider? Which facts must a court consider? Are there facts a court must ignore entirely?

title: The Killing Field
description: LEER, South Sudan  THE killing field on the edge of town is marked by skulls and bones littering the ground, attracting vultures and hyenas.

title: Deniz Gamze Erguven
description: Deniz Gamze Erguven is a Turkish-French filmmaker whose debut film, Mustang, has been nominated for an Academy Award for best foreign language film.

title: Trigger Warnings
description: ACCIDENTAL gun deaths are not all that common, but stories about them are.

title: What Prodigies Could Teach Us About Autism
description: MANY parents remember a moment when their toddler astounded them. Maybe he outpaced his playgroup at mastering a song. Maybe she knew an esoteric fact about outer space. They might quietly wonder: Is my child a prodigy?

title: Even When Shots Miss, Intentionally Fouling May Not Pay Off
description: Every time a poor free-throw shooter is fouled intentionally, it seems to reopen the debate about whether the N.B.A. should take action against the strategy.

title: What Women Find in Friends That They May Not Get From Love
description: SARA and I met as office drones in 1999. We became friends in a period of our lives when the demands of our jobs were just heating up, when the roots we were putting down in the city were just getting deep. In each other, we found respite, recognition, a shared eagerness to relax, take stock and talk about it all.

title: Early Tallies Show Irish Voters Rejecting Government
description: DUBLIN  Early results in Irelands general election indicated Saturday that voters had firmly rejected the center-right government, but it remained unclear if any party will have enough seats in Parliament to form a government.

title: Davis Cup Returns to a Scene of Its Grassy Past
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  It will be the United States versus Australia in the first round of Davis Cup this week at Kooyong Stadium.

title: The Wrong Way to Teach Math
description: HERES an apparent paradox: Most Americans have taken high school mathematics, including geometry and algebra, yet a national survey found that 82 percent of adults could not compute the cost of a carpet when told its dimensions and square-yard price. The Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development recently tested adults in 24 countries on basic numeracy skills. Typical questions involved odometer readings and produce sell-by tags. The United States ended an embarrassing 22nd, behind Estonia and Cyprus. We should be doing better. Is more mathematics the answer?

title: Dont Call Me the Black Seth Rogen
description: Los Angeles  YEARS ago, I was in a cast in whats called a network showcase. Hollywood does tons of these types of showcase shows. The networks bring in young actors to create material and perform for agents, managers and casting directors. The goal is to get actors signed or brought in for auditions for pilots and eventually to create a star.

title: Fixing the Iraq Mess
description: Readers discuss a letter from a retired Marine colonel about the need to pursue a managed breakup of Iraq and what Americas role should be.

title: Marco Rubio on Day 3 of Trump Offensive: He Should Sue Whoever Did That to His Face
description: KENNESAW, Ga.  Senator Marco Rubio of Florida, his momentum seemingly stunted by Gov. Chris Christies endorsement of Donald J. Trump, said Saturday that he would not stop ridiculing Mr. Trump as he tries to capitalize on  fears among Republicans about the businessmans candidacy.

title: Ask Your Doctor if This Ad Is Right for You
description: A LITTLE more than a decade ago, most health care advertising was confined to mass-market drugs, and hospitals and doctors generally considered the practice tacky or ethically dubious. More often than not, the ads appeared in unassuming places like cheaper womens magazines or the New York subway  for decades New Yorkers sat beneath ubiquitous rainbow posters for Dr. Jonathan Zizmor that promised to conquer blemishes: 212-594-SKIN!

title: Talk Grows About Who Will Succeed Palestinians Fading Mahmoud Abbas
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank  The past five months of Palestinian attacks on Israeli Jews have undermined the already weak political position of Mahmoud Abbas, the Palestinian president, who rules ineffectively over a divided people and failing institutions.

title: John Kasich Says If He Doesnt Win Ohio, Hes Going Home
description: NASHVILLE  Facing pressure to leave the presidential race, Gov. John Kasich on Saturday singled out next months primary in his home state of Ohio as a make-or-break moment for his campaign.

title: Sam Beall, Farm-to-Table Restaurateur Right on His Farm, Dies at 39
description: Sam Beall, who turned Blackberry Farm, his parents country inn in Walland, Tenn., into a national destination for fine dining and a leader in the farm-to-table culinary movement, died on Thursday in Vail, Colo. He was 39.

title: Wesley A. Clark, Who Designed First Personal Computer, Dies at 88
description: Wesley A. Clark, a physicist who designed the first modern personal computer, died on Monday at his home in Brooklyn. He was 88.

title: Baffling the Yankees: A Select Group
description: Dallas Keuchel of the Houston Astros dominated the Yankees last year, defeating them three times. We take a closer look at those games as well as a list of other pitchers who have managed to confound the Yankees.

title: Guile Sharpens Perpetual Thorn in Yankees Side
description: KISSIMMEE, Fla.  He stifled the Yankees in the summer, eliminated them in the fall, haunted them in the winter and looms over them in the spring. Even when he visited New York in January, the city stood still for Dallas Keuchel.

title: Zack Wheelers Warm-Up Commands a Stage
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  As the other Mets pitchers scattered to take part in various drills Saturday morning, Zack Wheeler reported to a relatively empty bullpen area. Standing on the slope of the mound, not even on the rubber, he made about 10 throws, as if simply warming up.

title: No Trouble Seen in Brooklyn Home Where Fire Killed Girl, 2
description: The anonymous calls to the New York State child abuse hotline claimed that Kalenah Muldrows mother was not taking care of her young daughter: Their home was squalid, the callers said, and lacking adequate food. In the most recent call, on Feb. 15, the caller raised concerns that Kalenah was being left with people other than her mother for extended periods of time.

title: Strangers Extend a Helping Hand to Struggling New Yorkers
description: For Margaret Macaluso, driving her sons to and from their college classes and part-time jobs requires patience and compromise. The family has only one vehicle. Fortunately, she does not mind being a chauffeur. Ever since Ms. Macaluso learned in August that she had Stage 3 ovarian cancer, she has viewed every car ride as extra time with her sons.

title: Smiles Come, and Smiles Go. Soon, Carmelo Anthony Might Follow.
description: Carmelo Anthony was back to being the last Knick out of the shower Friday night, as opposed to being the first one through the Madison Square Garden exit, as was the case earlier in the week. Normalcy was restored. He had returned to his standard postgame speaking slot as the resident star.

title: Neediest Cases Fund: How to Give
description: For more than 100 years, The New York Times has asked readers for contributions to its Neediest Cases Fund, to give direct assistance to troubled children, families and elders. The first years contributions totaled $3,630.88. The total now is about $6 million a year, and over the years the Fund has raised more than $282 million.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Court Jesters
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Today, Timothy Polin merges wacky definitions and sports in a crossword puzzle. Some of you might find this easier than others (and by that I mean me), especially if you are a basketball fan.

title: Donald Trump Has Big Lead in Massachusetts, and Marco Rubio Is Distant Second, New Poll Shows
description: BOSTON Donald J. Trump is the clear favorite among likely Republican voters in theMassachusetts primary on Tuesday, according to a poll released on Saturday by Suffolk University.

title: With Fewer Members, a Diminished Political Role for Wisconsin Unions
description: MILWAUKEE  Gov. Scott Walkers foray into the Republican presidential field ended months ago, but he may yet have sway over the outcome.

title: South Carolina Primary: Highlights
Donald Trump, Despite Impieties, Wins Hearts of Evangelical Voters
description: OKLAHOMA CITY  It is one of the prime paradoxes of the 2016 election: A twice-divorced candidate who has flaunted his adultery, praised Planned Parenthood and admitted to never asking for Gods forgiveness is the favorite of the Christian right.

title: Female Pilot Unit Gains Support in Congress for Right to Arlington Burials
description: SILVER SPRING, Md.  Shortly after Elaine D. Harmon died last April at the age of 95, her family found a letter in a fireproof box with explicit instructions: She wanted her ashes placed at Arlington National Cemetery.

title: Assassination of Putin Critic Remembered in Moscow
description: MOSCOW  Tens of thousands of people flooded the streets of central Moscow on Saturday, joining a solemn march to commemorate the anniversary of the assassination of Boris Y. Nemtsov, a Russian opposition leader.

title: C.D.C. Urges Pregnant Women to Avoid Travel to Olympics Over Zika Fears
description: Health officials in the United States have advised pregnant women who are scheduled to attend the Olympic Games in Brazil to reconsider their plans because of the Zika virus epidemic.

title: Scientists Protest Cuts and Commercialization at Australian Climate Center
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Perched on a wild, windy promontory on the rugged tip of northwestern Tasmania, the tiny Cape Grim research station has been measuring airborne greenhouse gases since 1976.

title: Monarch Butterfly Migration Rebounds, Easing Some Fears
description: MEXICO CITY  After years of being ravaged by severe weather and shrinking habitats, the monarch butterflies hibernating in the Mexican mountains rebounded last year, kindling cautious hope that one of the insect worlds most captivating migrations may yet survive.

title: South Carolina Exit Polls
description: Surveys of Democratic voters exiting voting locations throughout South Carolina on Saturday.

title: Hillary Clintons Winning Numbers in South Carolina Suggest Sweep in South
description: After winning South Carolinas Democratic primary eight years ago, Senator Barack Obama declared that after four great contests, we have the most votes, the most delegates, and have the broadest coalition for change. Tonight it is his former opponent, Hillary Clinton, who can now make the same claim.

title: Italy Growers Wary of Olive Oil Fraud as New Law Is Weighed
description: BLERA, Italy  For some of the 300 olive growers who toil here in the rolling hills of the Lazio region, making olive oil is a year-round labor of love.

title: Ex-Official Calls for Malaysian Prime Minister to Step Down
description: BANGKOK  A prominent member of the governing coalition in Malaysia who has been removed from a top party job lashed back on Saturday with a strongly worded Facebook post saying he had seen proof that Prime Minister Najib Razak committed a crime in his dealings with the countrys sovereign wealth fund.

title: Yemeni Civilians Killed by Airstrike on Market, Witnesses Say
description: SANA, Yemen  A United States-backed Arab military coalition bombed a busy market north of Yemens capital early Saturday, killing at least 30 people, witnesses said.

title: Donald Trump Returns Ire Against His Latest Enemies: New Yorks Attorney General and Little Rubio
description: Donald J. Trump suggested Saturday a lawsuit filed against him by the New York attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, over his Trump University was part of a conspiracy involving President Obama.

title: Marco Rubio and Donald Trump Open New Fronts in War of Playground Insults
description: In a campaign season without peer in insult tragicomedy, consider Saturdays candidate-on-candidate exchanges:

title: Marco Rubio Pushed for Immigration Reform With Conservative Media
description: A few weeks after Senator Marco Rubio joined a bipartisan push for an immigration overhaul in 2013, he arrived alongside Senator Chuck Schumer at the executive dining room of News Corporations Manhattan headquarters for dinner.

title: What Hillary Clintons South Carolina Win Means
description: Hillary Clinton notched her first big primary victory in South Carolinas contest on Saturday, with exit polls suggesting an even bigger win than Barack Obamas 29-point victory over her in 2008.

title: A Bolivian Towns Emergence Under Evo Morales
description: Residents of Cobija, which has prospered under President Morales, expect his leftist policies to survive his political departure.

title: Bolivian Town Drifts From President Evo Morales, Despite Promises Kept to Left
description: COBIJA, Bolivia  When Evo Morales, Bolivias first indigenous president, took office a decade ago, he vowed to put this impoverished town in the Amazon Basin on the kind of pedestal often reserved for a capital city.

title: A Famous Voice Praises Hillary Clinton as a Voice for Blacks
description: It is a choir of two, singing for millions. She says their names, Morgan Freeman intones, and Hillary Clintons voice, clipped from the campaign trail, seems to blend in with his: Trayvon Martin, they both say. Shot to death, says Mrs. Clinton, as pictures of victims of police brutality, and their grieving mourners, flash on screen. Dontre Hamilton: Unarmed, she says. Sandra Bland did nothing wrong, she says. Mr. Freeman drives home the point: Mrs. Clinton makes their mothers fight for justice her own.

title: Hillary Clintons Legacy in Libya
description: As the secretary of state in 2011, Hillary Clinton pressed the Obama administration to intervene militarily in Libya, with consequences that have gone far beyond the fall of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi.

title: Three Stabbed at Ku Klux Klan Rally in Southern California
description: Five people were injured at a Ku Klux Klan rally in Southern California on Saturday when protesters attacked members of the white supremacist group, the police said, unleashing chaos on a popular park and leaving three people with stab wounds.

title: Hillary Clinton, Smart Power and a Dictators Fall
description: By the time Mahmoud Jibril cleared customs at Le Bourget airport and sped into Paris, the American secretary of state had been waiting for hours. But this was not a meeting Hillary Clinton could cancel. Their encounter could decide whether America was again going to war.

title: A New Libya, With Very Little Time Left
description: It was a grisly start to the new era for Libya, broadcast around the world. The dictator was dragged from the sewer pipe where he was hiding, tossed around by frenzied rebel soldiers, beaten bloody and sodomized with a bayonet. A shaky cellphone video showed the pocked face of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, the Leader who had terrified Libyans for four decades, looking frightened and bewildered. He would soon be dead.

title: In Their Own Words: The Libya Tragedy
description: Architects of the Libyan intervention lament its aftermath.

title: Marco Rubio PAC Unleashes Its Ad Playbook Against Donald Trump
description: In New Hampshire, Gov. Chris Christie felt the full force of the super PAC supporting Senator Marco Rubio: It ran two negative television ads, printed mailers, made digital display ads and ran two separate websites against Mr. Christie that meshed with the broadcast ads.

title: Jessica Hendricks, Patrick Yee
description: Jessica Ann Hendricks,a daughter of Dawn E. Hendricks and Charles H. Hendricks of Larchmont, N.Y., was married Feb. 27 to Patrick Wei-Bun Yee, a son of Anna Yee and Bing Yee of Lexington, Mass. Cantor Fran Chalin officiated at Casa de Monte Vista, a vacation resort and event space in Palm Springs, Calif.

title: Emily Eyerman, Gregory Schneider
description: Emily Jill Eyerman and Gregory Evan Schneider were married Feb. 27 by Cantor Malcolm Arnold at the Marriott Harbor Beach Resort in Fort Lauderdale, Fla.

title: Jennifer Piro and Michael Balkin: A Match Backed by Experience and Data
description: Jennifer Beth Piro and Michael Golding Balkin were married Feb. 27 in Scarsdale, N.Y. The ceremony, at the Rowsley Estate, the headquarters of the Scarsdale Womans Club, was led by two friends of the couple who became Universal Life ministers for the event. Jessica H. Hirschey legally solemnized the couples New York City marriage certificate and led the couple in their exchange of rings; Jacob Condon led the couple in their vows.

title: Mallory Staub, Clayton Young
description: Mallory Christine Staub, the daughter of Christine E. Staub and Robert A. Staub of New York, was married Feb. 27 to Clayton Anthony Young, the son of Marie M. Young and R. Nils Young of Atlanta. The Rev. Beverly Bartlett, a Presbyterian minister, officiated at the Metropolitan Club in New York.

title: Stacy Groll, Alexander Guffanti
description: Stacy Leigh Groll, a daughter of Diane M. Rauch of Valatie, N.Y., and Philip F. Groll of Hudson, N.Y., was married Feb. 27 to Alexander Lee Guffanti, the son of Julia F. Guffanti and Robert T. Guffanti of Manahawkin, N.J. The Rev. Jim Sexton, who was ordained by the One Spirit Interfaith Seminary, officiated at Gedney Farm in New Marlborough, Mass.

title: Danielle Bodzin, Alex Horn
description: Dr. Danielle Kay Bodzin, a daughter of Carolyn W. Bodzin and Gary A. Bodzin of Aventura, Fla., was married Feb. 27 to Alex Horn, a son of Lory Y. Horn and Joseph Horn of Coral Gables, Fla. Rabbi Getzy Fellig officiated at the Bath Club, an event space in Miami Beach.

title: Maegan Mishico, David Morris
description: Maegan Joyce Mishico, the daughter of Lisa S. Dontzin of New York and Stephen A. Mishjko of Bovina Center, N.Y., is to be married Feb. 28 to David Koskoff Morris, the son of Ellen G. Koskoff and Robert D. Morris, both of Rochester. E. Leo Milonas, the retired chief administrative judge of New York State in New York, is to officiate at the Garrison, an event space in Garrison, N.Y.

title: Susan Lipp, Taylor Cox
description: Susan Terese Lipp, a daughter of Michelle L. Lipp of Katonah, N.Y., and Brady T. Lipp of Woodbury, Minn., was married Feb. 26 to Taylor Wayne Cox, a son of Maureen H. Cox and Richard S. Cox of St. Paul. Matthew T. Nathanson, a Universal Life minister, officiated at the Royal Palms Resort and Spa in Phoenix.

title: Astrid Hugentobler, Jason Trost
description: Astrid Hugentobler, the daughter of Catherine E. Hugentobler of St-Germain-en-Laye, France, and Dr. Herv F. Hugentobler of Paris, was married Feb. 27 to Jason Reinert Trost, a son of Roberta L. Trost and Donald C. Trost of East Lyme, Conn. Philippe Pivert, a government representative, officiated at City Hall in St-Germain-en-Laye.

title: Amanda Grey, Stephen Wolf
description: Amanda Kathryn Grey and Stephen Francis Wolf were married Feb. 27 at the Cree Estate in Cathedral City, Calif. The Rev. Catherine Williams, a United Methodist minister, officiated.

title: Erin Bevacqua, Ari Astles
description: First Lt. Erin Elizabeth Bevacqua and Ari Isaacman Astles were married Feb. 22 at the Sixth & I Historic Synagogue in Washington. Rabbi Deborah Reichmann officiated at a ceremony that incorporated Jewish and Catholic wedding traditions.

title: Lynne White, Joel Schnell
description: Lynne White and Joel Kenneth Schnell are to be married Feb. 28 at the Riverpark restaurant in Manhattan. Tony LeRoy, a Universal Life minister, is to officiate.

title: Bernie-mentums Next Stop
description: Columbia, S.C.  As the great poet Shawn Carter (aka Jay-Z) once said, On to the next one.

title: Olivia Merns, Daniel Berger
description: Olivia Jonquil Merns, a daughter of Karen Benz Merns of Manhattan and the late Stephen A. Merns, was married Feb. 27 to Daniel Haines Berger, a son of Miriam J. Haines and Michael G. Berger of Manhattan. Rabbi Ethan H. Witkovsky led the ceremony at the Liberty Warehouse, an event space in Brooklyn.

title: Jessica Crenshaw, Richard Dunne
description: Jessica Lee Crenshaw and Richard Joseph Dunne were married Feb. 26 at All Saints Episcopal Church in New York. The Rev. C. Hugh Hildesley, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Yamicia Connor, Yonatan Tekleab
description: Yamicia Doyasi Connor and Yonatan Tekleab were married Feb. 26 at the Paradisus Palma Real Golf and Spa Resort in Punta Cana, Dominican Republic. The Rev. Jean A. Lacaille, a Roman Catholic priest, officiated.

title: Back on the Auction Block, a 19th-Century Document Essential to Baseballs Rules
description: When it was auctioned in 1999, a document called Laws of Base Ball had no known author but obvious significance.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: There is no mechanism. There is no smoke-filled room. If there is, Ive never seen it, nor do I know anyone who has. This is going to play out in the way that it will.

title: Corrections: February 28, 2016
description: NATIONAL

title: Spotlight Wins Big at a Diverse Indie Spirits Ceremony
description: Tonights nominees are more diverse than the cover of a brochure for a liberal arts college, the wonderfully oddball comedian Kate McKinnon, of Saturday Night Live, told the crowd boozing it up Saturday at the Independent Spirit Awards. She would later kiss the actor Paul Dano through a mouthful (her mouthful) of ham.

title: Overdraft Practices Continue to Gut Bank Accounts and Haunt Customers
description: Angelina Lemus was puzzled. She had no idea why every month as much as $96 was disappearing from her Citibank checking account.

title: The Silicon Valley Hustle
description: Many young dreamers have flocked to the area with the hope of starting a successful start-up or striking it rich by joining the right company at the right time. This is what they look like.

title: Your Weekend Briefing: Donald Trump, Hillary Clinton, iPhone
description: Here are the weeks top stories.

title: Marni: Fall 2016 RTW
description: The labels fall 2016 show.

title: 1916: Henry James Dies in Britain
description: LONDON  Mr. Henry James, the essayist and novelist, who became a naturalized British subject in July of last year, died to-day [Feb. 28], aged seventy-three.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know about the weeks top stories.

title: The School Conference Blues
description: Middle school parent-teacher conferences are tomorrow and I cant bring myself to think about going.

title: Donald Trump Retweets Post With Quote From Mussolini
description: Donald J. Trump on Sunday morning used his Twitter feed to post a quote attributed to Benito Mussolini, the founder of the fascist movement, from a parody account. The tweet compared the Italian dictator to Mr. Trump, the Republican front-runner for the presidential nomination.

title: Rainy Day Annoyance Haiku
description: Dear Diary:

title: China Deletes Microblog of Critic of President Xi Jinping
description: BEIJING  The microblog account of an outspoken property tycoon and critic of President Xi Jinping, which had nearly 38 million followers, was deleted by Chinas Internet control bureau on Sunday.

title: Stella Jean: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Looks for next fall from Stella Jean.

title: The Daily Shoe: Bottega Veneta
description: The sharp endpoint to Tomas Maiers neat, fashionably restrained new lady.

title: Philipp Plein: Just Dont Call Him Normal
description: MILAN  I just want to get bigger and bigger every time. Its for my fans, said the 38-old-year German designer Philipp Plein, the unapologetic king of nouveau riche bling. The subject was his shows.

title: 1941: British Planes Set off 150 Fires in Cologne
description: LONDON  In the fifty-sixth raid on Cologne since the war started Royal Air Force bombers concentrated their fire on that important German manufacturing city for two and a half hours last night, dropping hundreds of high explosive and incendiary bombs. Pilots reported that 150 fires were set, and the Air Ministry termed it a heavy and successful attack.

title: At Bottega Veneta and Versace, the Soft Power Suit Also Rises
description: MILAN  On and on they came, the Versace hordes, striding out in pencil skirts and lace-up bootees and then circling left and right, tracing their way between rows, swarming the room. Donatella Versace set her show in the round, and paced it accordingly, so that at any given point wherever you looked was a streamlined silhouette, moving purposefully forward. The effect was to invert the usual runway equation: Instead of the audience surrounding the clothes, the clothes surrounded the audience. There was no escaping the import.

title: The Daily Bag: Jil Sander
description: Jil Sanders designer gets the modern working woman: This seasons practical purses in drab neutrals  especially this one little black bag, with a twist  seem made for the ever-on-the-go minimalist.

title: The Daily Jewel: Bottega Veneta
description: When almost all the models in Bottega Venetas fall show have long scarves wrapped around their necks, its nearly impossible not be pulled in by this multistrand necklace worn by only two. It was styled for daytime, but looks just right for evening wear  and spring, summer and winter too.

title: Marnis Old Hollywood Beauty
description: Amazing is how the makeup artist Tom Pecheux, laughing just a bit, described the look he created for Marnis fall show today. The designer Consuelo Castiglioni pointed to the 1940 black-and-white film Rebecca as a spark for the new collection, and the movies dramatic lighting and silver-screen glamour were translated into a classic Hollywood look: pale skin, intense lips, waves of hair set about the face  all thrown a little off-balance.

title: What Happened to the Great Divergence?
description: Thats the title of a very interesting speech by Lael Brainard of the Fed, who has been warning for a while that international finance  in particular, the importation of overseas weakness via the strong dollar  made the case for rate hikes very dubious. Now she expands on that theme:

title: Milan Fashion Week: Bottega Veneta and Jil Sander in Pictures
description: A photo diary of the fall/winter 2016 collections that were presented Saturday.

title: Threes a Trend: Leopard Coats
description: This season, as ever, the timeless animal print is back  on coats at Bottega Veneta, Prada and No. 21. The common denominator: a strong lapel (and heavy dose of attitude).

title: A Former Calvin Klein Underwear Model Ages, if Only in a Leap Year
description: Antonio Sabato Jr. remembers unveiling the huge photograph on a billboard in Times Square in 1996  the 90-foot-tall image of him with a defiantly seductive look in his eyes and almost no clothes on, only black bikini briefs. He was Calvin Kleins newest underwear model, and the world took him for a 20-something heartthrob.

title: Stephen Curry Cant Be Stopped, by Any Generation
description: Stephen Curry heard the criticism last week  that his success was due in part to a lack of legitimate perimeter defense in the N.B.A., that todays stars do not play tough enough to stop him.

title: Israel Museums Director to Make Way for Successor
description: James S. Snyder, the director of the Israel Museum in Jerusalem for 20 years, will assume the newly created role of international president for the museums worldwide activities next year, the museum announced on Sunday. A search will begin shortly for his successor.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Donald Trump Wavers on Disavowing David Duke
description: Donald J. Trump came under fire on Sunday for declining to disavow the support of David Duke, the white nationalist and ex-Ku Klux Klansman who has called him by far the best candidate.

title: In Iran Elections, Conflicting Forecasts Emerge Along Rival Lines
description: TEHRAN  A day after results in the capital showed a landslide victory for reformist and moderate allies of President Hassan Rouhani in Irans parliamentary elections, state television on Sunday reported a nationwide triumph for hard-liners.

title: After Tense Weeks, Melissa Harris-Perrys MSNBC Show Is Canceled
description: It all began to unravel for Melissa Harris-Perry four weeks ago.

title: MSGM: Fall 2016
description: Designs for fall 2016 from MSGM.

title: Salvatore Ferragamo: Fall 2016
description: Salvatore Ferragamo offers its take on fall 2016.

title: Rescue Workers and Miners Are Killed in Russia Accident
description: MOSCOW  Descending into the smoking pit of a coal mine after methane explosions set off underground fires, six rescue workers were killed on Sunday in a failed attempt to reach 26 stranded miners in northern Russia.

title: Ondria Hardin Transforms at Marni
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures behind-the-scenes beauty transformations during Fall/Winter 2016 Fashion Week in Milan.

title: Putting Donald Trumps Promises Under Scrutiny
description: A powerful force driving Donald J. Trump and Senator Bernie Sanders in the presidential race is the frustration of grass-roots voters that politicians in Washington havent kept their promises.

title: Tulsi Gabbard, Rising Democratic Star, Endorses Bernie Sanders
description: Representative Tulsi Gabbard, Democrat of Hawaii, resigned as a vice chairwoman of the Democratic National Committee on Sunday in order to endorse Senator Bernie Sanders for president.

title: Meg Whitman Assails Chris Christie for Backing Donald Trump
description: Meg Whitman, the Hewlett-Packard executive who was a top supporter of Gov. Chris Christies presidential campaign, on Sunday criticized Mr. Christie for supporting Donald J. Trump, assailing him for political opportunism and calling on Mr. Trumps other supporters and donors to walk away from him.

title: Berlins Museum Tours in Arabic Forge a Bridge to Refugees
description: BERLIN  The Pergamon Museum is home to the famous Ishtar Gate, a monument of blue and white tile decorated with golden lions and daisies that was once the entrance to ancient Babylon. When Kamal Alramadhani, a 25-year-old Iraqi economics student, saw it for the first time this month, I got goose bumps, he said, pointing to his arm.

title: Facing the Taliban and His Past, an Afghan Leader Aims for a Different Ending
description: LASHKAR GAH, Afghanistan  When mujahedeen guerrillas captured this southern provincial capital in 1993, Gen. Abdul Jabar Qahraman was the Afghan government commander on the last flight out, surrendering the city.

title: Netanyahu Welcomes Cease-Fire in Syria, but Adds a Warning
description: JERUSALEM  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel said on Sunday that he welcomed the efforts to achieve a long-term cease-fire in Syria but warned that Israel would continue to defend its own interests there.

title: Gods of Egypt and Eddie the Eagle Struggle at Box Office
description: LOS ANGELES  As Hollywood prepared to celebrate its artistic accomplishments at the Academy Awards on Sunday, three movie studios were licking box-office wounds. Arriving in wide release over the weekend and struggling were Lionsgates big-budget Gods of Egypt, 20th Century Foxs Eddie the Eagle and Open Roads Triple 9.

title: Trying to Revive H.M.O.s, but Without Those Scarlet Letters
description: An H.M.O. by any other name is still an H.M.O.

title: Academy Awards 2016: Highlights and Analysis
Rangers Trade for Eric Staal, Hurricanes Captain
description: Five months after signing a seven-year, $57.75 million contract extension, center Eric Staal beat Martin Brodeur with a wrist shot with 31.7 seconds remaining in regulation to lift the Carolina Hurricanes over the stunned Devils in Game 7 of a first-round playoff series in 2009.

title: Report Cites Dangers of Autonomous Weapons
description: A new report written by a former Pentagon official who helped establish United States policy on autonomous weapons argues that such weapons could be uncontrollable in real-world environments where they are subject to design failure as well as hacking, spoofing and manipulation by adversaries.

title: Missoni: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Angela Missonis vision for fall 2016.

title: Oscars 2016: Chris Rock Scores and Spotlight Takes Center Stage
description: LOS ANGELES  In a ceremony that became a raucous diversity lesson under the guidance of its host, Chris Rock, Spotlight, a newspaper drama about the Roman Catholic Church cover-up of sexual abuse by priests, snatched top honors at the 88th Academy Awards on Sunday. It beat out The Revenant, which had been widely viewed as the favorite, but which nevertheless earned a best actor prize for Leonardo DiCaprio, his first Oscar, and a best director award for Alejandro G. Irritu.

title: Review: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon: Sword of Destiny, a Fight-Ridden Sequel
description: When Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon opened in 2000, it carried surprises: that Ang Lee, a director known for high-minded literary adaptations, could make such a vibrant and exciting martial-arts movie, and that a Chinese-language film could be a box-office hit in America.

title: Review: Battle for the Airwaves, a Rock n Roll History
description: Several rows of empty seats at Saturday evenings opening performance of the 92nd Street Ys Lyrics & Lyricists series suggested the lingering hostility of older patrons toward rock n roll. Some cultural conflicts never end. And the program, Battle for the Airwaves, hosted by the actor and singer James Naughton, rekindled memories of a time when the ascent of Elvis Presley was regarded by popular musics old guard as a nothing less than a barbarian invasion.

title: Review: The Heart Offers Portraits in the Race to an Organ Transplant
description: Why are hospitals so rarely the settings for works of serious contemporary fiction? There are exceptions to this rule  Abraham Vergheses Cutting for Stone comes to mind  but not many, which is strange, given that were at our most vulnerably human once weve burst through those automated doors, either wretched from grief or ecstatic from relief, release, new life.

title: 3 Killed and 2 Injured in Hit-and-Run Crashes Across New York City
description: Three people were killed and two were injured on Sunday in separate collisions across New York City in which pedestrians and a cyclist were hit by motorists who fled the scene, the police said. No arrests had been made, and each of the five episodes remained under investigation.

title: Only Separation Can Lead to a Two-State Solution
description: Jerusalem  The Israeli-Palestinian conflict in its post-1967 incarnation has been raging for nearly 49 years, with no solution in sight. Several Israeli prime ministers, including Ehud Barak and Ehud Olmert, made great efforts to reach a permanent agreement, only for the Palestinians to decline, while Ariel Sharons unilateral withdrawal from Gaza was met not by peace and quiet, but by rockets and terror tunnels. The terror wave of recent months, in which Israeli civilians have been victims of stabbings, shootings and car attacks, has further eroded the faith of Israeli moderates in the prospects of attaining peace.

title: Donald Trump Elicits Shock and Biting Satire in European Media
description: LONDON  He has been depicted as a snarling demagogue in France, equated with Donald Duck in Spain, and described as worse than Lord Voldemort in Britain.

title: See That Billboard? It May See You, Too
description: Pass a billboard while driving in the next few months, and there is a good chance the company that owns it will know you were there and what you did afterward.

title: Review: In Pow, Keely Garfield Combines Tough and Awkward
description: After 30 years of making dances, Keely Garfield has found a way to wake herself up. The trigger was a Zen koan, a kind of riddle: How is it when the tree withers and the leaves fall? the student asks. The master replies, Body exposed in the golden wind.

title: Lil Yachty, Lil Uzi Vert and Playboi Carti, Oddball Raps Children, at Play
description: In the way that the Internet has scrambled pretty much everything, it has remade the textbook of oddball rap. For this generation, the tree of influence is short and irregularly shaped: Soulja Boy for self-started, Internet-driven fame; ASAP Rocky and the rest of the ASAP Mob for flamboyance and for eradicating regional loyalty; Chief Keef for the disassembly of traditional ideas about verse structure; Young Thug for radiant weirdness and genuine indifference.

title: Review: Pacific Northwest Ballet Plays With Limits and Dystopia at City Center
description: During intermission at City Center on Friday, some fragments of distressed conversation floated my way. Wheres the danger? one audience member asked another. After watching David Dawsons A Million Kisses to My Skin, the first work on Pacific Northwest Ballets Contemporary Innovators program, I was wondering the same.

title: Viceland, a New Cable Channel, Aims to Stand Out
description: Vice Medias march toward world domination of news and lifestyle coverage for the 18-to-34 demographic continues at 6 a.m. Monday with the introduction of Viceland, a new cable channel inhabiting the slot formerly occupied by H2 (in the 70 million homes where H2 had a slot). It further expands Vices already-substantial efforts in video programming, joining the companys highly popular online library and a documentary series, Vice, on HBO.

title: Finding Beauty in Georg Friedrich Haass Darkness
description: Was that a frisson of tension that ran through the audience at the start of Fridays concert at the Bohemian National Hall when the composer Georg Friedrich Haas took the microphone and said he had an uncomfortable announcement to make? After all, Mr. Haas had jolted some readers earlier that week when he spoke openly to The New York Times about devilish desires, his interest in playing with pain and the happiness he has found in his fourth marriage, which is based on a dominant-submissive power exchange.

title: Start-Up Lessons From the Once-Again Hot Field of A.I.
description: In 2010, Kris Hammond, an experienced artificial intelligence researcher, and a few partners founded Narrative Science. The Chicago start-ups software ingests and interprets numbers for things like investment holdings, billing records and sports statistics and transforms them into written summaries or stories.

title: Obamas Tangled History With Supreme Court Sets Stage for Nominee Fight
description: WASHINGTON  The first time President Obama sat down to pick a new Supreme Court justice, surprised aides discovered that he had gone beyond the briefing memos to read the leading candidates past judicial rulings. The president, a onetime constitutional law teacher, was in his element, a legal nerd, as one aide called him, putting theory into practice.

title: Why a Push for Online Privacy Is Bogged Down in Washington
description: In February 2012, the White House introduced a blueprint for the Consumer Privacy Bill of Rights, intended to give Americans the ability to exercise control over what personal details companies collected from them and how the data was used.

title: The Promise of Artificial Intelligence Unfolds in Small Steps
description: When IBMs Watson computer triumphed over human champions in the quiz show Jeopardy! it was a stunning achievement that suggested limitless horizons for artificial intelligence.

title: February 29, 2016
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  This is a special year, as 2016 has an extra day in the month of February which, to most people is a fun and lovely thing. To me, its just an extra day of winter, but if you happen to celebrate a birthday or anniversary on Feb. 29 and youve waited four years for this, happy day to you.

title: Democrats Fight for Young Voters in Massachusetts Primary
description: WELLESLEY, Mass.  Here among the historic brick towers and wooded hills of Hillary Clintons alma mater, Wellesley Students for Hillary has a robust campus organization. But so has Wellesley Students for Bernie.

title: Hillary Clinton Holds Eight-Point Edge Over Bernie Sanders in Massachusetts
description: A poll on released Sunday shows Hillary Clinton having an advantage of eight percentage points over Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont in the Massachusetts Democratic primary on Tuesday.

title: Hillary Clinton Vows to Tackle Systemic Racism
description: MEMPHIS A day after black voters delivered Hillary Clinton an overwhelming victory in the South Carolina primary, she spoke at two black churches here, vowing to tackle the continuing challenge of systemic racism and denouncing the leading Republican candidates ubiquitous slogan.

title: Al Sharpton Berates Hollywood and Urges Oscar Protests
description: LOS ANGELES  Clorox could not have made it any whiter.

title: Slide Show: Oscars 2016 Red Carpet
description: This is it: the red carpet to end all red carpets (until the Tonys, that is).

title: Oscars Red Carpet 2016: See the Stylish Celebrities Arrive
description: Well, this is it: the denouement of countless other awards shows, red carpet watches and weeks (make that months) of who-will-wear-what designer speculation. Check out our slide show in which we open the envelope, if you will, for those answers.

title: Two Bombings Kill Dozens at a Baghdad Market
description: Dozens of people were killed Sunday in two bombings at a crowded market in a Shiite neighborhood of Baghdad, the police said. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attacks.

title: With Humility, Starbucks Will Enter Italian Market
description: MILAN  Standing in the art-soaked splendor of a Milanese parlor as an array of A-list Italian business leaders listened intently, Howard D. Schultz, chairman and chief executive of Starbucks, recited a remarkable statistic on Friday: Each week, roughly 90 million people pass through a Starbucks somewhere on earth.

title: Wanted: Supreme Court Nominee. Must Not Bruise Easily
description: WASHINGTON  Would you apply for a job when the application process includes attacks so vicious that your spouse weeps and the hiring committee has already announced that it wont even consider you for the position?

title: Jeff Sessions, Virulent Opponent to 2013 Immigration Bill, Endorses Donald Trump
description: MADISON, Ala.  Donald J. Trump unveiled his first Senate endorsement at a rally here Sunday night, bringing Senator Jeff Sessions of Alabama up onstage with him and praising him as really the expert as far as Im concerned on borders.

title: Administration Protests Limits on Its Power to Fill Vacancies
description: WASHINGTON  A federal appeals court ruling that limits the presidents power to appoint officials to temporarily run federal agencies when high-level government jobs become vacant has prompted growing concerns among Obama administration officials.

title: Bernie Sanders Stands Alone as Hillary Clinton Gains Senate Endorsements
description: Join us for live updates and analysis of Super Tuesday.

title: A Change at Second Base for the Mets, but Only a Slight One
