description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  The Mets would not have reached the World Series without Daniel Murphy. His joy ride through the National League playoffs, when he belted seven homers in nine games and hit .421, was every hitters dream.

title: Sanders and His Son in a 1980s Show
description: In 1987, Levi Sanders was a guest on his father's television program, which he produced as mayor of Burlington, Vt.

description: Levi Sanders was an assistant manager at the Burlington Emergency Food Shelf when he was interviewed for the 2001 documentary People Like Us: Social Class in America.

title: In Long Political Career, Sanders Relies on Son as a Constant Witness
description: When Bernie Sanders first raised his hand to run for office, his towheaded 2-year-old, Levi, was there, sitting on his lap.

title: A Chilean Ex-Soldier Guiltily Recalls His Units Atrocities
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  The scene has haunted Guillermo Padilla for over 40 years.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Feb. 29
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Twin Suicide Bombings Kill at Least 20 as Shabab Violence Intensifies in Somalia
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia  Two popular restaurants in a regional capital of Somalia were hit by suicide bombings on Sunday afternoon, killing at least 20 people and injuring at least 60 others, witnesses and officials said.

title: John Kasich Sticks to Strategy Despite Doubts in G.O.P.
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass.  Gov. John Kasich finished last and second to last in the two most recent Republican nominating contests. He talks openly about being ignored for most of the campaign, and a month ago, he was almost out of money.

title: Migrants Stories From a Greek Island
description: Lesbos is a popular vacation destination. When refugees began streaming onto the island, a Dutch couple decided to pair them with tourists for conversations about the journeys that brought them there.

title: The Best Sellers: Filed Under Sports
description: The best-selling sports books in January 2015, according to the New York Times best-seller list.

title: In Toronto, a Neighborhood in Despair Transforms Into a Model of Inclusion
description: TORONTO  Her face framed by a yellow hijab, Idil Hassan watched her young daughter splash with other children at the Regent Park Aquatic Center, an architectural jewel of glass, wood and chlorine in the middle of Canadas largest housing project.

title: Is the Age of Regime Change Over?
Valeant Pharmaceuticals Chief Returns From Medical Leave
description: J. Michael Pearson has returned as the chief executive of Valeant Pharmaceuticals International after two months of medical leave, vowing to improve the embattled companys relationships and restore investor confidence.

title: N.B.A. Game of the Week: Rockets at Bulls
description: Every week, The New York Times chooses one essential game to watch, highlighting hot teams, winning and losing streaks and statistical intrigue in the N.B.A.

title: Day 2 of Syrian Partial Truce Is Marred by Violence
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The second day of a partial truce in Syria was marred on Sunday by a number of airstrikes and artillery attacks, the warring sides reported, demonstrating the challenges of even a limited deal.

title: February Auto Sales, Barclays Results and Hiring Numbers
description: Heres what to look for this week.

title: G.O.P. and Democrats at Odds Over Dismissal of Perry Indictment in Texas
description: HOUSTON  It was unusual for a judge on the highest criminal court in Texas to start his opinion by quoting Omar Little, the shotgun-wielding character in the HBO series The Wire with a knack for robbing drug dealers. But the quote, strangely enough, seemed to encapsulate one of the most politically charged legal cases in recent Texas history and to vindicate former Gov. Rick Perry: Come at the king, you best not miss.

description: [ Reviewing Chris Rock | what happened in the show | red carpet looks | the opening monologue ]

title: Former Catcher Mike Piazza Admires the Mets Pitching
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Mike Piazza visited Mets camp Sunday for the first of three days with the team before it begins the exhibition schedule Thursday. Piazza, who was elected to the Hall of Fame in January, has noticed Yoenis Cespedess impressive car collection.

description: Missed the Academy Awards? Lets get you caught up.

title: Pursuit of Intruder at Yankees Park Has That Rough Spring-Training Feel
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The most riveting matchup Sunday at Steinbrenner Field did not take place on the field, but above it  and then into the stands, onto the backfields and the shrubs that surround the Yankees complex.

title: Son of Saul, Kierkegaard and the Holocaust
description: I.

title: For a Natural, Swimming Isnt Always Easy
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla.  The calm, clear water beckoned Caeleb Dressel, who stripped to his swimsuit and jumped into an unoccupied lane for the 6-and-under boys 25-yard freestyle race. Upon reaching the other side of the pool, he climbed out of the water and cried: I won a medal! I won a medal!

title: On the Campaign Trail: G.O.P. Race Grows Cruder and More Aggressive
description: Join us for live updates and analysis of Super Tuesday.

title: Plan to Expand a Pipeline at Indian Point Raises Concern
description: BUCHANAN, N.Y.  Every so often, catastrophes prompt fresh worries about the Indian Point nuclear power plant, whose twin domes loom over the Hudson River about 45 miles north of Midtown Manhattan.

title: Paul Georges Secret: He Learned to Play Like a Girl
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Long before Paul George emerged as a star forward with the Indiana Pacers, he played countless games of one-on-one in the quiet street outside his familys home in Palmdale, Calif. The rules were simple: Each game went to 21 points, and only the most egregious fouls were called. The post was no place for the meek.

title: Brandishing a Short Putter, a Relieved Adam Scott Wins the Honda Classic
description: PALM BEACH GARDENS, Fla.  Adam Scott pulled his 8-iron and stared at his target. He had not won a golf tournament using a short putter in more than five years, but on Sunday at the Honda Classic, the shortest club in his bag plagued him less than the shortest hole on the PGA National Champion course: the 151-yard par-3 No. 15.

title: Christie Splits With His Past in Backing Trump
description: Join us for live updates and analysis of Super Tuesday.

title: For Stacey Augmon, U.N.L.V.s Mr. Rebel, the Time for Opportunity Has Come

title: Chris Rocks Opening Oscar Monologue: A Transcript
description: [ 2016 Oscar winners | reviewing Chris Rock | what happened in the show | red carpet looks ]

title: Vinyl Season 1, Episode 3: Rock Star Karaoke
description: Vinyl isnt the first TV show to fill out its cast of characters with a parade of real-life music stars from the past: American Dreams, for example, which ran on NBC from 2002 to 2005, was centered on the 1960s era of Dick Clarks music program American Bandstand, and included modern singers impersonating older ones (John Legend as Stevie Wonder, Usher as Marvin Gaye, Jennifer Love Hewitt as Nancy Sinatra). When a show pulls off this stunt, it can bring the past and the present into a dialogue  when it fails, it can feel like one long Halloween episode. Vinyl hasnt carved any pumpkins yet, but I worry that the show has a jumbo bag of fun-size Nestle Crunch stashed in the pantry.

title: The Walking Dead Season 6, Episode 11: Well That Got Awkward
description: Your worlds about to get a whole lot bigger.

title: A Chicago Academy, Lauded for Instilling Pride, Faces Closing
description: Illinoiss charter school commission plans to vote on Tuesday on whether to close the African-centered Barbara A. Sizemore Academy, which has performed poorly on national exams.

title: Poor Scores Leave an Afrocentric School in Chicago Vulnerable
description: CHICAGO  Test scores suggest that the Barbara A. Sizemore Academy, an African-centered school, is struggling mightily. Its students in third through eighth grades scored in only the 14th percentile in reading on national achievement tests last year and in the eighth percentile in math.

title: The Best Dresses (and the Biggest Trends) at the Oscars
description: From Lady Gagas white jumpsuit to Cate Blanchetts pastel Armani Priv, the standout looks from the 2016 awards show.

title: Fears About Water Supply Grip Village That Made Teflon Products
description: HOOSICK FALLS, N.Y.  One resident called 911 asking whether the villages water would burn his skin off. Families have lined up to have their blood drawn and their wells tested. Banks stopped giving out mortgages, and some local residents stopped washing their dishes, their clothes and themselves. Erin Brockovich has been to town.

title: Trash and Vaudeville, a Punk Emporium, Leaves Its East Village Home
description: At Trash and Vaudeville, the rock n roll clothing store in the East Village, punk rock music played as usual. Fliers for defunct bands peeled off the wall. Shoppers ambled through the cavernous space, plucking leather jackets from pipe racks.

title: Seven Face Charges After Melee at Klan Rally in Anaheim
description: Seven people were awaiting charges on Sunday in connection with a melee at a Ku Klux Klan rally in California the day before, during which anti-Klan protesters attacked two white supremacists, the police said.

title: Hillary Clinton Gets Help From Bill, in Spirit, at Least
description: PINE BLUFF, Ark. It was Hillary Clintons final event in the South before the string of contests on Super Tuesday that could set her on a surer path to the Democratic presidential nomination. But there was someone else on stage helping her here on Sunday night, in spirit, at least.

title: A.F.L.-C.I.O. Prepares to Create Its Own Super PAC to Get Voters to the Polls
description: The A.F.L.-C.I.O., the federation of unions representing nearly 10 million workers, is preparing plans for a super PAC that would raise tens of millions of dollars and focus on grass-roots efforts to mobilize voters.

title: Amare Stoudemire Laments Knicks Decline, Then Helps Sustain It
description: Amare Stoudemire sat down on the floor of the visitors locker room at Madison Square Garden, stretched his legs into a computerized massage machine and looked up to greet the dozen reporters hovering in a circle above him.

description: Trash and Vaudeville, a punk rock haven on St. Marks Place in the East Village, moved out of the space it had occupied since 1975.

description: Turns out the Oscar outfits were also white, #SoWhite...#SewWhite. Not merely the fabrics  though the nominee Rooney Mara looked like a medieval-castle bride in a Givenchy gown of cream translucent tapestry with a window over her midriff  but the fashion houses.

title: U.S. Soccers Rebranding Gets an Assist From Virtual Reality
description: For almost two years, the United States Soccer Federation fiddled with the redesign of its most conspicuous symbol: the red, white and blue crest adorning the jerseys of the mens and womens national teams.

title: Pakistan Hangs Guard for Assassination of Outspoken Secular Politician
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The Pakistani authorities early on Monday hanged Malik Mumtaz Hussain Qadri, who was convicted of killing Salmaan Taseer, a governor of Punjab Province who had campaigned to change the countrys blasphemy law.

description: Oh, mercy: HBO grooves down memory lane with Mavis Staples. Rachel and Josh set their repressed emotions to music in Crazy Ex-Girlfriend. And James Franco picks some favorites from the Criterion Collection.

description: MILAN  The Milan Fashion Week show schedule is bookended by two of the biggest brands in the business: opening with Gucci and closing with Giorgio Armani, at his sculptured headquarters on Via Bergognone.

description: #OscarsSoWhite, meet #OscarsSoContrite.

description: SEOUL, South Korea  An American student detained in North Korea appeared in a government-arranged news conference in Pyongyang, the capital, on Monday, apologizing for what the country called an antistate crime: trying to steal a political banner.

title: Backstage at the Oscars
description: Scenes of the stars before and after they took the stage during the 88th Academy Awards in Hollywood.

title: My Oscar Performance
description: On the red carpet, Oscar attendees recite lines from their nominated films.

title: Cuomo-de Blasio Feud Threatens New York Citys Plans for Affordable Housing
description: For most of the last two decades, financing affordable housing in New York City has been a predictable process, instrumental in adding tens of thousands of apartments for lower-income households in a city where rents continue to soar out of reach for more people every year.

title: Once Upon a Greek Island, Migrants and Tourists
description: Its hard to imagine enjoying a holiday getaway in an area rife with suffering. But it happens all the time, and not just in the developing world where verdant, gated resorts exist not far from impoverished shantytowns. Consider the Greek island of Lesbos, where sunbathers laze by azure waters while not too far away boats arrive daily full of families fleeing violence in Syria and other hot spots.

title: Planet on the Ballot
description: We now have a pretty good idea who will be on the ballot in November: Hillary Clinton, almost surely (after the South Carolina blowout, prediction markets give her a 96 percent probability of securing her partys nomination), and Donald Trump, with high likelihood (currently 80 percent probability on the markets). But even if theres a stunning upset in whats left of the primaries, we already know very well what will be at stake  namely, the fate of the planet.

title: H.I.V.s Toll on Black and Latino Men
description: There is encouraging news in the fight against H.I.V in the United States: Over all, fewer people are contracting the virus, which causes AIDS. But H.I.V. continues to take a devastating toll on men who have sex with men, particularly among African-Americans and Latinos. If current rates persist, one in every six men who has sex with men will become infected with H.I.V., the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said last week in its first lifetime risk analysis. One out of every two black men and one out of every four Latino men in this segment of the population is projected to become infected.

description: To the Editor:

title: Im Not a Super Predator
description: Days before Hillary Clinton thundered to an overwhelming victory over rival Bernie Sanders in South Carolina  largely on the strength of black voters who supported her by an even higher percentage than they supported Barack Obama with in 2008  a young, proudly queer, black activist, Ashley Williams, was in Charlotte, N.C., plotting an action that would make a statement of its own.

title: From Je Suis Charlie to Attacks on Free Speech
description: After the murderous attack on the offices of the satirical French magazine Charlie Hebdo in January 2015, Je suis Charlie became a rallying cry in France and across much of Europe in support of free speech and freedom of expression. It is a sad and depressing sequel to that display of solidarity that so many European nations seem willing today to curtail those same freedoms in the name of fighting terrorism.

title: Clinton, Sanders and the Fight Over Obamas Legacy
description: Picture a largely unknown, black first-term senator with a surname that rhymes with Osama, who spent part of his childhood living in a Muslim country, crisscrossing the country calling for revolution, perhaps with a guy called Killer Mike in tow. Now imagine that person becoming president of the United States.

title: The Broken System of Classifying Government Documents
description: EVERY few years, a news event demonstrates how dysfunctional, arbitrary and counterproductive the countrys system of classifying information really is. Sometimes its an article or book about government conduct that causes hand-wringing among intelligence officials. Sometimes its a prosecution under the nearly 100-year-old Espionage Act for mishandling classified information, instead of for actual spying. Now we have calls for prosecuting Hillary Clinton because, when she was secretary of state, she had documents on her private email server that have since been declared top secret.

title: A Better, Not Bigger, Military Budget
description: Given recent history, the next president can expect to face an even more unpredictable world than the one President Obama is dealing with. Russia, China, Syria, Iran, North Korea, the Islamic State  the list of security challenges is daunting. It will require smart policy choices backed by a powerful military to protect American interests.
Las Souza

title: News Qs | The Economic Effects of Marriage Equality
description: The following lesson activities are based on the Upshot article Equality in Marriages Grows, and So Does Class Divide.

title: A Conversation With Latinos on Race
description: In this short documentary, Latinos grapple with defining their ethnic and racial identities.

title: A Conversation With Latinos on Race
description: Last year we set out to make a series of short documentaries that we hoped would foster a discussion about race relations in the United States. To date the series has focused on the personal nuances of systemic racism as reflected in the relationship between blacks and whites. And while that dynamic is a significant part of the American story of race, it does not fully reflect the countrys varied history and rapidly changing demographics. So for our next installment of our Conversation on Race series, we decided to go broader, and hear from Latinos on their experiences here.

title: Student Question | Should Displays of Art Be Welcome in All Public Spaces?
description: Many public spaces such as parks are home to art such as sculpture or site-specific installations. Finding a way to bring art appreciation to the drudgery of commuting, for example, is behind a collaboration presented in a German subway. There are even degree programs in social practice devoted to creating and presenting communal art.

title: Eyes on Kennedy, Women Tell Supreme Court Why Abortion Was Right for Them
description: WASHINGTON  Amy Brenneman, an actress, wants Justice Anthony M. Kennedy to know about the abortion she had when she was a 21-year-old college junior.

title: As Detroit Starts to Mend, Its Schools Lurch Toward Fiscal Crisis
description: DETROIT  Since this city emerged from bankruptcy at the end of 2014, it has eked out a tentative recovery, tearing down thousands of abandoned houses, restoring streetlights and luring new businesses.

title: Identidad y Raza: Una Conversacin Entre Latinos
description: El ao pasado nos propusimos hacer una serie de documentales cortos con la esperanza de fomentar una discusin acerca de las relaciones raciales en los Estados Unidos. Hasta la fecha, la serie se ha enfocado en los pormenores personales del racismo sistemtico que se refleja en las relaciones entre personas blancas y negras. Mientras que esa dinmica es una parte significativa de la historia racial estadounidense, no refleja del todo la diversidad histrica y la configuracin cambiante de nuestra nacin. As que para nuestra siguiente entrega de la serie Conversaciones en torno a la raza, decidimos ir ms all y escuchar las experiencias de los latinos de este pas.

title: E.L.L. Practice + Prompt | The Life of a Refugee
description: Note: We invite any English Language Learner student 13 years or older to post comments in response to the writing prompts in this post.

title: Stars Celebrate at the Governors Ball
description: After the last Oscar was handed out, Hollywoods biggest names flocked to an after-party.

title: The Civil Wars of Julia Ward Howe, by Elaine Showalter
description: It needed a very serene or a very powerful mind to resist the temptation to anger, Virginia Woolf wrote in 1929 in an essay about 19th-century women writers. A woman might start out writing about one thing or another but, before she knew it, shed find herself resenting the treatment of her sex and pleading for its rights. This was a pity, Woolf thought, and a trap she hoped women were on the verge of escaping.

title: Constance Fenimore Woolson and Miss Grief and Other Stories
description: If the American writer Constance Fenimore Woolson is remembered at all, its mostly for her dresses. And these werent just any dresses. These were the dark silk ones that, after her sudden death, Henry James presumably tried to drown in a Venetian lagoon, hurling them from his gondola and jabbing them with a pole to keep them from rising. But he failed, and to Woolsons admirers his failure is symbolic: You cant keep this good writer down.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | Feb. 29, 2016
description: Updated: March 4, 2016

title: Trumps Il Duce Routine
description: LONDON  Europe, the soil on which Fascism took root, is watching the rise of Donald Trump with dismay. Contempt for the excesses of America is a European reflex, but when the United States seems tempted by a latter-day Mussolini, smugness in London, Paris and Berlin gives way to alarm. Europe knows that democracies can collapse.

title: Pakistan Braces for Violence After Execution of Governors Killer
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The authorities in Pakistan were bracing for the possibility of violence and escalating protests on Monday after the execution of the man who killed Salmaan Taseer, a governor who had campaigned for changes in the countrys blasphemy laws.

title: Cruise and Air News: Barge Trips on Sale, Polar Snorkeling
description: SNORKELING THE NORTH POLE

title: Turning Your Pet Into a Therapy Dog
description: It did not take long for me to recognize the therapeutic potential of Max, the hypoallergenic 5-month-old Havanese puppy I adopted in March 2014. He neither barked nor growled and seemed to like everyone, especially the many children that come up and down our block.

title: Your Monday Briefing: Academy Awards, Chris Rock, Donald Trump
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New York Today: Leap-Day Lore
description: Updated, 10:04 a.m.

title: Q. and A.: Minxin Pei on the Future of Communist Rule in China
description: Some social scientists spend their careers researching small-scale topics that may help push forward our understanding of bigger forces shaping our lives. Or not. Many academic papers are never cited.

title: Morning Agenda: Buffett Rejects Activism and U.S. Decline
description: BUFFETT REJECTS ACTIVISM AND U.S. DECLINE | For 240 years its been a terrible mistake to bet against America, and now is no time to start, was the message from Warren E. Buffett in his annual letter to shareholders.

title: The Giving Tree, Giving Syrup Year After Year After ...
description: Q. How can maple trees used in the production of syrup not be harmed when they are drained of their sap?

title: ScienceTake | Teaching Crows
description: With a little training, crows can master a kind of animal shell game.

title: Crows Clever Enough to Learn a Shell Game
description: New Caledonian crows are especially clever. Experiments have shown that they are able to make tools and use them, and theyll even add stones to water to raise the level higher.

title: When Symptoms of Television Began Their Inexorable Spread
description: It was a problem that everyone knew was solvable, but one that had yet to be solved.

title: E.U. and U.S. Release Details on Trans-Atlantic Data Transfer Deal
description: American and European officials released details on Monday about a new trans-Atlantic data transfer agreement, prompting a new round of debate about how companies like Google move digital information between the two regions.

title: Senate Republicans Hope Bipartisan Drug Bill Shifts Focus From Supreme Court
description: Senate Republicans are hoping to get back to business this week and shift attention away from the political fight raging over the Supreme Court vacancy with the consideration of a bipartisan measure on drug addiction and treatment.

title: Veterans Seek Help for Infertility Inflicted by Wounds of War
description: During a firefight in Afghanistan in 2005, Army Cpl. Tyler Wilson, then 20, was hit by a bullet that pierced his spine and left him paralyzed below the waist.

title: At Missoni, the After-Party Has to Be a Family Meal
description: MILAN  It was 9:30 p.m. on a chilly Sunday in an industrial area on the outskirts of Milan, and rain had been pounding down for 48 hours. The Missoni show had just ended, and Angela Missoni, the brands creative director, was welcoming around 120 guests for supper.

title: 1941: Bulgaria Joins Axis
description: The entrance of Bulgaria today into what was originally the Rome-Berlin Axis will make her the seventh nation to participate in that political and military front, which was first set up in May 1939, in Berlin.

title: Justices to Announce Appeals They Will Hear Without Antonin Scalia
description: Most Fridays during the Supreme Court term, the justices gather in a private conference to decide which appeals they will hear. The odds have always been long: About one in 100 requests for review are granted. With Justice Antonin Scalias death, the odds just got longer.

title: Violence Erupts in Greece as Migrants Try to Cross Into Macedonia
description: ATHENS  It was a scene of a type that could become all too common in coming months: Thousands of increasingly desperate people backed up at the frontier between Greece and Macedonia on Monday, stymied in their efforts to reach Germany. A group of angry asylum seekers busted through a razor-wire fence. Armed police officers fired tear gas as frenzied crowds chanted, Open the border!

title: China Moves to Bolster Lending by Easing Banks Reserve Ratio
description: HONG KONG  China said Monday evening that it would free up banks in the country to lend more, as the government tries to shore up slowing economic growth.

title: One Day Until Super Tuesday, When Some Clarity (Maybe) Moves In
description: A raucous Republican race could gain clarity this week, and Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont could face a dwindling opportunity to prove he can develop support beyond his coalition of younger, whiter voters, as the parallel primaries head into Super Tuesday.

title: Where Marco Rubio Has the Best Chance to Win
description: Can Marco Rubio win a state on Super Tuesday? Its not an especially high bar  after all, there are 12 for him to choose from. But he hasnt won a state yet, and a win would quell the complaints that he hasnt.

title: TSCA Letter to Congressional Leaders
description: This letter was sent to congressional leaders in early February by top environmental officials in eight states, raising issues with legislation now pending in the House and Senate that would change the way toxic chemicals are regulated in the United States.

title: State Attorneys General Letter to Congress
description: This letter was sent by attorneys general in a dozen states to Congress to object to certain language in legislation that would change how toxic chemicals are regulated in the United States  particularly provisions that would pre-empt state powers.

title: Giorgio Armani: Fall 2016 RTW
description: Looks from the mind of Giorgio Armani.

title: Chemical Safety Bill Could Help Protect Monsanto Against Legal Claims
description: WASHINGTON  Facing hundreds of millions of dollars in lawsuits, the giant biotechnology company Monsanto last year received a legislative gift from the House of Representatives, a one-paragraph addition to a sweeping chemical safety bill that could help shield it from legal liability for a toxic chemical only it made.

title: Hong Kong Bookseller Confesses on TV to Evading Rules on Shipping to Mainland
description: HONG KONG  A co-owner of a Hong Kong publishing house who disappeared from his home in Thailand only to emerge in police custody in China has given a televised confession, saying that his company circumvented customs regulations to ship politically sensitive books from Hong Kong to the mainland.

title: Arthur Arbesser: Fall 2016 RTW
description: The fall 2016 collection from Arthur Arbesser.

title: CNN Poll Points to a Donald Trump-Hillary Clinton Matchup in November
description: Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton are racing toward a general election matchup, according to a new poll that shows the presidential candidates with dominant national leads atop their parties.

title: Once I Saw Light in Iran. Now Its Mostly Shadows.
description: I REMEMBER vividly the first time I ever voted in an Iranian election. It was a balmy summer day in June 2001, in the election that won the reformist president Mohammad Khatami a second term. The blue stamp was the first on the voting page of my identification card, and I felt a sharp, exhilarating pride.

title: Democrats, Looking to South, Face Balance Between Core and Younger Voters
description: ATLANTA  For years, voting as a Deep South Democrat in a presidential general election has been like shouting at the television set: It may feel good, but it will not make much of a difference.

title: Japan Indicts 3 Former Executives Over Fukushima Nuclear Disaster
description: TOKYO  Japanese prosecutors indicted three former executives of the Tokyo Electric Power Company, the owner of the ruined Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Station, on Monday, charging them with criminal negligence for their role in reactor meltdowns after an earthquake and tsunami five years ago.

title: Icahn Makes Bid for Federal-Mogul, an Auto-Parts Supplier
description: Two months after winning a bidding war for the car-parts retailer Pep Boys, Carl C. Icahn has his sights on acquiring another company in the auto industry: the Federal-Mogul Holdings Corporation.

title: 1956 | Why Read When You Can Redecorate?
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how daily news, features and opinion pieces come together at The New York Times. Below, reporter David W. Dunlap discusses The Timess publication of a guidebook, in 1956, for decorating ones home with books.

title: Mahathir Mohamad Quits Malaysias Governing Party, Citing Corruption
description: BANGKOK  Mahathir Mohamad, who long dominated Malaysian politics as prime minister and leader of its governing party, said on Monday that he was quitting the organization because he was embarrassed by its role in protecting Prime Minister Najib Razak from accusations of corruption.

title: Muslim Enclave Forged in Apartheid Now Faces Gentrification
description: CAPE TOWN  In the days when everyone in the neighborhood celebrated Muslim holidays, Mogamat Khan Salie would take almost two hours to walk the three blocks from the mosque to his home.

title: Donald Trump Blames Earpiece for Declining to Disavow David Duke
British Regulators to Exempt Small Banks From Bonus Cap
description: LONDON  British financial regulators said on Monday that they would continue to exempt small banks and similarly sized financial institutions from European rules that cap bankers bonuses.

title: How Clinton and Sanders Pursue Change, Academically Speaking
description: How, actually, does the world change?

title: The Bumpy Road to New Technologies
description: The hype of a new technology is outpacing commercial success. Sound familiar?

title: Making the Mac Ignore Those Phone Calls
description: Q. I have an iPhone and an iMac and somehow when the phone rings, so does the computer. Any idea how to turn off the computer component so just the iPhone rings?

title: Nate Cohn and Justin Wolfers on Donald Trumps Chances
description: Justin Wolfers, a University of Michigan economist, and The Upshots Nate Cohn debated the likelihood that Donald Trump would become the Republican nominee. We thought you might enjoy the conversation.

title: Daughter of Abe Vigoda Is Upset About Oscars Memoriam Snub
description: The daughter of Abe Vigoda, the sad-face actor who died last month at 94 and was known for his roles in The Godfather and the television show Barney Miller, said on Monday it was wrong for her father to have been left out of the In Memoriam segment of the Academy Awards on Sunday night.

title: Woman Waving Childs Severed Head Is Arrested in Moscow
description: MOSCOW  A visibly disturbed woman was arrested on Monday after witnesses said they saw her waving the severed head of a small child outside a Moscow subway station. A Russian television network, REN TV, posted images from video that appeared to show the woman dressed in black and shouting incoherently. The Interfax news agency identified her as Gulchekhra Bobokulova, 38, a native of Uzbekistan, and said she was the childs nanny. The childs body was found near the subway station in an apartment that had been set on fire, the news agency said. Investigators issued a statement saying the woman had been charged with killing the child, who was 3 or 4, and that she appeared to be mentally unstable.

title: Deepwater Horizon and Dewey & Leboeuf Cases Share Challenges
description: The explosion of the Deepwater Horizon drilling rig in the Gulf of Mexico in 2010 and the demise of venerable New York law firm Dewey & Leboeuf in 2012 could not be more different. One causing widespread pollution along with 11 deaths, while the other involved questionable accounting to keep the firm afloat as it struggled to deal with a changing marketplace.

title: Bernie Sanders Collects $36 Million in February as Fund-Raising Successes Continue
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont raised more than $36 million in February and was hoping to hit the $40 million mark by the end of the day on Monday, his campaign announced.

title: Souq, Online Retailer in Middle East, Gets a $275 Million Boost
description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates  Souq.com, an online retailer based in the United Arab Emirates, said on Monday that it had raised $275 million from international investors. It was a vote of confidence for digital commerce in the Middle East, which has made little headway compared with elsewhere.

title: Beyond the Red Carpet, at Giorgio Armani and Missoni
description: MILAN  It was probably always going to be anticlimactic. Stuck between the Oscars (rock) and Super Tuesday (hard place), not to mention the news that the unthinkable was happening and Starbucks was coming to Italy, there wasnt much the final Milanese shows could do to claim peoples attention.

title: Even as He Rises, Donald Trump Entertains Conspiracy Theories
description: It was a question that most major presidential candidates would have quickly dismissed as absurd, even offensive: What do you make of these theories that Justice Antonin Scalia was murdered?

title: What China Has Been Building in the South China Sea
description: China has been feverishly piling sand onto reefs in the South China Sea, creating seven new islets in the region and straining already taut geopolitical tensions.

title: 1916: Kaisers Goal Is Verdun
description: Despite the instructions which have been issued to the German press to diminish the importance of the attack upon Verdun and even to deny that the capture of this stronghold has been the German high commands objective; despite also the semi-official statement published in the Norddeutsche Allgemeine Zeitung that the object of the attack has been attained and that the present attack is not of exceptional importance; the Kaiser has just admitted in a telegram that his hopes, now doomed to disappointment, were centred in the capture of Verdun. The New York Herald, European Edition, March 1, 1916

title: Make a Plan on How to Handle Risk, Then Stick to It
description: I ski the backcountry a lot, so I pay close attention to reports of avalanches. In particular, I pay attention when a skier is caught and killed by one. This year alone there have been 20 avalanche fatalities in the United States. In January, there were nine fatalities in nine days.

title: Donald Trumps Conspiracy Theories
description: From hinting that Justice Antonin Scalia may have been murdered to suggesting that George W. Bush knew the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks were coming, Donald J. Trump has shared many outrageous conspiracy theories.

title: Argentina Reaches Deal With Hedge Funds Over Debt
description: Argentina has agreed to pay $4.65 billion to four hedge funds in a deal that could put an end to more than a decade of mudslinging and legal attacks that had cut the country off from global financial markets.

title: The Daily Jewel: Salvatore Ferragamo
description: These swinging pendulum earrings at Ferragamo were simultaneously intricate and entirely simple.

title: The Daily Shoe: Dolce & Gabbana
description: These Cinderella shoes are a sheer delight, from their fairy-tale flowers to their blue pompoms.

title: The Daily Bag: Marni
description: Just think of all the bangles you wont have to wear when toting around this mini bucket bag by its oversize ring of a handle.

title: Nicole Aragis Family History in a Jar
description: In her kitchen, Nicole Aragi keeps a jar of olive oil from a village in Lebanon whose name she cannot pronounce, high in the mountains above Beirut where her father was born.

title: 8 Recipes for Now
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: The Pocket Watch, a Gentlemans Best Friend
description: In the early 18th century, when a handmade pocket watch was the ultimate luxury for a gentleman, master clockmakers engineered one that could tell time at night, even after the candles had been extinguished. With the touch of a button, the divinely complex mechanism would chime a mellifluous pattern counting off the hour, and then, in increments of five, the minutes. Baume & Merciers new Clifton 1830 pocket watch is an updated version of that marvel, showcasing the five-minute repeater, a complication long vaunted by aficionados. The Swiss house has made just 30, set in 18-karat red gold. It makes telling time by the glaring face of a smartphone seem strangely pass.

title: Oscar Ratings Fell, but All Eyes Are on the Academy
description: LOS ANGELES  The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences survived, just barely, Sundays tumultuous Oscar telecast. Overall ratings tumbled to near record lows but did not completely implode, as some movie executives had feared.

title: At Giorgio Armani, the Romantic Side of Fall
description: When he first envisioned the beauty look for his flower-filled fall collection, Giorgio Armani drew a woman with an upswept pouf of hair and handed the sketch to the Aldo Coppola hairstylist Roberta Bellazzi. To create the look, she loaded hair with product: Elnett spray, mousse, and  she admitted sheepishly  sugar water, which turned out to be the key ingredient for what she called a cotton candy effect. The back of the head was pulled into a tight, upswept twist and held in place with copious amounts of micro bobby pins, while on top, hair was shaped into spirals with a curling iron and sculpted into its final fluffy form, delicately falling to one side of models faces.

title: The Best and Worst of the Oscars
description: Chris Rock provoked, Spotlight stunned  and not every joke landed quite right. Here are some of the most memorable moments of the night.

title: Capturing the Academy Awards  in Real Time
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how daily news, features and opinion pieces come together at The New York Times. Today, Craig Allen, a photo editor, describes the process behind The Timess photographic coverage of the Academy Awards.

title: Digital Ads for Hillary Clinton Focus on Young Women and Equal Pay
description: Two outside groups supportive of Hillary Clintons campaign are running their first ads as part of a multimillion dollar advertising effort hoping to energize the millennial female voting base.

title: Fighting the Incredible Shrinking Airline Seat
description: Can plane seats get any smaller?

title: Narendra Modi Struggles to Fulfill His Plan to Rejuvenate India
description: MUMBAI, India  A flash fire sent the star-studded audience at Prime Minister Narendra Modis Make in India convention fleeing into Mumbais streets last month. But that was minor compared with the political firestorm caused by his governments arrest that same weekend of a student leader accused of participating in a university rally in support of a man put to death for a terrorist attack in India years ago.

title: Cabbage and Potato Gratin Makes a Rich Vegetarian Meal
description: Why is this sweet? a friend of mine asked as he spooned a second helping of cabbage and potato gratin onto his plate.

title: How the Supreme Courts Decision Will Affect Access to Abortion
description: The case centers on a Texas law that has resulted in half its clinics closing.

title: The Rajahs Pearls
description: This weeks puzzle was suggested by Fred Gluck, a math educator who works mainly with grade-school children.I really enjoy Freds challenge because theres more than one way to crack it. How many can we come up with? Lets find out by trying on

title: Fight the Power Roars Back to Relevance at the Oscars
description: As Chris Rock strolled onto the Dolby Theater stage Sunday night and prepared to lay waste to the Academy Awards, there was a hint of what was to come in the music playing in the background: Public Enemys Fight the Power.

title: On New Yorks Bustling Streets, a Soccer Megastar Roams Freely
description: To many people around the world, Andrea Pirlo is a god. As a soccer player for some of the planets biggest clubs, he has two Champions League trophies and six league titles. In 2006, he won the World Cup with Italy, where he has three times been player of the year, and where his nicknames include Mozart and The Professor. His 2013 autobiography, I Think Therefore I Play, was a best seller in Italy. There are social media accounts devoted entirely to his beard. A quick Google search of his name returns results like 37 Reasons Why Andrea Pirlo Is the Worlds Greatest Living Human Man. He has met two popes.

title: Antico No Panini From Florence Now Sold in New York
description: The logo and the name of the panini shop Antico No, off Piazza San Pier Maggiore in Florence, Italy, came from an old mirror on the wall. It advertised an Italian vermouth, Antico No. Michael Grant and Vinny Dautaj, who lived in Florence and became devotees of the 71-year-old shop, have opened a New York branch with the blessing of the originals owners. They offer 10 of the shops 25 panini, made on sub-style breads, white and seven grain, pressed and crisped in a press. Finding someone to bake the bread was not easy, Mr. Grant said. It has very little salt and is light enough to press flat: Antico No, 220 East 53rd Street, 212-750-0802, anticonoe.com.

title: Why Liberal Massachusetts Is Poised to Give Donald Trump a Big Victory
description: It might strike some people as a misprint: Donald Trump has a giant lead in the polls heading into the Massachusetts primary on Tuesday.

title: Sam Smith, the Only Openly Gay Oscar Winner? Not Really
description: Viewers of the 88th Academy Awards had two words for the singer Sam Smiths performance Sunday night: off pitch.

title: For Bronson Arroyo, a Comeback at 39 Would Be Pure Gravy
description: VIERA, Fla.  Bronson Arroyo dresses next to Lucas Giolito in the Washington Nationals clubhouse at spring training. Both pitchers are tall right-handers, but that is where the similarities end. Giolito was born in 1994, in the summer before Arroyos senior year in high school. He has not yet pitched in the major leagues. Arroyo has logged 15 seasons.

title: Riots Erupt on Greek Border
description: Conflict on the border with Macedonia surged as the Greek government warned that as many as 70,000 people could be trapped in the country within a month.

title: Clarence Thomas Breaks 10 Years of Silence at Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON  Breaking a decade-long silence, Justice Clarence Thomas on Monday suddenly started asking questions from the Supreme Court bench.

title: Nail Salon Sweeps in New York Reveal Abuses and Regulatory Challenges
description: When a New York State labor investigator entered a Long Island nail salon last July, she spotted two women sneaking out the back. The owner insisted that they did not work there.

title: Partisan Classiness
description: Many people in the commentariat are utterly committed to the view that the two major parties are mirror images of each other, despite vast evidence to the contrary. But until Harry Enten directed me to this interesting paper by Grossman and Hopkins, I hadnt really registered the extent to which the same assumption of symmetry is often made by political scientists. What Grossman and Hopkins do is try to document the very real differences in the two parties structure  not in terms of value judgments, but in terms of how they work:

title: Clubbed Thumbs Summerworks Festival Announces Lineup
description: Three in-demand playwrights will debut new plays at the Clubbed Thumbs Summerworks Festival, which runs May 27-July 9 at Wild Project in Manhattan. Julia Jarcho, Ethan Lipton and Eric Dufault will join an impressive list of playwrights who have worked with this festival, which emphasizes the discovery and showcasing of rising writers.

title: In Zimbabwe, Mugabes Birthday Is Rife With Political Jockeying
description: MASVINGO, Zimbabwe  The lavish annual birthday parties for President Robert G. Mugabe of Zimbabwe, who has been in power since the country gained independence in 1980, have been a stage from which he has swatted away challengers and secured his larger-than-life hold on his nation.

title: Threes a Trend: Vibrant Graphic Prints
description: Despite rain in Milan this week, bright, kaleidoscopic patterns have dominated the runways. Massimo Giorgettis second outing for Emilio Pucci (left) offered a colorful collection that took cues from ski wear, including this boxy jacket and pencil skirt in blue and yellow stripes. Marni (center), another brand fond of graphic motifs, showed a knee-length tunic in a pattern that recalled abstract art. And at Salvatore Ferragamo (right), Massimiliano Giornetti presented a vibrant, zigzag cape and skirt that were just as colorful as the runway.

title: Unpublished: Black History Notables
description: Can you identify these six famous figures in black history?

description: Do you know these moments in sports and black history?

title: Unpublished: The Back Stories
description: Revealing moments in black history, with unpublished photos from The New York Timess archives.

title: Sumner Redstone Competency Case Will Go Forward
description: The lawsuit challenging the mental competence of the ailing 92-year-old media mogul Sumner M. Redstone will go to trial in May because of a plethora of disputed factual issues over his capacity and current medical care, a California judge ruled on Monday.

title: Lets Talk About the Oscars: An Evening of Squirming
description: The story so far: In January, when the nominations for the 88th Academy Awards were announced and not a single nonwhite performer was recognized, a lot of people voiced their outrage about the omissions. The oversights werent new for this predominantly white organization, but the intensity and volume of the criticisms were.

title: Reviewing the Oscars From Afar
description: MILAN  On Monday, barely hours after the Oscars show had ended halfway across the world, the fashion flock had to hie themselves to the Giorgio Armani show, with barely a chance to scan the slide shows to see what they had missed (Cate Blanchett in floral-strewn mint Armani, for one).

title: At Milan Fashion Week, Now in the Front Row
description: Here are some of the celebrities getting attention at the shows this season.

title: The Backlash in Birmingham
description: The Alabama legislature has voted to nullify a law passed last year in Birmingham that would have set the citys minimum wage at $10.10 by mid-2017.

title: On the Trail: The Week of Feb. 21
description: Voters participated in the Republican caucuses in Nevada and in the Democratic primary in South Carolina.

title: Iranian President and Moderates Make Strong Gains in Elections
description: TEHRAN  Nearly three years after Irans reform-minded president was elected, the most reactionary voices in Iranian politics are losing ground to moderates buoyed by the sweeping nuclear deal with big powers, including the United States.

title: Hope and Fear Await a Basque Leader on His Release From Prison
description: MADRID  A terrorist to some, an independence leader to others, Arnaldo Otegi has been in and out of Spanish courts and prisons for three decades for his links to ETA, the separatist group that has led a violent campaign for an independent Basque homeland.

title: What to Look For in a Wine Store
description: Six key points to consider when judging which wine store works best for you.

title: How to Pick a Wine Store
description: If you care about wine and want to drink better and more confidently, the best thing you can do is cultivate a close relationship with a good wine shop. I have been making this case for years without ever addressing the obvious question: How do you know if a wine shop is good?

title: Review: Dark Territory Illuminates Cybersecuritys Shadows
description: Fred Kaplan has written a consistently eye-opening history of our governments efforts to effectively manage our national security in the face of the largely open global communications network established by the World Wide Web.

title: Derek Hough to Play Gene Kelly Role in Singin in the Rain on Broadway
description: Derek Hough will make a splash on Broadway next January: He has been cast as the lead in the Thtre du Chtelets production of Singin in the Rain. Mr. Hough, a two-time Emmy winner (for Dancing with the Stars), has stage experience from the 2006 West End production of Footloose. Here, hell step into the role of Don Lockwood, which Gene Kelly made famous in the 1952 film.

title: In Half Earth, E.O. Wilson Calls for a Grand Retreat
description: This week, the biologist Edward O. Wilson, professor emeritus at Harvard University and recipient of two Pulitzer Prizes, will publish his 32nd book, a personal exhortation to conserve biodiversity titled Half Earth: Our Planets Fight for Life.

title: Free the Tampons
description: Call it the period paradox. Everyone knows most girls and women menstruate, but even in the age of oversharing, periods are treated like a dirty little secret.

title: By Disclosing Tax Data, Rivals Pressure Donald Trump to Do the Same
description: Putting heft behind their calls for Donald J. Trump to release his income tax filings, Marco Rubio and Ted Cruz have now made public some details of their own taxes.

title: Woman, 77, Fatally Struck by Livery Cab in Midtown
description: Carol Dauplaise was crossing Madison Avenue at 36th Street just after 8:30 a.m. on Monday, a few blocks from her apartment and the costume jewelry company that she started more than 35 years ago, when a black livery cab turned and struck her, pinning her under the car.

title: Another Trip Cut Short on Anthem of the Seas
description: It happened again: Less than a month after Royal Caribbeans Anthem of the Seas vessel returned earlier than scheduled to its port of origin in Cape Liberty, N.J.,  after facing 120 m.p.h. winds off Cape Hatteras, N.C., the ship ended another cruise early in anticipation of a severe storm expected in the same location.

title: Donald Trump Carries Big Leads in Alabama and Oklahoma, Polls Show
description: Donald J. Trump is in position to sweep to victories in the Alabama and Oklahoma primaries on Tuesday, according to a new polls that show strong support from evangelical Christians potentially helping him win a big haul of delegates.

title: Curtis Grandersons Eye Malady Underscores Mets Outfield Depth
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  When Curtis Granderson arrived at the Mets complex Monday morning, he was wearing glasses because he was worried about redness around his eye. The Mets worried it might be pinkeye, and given how contagious that can be, they sent him away and asked him to skip his normal drills for the day.

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: Female Viagra Only Modestly Increases Sexual Satisfaction, Study Finds
description: WASHINGTON  Half of one satisfying sexual encounter a month. That is the average benefit a woman gets when she takes the new female libido drug, sometimes called the female Viagra, researchers reported Monday.

title: Australia Hampers Climate Efforts
description: To the Editor:

title: Party Hopping With Daisy Ridley and Bryan Cranston
description: Everyone loves an underdog story, especially a surprise one, and ripples of delight over Spotlights win for best picture spread out from the Dolby Theater on Sunday night into the after-party beyond.

title: A Mens Store for the Everyguy
description: Willy Chavarria, 48, the tattooed owner of Palmer Trading Company, at 137 Sullivan Street in Manhattan, set up shop in 2010. When we started, it was all vintage, Mr. Chavarria said.

title: France Faces Protests as It Dismantles Jungle Migrant Camp
description: PARIS  The French authorities faced angry protesters on Monday as they began to dismantle part of a vast migrant camp near the northern city of Calais after a court order last week that at least partially allowed the government to move forward with its plans to vacate the settlement, known as the Jungle.

title: A Decade Later, Clarence Thomas Speaks Again
description: Ten years and one week after it began without warning or explanation, Justice Clarence Thomass unofficial vow of silence has ended.

title: Argentinas Debt Settlement Ends 15-Year Battle
description: The announcement of a $4.65 billion agreement between the Argentine government and four holdout hedge funds promises to end a 15-year battle that started when the government defaulted on $100 billion in debt in 2001.

title: Hillary Clinton Rallies Large Crowd in Boston Before the Primary
description: BOSTON  A buoyant Hillary Clinton plunged into the crowd here after a barnstorming speech, posing for selfies and shaking hands on the eve of what she hopes will be a pivotal victory in the 11 states, including Massachusetts, that hold Democratic nominating contests on Tuesday.

title: Invasive Species Arent Always Unwanted
description: Invasive species are bad news, or so goes the conventional wisdom, encouraged by persistent warnings from biologists about the dangers of foreign animals and plants moving into new territories.

title: Does This Species Belong Here?
description: Many common animals, plants and insects are not native to the environments in which they are now found. Take this quiz and learn more about the living things that surround you.

description: Nikita and Tina Sutradhar share images from The Explorer.

title: Nikki Haley Faults Donald Trump for Not Condemning White Supremacists
The Birth of Postwar Italian Style
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla.  Bonnie Clearwater cast a covetous eye on a pair of wool coats. Id love to own one, she said. Wear it and you wont end up looking like a box.

title: Parents of American Held in North Korea Unable to Speak With Him
description: The parents of an American college student who tearfully apologized on North Korean state television on Monday for having plotted to steal a political banner said they had been unable to speak with their son since the North Korean police seized him two months ago.

title: Women Waiting Longer to Have Children
description: American women are having their first babies at increasingly older ages.

title: Goldman Sachs Puts Worker Linked to Donald Trump on Leave
description: A financial adviser who was recently highlighted in an article in The New York Times as the only Goldman Sachs employee to contribute to Donald J. Trumps presidential campaign has been placed on administrative leave, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Bernie Sanders Tells Minnesotans They Can Make History
description: MINNEAPOLIS  On the eve of voting in 11 Democratic contests, Bernie Sanders told hundreds of supporters here on Monday that he was counting on them to defeat Hillary Clinton and start a political revolution.

title: Sikh Soldier Sues Defense Dept., Citing Religious Discrimination
description: A combat soldier who is Sikh sued the Defense Department on Monday, saying his beard and turban had made him the subject of religious discrimination because the Army was putting him through arduous helmet and gas mask testing that no other soldier goes through.

title: Milan Fashion Week: Marni and Dolce & Gabbana in Pictures
description: A photo diary of the fall/winter 2016 collections that were presented Sunday.

title: Just Dandy: the Style and Legacy of Mr. Fish
description: In the late 60s, this one peculiar designer redefined mens fashion  silk blouses, swishy florals and all. His look is back.

title: The Peculiar 60s Designer Who Redefined Mens Fashion
description: He went by the name of Mr. Fish. And today, his gender-bending look  silk blouses, swishy florals and all  is back.

title: Adeles 25 Hits No. 1 on Billboard Chart for the 10th Time
Chris Rocks Asian Joke at Oscars Provokes Backlash
description: Amid generally positive reviews of his jabs at Hollywood and #OscarsSoWhite, the host of Sundays Oscar ceremony, Chris Rock, is being taken to task for some of his material involving Asian-Americans.

title: Ad Tars John McCains Pledge to Back the Republican Nominee
description: If Republicans are worried about a Donald J. Trump presidential nomination damaging the party down the ballot in November, Representative Ann Kirkpatrick, the Arizona Democratic who is challenging Senator John McCain, is offering a prime example of why they should be.

title: Where to Reset and Relax During Paris Fashion Week
description: The culinary capital has embraced its fitter, more Zenned-out side.

title: Eric Staal Opens His Rangers Career With a Victory
description: After Eric Staal told his family he had been traded to the Rangers, Levi Staal, who is 4 years old and is the second of Eric and Tanya Staals three sons, told Eric time after time that he did not want his father to move away. Eric assured Levi that he would not be leaving North Carolina without him.

title: Catalog Interview With Gloria Steinem Has Lands End on Its Heels
description: The retailer Lands End was scrambling to disentangle itself from the feminist icon Gloria Steinem after an interview printed in a recent catalog prompted criticism from parents at Christian schools and anti-abortion activists.

title: Judge Grants Delay of Sodium Warnings for New York City Restaurants
description: An appeals court on Monday ordered a temporary halt to New York Citys enforcement of a measure requiring some chain restaurants to post warnings on menu items with high levels of sodium.

title: SEAL Who Wrestled Gunman and Shielded Hostage Is Awarded Medal of Honor
description: WASHINGTON  Edward C. Byers Jr., a senior chief special warfare operator, was the second Navy SEAL team member to enter a Taliban compound on a frigid night in December 2012, part of a mission to rescue an American doctor being held hostage in eastern Afghanistan. The first, Petty Officer First Class Nicolas Checque, was shot in the head after he burst through the door.

title: Valeant Chief Returns to a Difficult To-Do List
description: J. Michael Pearson is back as chief executive of Valeant Pharmaceuticals International, but with less power and no glory. He is no longer chairman of the drug makers board.

description: Greece and Elsewhere  Pictures of the Day

description: Photos from Greece, France, Italy and the United States.

description: The worst hotel experiences can be caused by an insect smaller than a fingernail clipping.

description: To the Editor:

title: Review: Dana Spiottas Innocents and Others Explores the Dynamics Between Life and Art
description: In her stunning 2001 debut novel, Lightning Field, Dana Spiotta wrote of her film-obsessed heroine Mina: She sometimes thought that if someone saw all the movies she had seen, the number of times she had seen them and in the order she had seen them, that person might know exactly who she was. Its an observation that could serve as a keystone for every one of Ms. Spiottas strobe-lit novels  all of which concern the search for identity, and the mysterious dynamics between life and art.

title: Milan Fashion Week: Salvatore Ferragamo and Missoni in Pictures
description: A photo diary of the fall/winter 2016 collections that were presented Sunday.

title: Oscars Best Dressed Men? Common, Eddie Redmayne and Jacob Tremblay
description: According to the tacit protocols of gala dressing, women, and not men, are meant to shine. Thus  whether by instinct or because that is what their Svengali stylists taught them  the best-dressed men at the 88th annual Academy Awards ceremony evinced faith in the simplicity of proper evening clothes, with the result that this was among the most stylish Oscars ceremonies in recent years.

title: The Inseparable Sisters Bringing Bright, Graphic Designs to London
description: Interviewing Nikita and Tina Sutradhar feels less like a formal assignment and more like being welcomed into their family. The sisters, 25 and 27, trade off the retelling of childhood anecdotes, reminiscing about their local Mumbai bookshop in the 90s that sold American Teen Vogue and watching Miss World as middle schoolers, enraptured by the parade of outfits. They describe how they crafted a dress from newspapers in their teens. Our father came home and we showed it to him, Tina says, and he was like, Thats it. You have to go to design school.

title: Review: In the Mets Figaro, a Scene Stealer in Her Element
description: Few operatic characters are better equipped to steal scenes than the adolescent page Cherubino in Mozarts Le Nozze di Figaro: a young man ridden by hormones and given gorgeous arias pulsing with sensuality. That the role is allotted to a grown woman only increases the opportunities for sophisticated humor and low farce.

title: Brandee Younger, a Harpist Finding Her Way to Jazz
description: Brandee Younger was a teenager  an aspiring classical harpist, growing up on Long Island  when she came across an eye-opening issue of Harp Column magazine. A trade bimonthly with a loyal constituency (motto: practical news, for practical harpists) had published a readers poll celebrating the instruments most influential figures of the 20th century.

title: Anna Netrebko, a Towering Soprano, in Her New York Recital Debut
description: As she began Rachmaninoffs Lilacs during her program of Russian songs at the Metropolitan Opera on Sunday afternoon, Anna Netrebko stepped away from her accompanist and walked to one side of the stage, where two enormous vases of flowers stood. Caressing some blossoms in her hands, she tenderly sang the lyrics, the thoughts of a sorrowful young woman comforted by the happiness that lives in the lilacs.

title: Valeant Pharmaceuticals Is Under S.E.C. Investigation
description: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International said on Monday that it was being investigated by the Securities and Exchange Commission, the latest turn of events for the Canadian drug maker, which has come under recent scrutiny for its sky-high drug prices and a once-secret relationship with a mail-order pharmacy.

title: Eiko, Koma and Soloists Perform in Sacred Space
description: Even if you frequent St. Marks Church in the East Village, youve probably never been inside the Priests Room or walked around the second-floor balcony. Youve passed the lion statue guarding the entrance, but have you ever really looked at it?

title: City Ballets Season of Renewal
description: Who is Miriam Miller? She became a member of the New York City Ballet corps only in January  so recently, in fact, that her brief biography on the companys website has no photo attached. This is odd for two reasons. One: From the auditorium of the David H. Koch Theater, where the company finished its six-week winter season on Sunday, she appears to have the perfect, theatrically legible features of a model. Two: Its been apparent since June that shes going places.

title: Apple Wins Ruling in New York iPhone Hacking Order
description: A federal magistrate judge on Monday denied the United States governments request that Apple extract data from an iPhone in a drug case in New York, giving the companys pro-privacy stance a boost as it battles law enforcement officials over opening up the device in other cases.

title: George Pell, Aide to Pope, Is Put on Defensive in Abuse Inquiry
description: ROME  When Pope Francis was chosen to lead the worlds 1.2 billion Catholics three years ago, he pledged to reform antiquated and troubled Vatican institutions.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing: Donald Trump, Academy Awards, Stephen Curry
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Officer in North Carolina Fatally Shoots Black Man During Chase
description: RALEIGH, N.C.  A crowd gathered here on Monday to denounce the killing of a black man shot earlier in the day after a foot chase with a police officer.

title: Young Lawyers Ready to Argue a Major Abortion Case Before the Supreme Court
description: Facing off before the Supreme Court on Wednesday, in what could be the most momentous abortion case in a quarter-century, will be two lawyers who are still in their thirties and are described by colleagues as whip-smart masters of the law and unflappable under pressure.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Review Agency Faults New York Police Department on Unlawful Searches
description: A team of plainclothes New York City police officers, tracking the signal of a stolen cellphone, pushed past a man who denied the officers permission to enter his home and searched it floor by floor. A sergeant forced the man to wait outside in his underwear in the rain.

title: Quiz: How Much Grit Do You Have?
description: Heres a sample of the Grit Scale, developed to identify traits that might predict success.

title: Ideas Help No One on a Shelf. Take Them to the World.
description: Have you thought of a clever product to mitigate climate change?Did you invent an ingenious gadget to light African villages at night? Have you come up with a new kind of school, or new ideas for lowering the rate of urban shootings?

title: Magistrate Judge James Orensteins Order
description: A federal judge has denied the United States governments request to open up an Apple iPhone in a drug case in New York.

title: Jets Are Said to Be Planning on Franchise Tag for Muhammad Wilkerson
description: The Jets contract impasse with the standout defensive lineman Muhammad Wilkerson, spanning years and regimes, will reach an expected stage Tuesday. The Jets intend to designate Wilkerson as their franchise player before the 4 p.m. deadline, according to a person in football with knowledge of their plans, in a maneuver that allows them to retain his rights while extending the window for brokering a long-term contract.

title: George Kennedy Dies at 91; Versatile Actor Won Oscar for Cool Hand Luke
description: George Kennedy, who played tough guys, oafs, G.I.s and a bonanza of cowboys as one of Hollywoods most versatile and durable character actors, and who won an Oscar as the best supporting actor of 1967 for his performance in the Paul Newman film Cool Hand Luke, died on Sunday in Boise, Idaho. He was 91.

title: New Study Links Zika Virus to Temporary Paralysis
description: A new study of 42 cases of Guillain-Barr syndrome in French Polynesia offers the strongest evidence to date that the Zika virus can trigger temporary paralysis, researchers reported on Monday. But experts cautioned that more evidence from other locations was needed to be conclusive.

title: Its Stephen Currys Game Now
description: If you have somehow missed watching the Golden State Warriors this season, you might have a quaint notion of how basketball is played.

title: Auto Safety Agency Resists Broader Recall of Takata Airbags
description: Under pressure from some lawmakers to recall all Takata airbags, the nations top auto safety regulator responded that such a recall would not improve public safety, and might exceed the agencys authority.

title: Artists Children, Depicted By Their Parents
description: Inspired by the paintings of Vige Le Brun, 13 contemporary artists portray their own kids.
